I am torn between liking that I can be left alone to browse the store aimlessly just to be surrounded by happiness that is Ulta, and not liking that once I find something I want, it is like pulling teeth to get a sales attendant to attend to you. 

I'm not picky about being greeted and such but don't be surprised if the girls give you the once-over and continue their gossip without a greeting to you, or shout out a brief "hello" over their shoulder before turning back to their task. 

Aside from about two kind ladies that helped me out in earnest, more than often, I walked out of there feeling like I was being a bother to the sales girls. It won't stop me from coming and quite frankly, I just need my eyeliner and I got it so that's what is important. But just saying they could improve on the customer service bit.

This Ulta has the worst customer service out of any other Ulta I've visited. The staff is rude and the managers don't acknowledge the policies that Ulta.com shows in regards to in store returns. They don't take any extra measures to have their customers walk out satisfied. On multiple occasions they have told me to call the customer service line because they don't want to handle it in store. One time I did call that line and they were so friendly and apologetic for the way the store acted that they emailed me a $10 gift card. 

Also, you should train your staff to not lecture your customers on how they should use their Ultamate rewards number every time. It's my choice to give my number out. The girl Ashley that rang me out lectured me for several minutes during checkout while I just stared at my phone trying to distract myself. She even said that returns "hurt" their store. Fact check: Your customer service skills are hurting the store more than anything else!

Since my last review, this place has gotten even worse. I went in last week in order to get something very specific that I found on their website. It specifically said the item was in stock at the Goleta store so I took a chance. 

So, not only was the item NOT in stock, the person I talked to said that it wasn't something she'd seen in MONTHS. So, wasted trip.

While I was there, I noticed there was an item that I usually use that had a great gift with purchase and it was worth it to me to get it.  The date of the gift with purchase was that day through about a week. This is important because it was literally the first day of the gift and it was about 20 minutes after the store opened. 

When I got to the register, I had to ask for the gift (it didn't automatically come up) and I was told they didn't have it. I asked them if they had a substitute and two salespeople looked through their stock to see if they could give me anything that would be comparable. I got nothing and still bought the item because I was embarrassed to say I didn't want it without the gift. Despite the fact that the gift was why I had decided to get it that day. 

In addition to the Case of the Missing Gifts (this has happened every time I've tried to redeem a coupon or advertised gift at this particular location) they had super messy shelves and empty shelves all over the store. I'm not sure if they're closing soon or if they just can't be bothered to clean up or restock. If they aren't closing, what does it say that they look like they are?

What a literal mess. This store location has so much potential. I'd buy a lot if they could get themselves together.

My favorite Ulta location !!! I have probably shopped at over 20 Ulta locations & the Lompoc Is officially my new favorite. Within seconds of walking in we were greeted by 3 employees. Every corner of the store was clean & tidy . A lot of stores look like a tornado hit after Christmas. That is not the case here .I found everything I was looking for & was offered assistance multiple times . When I inquired where something was located , they actually walked me over to the display !! Check out was a breeze, cashier was friendly !! Worth the drive from Santa Maria!

All the people working here, a mega long line, and only two cashiers. The majority just put their stuff back and left. This would never fly in Seattle. I wish I wasn't on the road and didn't seriously need something I forgot.

First of all, I am not a make up person at all. I dread getting make up for myself. Patricia was extremely knowledgeable in finding me a beginner friendly option for both highlight and contour. She talked me through proper ways to apply and found what would work best for me and my skin tone. Thank you Patricia for the help!

For anyone who's still making an effort to avoid in store shopping, Ulta's curbside and in store pick up options are a godsend. Also, ordering through the app prevents impulse shoppers (like me) from mindlessly shoveling a ton of products I don't need into my basket! 

For online orders, you have the option to skip the line, as well. There's a little desk right by the front door that's labeled "Pick up." In total, it takes about 1-2 minutes to get everything! You just need to show the order number (found in the confirmation email) and a driver's license. This genius set up reduces time spent in the store, and makes the transaction significantly more efficient. 

As for the customer service, I have only ever had positive experiences here. I've lived in Goleta for over a decade, and have been coming to this store religiously since it first opened (not a fan of Sephora). The people who work there are helpful and welcoming, but not over-the-top-breathing-down-your-neck friendly (thank goodness). In my opinion, there's nothing worse than people hovering! However, they're always available when I have questions, so it's a perfect balance that creates a beautiful shopping experience.

My friends hate coming with me to make up stores, because they end up coming out with more stuff than they intended. Ulta is awesome in that it is located in a convenient location (there's also ample parking), is huuuuuge, and has lots of variety.

I love that this store sells Pureology products- my absolute favorite hair product brand. I'll come here for my hair needs as well as the nail polish. The amount of nail polish that Ulta sells is amazing-from OPI to Essie, you will have be satisfied with the alllll the colors.

The reason why I only added four stars to this review is because while there are so many things you can buy here, I don't ever know who to ask for help. It seems like the employees are pretty sparse every time I'm there. In addition, I can never find basic essentials here, such as cotton pads. Those should be restocked fairly often (I mean, with all the nail polish you sell, we need cotton pads to remove them off our fingers)!

FANTASTIC HAIR SALON (JESSEE!)  I am a 1st time customer and got a gorgeous full hair color treatment.  Jessee is fantastic!  Great color, great ambience, I will continue to go to Jessee for all my color and hair needs! She is awesome, professional and very knowledgeable.  A wonderful experience - the Goleta store is clean, well-staffed, bright, airy and fun!

I booked an appointment for "formal makeup" it's literally the works you get everything done, the problem is the girl who did my makeup I don't know even if she was certified or anything only reason my makeup was disgusting she didn't even bother to do my eyebrows correctly my eye make up was something else for the price I paid I'm sure MAC would've done better, 90+ dollars a 5 year old could've done better!!! Yet there rude there not even a smile when u walk in for what you end up spending at this store at least have the girls freakin fake a smile!

Walked into the store on a tuesday night, it was very empty (customer wise). Did not hear a hello. When asked if I could be helped (they did not have half of the lipsticks I wanted to try as samples), the woman walked away with the unopened one (seeing if she is allowed to open this one) never to return. When I was asked if I needed help again, by a different person this time, I told her I was waiting on a lipstick. She asked if I knew the number of it..um NO, she said there was nothing she could do. 

As I found another brand of lipstick, I asked the second woman if they had any more because the stand was filled with 2/5 of them. She looked at it and said they didn't have anymore. Thanks for looking in the back? This is ULTA, you don't just runout like that. I opened the drawer right under this lipstick and found what I was looking for.

DID NOT PURCHASE IT THERE, because I didn't want to give them the business. Snotty, LAZY, rude and incompetent employees who only seem to talk with each other the whole work day.

1st and last time at this location, maybe ULTA in general. I'm taking my business else where.

* Very disorganized

Just got my Brows done at Ulta! Lyndsay did an smazing job. She listened to me and gave me exactely what I wanted.
I was there 3 weeks ago and Tangela did my Brows.
Both girls were amazing and super sweet.

AVOID.

I used to see Ulta's coupons in the Sunday paper and take stock of anything I needed.  Unfortunately, the coupons only apply to non-prestige brands, Ulta's included.  There are so many exclusions on those coupons that the "deal" itself might as well be null and void.  Totally a flaw in the company's policy if it is aiming to compete with the department stores in Oxford Valley, and more importantly: Sephora. 

With the exception of the person who used to wax my brows at the Benefit Brow Bar -- before she left -- became the only reason I would go here.  Otherwise, I've met happier people stocking shelves at the grocery store!  One night I walked in after I was at the gym and asked if the Urban Decay Naked eyeshadow palette was in stock.  Both employees just turned to each other as if we were in an episode of the Three Stooges.  Either they didn't know one of the store's major brands or they had never seen someone in sneakers and exercise clothes.  The girls hastily told me it wasn't in the store, yet there was a tester palette sitting in the aisle where Urban Decay was displayed.  Since it was going to take a Herculean effort to look in the computer or in the stock room, I just walked out and gave my business to Sephora.

A month or two later, I revisited in the afternoon, and went for my brow waxing.  This my brow girl's last day and I couldn't say I blamed her.  I paid immediately after the service since her shift was over, then I went looking for an eyeliner.  I scanned the aisles for the product and someone who could help me since the cashier said she could not leave the register.  No problem.  I noticed an employee in the back where the salon is located, though I needed to use a bathroom, so I asked the cashier if there was one.  She called over the person I had seen near the salon who had the key, then let me in.  After I was finished, I told the person I was out, and she was actually very friendly.  When I asked her about the product I was looking for, she told me she could not leave the salon.  Again, I understand, so I took another once-over down the aisle.  

With no luck, I headed for the door, and that's when I was confronted by an employee.  "Excuse me, I saw you wandering around and I'm going to need you to open your bag."  She had this shit-eating grin on her face like she was going to get Employee of the Year for busting a shoplifter.  It was alarming, yet I kept my cool and replied, "Melissa waxed my brows, the cashier let me into the bathroom, here is the recei-..."  

"OPEN YOUR BAG."

Now this woman is in my face, basically trying to bully me into her own version of search and seizure.  You got a warrant to go with that name tag, too?  So, extremely offended, I opened my bag and showed her the receipt, as well as moving aside my wallet and other personal items to prove her theory wrong.  I guess some mental breakthrough occurred because all of a sudden, she softens with, "Oh, I saw you wandering around..."  to which I cut her off with, "Yes, because no one is on the floor to help any customers, then I asked the cashier to use the bathroom, which she and your coworker in the salon can confirm."

I didn't stick around to hear Ms. Justice's reply because you know what?  Just because a customer is young, DOES NOT mean he/she is going to steal.  Since then, I've taken my business to Flirt Beauty in Yardley and Bensalem, and other *worthy* local shops.

This shopping plaza could do without Ulta taking up its space.

This review is specifically for Karen in the hair salon. The day before my color appointment with Karen I went to a very highly rated salon for a bayalage. I left the salon with four inches of near-black dyed roots and the remainder of my hair a light orange. This was a Saturday, late afternoon, and I was leaving on a business trip the following Monday morning. Ulta was the only salon open on Sunday and I got an appointment with Karen (thanks to previous reviewer Nicole for the positive review of Karen's work, I felt hopeful and more confident because of it). When Karen saw my hair she immediately told me not to worry, that she was going to fix everything and it would look a thousand times better. She was wrong - it looks a million times better! She foiled my hair using a technique I've never seen before and then used a different dye on the hair outside the foils. She used two different glazes as well. What I really liked was that she never once made a disparaging remark about the other salon or colorist - very professional. She was super friendly, too. But my hair - it's gorgeous! I've gotten so many compliments on the color. When I tell them it's a correction and show them the "before" pictures they can't believe that A) someone was able to fix it, and B) fix it so incredibly. Karen worked some serious magic on my hair!

I went to Karen to get my color correction done and she was AMAZING! 
She listened to my concerns and kept the integrity of my hair in mind. She took my hair from a green tinted silver to a beautiful cool silver. 
She knows what she is doing and I recommend her to everyone!!!

I've been shopping here for many years and I know the salespeople aren't the friendliest but I can overlook that since I like the coupons and products.  But after today I've had it with RUDE salespeople, particularly the manager!  I wanted to return something that I unfortunately didn't have the receipt for but was always told as long as it's within 3 months, they can find it on your account.  Well, today my account just so happened to only go back a month and a half. So instead of giving me the benefit of the doubt (I spend hundreds of dollars there--how else would I be a platinum member!!) or even a store credit, the manager brings up the last price it was sold for--.25.  Really?!?  You sold a $14 bottle of sunscreen for .25???  Then I get the attitude--take your .25 or leave.  I think it's time to shop where they actually have customer service!

I adore this Ulta store! The staff here are very friendly, especially at the Brow Bar and Salon. After reading reviews, I decided to get my hair cut and colored by Zak. I am so happy I did!! He is easy going, listens to what I would like, and is just an overall amazing person. I absolutely LOVE my cut and color. He knows I am very busy and gave me an easy to maintain style with highlights. I am thrilled with the service and highly recommend!

I went here to get my hair trimmed and cut my bangs. SAMMI was my hair stylist. I told her to cut 2 1/2 inches off and layered. She shampooed. Trimmed. Then blow dry and straighten my hair. Even though I didn't tell her to straighten my hair. We talked a lot. She told me she's been doing hair since she was 16 yrs. old and went to beauty school. I was still a bit skeptic but the after seeing the results I believed her. She was very professional and knew what she was doing from what I've seen. I would go back again!

The staff here is amazing! Got oil slick color from Zak and it is absolutely gorgeous. In all my years of hair dying, I don't think my color has ever looked so good. He somehow managed to make pink, purple, blue and green hair look completely natural. The cut is super cute too. I cannot recommend him enough for everything. You need your eyebrows done, see Kasey she has a gift. My eyebrows have always been terrible, but she has found a way to make them almost perfect. I don't even need to fill them in anymore. Cannot say enough good things about this place.

I discovered the Yelp site when  I was looking at revews for Ulta Cosmetics. I stopped in about a week before and was so impressed by the Studio Gear line of skin care and makeup products that I wanted to see if they were backed by any major cosmetic company,  much like L'Oreal/Lancome, etc.  Anyway, it seems they are Ulta's own line. I've tried a lot of different products--right now I have Estee Lauder, Bobbi Brown and Lancome but the salesperson talked me into the Studio Gear eye cream and a product called Prime Objective (a kind of face base you apply after moisturizer and before makeup) and I absolutely loved them both! In fact, I got the on line coupon and can't wait to return on Saturday to purchase the night cream. The salesperson who helped me was very knowledgeable and really knew the line of products. I also tried the eye shadow and lipstick (loved them both). 
P.S. Glad I found the Yelp site--Loaded with lotsa good stuff!

The staff here seems to know nothing about makeup or skin care products. I always end up going to sephora  because they seem to know more about makeup. I decided to give them another try the other day and I went in to ask for suggestions on the best skin care wash for my skin and the " skincare expert" there seemed to have no clue what I needed to use and quite frankly it seemed like she was just guessing. I ended up going to sephora yet again in the end. I also feel like I'm being judged every time I walk in there by the staff. I don't know why I waste my time or money at this location.

I used to go to Michelle but she went to another Salon out of my way. I just happened to stop in Ulta and found that Nicole at the Brow Bar is amazing. She was super patient with my daughter and actually could take us without an appointment. So glad I can keep earning my points. Try Nicole out, she is awesome.

A Hidden Gem - Stylist Mary Jane..

A few months ago I stopped in to try a new hairstylist and I was introduced to Mary Jane. I am extremely picky!!!!...and had a lot of requests.  I have wildly curly frizzy long hair that I straighten every day. 

However I have never seen my hair look so beautiful and so straight, as when Mary Jane did it for me...it even lasted until the next day and it was raining the night we did it!  

I loved what she did with my hair so much that when my mom was visiting on vacation I made an appointment for the two of us. We both had color and I had highlights and we left looking like movie stars. My mom felt 15 years younger and if I do say so, I thought she looked 20 years younger myself.  My father even complimented her! (which is both rare and amazing). 

Mary Jane talks to you about what your specific requirements are and makes you feel comfortable with your selection. We listened to her suggestions and were so happy we did. 

This girl is so good she should open her own salon!!!  

Thank you Mary Jane ...for your commitment to excellence!!!
Staff, you are paid to help customers. Please do so. I am not interested in your personal drama, nor do I appreciate being told that you don't know about products so you can be of no help to me.

I'm not a fan of the Ulta at this location.  I use to go here all the time for the brow bar but the staff is pretty awful.  I don't need to listen to a bunch of late twenty-somethings talking about their drinking binges!

That said, one counter girl was extremely helpful selling me makeup when I wanted a good, high end foundation.  She took the time to use several products on me and blended different colors to my skin tone.

I just don't like how judged I feel walking into this place usually.  It puts bad tastes in my mouth every time I leave.

Liz at the makeup counters is a-maz-ing!!  It's been awhile since I have cared about my look.  Liz took her time & counseled me on what makeup would help me look like me, just a fresh version!!!  I bought everything she used & could not be happier!!  Ulta...you're lucky to have Liz!!

I always find the staff helpful and friendly. I like their coupons, they always have what I need, and the store is clean. I can't really say for the salon as I never tried them and most likely never will, but only because I have a stylist I don't plan on leaving.

Went to Ulta to try their nail service because my normal girl is out of town. I showed up for my appt on time and had to wait around for 20 minutes for the girl to come start my appt. This was after I walked to the front of the store to ask if someone else could do my nails because I was tired if waiting and I had to be somewhere an hour and a half later. They had a decent collection of OPI gel colors which was nice but that is the only reason I gave them 2 stars. Once my manicure started I could tell the girl doesn't do them very often because the gel is never supposed to touch your skin or cuticle or it won't seal properly. After my nails were done she didn't use any lotion or cuticle oil so my hands were dry and gross when I left. Next time I need a mani I will find an actual nail salon and not waste my time and money here for this service.

I've been to other ultas and I typically feel harassed. This one didn't have and assistants in sight or they were helping other people. When I finally found someone they we not helpful at all. I couldn't find things and I felt the store was very sloppy. Won't go back.

I love my Ulta.

But damn if it isn't a bit sad that *I* end up commenting on products or giving tips to the people that work there or that are in the same aisle as me.

I will always love my Ulta because I found my current hair dresser here. She now works at Casual Hair & Nails - and when she left I never looked back - but Ulta brought us together. My curls will be eternally grateful.

But my regular buys are always in stock and more often than not I can find the new OPI fad shade or whatever's the current must-have. The layout is easy to navigate (the remodel with the registers up front also make things a bit more convenient.)  
The place is clean, items are rarely out of place and they have a wide variety of brands and items to choose from.

One day I'll have to check out the 'new' Dermalogica beauty bar - I've been intrigued since its arrival but I never SEE anyone over there who might try & reel me in. That seems like a shame!

I have always wanted to try a facial so after being a customer of ulta for sometime I tried the salon spa for the first time. I had a facial done by paige. She was so nice and answered all my questions. She had some helpful ideas for skin care products. I have been there 2x for a facial and I will definitely keep coming! 
My skin was glowing after it was wonderful

Best selection in the area! Far better than the Sephora that opened up at the Oxford Valley Mall.

If you're looking for high-end makeup, Ulta has you covered. But if you just need your standard drugstore brands, you'll find those here, too.

Make sure to check out the Ulta brand nail polish. It's usually on sale (but two, get one) and it's nice quality.

The only thing I wouldn't suggest: the salon. They butchered my hair the one time I tried it out.

I went in to get a facial and had Paige.  Paige was amazing. Super nice and easy to talk to. She did an amazing job on my facial and was super helpful answering all of my questions. She isn't pushy at all to try to get you to purchase products either. I booked her for their power peels and I'm super excited! The only thing I didn't like was that the facial is out of the sales floor. It is closed away but you can still hear everything around you. They use to be in a room in the salon. That was a surprise that I wasn't happy about.

I went there to get my hair relaxed for the summer. along with a haircut.  I have been there before for the same treatment.  This time, my hair was burnt to the point that it has broken off at the root.  It is like having split ends all the way up.! There is little chance of styling this frizzy mess except to cut it off which I choose not to do.  So I am stuck with it until it grows out.  I visited the salon afterwards to tell them about it and I did see them put these notes into MJ's account.  Not a phone call- TEXT - nothing - never contacted me.  I had to go to another salon and get the haircut fixed b/c it had broken off so much.  No joke -it has been awful and I paid for this.  So upset about the experience will not set foot in Ulta anywhere ever again.

I am so disappointed in what was my first and last visit to the "spa" at Ulta. The only reason I was there was because the BEST brow girl, Amanda, resigned from the Benefit Brow Bar in the store and they had no one working it. So, I took a brow appointment at the spa. Spa is such a bad word for the two, dimly lit, plain, and somewhat dirty rooms in the back of the store. It did not feel like a spa-they waxed my brows at a freaking hair washing sink with a plastic tub full of supplies they pulled out of a cabinet. Nothing was set up for waxing, it felt like I was getting a wax out of the trunk of a car. On top of that, hey charged two dollars more then the Benefit bar. The girl, Rebecca, was sweet. However, I told her exactly what I wanted and I mentioned multiple times that I thought she was taking too much off and what did she do? Take too much off. Not happy with the outcome at all. Won't be back and will go out of my way to not recommend this place to others. When I walked out, I passed the Benefit brow bar and shed a tear.

I wanted to get a new eyeshadow pallet. I usually go to Sephora but I wanted to try Ulta because I was told they have a better rewards program. I had a couple choices in mind but I also went with a friend just to do some browsing and shopping. There was one staff member who asked us many times if we needed help, like so many times it was annoying. I understand at places like Ulta and Sephora it's their job to ask if you need help and when I do need help I always ask but this time I didn't. It was like even though I had already told her no thank you and explained why I didn't need anything she still asked me like  6-7 times. I don't know if she was just overly friendly or if Ulta makes them do that but it was annoying and made me and my friend uncomfortable and wanted to leave. Other than that when I decided on what I wanted and checked out everyone else was super helpful and nice. I'll still go back because I like the bigger selection and the rewards program and maybe ill try to come with some questions to give that girl something to do lol.
Looking to get your hair done? Go to MJ!!! She is fantastic and such a good listener. She has become more than my hairstylist.. she has become a friend.

I wrote this review under "Benefit Brow Bar at Ulta" but I'm putting here too, incase it goes unseen. Note that my other review was 5 stars because it was just about the brow bar. I'd probably give the rest of the store 3 stars because the staff, not including specialty staff (Benefit, Dermalogica, etc.), are very rude and make it very aware how much they hate their jobs. Anyway, here's the review for the brow bar:

Michelle is a GODSEND! I went into Ulta looking like Frida Kahlo and *thankfully* Michelle had an open spot to fill before her next client. I explained how I just couldn't find someone who could get the right shape for my brow (or any shape really) and that I wanted a natural look as opposed to being permanently surprised. She laughed and assured me that she would fix everything up. That was an understatement. My brows are now absolute perfection. I can't stop staring at them. After she tweezed (wax irritates my skin) and trimmed them, she filled them in with the Benefit products, not once pushing me to buy anything. The best part of the whole experience was the great conversation we had while she was reconstructing my face. Michelle was so nice and hilarious and I could have sat there all day chatting. 

I'm so glad that I took a chance and switched up my brow routine! Michelle is definitely my new go-to-girl now that I have fabulous brows that need maintaining.

I received a $50 gift card from Ulta. I'm a new mom and I work outside in construction. I do not get a lot of free time. So with the weather being bad, my jobs canceled yesterday and I was looking forward to splurging on some girly products to help me feel and smell great. What I got however was an awful shopping experience because one of their sales associates chased me around the store. I do not get free time, so being able to take my time in a store without a baby is heaven. But no as I was looking around, having myself a shopping spree I was hounded. Shame on you Ulta!!

I will start off by saying that I walked into this salon with wreckage on my head from the day before, hoping to get it cleaned up and treated since it was over bleached. As far as color, Erin did a decent job blending it all in. But as far as my cut.... I WILL NEVER GO BACK. Mid way through my appointment I smelled alcohol on her breath and when she arrived late to my appointment she had a blue slushy and it all kinda made sense. I wish I would've said something when I smelled it but because I was just trying to fix my hair and get out I let her keep going. (I was there for 3 and a half hours) We both had agreed to only cut off what was necessary. Keep in mind my original stylist back home was working with me to grow out my layers and let everything grow out evenly. When Erin showed me the back of my hair I almost cried. She butchered the back putting in short layers on my what I would consider to be long hair. It was so choppy that she went back in with her texturizing shears and TOOK MORE OFF. And then proceeded to say, "I don't usually criticize other stylists work but omg who took your layers up that high?" Meanwhile like I said my previous stylist was working with me to grow them out so I haven't had them touched in over 6 months. Now I have two completely different lengths of hair. I was so disappointed that I went home and cried for hours. I've read other reviews and it seems pointless to try to get my money back. But just know I will make that 50 minute drive and spend more money on someone who actually knows what they're doing. I WILL NEVER EVER EVEN OUT OF COMPLETE DESPERATION COME BACK HERE. Worst hair experience of my life.

Between my home and office, I have access to three Ulta stores -- and this is by far the worst of the three. Customer service? Ha, ha. Most of these girls wander around trying NOT to make eye contact with customers. If you manage to hunt one down to ask a question, be prepared for this annoyed look and an indifferent answer. Really, if you can go to a different Ulta, do so!

Very disappointed. I went to Ulta last summer to have my hair done for my wedding. They did an amazing job on our hair. It was perfect. Couldn't be happier. I went back on Jan 27 to have my hair cut and styled. It was a disaster. I brought pictures. Neither the front or back of my hair looks like the photos. During the process i see that my hair is very uneven. When the stylist realized how bad it was she got another stylist to try and fix my horrible hair. By this time I was pretty upset and just wanted them to quit hacking at my hair. When she printed up my receipt she charged me $47 and didnt even give me a price adjustment for messing up my hair. I will never go back. I will tell everyone I know not to go there either. I wish I could post a photo.

This review is not about the stylists or the employees because most are absolutely  lovely!  This review is about the mess of that salon.  You can take your pick and walk into ,list any other Ulta salon and it's beautiful, modern, brightly lit with working equipment.  This location unfortunately has none of the above.  The lighting is horrendous, I can't say it enough times.  The stylists know it and hate it too.  I've been hearing about this fictitious remodel probably just as long as they have.  You cannot see the color of your hair until you physically walk through the store to go outside, it's absurd!  There are broken sinks and dryers every time I go.  The last time I went, they had one working dryer which was not a normal bucket dryer so my color did not process Fully.  They will never admit that's the reason though.  They get one more chance to make it right then I'm moving on.  What a shame for your stylists to have to loose clients because for some reason this is considered ok.  MANAGEMENT, ARE YOU LISTENING?  DO YOU CARE AT ALL THAT YOUR SALON IS FALLING APART AND CLIENTS HAVE TO BE UNHAPPY AFTER PAYING GOOD MONEY?  No, clearly not and that's why it's been acceptable for so long.  Another one bites the dust, I'm finally moving on!  Great job, Ulta.

I love this ULTA location. I've been coming here for the last 5 years to buy makeup and get my hair done. I've tried places in between for my hair and I always end up back here. The staff is really friendly and they take time to get to know you. MJ is your go to for hair. She's fantastic and has done everything and anything to my hair with success. I've never left unhappy. Paige is your go to for facials. She's great and does wonders for my complexion. Someone complemented once that my skin was so bouncy....I thank her for that. They have great sales and fantastic coupons throughout the year. Love ulta!!

I took the plunge, December 2017, to try a new hair stylist and a new salon! I've went through hell and back with my hair in 2017, and I was feeling really good about being at this salon in general. The vibes felt great, the salon didn't make me feel off or uncomfortable. The good vibes were there! 

My best friend knows how scared I am of hair stylists because of how much I went through in the last year. So I had a really tough semester, and wanted to make myself feel good about myself again. I fell into this rut, and I was exhausted, sad, and overall over 2017. 

There were two photos that I showed my stylist, Heather, as to what I wanted. She consulted me about the color choice beforehand. Let me know what happens to fashion color etc. I've been into fashion color for some time now, and have been dying to go pink!  

I wanted my roots to be left alone because I was pre-lightened, and I just wanted some fun color done. Heather has such a great personality! I hope she never leaves, because I'm definitely becoming a regular. Fairless Hills is quite a hike from me. I'm near Northern Liberties in Philadelphia, PA, but I'll drive anywhere for quality service! I have an appointment with her again, March 9th, and I'm ecstatic that I chose someone I already trust to do what's next. 

She really seems like she knows what she's doing; I'm so glad she made me pink, and the pink came out amazingly! It lasted over 2 months, and she also recommended me some awesome dry shampoos. With her consulting, I made my pink last a long time! I was obsessed, and still obsessed; everyone was obsessed. I felt so magical and fun! I work in a conservative environment, but they were over the moon with it! They loved it and were accepting of it considering my reasons for getting it.

I can't wait to feel good about myself again. I'll update this after March 9th 2018.
Sales hungry associates that don't listen to what you say. Very annoying when shopping with Mom Mother's Day weekend.
Updating my review to 4 stars because I stopped in today and received really great service from one of the cashiers as well as one a couple of the employees working the floor. Keep up the good work!

I was a little nervous trying out ulta as I tend to avoid chain salons, but was very pleased. I saw lin and she did a cut with highlights and did a great job. she also did my gel manicure and again ,very good job. shes fun and creative and I will def be coming back to her. I think its perfect that they have later hours than a regular salon, I work off hours and have weird days off and you can make an appointment almost any day of the week and the times go much later than a regular salon. I am curious about the brow and skin treatments and will probably add those to my list of services to try. I hope to schedule a full color, cut and highlights next week...will add an updated post of full color services. its not like a spa experience but it is a solidly good experience.

I've been to the salon at Ulta a few times for gel nails, and my experiences have mostly been bad.  The first time, in September 2013, I had called to make an appointment, but when I got there there was no record of it.  I had to come back later in the week.  over the next few months I'd gone in occasionally, when I couldn't make it to the nail salon I prefer. (City Nails on Robert E Lee has great customer service and a huge selection of gel colors.) I considered Ulta a "last resort" since they're open late and are nearer to home for me.  the last time I went April) I had late appointment.  After I sat down she took a walk-in hair appointment... the problem is, she was the only person working the salon! long-story short, I was there over TWO HOURS and my nails looked horrible! The color was sloppy and uneven, it looked ridiculous.  I was just happy to get out of there.  The next day I went and spoke with a manager.  She offered have them re-done, but I just wanted a refund.  Even when I've had decent gel manicures at Ulta I've been disappointed by how long it takes.  From now on I'm sticking to City Nails or doing it myself!

I love Ulta and probably go there than one should so I know entirely too much about it.  

Things to Consider:
Like one of the reviews stated this is more of a self service location. If you know your beauty products and makeup you will do okay and Ulta and able to get in and out. If you need more help in cheaper brands, beauty products and etc then you may find it hard to get a little help. On the other hand in the makeup department for the non Ulta brands you will find the best chances for help at this location. 

I love this location because there is a salon and a Benefit Brow Bar, which are important in my world and probably get all of my money. They bought offer pretty reasonably priced services and most important quick. The turnaround on services here is great especially when they stick to appointments. If you are looking to get your hair down ask for GiGi she is the queen of the blowout and style. For Eyebrows definitely let Maria do them.

Another great thing about this location is brands brands brands. They tend to stay stocked with my favorites along with others such as a pretty massive Smashbox section as well as Benefit section. You will also see other brands such as Urban Decay and Still among many others in the makeup department. There is a reasonable sized skin scare section. I often don't see much help in this area so it can be frustrating trying to figure it out.  Another good thing about this location is there is lotttttttttttttttts of hair products. Whatever your needs are they probably have it to get your hair together.

I'm just happy they have this location in the city. The staff is friendly and definitely efficient and I have not had any problems at all.

Sign up for beauty card so you can get all the coupons! You can't go wrong with ULTA Coupons.


Parking: Ample Parking 

Plus: It's next to DSW People!

I used to work with a woman who raved about Ulta; she was a huge fan and constantly complained that there was no location in the GNO. Fast forward a couple of years and we have a location in Elmwood. 

I liked being able to buy inexpensive brands that are tried & true next to the higher end items. I did have a sales associate offer assistance on the high end side but she seemed stressed and so I said no thanks. There was no one offering help on the more crowded drugstore brand side.

I was disappointed by the messiness/empty shelves. Maybe this place has been slammed since opening a few months ago...oh wait, it's been almost 7 months, so they should have their act together.

Bonus star for finding a hairbrush that I'm actually liking...yes I'm super picky about that sort of thing.

Ulta is my disneyland. Everyone there is WONDERFUL. I recommend Erika for skin, Maria for brows and Lynn for Salon servives, although Pam is good too. If I ever have a problem they are quick to fix it. When you walk in, ask for Tina and Ulta will be your disneyland too :)

The service here is very inconsistent. Last night it was about nil. So many options, so many questions and it was at least half an hour before anyone was available to help or rather I could find to help. The cashiers looked aggravated and unapproachable. I'd probably go to the individual counters at canal place versus coming back here; you get what you pay for.

Ulta has a solution for every beauty problem you think you have and even something for ones you didn't realize you have. From hair products/accessories/tools, perfume for men & women, every OPI & Essie nail color you could ever want, skin care, makeup, and a salon in the back, it's definitely the perfect place for a girly girl. I used to frequent Ulta in Atlanta and always preferred it to Sephora so now that we have one here, I'll be a regular for sure.

I was in desperate need of a little refreshing at the Salon, and Alex was so wonderful. She was very patient when I was explaining what I would like done, and captured exactly what I wanted. I am very pleased with the results! I definitely recommend her. 
Thank you Alex for making me look and feel alive again!

This is the only makeup/beauty store that sells products in every price range. You can get drug store brand makeup like NYX & L'oreal and high end brands like Tarte and Urban Decay. Love the variety! Plus there is a hair salon in the back in which you can choose which hair stylist you want based on price. I went with my friend who got a hair cut/style there recently. She picked one of the "cheap" stylists and she did an excellent job.

Thank God for Melissa !!! She is so sweet and accommodating. Made sure I was comfortable at all times even though she was there alone. Alone to answer the phone , answer questions from all the customers in the store. She never let it get to her , I was overwhelmed for her, she was kind to everyone. Bonus my haircut and color looks amazing! Thank you for everything Melissa. You have a forever client with me. Jackie

I L O V E going to this Ulta so much. I've been there on several occasions and each time I step foot in the store, I am welcomed with a friendly greeting from the first sales associate who sees me. The staff is eager to help out, which is great, even though sometimes it's hard to find someone on the floor who isn't already helping another customer.

I have even called to schedule a hair appointment. The woman who answered the phone was super sweet. Unfortunately, because I'm really bad at procrastinating, they didn't have any openings that day, so I had to go elsewhere. BUT I may give them a try in a few weeks.

Pretty good variety of products but while I was in the store, an employee walked up to a lip gloss sample/display, put it directly on her lips then put it back. Disgusting and unsanitary. She didn't use a disposable applicator or anything. I couldn't get past it and definitely didn't want try any out any products.
The customer service was less than average.

Moving to a new state I had to find everything all over again. This store has got it all!

Everyone is so friendly and helpful that works here. All products are organized and store is overall clean.

This review is mainly for the salon. I've been here twice and I had Krystal help me both times. She is the BOMB! She is so awesome. Going from long hair to a short/medium bob she did it. She knew exactly what she was doing and nailed it. She added a subtle sun kissed highlight to it also. She is just great and I'm so glad I came across her at this awesome store. I am definitely going to be going back. Another hair stylist was there while I was getting my hair done and she was a sweetheart as well. Her clients looked pleased and great.

Overall I love ULTA in Elmwood. I don't understand the low reviews.

I had a really wonderful hair coloring experience with Lynn! I came in after another salon did NOT deliver, and she made it perfect. She's extremely meticulous and was wonderful to work with. Now I can multitask - stock up on my beauty essentials in the same place I get gorgeous hair color!

Literally the worst possible Ulta I've ever been too. First they wouldn't honor a mismatch price tag they had in their display. Then they forgot to put the $20 eyeliner I had purchased in my bag. I spent over $200...I went back the following day and the manager said she checked the cameras and she watched the sales associate put it in my bag and it MUST have fallen out after I had left the store. 

I have been running and managing a retail business for over two years the customer service I have received here is the absolute worst and I would never treat my customers this way.

Decent selection of beauty supplies with very well priced Ulta brand items.  They have everything from makeup to perfume/cologne to hair products and styling tools.

I would rate them higher, but their prices really aren't any better than any other store on name brand items.  Watch sales circulars for good deals and coupons.

I thought I would write an update since I recently got my make-up done at Ulta! I am sort of challenged when it comes to putting on make-up and one night I had a nice event to go to and I got a wild hair to get my make-up done. 

I called and was able to book an appointment for the day of. This was great for my spontaneity! I asked them how much for a make-up application and was pleased to hear it was only $30, which I think is pretty reasonable. Upon arrival I checked in at the salon in the back. My make-up artist introduced herself and asked me about what look I was trying to achieve. Mostly everyone at Ulta had bright and over the top make-up on, as expected for a cosmetic store! but still, I was a little worried that I would walk out with more than I bargained for. I explained that I didn't want anything too dramatic and liked the smokey eye look. She seemed to understand my goal and proceeded to ask me what colors I was wearing. She chose complimentary hues and away she went. The make-up application happens in the middle of the store where they can easily pull from the shelves. This didn't bother me since I was enjoying the lively conversation next to me. The whole application took about 30 minutes. The final product was exactly what I was looking for. She enhanced my features and made me look and feel beautiful. The make-up lasted all night long. Hooray!

Their products are great and I would go to any other Ulta in the country. This one has the worst costumer service of any store I've been to in ages. I've ended up leaving twice due to being rung up incorrectly and then flat out ignored while no one figure out what the issue is. It's also nearly impossible to find help on the floor because the staff is too busy socializing in the back. Staff is rude, unprofessional and this place is not worth the effort to get out there. I'd rather spend a few extra bucks and get good customer service at Sephora. I'm never going back.

Put me on a leash because I am out of control. I walk in and suddenly I think, I need one of everything in this store. Why don't they have shopping carts with wheels? 

You have your fancy pants name brand makeup lines and you also have drug store brands, which is great because you can get everything you need all in one place. 

I have never needed help, but someone always asks me if I do. The cashiers are always friendly and efficient.

I have always loved Ulta. I have shopped them through my travels. This one pleased ,as expected. Salon brands abound. And the makeup....ahhhh the makeup. Smash box, Stila, Benefit, Bare Essentials. And plenty of the drug store favs. The fragrances are as good as, or better than the big named department stores. And so much more. My only issue was the heat. The store seemed to be some what stuffy. I had on a sun dress and cardigan. By the time I got through the checkout, I was feeling some what 'moist'. Or 'glistening' as my mother would put it. Get an Ulta club card for further discounts.

As Rene put it below, this place brings up feelings of anticippointment.

I've visited Ulta locations outside of New Orleans and I really looked forward to the new location in Nola. I have been 4 times since it opened. On 3 of those occasions, I experienced big issues with customer service that make me never want to return.

The employees are nice and helpful....but unfortunately there seem to be only about 2 or 3 in the store on busy Saturdays! There is usually a long checkout line with one overwhelmed employee checking people out, one person in the upscale makeup section trying to help 5 people at once and another person restocking or in the back somehwere.

The last time I went, my product was completely sold out in a myriad of colors and I couldn't get the attention of any salesperson. So, I walked out and ordered the product online at Sephora.

I won't be visiting this store again until I hear that they have hired more staff.
Went in to shop around and buy some IT products. Theresa was very helpful to our needs. Had what we wanted and check out was pretty quick. Highly recommend

This Ulta is great! The manager and the sales associates are friendly and courteous, and they help you find the right products without being pushy. The store is spacious and very clean. I would highly recommend Maria at the Benefit Brow Bar. She's very friendly and does a fantastic job! Would highly recommend this store. In fact, since they opened I've hardly been to Lakeside to the "other big beauty store"...hint hint!

Listen, I know I'm nowhere near a Kim Kardashian, or Paris Hilton... but whoa now the service I got was, WAIT WHAT SERVICE?! I entered the doors with about 5 employees waiting at the door to greet people, but they just stood there, starred at me and talked amongst themselves. I needed some help picking out foundation. Walked up and down aisles and many employees in the store walking around pretending to be busy.  I asked someone if they carried a certain foundation and this person acted like she didn't hear me.  Then I noticed she was holding a purse, so I'm sure she was just rushing out the door before having to help anyone. 

Went to Sephora the next day got the service and merchandise I needed and wanted to go back to Ulta and have my Pretty Woman moment... BIG MISTAKE, HUGE, BIG... I MUST GO NOW...  but I refrained and figured I would review it.  I notice all the amazing reviews on here so they must be doing something right, but wowza they certainly had an incredibly off day....

I went in to get a manicure today and it was the absolute worst manicure I've ever gotten.
It was supposed to be a gel manicure but my whole finger tips were painted. 
The woman was incredibly unprofessional and made the entire situation very uncomfortable. She obviously is not capable of giving a manicure.
It seems like there is only one layer of paint on my nails.
It seems as though a child did my nails. I am so embarrassed, as I got 3 comments on how bad they were and that I should have never paid for this. I am most likely going to requests refund. 
I will never purchase another service from ulta and I most likely will never shop there again.

I got some flyers in the mail from ulta about the salon so I wanted to treat myself and get my hair done. I wish I had read the reviews here beforehand because the salon part is not rated well.

I scheduled a trim and blow out at the salon. Haircut turned out good but blow out was beyond sub par for the price. It looked awful, like I spent a full day at work and had already exposed it to the humid air. She barely used any styling products. Nor took my advice when I mentioned the kind of products my hair likes. When you leave the salon, hair should look awesome...no more styling needed. That's why I pay the big bucks and tip big. I'll only be going back for products now, not the hair service.

5 stars for a great experience in the salon as well the store. After trying several different salons around the city, I decided to give this Ulta a try. My stylist was Brittany and she was awesome! She listened to what I wanted and gave me exactly that. My hair feels and looks better than it has in a long while. She was also so friendly and a pleasure to talk with. Thank you Brittany! I will be back again soon. 

Employees offered assistance as my friend and I looked at some makeup and other products. Everyone was friendly and willing to answer our questions.

Ever wished for something so fervently for so long that once it's been realized, it's a huge letdown?

I've heard called...anticippointment. 

This was one of those times. Ulta, I can go to the drugstore and buy a lot of what's here. The brands I'm looking for? Their shelves are empty. Then I am approached by a staff member; they are friendly but not very knowledgeable.  The haircare section is large, but confusing. You'd better do your homework before heading here, or else you'll come home with a big bag of sadness.

Let me preface this by saying I visited during their "grand opening", so they had only been open two days. 

I like Ulta in general because they have a nice mix of high end and drugstore beauty products....it's kind of a one-stop-shop of make-up/beauty.  

I threw the new cashier off because I had two coupons* at check out.  That's OK, she's new, the store is new, and I was patient.  She had to call a manager over and, here is where the bad taste was put in my mouth, the manager not only barked rudely at the cashier, she literally berated every worker around her.  Is this the way to start out a new store?  You could already tell every underling was completely alienated from said manager.  2nd day? Really?

They had a nice selection of, well, everything. BUT, I could not get over the shabby treatment of the employees who were more than nice to me.  I can only believe the employee turnover will be high.

My imagined truth is that this mean manager is a high-level executive from corporate and she is here temporarily to open the store.  Hopefully the real manager is from New Orleans, awesome, and I will return in 3 weeks and witness the happiest employees ever.   I'll let you know...

If my imagined reality is incorrect, I will not be back.





*Don't judge, they were seriously amazing coupons.

I thought this place was going to be like Sephora, and in a way, it is, but it is more hair products than anything. I thought the selection was really good and I liked that they some higher end products. As a black woman, I wish they had more products for our hair in there, but they do have a a decent selection.  I also wish that they had less drug store products as in the makeup selection, but it is a nice store all the same with a big ass collection, so what's not to love. I will be back when the stuff I bought is used up, but I am not sure that I would make this my destination for beauty products.

I would normally give them a 3 - 4 star rating however my recent experience at this location was not the most pleasant. I was in the store for over 30 minutes checking out the sales and other products that were not on sale and one of the employees walked directly in front of me brushed up against me and didn't even say excuse me or speak to me at all.  Then to add insult to injury she end up being the lady who checked me out at the register.

I could spend my entire saving account in Ulta Beauty! This location is well kept and the employees are helpful. My last visit was kept short but whenever I needed assistance with a product an employee was quick to help me!

I went to the salon for a haircut. Upon arrival no one was actually in the salon and I had to wait even though I had an appointment.  The stylist was nice and friendly but not good at cutting hair.  I asked for a trim since I love my long hair.  The stylist cut horrible layers into my hair cutting off six inches in the front and I ended up having one chunk that is shorter than the rest of my hair.  I was visibly upset about the cut but she kept cutting more off in an attempt to fix it. Now I'll have to go somewhere else to have it cut much shorter all around. I do not recommend.

I thought I had seen every type of Ulta there is, but this is a super fancy Ulta with a salon in the store! Oooh fancy!

I have mentioned in past Ulta reviews how much I love this store because some of the things they sell are better priced than what you would find at a drug store and everything is neatly organized by brand. On this particular day, I was in the market for a curling iron and I knew that Ulta would have a large selection, so that I could find what I needed. I ended up getting the perfect 1 1/2 inch barrel curler that I was looking for for a little under $40.

While this Ulta isn't necessarily worth going out of my way, it's great for beauty needs if you are in the area.

Ulta is great if you're all about self-service...however, I think a store dedicated to skincare/salon service should offer personalized service, or at the very least, service.

I like to browse around on my own, so I don't need a tour of the place and if I'm stopping in to pick up product that's running low, I'm all about the grab and go.  However, on this particular visit, I wanted to get some insight on concealer.  Long story short, as I read through 50 different descriptions to find a concealer I could live with, while the staff discussed scheduling and the high costs of ultrasounds.  I must have wandered around for 20 minutes and not one of them looked at me as they pondered the difficulty of setting regular hours in retail.  Granted, no one there is a dermatologist, so it's no like I missed out on anything, but isn't the point of being a specialized store the fact that you offer in-depth, personal service to clients.  Aren't the associates trained to be (or appear to be) subject matter experts?  

Once I gathered my items and headed to the register I consoled myself by saying, at least I am leaving with everything I wanted/needed, even if it probably took longer since no one was available to help me.  So, what happened next?  The clerk at the register asked me about cleansing beads and whether or not my face wash contained these beads...how the hell should I know, as I have never used the product.  More importantly, can't you sample this, and every other product in the store?  Couldn't you just read the ingredient list?  

Lesson here:  Though disappointed, I realized this place is better for picking up products I'm familiar with, rather than shopping for new products.

DO NOT GET A HAIR CUT HERE! Both my roommate and I have visited this salon and had bad hair cuts with Pam. Unfortunately we didn't realize it until it was too late.  My hair cut was uneven - which is quite an accomplishment considering all I asked for a straight across the back with a slight angle in the front. My roommate asked for layers but they are not blended at all AND her hair wasn't actually dry when she left the salon. Awful, just awful.

My name is Morgan, and I am a productaholic. There I said it.  I scrounge CVS for cheap but rare hair products and hit up Sephora on Black Friday like it's going out of business.   

I've skirted Ulta for some time now, hearing the terms "glorified convenience store." I had to get my bareminerals foundation so I decided to peak inside.  

HOLY MOTHER OF BARBIE! To your right is Sephora without the flittering sales ladies, to your left is CVS on 'roids and down the middle there are rows for men and in the very back, there's a fricken' salon. 

Think of how in the Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory, the kiddy-winks got to touch and feel all the candy...here, you get to touch and feel all the makeup brushes, blow dryers and styling tools. 

A sales associate noticed my gaping mouth and offered an explanation of this makeup utopia. I did my best to grab just the bare essentials and a new moisturizer in the Yes to Tomatoes line (There's more than just Yes to Carrots, ladies!). Thank God it's in Kennah' or it'd be on my route.  The pièce de résistance is that they have a points card, much like Sephora's, and email you coupons! Ulta...I think I love you.

I like the fact all brands are in one location. I am a fan of a one stop shop. 
I did receive help from an associate and she was honest enough to tell me she preferred other brands than Ulta. 
It would be even more convenient if their drug store brands were slightly cheaper than drugstore prices.

This is by far the best Ulta in the New Orleans Metroplex (Harahan). The staff is always attentive. The items that are usually sold out at other Ulta's in the city are ALWAYS at this one. I wish I could use them for all my makeup needs but that other dreadful store (won't say any names) carries some things that they don't. 

If you're a makeup lover get enrolled in their points program. Free makeup, bday gifts and double points.

I needed a complete restock of my makeup so I stopped here while I was in Elmwood. I spent over $250 on products after the It representative helped me. The girl working for ULTA not only knew nothing about products, when I got home she had put brown eyeliner in my bag instead of black...ugggghhhh! I was so aggravated but I needed the eyeliner for that night :(

Why does this place always suck me in? I never have an intentions of going and then bam I'm there for an hour! Which..... I never leave disappointed. What girl doesn't love her makeup? It was a little hectic this time going, it was homecoming season. Still I got offered help plenty of times and the ladies also seemed very nice and eager to Help. They also almost always have a sale on something. I don't think I've ever left empty handed

I've been here three times. Fortunately for my pocketbook and schedule, I'm not a makeup fanatic, because this store has so much stuff. I know some people probably go broke in here. I'm going to try to stay away because I could easily get hooked.

While there yesterday and the day before, I saw so many different brands from so many different celebrities and people I learned about through YouTube right alongside the brands that have been around for years. There is something for everyone. 

Upon entering the store, there were several people mulling around the front door. I couldn't figure out what exactly was going on. I'm guessing the store was having a party, team meeting, or maybe they just happened to be there at the time I entered. I'm not sure if one of those many people greeted me or if they were even employees. But as I made my way further into the store, an associate asked whether or not I needed anything. I declined and continued on the search for the specific product I had come for. 

The shelf had a spot and price tag for the product I'd come for but there was nothing there. There were similar products by the same manufacturer next to the empty spot so I decided to look for someone to assist me. This turned out to be a small challenge. I couldn't find anyone in that area of the store. I walked around the general area trying to figure out who worked there and who didn't. Finally, two ladies appeared about the same time at a counter in the rear of the store. I asked if perhaps the product might be in the back and one of them went to check. She returned with the last one in the store which was wonderful. I returned to the front to check out.  The line area has lots of last minute temptations, but once again, I was thankful that none of it interested me.  There were two or three people checking customers out and one or two more doing different things in the register area. I've concluded that getting customers out the door is not a number one priority here.

Although the store is well organized, sections are clearly designated, and lighting is perfect, if employees had a uniform look, a smock, or if this huge store had little stations where customers could summons assistance, it would be helpful for those of us who are not experts in "beauty". 

I ended up needing to return the item I purchased because I was not satisfied with it. I looked online for Ulta's return policy and was delighted to find out that I would have no trouble getting a refund even though he item had been opened and used, and could not be resold. They have a very fair and accommodating return policy.

The store has more than just make up. It has curling irons, blow dryers, waxing kits, lighted mirrors, facial equipment, the list goes on and on. After returning home, I received an email survey about my experience. Through the survey, I learned that they offer services. I had no idea. But yeah, they offer hair and skin services and even make up. 

I will say it one more time:  I'm so glad I'm not into make up because this store has way too much stuff and it looks like it could be fun.

I am the biggest makeup junkie (ask any of my friends)-I have gone days without buying food yet somehow managed to still purchase new makeup. 

Given my love for makeup, I've always loved Ulta because they have such a wide variety of not just high end products but drugstore products as well. I also like the layout better than Sephora (not as cluttered, brighter, more spacious). With that said, I'm not a fan of this location. The products are great, the store is clean, but each time I've been here the employees haven't been helpful at all. They can typically be found in a corner gossiping and when I've asked them for help (e.g. Where are your dry shampoos? Where are your self tanners?), they come across bothered. And I'm not someone that necessarily expects a salesperson to come
up to me asking if I need help, but when I do ask for help, at the very least I expect help in return without an attitude.

It's a shame because if the employees were friendlier this review would be five stars instead of two stars, but every time I go to this location I leave with a bad taste in my mouth.

Despite all of this, I'll still go every so often as I do love Ulta, but now I'll only go to this location if I can't find the products at a CVS or Sephora.
This is one of my favorite Ulta's to go to in person. Always very clean and friendly staff. The makeup ladies here, they know their stuff.
We had the best experience today with Jacob! Very knowledgeable, kind and explained things well to my daughter and I.  We hope to see him again soon

Okay I normally don't do this but now I'm frustrated.

Long story short, I know makeup. I've done makeup for weddings, proms, models, etc. My specialty is skin/complexion, so I KNOW the difference between warm/cool/neutral foundations. With that said, I went in today because I had a coupon and wanted to get some more foundations.

Again, I know my undertones. So I began talking to the NARS rep and decided to purchase the sheer glow foundation-one of my favorites. I told him I wanted one shade just slightly darker than my skin because I get spray tans but that I still wanted it to be in the warm/golden family-I then pointed at the shade Punjab because I've owned it before and know it's my perfect shade. He then questioned me and said "um you mean something with a rosy/cool undertone then? Because Punjab is rosy and a warmer shade will be too yellow for you." This was after I told him I do makeup, so it came across a bit demeaning-as if I don't really know what I'm talking about. I kind of just nodded my head and said "sure" because I didn't want to come across mean, but I was confused. He then put Punjab on me and just like I said, it matched me perfectly. I ended up purchasing Punjab and their concealer in the shade cannelle. He kept referring to them as "rosy"

When I got home, I immediately googled the two shades on NARS site to make sure I wasn't going crazy, and they are described as "golden" and "peachy" (see attached photos).

So why am I writing this? 1. Because although the NARS rep was nice, I didn't like his comments 2. If you're going to have a NARS rep at your store, he/she should at least be able to properly tell the difference between undertones and not improperly refer to shades as being something they are not.

All in all, my experiences at this location have been way too hit or miss for me to definitively give them more than 2 stars. Sorry Ulta, but until you get your act together I'm officially done visiting your Elmwood location.

So I went here to get some simple face moisturizer and a gentle cleaner. It takes like 15 minutes just to get through a 4 person line and then I'm forced to give my info. I told them I wasn't a member and wasn't interested but the lady there literally didn't care about what I was saying and I had to give my info just to get some simple supplies. In retrospect I should've refused and not given all that info but I felt like ambushed by it. That's really messed up Ulta

Alex saved the day again! She is an amazing stylist and the sweetest, most kind hearted person! I will always recommend her to anyone. She really takes time to listen to you and help you communicate what you want. She never makes me feel rushed and ensures I'm always happy before I leave her chair. Thank you so much Alex!

If you're needing a makeup consultant, I would recommend Anna. She's so nice, personable, professional, and knowledgeable! She didn't push a product on me, and really listened to my needs. Although making a sale I'm sure is priority, I felt she really cared more in ensuring I left with what I wanted; in turn encourages me to shop there more often. Thanks Anna!

Hi! I was in the Metairie area visiting family. My fiancé and I DID NOT LIKE THE EXPERIENCE! When we first walked in we were not greeted. We was asked if we needed help by the fragrance counter. We was just testing different perfume/cologne just to see which one we wanted for the summer weather. We picked two and put in our bag. I had a few more items I had to get since I'm a Professional makeup artist. We was followed constantly by the police and associates!  Meanwhile, I go to an aisle to find concealers, and see there were two girls with large bags talking about what they was going to steal! I was like what the heck! So I left and went to the Mac area. I was looking for the Mac Mineralize powder that I use for my clients. The darkest color they had was Deep!  I was like what the hell! The girl said I know everybody ask for Dark Deep. My fiancé said well it looks like you guys need to get darker shades since it's popular. Then he said well I see y'all want a certain race here huh?  She turned red. Lol. That's a shame. We walked away. And got in line to check out. We spent about $250 in this store. And honestly my fiancé was like no, don't buy here since they are like discriminating and acting like we can't buy here. I said no. I just KNOW I WONT BE BACK AND WILL TELL PPL NOT TO GO THERE. Crazy part was that a mua from my hometown referred me there to work at the Mac there. She wanted me to see if I would like to work there. And I would NEVER!  I'm self employed and I'll stick with shopping online w Ulta. Because bad customer service like that will make me not want to spend Any money!  Def do not recommend this place!

Terrible customer service. The elmwood location is my go to store, typically greeted or acknowledged upon entering.  Not the case today, 4 customer service ladies behind the counter leaving 2 ladies on the floor to help the good bit of customers in the store at the time. Not a single one emerged to the floor until I made a comment about the poor service.

I am not much of a makeup wearing person at all. I got a gift card to Ulta during the holiday season of 2018, and have been debating on what to do. Give it away? Use it myself? I know of several people who go to Ulta and love it. I watched a few YouTube videos about makeup application. Ok, I fell down the rabbit hole of videos. I knew I wasn't going to drop money on anything expensive, and I talked myself into coming here. I was greeted upon walking in the store, saw a few people who might be staff members walking around the store, or talking to each other in small groups on the sales floor. No one came up to talk to me at all. I picked out a few things and got in line to check out. There were about 10 people in line and only 2 people checking out on a Saturday afternoon. The cashier did talk me into joining the rewards program. Whatever. I got a discount, only having to spend about $30 of my own money after the $25 gift card and discounts. Will I be back? Maybe.

The parking lot is large. This is in the Elmwood Shopping Center, right beside DSW across from Old Navy. It is easy to spot once driving through the strip mall parking lot. I kind of wish there were staff members walking around asking if customers needed any help, but I get that most people coming in already know what they are coming in for, this caters to makeup wearing people who already know what they are doing.

I came in looking for one thing with my sister. We literally had to run around looking for a a worker to help us and when we finally asked someone if they had something we needed they claim to "look in the back" stood there for 20 mins saw the woman again and walked past us like we were nothing.

I'm really disappointed in the staff at this location. I went in to find a light chemical exfoliater for my face (very light, as in, something I can use multiple times per week). I specified that I wanted something inexpensive. The sales associate proceeded to show me multiple $70-$150 products and insisted, even after I told her what I wanted, that nothing with less than 10% glycolic acid would help with exfoliation. Unfortunately, I'm not sure she understands how chemistry works. Even at a low percentage, even mild agents like 2% salicylic acid WILL exfoliate your skin; they won't make your entire first layer of skin peel off, but they will exfoliate. This is right up there with the "dietician" who tried to tell me that potatoes are not a complex carbohydrate...

They will try to scam you into getting the credit card. One worker told me to get the credit card and I can cancel it anytime. She was hyping it up and when I said my credit score will go down if I cancel it and she was surprised that I knew that. She started laughing saying " You're smart". It made me wonder how many people they scammed that way.

I was buying a couple Estee Lauer products. I have not been in an Ulta store in about 10 years.  The cashier asked if I was a member of their rewards program. No I said.  She then told me I had to join the rewards program or I could not return any part of my purchase.  Then asked for my phone and email.  I was surprised to hear this and asked her to repeat what she said. She said their policy was that there are no returns unless you join the rewards program and I had to provide my information to join.  I told her no thanks. I don't want to buy anything.  I have checked the Ulta site online. It does not state this policy. I strongly suspect that cashiers get a commission or bonus for signing new customers, so this store allows their cashiers to run this scam to get more people to sign up for the rewards program. Don't shop here. You deserve better.

Stopped in this store when I was in the area. Was welcomed while walking in but then no help. Girls were working throughout store and yet no help. The one I asked gave me an attitude like I was bothering her. Still asked my question with no help or suggestions. Had to walk out due to poor customer service. Won't be coming back to this location.

Keep in mind that I am a Sephora and Ulta card carrying member. I tried comparing my specific lotion and scrub and it turns out to be the same price at both places. But the big difference is that him can get tons of coupons from Ulta so this may be my new favorite store.

Like Shercole described this is more of a self service store so you kind of need to know what you want. One of the things I likes was the free gift you get when you bought a boxed set of perfume. I'm a sicker for free stuff and was looking for a present for my mum. So the cute little tote bag that came with her boxed perfume was a huge hit!

Like Morgan described there are drug store items on the left, and beauty products on the right. There is a salon in the back and clean restrooms. It's a well lit store and the staff are friendly! Plus they let you use coupons that they can scan from your phone! Score!

Happy beauty product shopping!

This place has a ton of variety items . High end to drugstore . That's great & all but who wants to shop here when the employees are rude af !! They don't care if you need help or not ! They are only there to gossip to each other ! I will take my business elsewhere ! I do not recommend this place ! Do not shop here !

Don't come here unless you want to be stalked by staff. Just because I'm not a old short white woman with a purse doesn't mean I don't have money. 
It's very inappropriate to have 30 staff members here. KMAA

One of the worst ulta's I've ever been to. I needed help finding a particular product and i approached one of the workers who not only gave me an attitude, but didn't bother to check in the back to see if there was any more available. She just told me no, there was none left. I then got everything else I needed and went to checkout. The cashier didn't greet me at all. She just scanned my items and gave me a smirk when she noticed I had two transactions. I also used coupons which she gave me an attitude about. What's the big deal? I was told manufacturer coupons were accepted and I had some to use so I used them. I not only got the deal, but an unnecessary attitude to go with it. There was also something going on in the store where each purchase came with a tote. I'm not sure if it was to get rid of extras or not. Either way, the girls were rude and I will not come back to this location.

Great beauty store! I have shopped here several times. I actually was able to purchase the James Charles palette that my teen wanted for Christmas that keeps selling out. It was limited in stock & I had to wait outside for the store to open. The employees handled it in such a professional manner. I was even able to use a coupon that I had when you use the Ulta app. I will definitely be returning! They have great sales too.

it's slow checkout  because they are new. They wouldn't give me my birthday perk because I didn't have the special email. Even though she could clearly see in my account that my birthday was a couple days ago. Probably ulta policy not hers but none the less it's lame and made me feel dumb. 
See ya ulta. I will only go to Nordstrom and sephora.

I had never been to this Ulta before. I was looking for a specific shade of Essie nail polish and they did have it so that was a plus. After I found the nail polish I wanted to look at Korean skin care products. I could not find them so one of the associates brought me to the correct aisle and left me to look for myself.
