I prefer this. I don't like when someone stays with me. Positive experience and I will return!

I usually shop at the chesterfield location but this was a soft opening and a great coupon was given to me so I decided to shop at this one. I forgot my coupon and the whole staff was determined to NOT help me according to the manager of which said they were just doing their job. Frustrated, I was about to walk without buying when finally the manager overrode the amount so I could get my coupon. Having a rewards account with Sephora I could have just gone there and skipped the headache but again, having gone to the chesterfield one I thought this experience would have been the same. The product I bought is not even good.  I will have to return or exchange it because it keeps breaking. Other than those issues, the store was pretty well stocked, is in a good location, and despite the unwillingness to help me the staff was nice. The manager was a little overwhelmed I think but she should have not let it show to her employees in my opinion. Those girls work hard for what they do.

I was so excited to learn that Ulta Beauty was opening up in Creve Coeur, MO.  Unfortunately, I find that the shelves are not stocked to accommodate in store specials.  The sales associates are not knowledgeable about products, however, they are friendly.  For a beauty supply store in this area, they are truly disappointing.

I called to see if they had an open appointment for hair color yesterday. I was able to come in at 3:15 and I was placed with the salon manager Kristina. She seriously knows her stuff and she is worth her prices. My all over color was 168$ before tip but that was after using 4 bowls of color. If you want someone who genuinely cares about your hair and will go above and beyond to make sure your color comes out perfectly, she's your girl. Also I don't remember her name but I got my eyebrows waxed the same night and she did an amazing job as well. I wish I caught her name but I highly recommend her for brows.

New location. I went today to check it out.

It's clean, well-lit and signage is well-viewable. Many sales associates are on the floor. I was greeted upon arrival, and numerous associates asked if I needed assistance.

Everything was all fine and good, until I got to checkout.

A woman was checking out, and asked how to use a particular item she was buying. That wasn't the cashier's fault, but the explanation went on and on.

Then, the cashier decided to do an upsell of some associated item that she would "swear on." And was it a Chatty Cathy sales pitch!

Now, five people were standing in line to check out. I was #2. #1 turned around and looked at me. We shared "The Look." No other cashiers came to operate another register.

I left the line, returned my would-be three purchases to their respective homes, and walked out.

As I walked out, I turned at looked at #1. We were both laughing, and upsell was continuing.

There's nothing wrong with upsell. We can all spot it, and we expect it. BUT PLEASE don't do it at checkout. Do it on the floor.

Men's haircut - 12:00
Female barber - Ashlan

Asked for light trim and said better to long than to short. Requested hair down over the ear ....business man style. 
Results: Modified burr on top, sides short, not over the ear as requested.  I feel like I have a military hair cut.
NOT PLEASED in ANY WAY 
Combed my hair very hard.......it hurt!!!!
Excellent parking, huge selection of products,
Brightly illuminated.   Beautiful business  
My recommendation is PICK ANOTHER STYLIST!
She does not follow instructions.....just does what she wants

The checkout staff was really great.  They called for more cashiers when the line got longer, which is not always the case in stores.  The manager at the checkout was really polite and efficient when handling a few problems that occurred with my transaction (my fault) and others.
Nothing is worth waiting in line for 30 minutes with one cashier who takes forever. Boo

This is my go to Ulta.  It is in a sleepy part of a strip mall so I don't have to fight the crowds and parking that I do at other stores (looking at you Brentwood).  I have been going for some time.  This one is the second friendliest but South County is too far for a regular visit.   The styling services are great at this spot and I would recommend Levi if you come out this way.  It's a smaller space but has what I need.

Everytime i come to this location i leave extremely happy.  Return visits after my first visit i am always greeted by name.  I had my hair done by Levi and qas extremely happy and the lady in clinique definitely knows her stuff!  I highly recommend.

I went to this Ulta location to get some ideas for a new foundation. I've been using Urban Decay Naked Skin for a few years, and was hoping to switch to a foundation with a bit more coverage. An employee approached me after being in the store for just a couple minutes, which I thought was great. However, after explaining why I was there, she navigated me away from most of the foundations over to another employee. She left me with this other employee because she was a "certified cosmetologist." I was asked about my skin care routine, and the employee recommended a three-part face wash package; I was annoyed because I was shopping for foundation, not skincare products. After spending a few minutes pushing skincare products in my direction, the employee gave me one sample of foundation, but didn't really explain why she was recommending it. I understand that it is important that they add on items to make sales, but I would have rather spent the majority of my time learning more about foundations. I will continue my makeup shopping at Sephora in the future.

Facility is nice but don't risk your brows at their brow bar. I was very specific about being in the process of not growing out my brows and that I don't want them to touch the tail. They instead removed the entire tail and when I told them I wasn't happy with it. They said " you'll just have to wait for them to grow back" like yes I know I've been trying to grow them back for over a year and you just waxed it all off.

The checkout staff was really great.  They called for more cashiers when the line got longer, which is not always the case in stores.  The manager at the checkout was really polite and efficient  when handling a few problems that occurred with my transaction (my fault) and others.


Update:

Once again, this Ulta handled my complicated exchange with efficiency and polite interaction.  I believe I dealt with Shelby both times....

This Ulta is in GulfView Mall and not as large as the store off Gulf To Bay but still has a decent selection, except for their perfumes.. The shelves are always practically empty. I visit this location at least once a month and for the most part, the employees don't talk to you even if you are just blank staring at a wall, like a lost baby. They won't budge to ask if you need help, whatever. If I want it, I'll go look for you. 
Howeevvveerrr, there is a man who works in the salon area who is very helpful and knowledgeable! I wish I knew his name.. He has facial piercings, that is all I can remember. Anyways, I walked up to the wall o' hair care looking for purple shampoo. I will be the first to admit I know nothing about my hair. I had the Redken brand on my hand when he approached and asked if I needed help. "Yeeeesssss thank you!!!" 
He showed me three of the top brands and explained the different pros and cons of each. He definitely made me feel very confident that I made the right purchase. 
Later on, a different employee came up to me and complimented me on my shoes (why thank you) and just all around it was an awesome shopping experience. 
Not to say every time is this enjoyable and heart warming though.. This past weekend I was looking for a specific eyeshadow palette from Too Faced. I couldn't find a spot that even said Peanut Butter so I asked an employee if the Too Faced palettes were any where else in the store, to which she quickly snapped at me, "No. We are all sold out of peanut butter." Okay. "And if you next question is about Peaches, we don't have that either." I wanted to just leave right then and there.. But I also wanted my Dark Chocolate palette.. Night staff is a delight! Weekend staff.. Well, they're more like the wicked witch of the west..

So I usually go to this store when it opens at 10. Since moving here I've been to it 4 times. The 1st time I walked in the woman didn't acknowledge me but a male that was there helped me a great deal. The next time I was returning and purchasing so I went to return and was trying to explain why.  The woman didn't acknowledge me kept scanning finally I said "so you probably don't care why I'm returning. Nothing. Than she had a phone call so she called someone over to finish my return and left. I said is she the manager they said yes. I said she was very rude. 3rd time went in for a hair cut with Tiffany (I've had no luck finding someone to give me a good cut and style other places so I was trying Ulta). Great cut and style plus 
other people helped with my skin care selection. My 4th visit was another cut plus I brought my husband for a cut also. An employee came over while waiting to see if I needed help. They are working up to a 5 star. Not this time because the girl at the register told me I couldn't apply for there MasterCard in store had to do from home. 
Wrong. Tiffany got that straightened out for me.

I LOVE make up. I love that the Mall at Gulfview has an Ulta store, and it's one of my favorite playgrounds. 

I will say that the service can be spotty. Like today. When I walked in 2 ladies, one of them was the General Manager were holding a conversation that was far too busy to give up in lieu of customers coming into the store.  After about 5 minutes they walked over to see if they could be any help. 

It's service like this that makes stores like Ulta and sephora seem unapproachable, but if you know what you're looking for, you'll find it.  What I was truly happy about was that I found that Urban Decay lipsticks were 50% off due to them being discontinued for re-boxing. New packaging means a great bargain. So instead of being $22, I got 4 gorgeous lippies for $11 each. I also picked up 3 new Nyx lipsticks too. 

Yeah, makeup shopping is hard on my pocketbook. WOE is ME.

My daughter suggested Ulta as a store that I could go into, and try some different products to accomplish what I wanted to accomplish. This way I could try what I wanted, be helped by someone who was familiar with the products, and purchase them right there. I was quite excited the first time I attempted to go, and left feeling not so great. There were three employees working, and two were talking, and one was stocking or going over products at the counter. I couldn't get a person, and after a while, I left. My second visit I had a similar experience, except I did get a person to talk to me after I followed her around, and felt I annoyed her by asking a question. I was looking for a pretty specific product, and if You've been to Ulta before, you know that sending someone down an isle to look is not much help. When I looked like I couldn't find it, she came over and pointed to everything around there, and said "these are all in the same catagory", not what I wanted whatsover. Again, she was stocking, and didn't want to help I would have liked to try something, but she was pretty rude, and I wouldn't have wanted her help even had she offered it (which she didn't). My third time there (yes, possibly stupidity), I happen to pass it (it's in a mall), and saw three woman at the counter, and crossed my fingers and toes. I walked in and spent my usual ten minutes there, not knowing where anything was, and wondering if they really do show people how to use their makeup, because I had never seen it. Im not sure if it's just that location, but as one who tends to spend money on makeup, I was pretty astounded, and wondered if they ever had a manager around. Had I been one around, there would be three people looking for a job, or much better trained. At the least acknowledge a person is in your store, especially considering you have to walk right past the desk when you enter the store. Personally, I would rather buy makeup from Walgreens, until I am in Tampa and can go where they seem to care about selling a product, or making a commission, or maybe they just enjoy their jobs, but in any event, three times is one time more than I usually give, and It won't happen again!!!  BY the way, just for the record, when I was there all three times, the store was empty. I believe once there was one woman in the store (not being helped) and the other times I was the only one, just so you know it wasn't because they were oh so busy!! :)

Agree with some of the previous reviewers regarding the customer service. Every time I have visited the store, there is a longer than necessary wait at the register. At least one of the cashiers spends way too much time chatting with the customers (especially when the lines are long). I have also experienced entering the store while at least 3-4 employees are chatting away in the front.

This is the worse Ulta I have been to . I spend a few hundred dollars at Ulta and Sephora every 6 to 8 weeks on perfume, make up and hair products . 
The service was the worse I have ever had . The ladies working didn't know much about their make up products and seemed bothered . The store was dirty. Floors have make up applicators, among other particles around the store . I will never shop at this Ulta again .

For the store in general, it's terrible. I've been here numerous times, always disappointed. I go here for the products they carry, but after all the negative experiences I'm opt-ing to buy online. Which is terrible, cause when buying make-up it's nice to see the colors and product before you buy it.

I've never gone in and there not been a line wrapping into the store from the registers. And it's not like they are under staffed... It's because several employees are not at the register. There was one specific time when they manager or shift leading employee was called (through the headsets) from the one girl left to tend to the registers alone 3x for help. She finally came to assist, and then decided to carry on a personal conversation (she was friends with the guest she rang up) for 5 minutes when there was still 3 more people in line. Leaving the other girl to the line again while she just talked... I finally made it to the register, and she picked up a call (which had been ringing for quite sometime) rather than help me. At that point I just walked out. It was that rude of her. I called cooperate to let them know about this. She clearly remembers me and is rude as can be on purpose each time I see her. Unbelievable... I try to continue shopping here and she still acts like this when I give multiple other chances.

I did use their beauty services and we're pleased. That's where the 2 stars come from. If you book online it is easy to get an appointment that fits your schedule. They do use great products, as well has have great stylists. I had to get a new headshot so I wanted a blow out and professionally done make-up. Definitely worth it for the price, and your first service you get a discount.

Some of the worst customer service (lack thereof) I've ever had the misfortune of dealing with. Employees were too busy talking to each other and rolling their eyes to be of any assistance to paying customers. Extremely rude and unpleasant. Won't be returning.

Ulta is a place you will often find me at. I'm originally from Tarpon Springs, and just recently moved to Port Richey. With that being said, I started going to the Ulta at Gulfview rather than the one in Tarpon. Upon my arrival with a friend everything was going great until I came to the check out counter and the cashier ringing me up (I believe the receipt said her name was Jamie. She also had pink hair from what I can remember about her) seemed annoyed from the beginning. I figured she was maybe having a bad day so I didn't make think much of it until I politely asked her to check my reward points. Keep in mind, I just came in last week and my receipt said I had hundreds of points I just wanted to see if I had any redeemable. So with an attitude and an eye roll from her, she says I don't have any points. I ask her nicely if she can check under a different phone number and she yet again rolls her eyes and let's out a huge sigh. At this point I'm just done and I tell her to forget about it. I've never received such awful customer service. Even my friend was absolutely appalled at the way she treated me. I never usually go out of my way to write reviews, but if you're that miserable at your job you should probably find something else.

Terrible place! Showed pictures of what I wanted and didn't end up at all like the picture so I had to come back for a service correction and they wanted to charge me for it after they messed up because of a product they recommended me use after they messed up the first time.
What a wonderful place this is for women. All of the employees and the professionals in the salon doing hair and skin care are very knowledgeable and kind. Ulta is like a Home Depot for women

If I could rate this a negative star I would. Went to ulta to ask if there was any way to tone down a certain area of my hair that was blonde and the hairdresser toned it twice and it is grey. Scheduled an appointment for 1:30, they called and said they couldn't do it until 2:30, and when I got there and finally was assisted it was 3:15 probably. I was in a rush and after the two toning processes and washes I had to rush out with wet hair. Later on when it finally dried it is grey and the most dead I've ever seen it. I'm going on vacation and I have to look like this for it so thank you! 10/10 would not recommend. I did not tip and my name is emily fisher.

Kayla waxed my eyebrows today and she did an AMAZING job! Jordan has done them previously too! Both of the ladies "mapped out" on my brows exactly what they were going to wax and most importantly made sure I was satisfied!! I HIGHLY recommend these two to make your brows perfect!

I was in Franklin for business and decided last minute that I absolutely needed a haircut. I live in the sfbay area and last minute could only think of ulta for an affordable good salon. Made a same day appointment after my training class and Sherayne did a fantastic job! I am so happy with my hair it's a shame I won't be able to come here all the time! She listened took her time and really made sure I was happy with the result. Thank you Sherayne for providing me with some much needed "me" time!!!

I was super dissatisfied with my experience today at the Ulta in cool springs. I was in to shop for a perfume and wanted to smell a perfume they had out on display and they had no tester out to smell. I asked if they had a tester available and was told "We recommend going to a department store to smell that". If that's the case, I would have went to the department store and bought from them. I don't understand why another bottle couldn't have been opened and made a tester. I ended up not buying any perfume and just getting other things I needed. Then, when I approached the counter to check out they looked at us a couple times and then were like "oh do you need to check out"... yes?? Why else would we be standing here? Just an all around bad experience and I won't be returning to this Ulta.

CONS:
- Never having the item I go in for in stock.
- Can't order it and have it shipped tot he store FOR FREE.
- Must pay for $50 of product for free shipping, said product is only $12.99
- Found one product on the shelf that had been clearly used, thinking a discount would work I would be okay with that. THE MANAGER said no, I can't but I can clean it up for you if you would like? 
-- -- NO. Okay so you need to make a full profit on a product that clearly had been used before? NOT GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE. 
- Never any parking
- Staffing, hit or miss. Sometimes you can't find anyone to help and other times several people are  just standing around. 

PROS:
- Location 
- Overall cleanliness of store, good

It is extremely frustrating that a customer cannot order a product and ship free to your store.

I made an appointment online through Ulta's website. I was called the next day about 2 hours before my appointment and was told that something was wrong with the online scheduling system and there was no appointment available that day. I was able to make an appointment for the next day with Sherayne. Not only did Sherayne rip hair from my head several times while vigorously brushing my hair, but the "layers" I requested ended up being ONE layer in addition to my regular length. I asked for a wavy hairstyle that had body and bounce, but by the time I arrived home 10 minutes after my appointment, my hair looked shaggy and messy. I decided to give it a few days but intimately decided that my haircut was awful. I called the salon and the manager told me to come back in for an appointment with Afsaneh. She listened to what I wanted and asked many clarifying questions. Afsaneh also looked at my hair and showed me how uneven my hair had been cut by Sherayne and seemed pretty shocked at how bad it was. She was gentle and friendly and my hair looked fantastic all day long and into the next day. She had a completely different approach to styling hair than Sherayne, and Afsaneh's method proved to be much more successful.  If you make an appointment at The Salon at Ulta, definitely request Afsaneh!  I gave 4 stars because of Afsaneh and the great manager who helped take care of me, but took a star away bc of the initial bad experience.

Ariel has colored my hair twice now and she is an excellent colorist and very down to earth and honest. Finally got to the cool grey look I have been wanting for a year! 

Also as far as the store, they were great at returning an expensive hair product it turned out I was allergic to! Nice to know!

We had a wonderful experience shopping at this location. 
The selection is huge and the employees are incredibly helpful. The store is very clean and well-stocked. 

I can only say great things about our shopping trip. 

I am so appreciative of one employee in particular. She might've been the manager but she helped us find every item that we were looking for. Even when she had to go help other employees, she always came back to check on us and help us find all the items on our list. 

Everything that we were looking for was stocked and there were so many choices of brands, prices, and colors to choose from. 

We made this a special 50 mile trip for my daughters birthday. She was looking for things she had seen from YouTube and she was not disappointed. I am so thankful they made it special for her.

Hey! It's Christmas time and a Tuesday. I had hoped to find a nail gift set for, wait for it, my daughter who is 10. 

Guess what I will in the future be steering my new consumer far far away from this store.  What, why? Cause if you ain't 20 something or below, you will not be waited on, or asked "can I help u?"!  

A Christmas miracle of a light bulb went off in my head! This place is like...... oh yeah Target, I'm going to target. See ya shorties!
Found what I needed and milk, boom!

This place is hit or miss.  I had one decent experience and the rest were crap.
It's typically a young newbie that doesn't know how to answer any of the questions and a long line of people in front and behind me.

There's no sort of helpfulness in terms of, what promos are going on right now and my biggest complaint is YOU CANNOT ORDER something to be shipped to the STORE for FREE. and they don't know what's coming in on the truck so you can't plan to ever come by and pick up what you need because you don't know if it will be in.  That's just bad customer service.

So I'll buy online and have to order $50+ worth of things in order to get free shipping on a $6 item I want that you can't seem to keep in stock.  It's frustrating.

I think someone else mentioned it as well, that I have only been asked once or twice of all the times I've been in, if I needed help with something.  The rest of the time, I have waited in line to ask someone, someone that wasn't helpful or even glad to be working there.  Fake it until you make it in retail honey. At least pretend to be happy or helpful, even one of the two would be great. :(  Ugh.

I stopped into this Ulta while I was in the area looking for two very specific products. I was having a hard time finding one of the items and a store associate asked if she could help me with anything and guided me right to why I was looking for! One of the items I was looking for was very popular, so they didn't have any on the shelf, but she checked the back and they had one! Yay!! The second item I was looking for I needed more guidance on so I asked another store associate her opinion on the foundation I was looking at and she gave me her honest opinion and helped me find the right shade for me!

I had two coupons, so when I went to check out I asked to do two separate transactions so I could use both coupons, which the cashier had no problems with. Unfortunately, the second item I purchased I couldn't use a coupon on because it was a prestige make up product, but he did give me the coupon back so I could save it for later or share with a friend.

The store was clean and organized and I would love to come back next time I need anything!
To the girl who helped me pick out my St. Tropez Tanning Mousse, you are a GEM! I didn't catch your name and I apologize (being sick) but girl you ROCK!!! Thank you bunches!!

Worst Ulta ever. NOTHING is ever in stock. NOTHING is ever organized or where it should be. All the testers are always disgusting or missing or still sealed and opening them yourself just brings negative attention because people around you assume you're opening  product and leaving it. The employees are always standing around talking to each other and seem very bothered when you ask for help. I asked for something comparable to what I usually get bc they haven't had it for over a month and I was brought one row over and basically had to help myself while she stood there and just said "sorry" when those didn't work out. I just lost out on 5x point per NYX product when I bought 7 even though she was in my account and saw my offers. The place is a joke. I spend thousands annually on make-up as do probably most women and for that amount of money, the employees could at least pretend to care. Whoever is in charge there has zero control of that retail space. I'll be going back to Sephora from now on.

Decent selection of items but the people working there usually have an attitude. 
I hate being asked by 50 different people if I need help and them watching me because I have a COACH backpack purse. 
Sorry for disappointing but I don't have to steal shit.

Trash. Asked specifically when a restock would be in for a specific line and they said it would be in the day after I called..come to find out they actually stocked up all that day and it got sold
Out the same day I called when they lied and said it would be in the next day?? Confused and horrible service they couldn't even respond when I was on the phone with them after asking why they didn't give me correct information

8/7/2020 - I'm actually surprised I haven't heard from Ulta since my review. 

Sadly, since I initially posted my review, I've been dealing with severe breakage (pieces that are 2 - 3" long, even after being forced to cut almost 3" off!). 

I get angry every time I look in the mirror - my hair is hideous looking, and will be for months!!!

And I resent that the salon manager said they'll use this experience as a "learning opportunity" for the stylist who ruined my hair...really? That girl needs to go back to school (her name is Kimberly, by the way...do not book with her unless it's a simple cut or blow out). 

*********************

Warning - do NOT go to the hair salon there!

I went to have some of my roots touched up (I was blonde up until this incident, about 2 weeks ago), get a color gloss, and a cut. I had been doing my own hair for months, and it was in good shape and condition before I walked into the salon. 

I was assigned a stylist (who I found out during my service that she had very little experience and wasn't yet 21...which is why she didn't take what I was telling her about my hair seriously). 

She bleached the roots, but the bleach didn't take. I mentioned that the product wasn't doing what it was supposed to, but she said it was a self-timed product and would stop processing automatically (FYI - the bleaching process didn't lighten my roots at all - but she left it on long enough to fry my hair, pretty severely). 

She rinsed out the product and went to prep the gloss shade (I had asked for something more platinum vs yellow. I also know a gloss needs to stay in the hair for at least 15 minutes.). Less than 30 seconds after she applied it, she was finding it out. I jokingly said "the color must be taking" and she said "yeah". Then I asked, "shouldn't this be on my hair longer?". Her response was that since she saw the color depositing, she could rinse it out.

She then took me back to the chair and said she was going to trim my hair and even out the layers. I specifically asked her not to take off any of the length or cut my bangs. She barely cut any of my hair, but what she did cut ended up looking like a mullet! And because if her poor bleaching technique my hair has such extreme breakage - I'm losing so much hair every day (and I'm getting depressed looking in the mirror everyday to see how badly she destroyed my hair). 

I went back to my darker color a few days after my appointment because it will prevent me from having to color it as frequently vs when I was blonde. 

I did call the salon the day after and spoke with the salon manager. I let her know about all the issues, and how bad my hair was (the stylist took so much off from the top of my scalp area that it sticks straight up! Now I realize she was trying to hide the fact that my hair was breaking off so much from her poor technique.

I'm giving 2 stars because they did, without incident, give me a full refund for the service. 

But I'm utterly disgusted that now I'm spending just as much on deep conditioning treatments to minimize the amount of breakage. 

I've had some good experiences with other Ulta salons (both here in Nashville and in LA), but this is by far one if the worst salon experiences I've ever had. 

I'd recommend going to a more established salon with technicians that actually have a good amount of

Dante (forgive my spelling) came right up to me and ask how he could help. He provided me with a better product that would help me out throughout the day to make me look fresh and great. Basically not worn out by the end of the day as I'm sure that's how I was looking when I walked in. When completing my makeover, he gave me the most kindest comments and made me feel beautiful. He truly made my day when it wasn't a great one to start. Dante, your positive spirit, warm smile and kind heart made my day so much better. Keep doing an amazing job!! My sincere thanks!!

Masks are supposed to be required inside this store. It is not enforced. In fact, the manager of the store did not, and would not, even ask customers who did not wear masks to put them on. When I inquired about the store policy, the manager stated he is lot permitted to ask customers to abide by store policy. Do I walked out.

The Benefit brow bar did an excellent job on my brows! First time getting my brows waxed in years but it looks perfect. She really took the time to map out my face and remove only what was needed. My brows look thick, arched, & well-shaped. The experience was painless.

What is up with these people?  No smiles, no sincere desire to provide customer service.  The only person who was helpful and provided true customer service was the sweet lady who checked me out, Hillary. Kudos to her!
There is also an unfortunate smell of body odor here.   
I will gladly go to 100 oaks next time.

I love that all of the associates wear masks! Super friendly staff that is knowledgeable about their items. If they don't have have the item they always offer a substitute or offer to order it and ship it to your house for free. I also love that their testers are taped up as a preventative measure to lessen the spread of COVID. Great return policy as well!

One of the worse Ulta's I have ever shopped at.  It has poor customer service and actually they act like they're doing you a huge favor by taking your money.   I will try to purchase what I can at Dillards or Sephora for right now.   It's too bad, because other Ulta's have been great.     

People don't ever say thank you anymore.

I normally pay an arm and a leg to get my hair cut at a nice salon in Brentwood. However, I was in a last minute situation and needed a quick fix so I booked an appointment at Ulta. Not only was my appointment rescheduled (without me being contacted) but customer service was absolutely horrible. No apology, no kindness, just told straight up the appointment had been moved, they were short on stylists and other appointments were running late. An employee actually walked by me while I'm sitting in their "lobby" and said "OMG I just had the biggest burp." You get what you pay for. I'll never cheat on my nice salon again.

I've been to this Ulta location for beauty services a few times. Most recently I stopped by for a 90-minute facial. Very decent beauty services, and a good Ulta location (by Cool Springs Mall, but not connected to the mall). If you need some salon or beauty services, it's worth considering Ulta. Their prices are really reasonable, and they usually have openings on their calendar. And you can book online!

Love Ulta however this store is always way too hot and it always feels cluttered! The staff is friendly enough but sometimes they will have a twenty person line ( not covid safe) and there will be 10 associates on floor but one maybe two cashiers

Warning - do NOT go to the hair salon there!

I went to have some of my roots touched up (I was blonde up until this incident, about 2 weeks ago), get a color gloss, and a cut. I had been doing my own hair for months, and it was in good shape and condition before I walked into the salon. 

I was assigned a stylist (who I found out during my service that she had very little experience and wasn't yet 21...which is why she didn't take what I was telling her about my hair seriously). 

She bleached the roots, but the bleach didn't take. I mentioned that the product wasn't doing what it was supposed to, but she said it was a self-timed product and would stop processing automatically (FYI - the bleaching process didn't lighten my roots at all - but she left it on long enough to fry my hair, pretty severely). 

She rinsed out the product and went to prep the gloss shade (I had asked for something more platinum vs yellow. I also know a gloss needs to stay in the hair for at least 15 minutes.). Less than 30 seconds after she applied it, she was finding it out. I jokingly said "the color must be taking" and she said "yeah". Then I asked, "shouldn't this be on my hair longer?". Her response was that since she saw the color depositing, she could rinse it out.

She then took me back to the chair and said she was going to trim my hair and even out the layers. I specifically asked her not to take off any of the length or cut my bangs. She barely cut any of my hair, but what she did cut ended up looking like a mullet! And because if her poor bleaching technique my hair has such extreme breakage - I'm losing so much hair every day (and I'm getting depressed looking in the mirror everyday to see how badly she destroyed my hair). 

I went back to my darker color a few days after my appointment because it will prevent me from having to color it as frequently vs when I was blonde. 

I did call the salon the day after and spoke with the salon manager. I let her know about all the issues, and how bad my hair was (the stylist took so much off from the top of my scalp area that it sticks straight up! Now I realize she was trying to hide the fact that my hair was breaking off so much from her poor technique.

I'm giving 2 stars because they did, without incident, give me a full refund for the service. 

But I'm utterly disgusted that now I'm spending just as much on deep conditioning treatments to minimize the amount of breakage. 

I've had some good experiences with other Ulta salons (both here in Nashville and in LA), but this is by far one if the worst salon experiences I've ever had. 

I'd recommend going to a more established salon with technicians that actually have a good amount of experience.

This Ulta was just ok. Came here with my mom on my birthday to use my coupons and we walked around with not a single employee asking if we needed help with anything. Not even a welcome in. The store was quiet but busy it was just a weird atmosphere in here. The product in many places was a bit dirty since no one can use samples (Covid-19) so it's unfortunate the products people actually buy are being used. When I got to the register the lady tried signing me up for a credit card without even telling me it was one. I had to stop her and ask if it was. You ALWAYS tell a customer it's a credit card. She was rushing and pretty rude as I had 3 coupons, one was my free birthday gift, and told me she doesn't need to see them?! How else would you scan so I had her scan them. Her name was Kayla. It's as if she was trying not to let me use my coupons. Overall it was just a weird vibe.

I had the best experience here. If you need someone to wax your brows, Lillian is the gal! I've been seeing here since around April and she does an excellent job every single time. Not only is she great at her, but she remembers everything. My mom was sick and she asked how my mom was doing and asks about my son every time I am there. I love this store and all the wonderful and friendly ladies that work here. From the moment I walk in the door to the moment I leave, I feel welcomed and well taken care of. Y'all are the best!

Completely clueless and incompetent! My daughter had an appointment w/ Caitlyn at 1pm.  We were there on time.  Checked in w/ someone at the desk who did not let Caitlyn know we were there.  She was still working on another client.  Finished up with that one at 1:20.  Then spent 10 more minutes primping herself in the mirror.  Completely clueless of her surroundings.  I was literally standing at the desk watching her.  Not once did she ask if I needed anything or try to figure out if her next appt was there.  Finally, the other clueless employee who checked my daughter in again, ON TIME, tells Caitlyn we are there.  THEN, Caitlyn walks to the back, says nothing to us and calls her next appt to come in early.  She then finally addresses me, tells me because we were late we needed to reschedule! Whoever is managing this place-YOU are to blame!  Take care of your business and stop letting 12 yr olds run things.  Clearly that does not work.  I wasted an hour of my time and I will NOT be back!

I love this Ulta. The location is great and easy to get to. I've been to this Ulta many times but felt the need to leave a review after my most recent visit. I went in wanting new face makeup but wasn't sure what I actually wanted. So many choices!!  As I was wandering around the store trying to figure out what I wanted ( COVID hasn't made it easy since we can't try anything) I was approached by an employee named Kelly and she literally helped me find everything that I wanted. She was very nice and extremely knowledgeable about literally everything!  Makeup, hair, etc. I will  continue shopping at this location just so she will be there to help. Unfortunately they were out of one of the products that I wanted but I was able to have it ordered for me and sent to my house. The only reason that I am giving this location 4 stars instead of 5 is because there was an employee there that was being extremely rude and I noticed her talking down to other employees right in front of shoppers!  I was shocked at how unprofessional she was. I'm not sure what her name is other than it started with a C or K. Either way she was tall with dirty blonde hair and honestly looked out of place. Hopefully she doesn't treat her employees like that daily. So sad. Anyway, if you decide to shop at this location ask for Kelly! If you forget her name just ask for the tall brunette with the fan. I'll be getting one of those!!!

This is one of the most unfriendly Ulta locations. Every time when I'm in there, and ask for a product they always point to where it's at. I had a lash appointment yesterday. I have never had lashes put on that badly. She redid them after the first time, because the one lash was sticking up. She redid them. They were okay looking. I only had them on for two hours before they came off. I wear this brand of lashes all of the time even in very hot weather. They never come off. The girl that I also told what I was there when going to the salon to check-in was very rude. I would go to another Ulta location. I was very disappointed with my lashes. I won't be getting them done here again. I love Ulta. I shop at other Ulta stores, and had my makeup done at other locations that are wonderful. It takes a lot for me to complain. This Ulta location isn't a good one.

OK lets just say what needs to be said....if you've seen my photo you know why I spend a good amount of my time at ULTA Beauty.  LOL  Pink hair has certain requirements and I can just let you know now that I don't wake up that way! 

I LOVE this ULTA!  Its one of the largest stores Ive been to and has a lot of products that the smaller ones may not have.  This ULTA is also at Coolsprings Mall so its super convenient to just pop in while I'm at the mall for other stuff.  Ill be honest, its never really a "pop in", its usually what I like to call a meandering.  My husband knows that if I'm going into ULTA its going to be a long wait or he should have something to do while I meander.  If youre a lover of all things makeup and hair like myself you get what I'm trying to say! For all those men out there DONT FEEL LEFT OUT!! They have an entire section of mens products from Shampoo to Cologne! So if you need to smell nice for your significant other then you can pop in and one of the great ULTA associates will help you find exactly what you need! OR if you need a great stocking stuffer....and ULTA gift card is NEVER a bad thing!! (ur welcome ladies!)

ULTA has everything, bodywash, shampoos, styling tools, perfume, makeup(over the counter and higher end), and so so SO much more...this is why its a meander and not a pop in. lol. The staff at this ULTA are amazing and always willing to help when needed but also happy to leave you to your own devices which is nice in my opinion.  Sometimes I like to try something new and being left to do that without a sales pitch makes it that much easier to do that, but I know that if I have a product question they are there and ready.  They also carry higher end makeup selections and usually have an expert for that brand in store so color matching and asking specific questions is a breeze! 

Overall I will always choose ULTA for my products because the return policy is amazing.  If you purchase a product and don't like it, its not the right color, its doesn't work well for you, or u have a reaction to it, return it! Even if you have used the product a couple times you can return it, that's nice when you have sensitive skin and things don't always work for you.

So pop in and meander around, get your brows done and find a new product you didn't even know you needed!! They have millions of them to choose from! Im sure ill see you there lol.

Took my girlfriend here for a shopping spree for her birthday in late November. I guess because we're young (?) we could not shop around without being harassed and asked "do you need help?", "what are you looking at?", or just shoving stuff we weren't interested at us without wanting any help. I gave my girlfriend a $500 budget for her birthday and she wanted all new makeup but we felt almost stalked here. She ended up feeling uncomfortable and just wanted to leave. She got one $12 thing and they asked a ton of weird information like we couldn't buy something without telling them our full life story.. birth date, phone number and something else. She gave them fake info because the vibe was already so weird. We took our business to Sephora. This place was weird and had way too many bored employees just following every customer around. My girlfriend just likes to walk around looking at things, but feels like you really can't do that here anymore. Another customer we spoke to felt the same way and tagged along with us to Sephora. Super weird and invasive experience.
If you want your eyebrows bleeding and uneven. Go here. I bleed and cried it was awful never come Here EVER!

I went here yesterday to get my hair cut/ colored and also got my brows waxed and tinted. The staff was so amazing!!! I am so glad that I went. Brittany did the color on my hair and gave me a trim. She was seriously so sweet and really listened to everything that I asked of her! I will most definitely be coming back to her every time.    She gave me advice on trying different treatments there which I really appreciated as well! Bri did my eyebrows (which were a mess before) and shaped them perfectly, not making them too thin, but cleaned them up! I could not be happier with my services! Thanks for taking such great care of me!!

The products and merchandise were scattered about,  including on the floor.  I asked for someone to help me find the Stila section. No one ever came to assist.  I will be driving further next time to shop at another location.

I woke up on a Sunday morning and decided that I wanted bangs. I usually stay away from anything drastic, and over the years, I haven't been able to find a stylist I really like. But I was determined to do it that day and thought, "Well, Ulta's open." I also had a coupon and needed some other things. Lucky for me, I got Peggie, who was absolutely fantastic. With other stylists, I've spent 15 minutes talking about what kind of style I want. Peggie just said, "Ok. More layers, keep the overall length, and bangs. Got it." She gave me a great conditioning treatment and then got right down to work. Honestly, I was there from start to finish for about 30 minutes, and I have thick hair that's hard to dry. I had told her that I usually put loose waves in my hair, so when she was done, she said, "You like it wavy, right? Let me try this curling iron I really like." She did a great job and was really friendly, too. I think I finally found a stylist I really like, and I definitely recommend her to anyone.

Like any Ulta, its clean, filled with all the cosmetics and beauty products you can think of, great deals on certain items from the weekly specials, and customer service is great! I have never tried the salon, but I always see plenty of people getting their hair done.

review for brow bar only:

was able to get my brows done without an appointment this past wednesday. i've been meaning to get them refreshed since i have been growing them out. michelle was my brow lady. she was very thorough and careful. she did a great job and even talked me into growing them out a bit more to get the definition i was looking for. awesome job cleaning around the brows. glad she took her time i did not feel rushed at all. probably was there for about 45 minutes or so just to get them done! i did not mind. other places rush you in and out. i even talked myself into a lip wax. thanks michelle! see ya in a month or so :)

This specific Ulta was completely disorganized and their employees were extremely unhelpful. When I asked an employee for help to find a few products, she shrugged me off and told me they were out of stock without even looking for the products. It took me opening storage drawers in the store to find what I was looking for. I love Ulta, but I will never go back to their Cherry Hill location.

Got my make up done for a night wedding by Jazmayne. She spent time with me, was consultative and nice. She did a terrific job. Wedding went till 1:30 am and I didn't reapply lipstick once! I would recommend her!

I've never been to Ulta and was pleasantly surprised.  They have EVERYTHING!  Hair, perfume, make-up.  You name it!  I needed a new concealer and the associate working was so helpful (short red hair - wish I remembered her name).  Anyway, super helpful.  Tried many out on me and let me walk around deciding and gave me great tips and suggestions.  I love this store.  The have everything you would ever need beauty related.

With my hair in serious need of some TLC, I walked into the salon at Ulta. This was the best decision I made for myself today, hands down.

My stylist was Devon Fearon, who is five shades of incredible! Professional and kind, she is exactly the type of stylist you want to trust your hair with. I peppered her with a hundred questions as she worked on my hair, and it became quickly evident that she is not only knowledgeable, but also genuinely enjoys her craft. Ask for her by name! Watch her work her magic on your hair (:

Came here for wedding party hair and makeup. We planned the appointments with Jazlyn months in advance and they could not have gone smoother. On top of being an amazing makeup artist, Jazlyn was incredibly professional and accommodating with our schedules. Everyone left feeling beautiful!

Went in to try the Keratin treatment with Nicole.

Nicole was very nice and attentive to what I wanted. In addition to the Keratin, she also took care of my roots that I still had despite having my color done earlier in the week elsewhere.

Now my hair is smooth, soft, and with great color. I spent more money than I wanted to, but part of that is because I had my color done twice that week. 

I will definitely be going back to see Nicole again.

While browsing through Barnes and Noble last week, I got a sudden urge to get a kind of drastic haircut. My last haircut was done at Mane Stop in Haddonfield, and it was, um, unique. I decided to head next door to Ulta, and see if they had anyone available. 
When I walked in, I was greeted by Courtney. Even though she was pretty booked for the night (it was already 5:30 by then) and she knew I was looking for something slightly involved, she squeezed me in. I had a vision in my head of exactly what I wanted, but not being a hairdresser, I was having a hard time articulating my gorgeous vision. Courtney walked and talked me through every snip, clip, and shave. 
Generally speaking, I'm not a huge fan of generic small talk when I'm having my hair done, but Courtney was really friendly and I felt completely at ease in her chair.
I absolutely LOVE my new haircut! It's funky, fun, functional and other great F words that escape me right now! Thank you Courtney! You've got a new regular in me!
The girl who does eyebrows there is literally the worst. DO NOT GO TO HER. not only did she completely f up my eyebrows but she was extremely rude.

I stopped by this Ulta last week at 8:40, twenty minutes before they closed for the night. I finally looking the purchase the Naked 2 palette. Unfortunately , they were sold out so the sales lady suggested I try a palette by another company that was cheaper. I wasn't sure if all of those colors would complement my complexion so I went with the Naked 3 palette. What was great is that they still were able to locate an Ulta for my home in Philly that had the Naked 2 palette and saved it for me under my name. 

They also had ULTA lipsticks buy 1, get 1 free which I always get when they have these sales.  I love that fact that they still let me to wonder and treated me with great customer service despite the fact they were closing.

I frequent this location fairly often to stock up on products for my freelance kit like Dermablend, lashes, sponges and NYX pencils. I like to be left alone while shopping most of the time, which is just great, because the staff at this store are some of the most unhelpful S.O.B's I've ever met. I asked the one trans employee the one time if they carried false lashes and she just looks me dead in the eye and goes "Yeah." oh! no kidding? well, moving right alone then, might you tell me what isle they're in?! Ugh. terrible customer service. I also feel like they're not particularly trained in makeup artistry in any way. 
I will continue shopping there and fueling their paychecks however, because it is a convenient location close to other stores that I shop at. And of course, they do carry a decent amount of brands that I like for a decent price.

For the past 3 years I've been going to ulta salon in cherry hill to the same stylist Rosa. She is the absolute best hair stylist I have ever been to. I've always gone in with a picture of what I want and she recreates my hair to look exactly the same and if a few days later if I don't like it she always offers to fix it with no hesitation so it is always how I like it. I wouldn't be recommending you if I didn't think she would do the best job, but she has for the past 3 years. Book an appointment with her to find out what I'm telling you about !!!

I normally go to Ulta in other locations and have been enjoying the service. This location however has disappointed me. My mother and I were in the area and went in so I can introduce her to the make up products I've been using from Ulta, needless to say we came to spend money. The staff was condescending, quick to dismiss us and overall felt as if we were going into the usually ego-filled Mac store, which is one of the reasons I stopped using Mac. 
I recommend finding another location if you're looking for Ulta, I've been to a few in PA and Delaware and I was treated like a valued customer.

I don't know what happened to this Ulta location, it used to be so much better! Lately, every time I go in there, it is dirty. Makeup smeared on the displays, products opened, used, laying on the ground or sitting open in displays, products not stocked, completely empty displays, damaged products on shelves for weeks and weeks. I saw the same dented, used can of "Pssst" for wavy hair dry shampoo sitting on the same shelf for well over a month. Every time I would come in, it would be the only can there, sitting, waiting for the forever home that would never come. 

I stopped in yesterday to redeem some points and check out the display of Ulta brand makeup and my God, it was foul. Smashed blushes all over, eye shadow quads with the safety seals torn open, smudged all over, open lipsticks, just gross. I walked down to the NYX aisle only to see some angsty teenager sitting on the ground pulling lipsticks out, breaking the seal, trying them on and then tossing them on the ground. I had to leave. It was just too gross. I love Ulta as a whole, but I refuse to buy products from this location for fear that they have been used (which has happened before, sadly).  I honestly hope and pray that the people who go in, try on unopened makeup, put it back, and leave all get a sever case of scorching, blistering mouth herpes.

This is my main Ulta, and my favorite. It's definitely the biggest of the ones I frequent, and the cleanest. I love the huge selection of Butter London that they carry, as well as the essential drugstore items I need but always forget! I have never gone to the salon here, and I highly doubt I ever will as I'm pretty dedicated to my salon now. This really is my go-to place besides MAC and the Sephora in the Cherry Hill Mall. There usually is very little staff here - at least when I go, which is typically 7pm or later - but that's fine by me as I don't ever need help.

I don't go to Ulta for expert advice or high end products but rather for when I need drugstore and/or salon products.  I can pick up my Neutrogena hair mask and Its a 10 conditioner under the same roof.  Score!  Their new rewards program is pretty sweet so I may start buying my prestige items here too.  This store has decent employees who are helpful and friendly.  Selection is good too.  Out of all the Ulta stores I visit this one is my favorite.

I went to this location tonight trying to find an incredibly light concealer for a look I wanted to do and didn't really know what brands to look at. I asked one of the employees (Morgan) and she walked through practically the whole store with me testing and recommending different products until I found one I liked. She also was very knowledgeable about many different brands and recommended specific products from each. I was very happy with my experience at this store and will continue to come here for my makeup needs. Two other employees helped us look as well. I didn't catch their names but they were very helpful and friendly as well. 10/10 recommend.

Worst experience ever went to get my hair high lighted and the women talked me into getting it dyed I usually am a blonde with natural low lights and now the top of my hair is bright yellow. I told her my head was burning and she still continued to process my hair over and over because she knew she messed up but wouldn't let me see it or tell me that she did it wrong I would not waste your money at this salon!

Ulta is the best I never read or review but ulta beauty is the best salom ever the mystique hair and skin they ruined my hair so bad and didn't even said sorry I ended up having my hair fixed by ulta salon and they did amazing job don't go to mystique hair and skin place just call to ulta make an appointment and get your beautiful hair done. Trust me I was one of you making worst mistake of my life going to different salon.
Amazing salon at this ulta. I have been going there for at least a year now and I always leave 100% satisfied.

nice stock and variety of products but the staff is never helpful at least in my experience, i have been told what wont look good on me or what not to buy but i never  get what i SHOULD buy.  Ill keep going cause its right next to my work but other than that its great

This location is full of employees who seem like they hate their job and don't want to we've assist you. I go here because of the convenience of location but I think I'll be going to the marlton location from now on. They seem to be the only ones wanting to do their job.

Eyelash extensions...... don't. Ulta has a contract with a glue company and I'm starting to think it's called Elmers. The girl was really nice which is why I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1. I get eyelash extensions all the time and had to go here for a last minute emergency but now I'm in an even bigger emergency... eyelash-less. She went really fast which made me a little skeptical from the start. I don't know where she learned or where that went wrong but she glued them to my actual lashes... biggest mistake. Anyone who has even so much as had this procedure done before knows that you glue to the skin in between the lashes to avoid lash-loss. Anyway, within a day or 2 the extensions were so tangled, upside down, twisted, and just plain old ridiculous looking, but bearable. But then after about a week they started to clump together so bad and formed this ball of glue/ gunk at the root of my real lashes to the point of pain with every blink. I tried every at home remedy to get them off safely but without fail it would take my lashes with them. So I stopped trying and am now waiting for them to come off naturally... if that will even happen. In the meantime I guess I'll just look like a scarecrow and try not to blink so much :) 

This review is really just to look out for anyone considering getting this procedure done here, I'm not speaking for anything else regarding this store/ salon!
Went to the Ulta in Cherry Hill on the spur of the moment .  Wash, cut, blow dry with highlights and lowlights done by Jesse was great. Will be going there again.

When it comes to makeup, I am a fish out of water, so I would have appreciated a much more thoughtful and personalized experience, hence the 3 stars.

With my skin looking really blah after this long winter, I desperately needed new foundation and products to help me. When my skin really needs a glow, I go for tinted moisturizer, specifically Laura Mercier or Stila. Unfortunately, this Ulta does not carry either product, bummer! I did not see any Laura Mercier products although they had a big wall of Stila products.

An employee helped me to find a different BB cream, from Smashbox. He did not really do a great job talking it up or exploring my options, and I felt like he was just going through the motions and did not really give a crap. I remembered that the Hello Flawless Oxygen Foundation by Benefit received good reviews, so a different employee helped me pick out one of those in my shade. She seemed a little nicer and more caring, but still not a very personalized experience.

I also picked up a Mario Badescu product, make up sponges, and some Burts Bees chapstick. 

I had a 20% off coupon on one item, but unfortunately that did not apply to "prestige" brands, of which Benefit and Mario Badescu were a part of. Well, how was I supposed to know that?? It took a whopping $1.00 off of my chapstick, whoop-de-do.

I am very UNHAPPY with the overall services and lack of availability of merchandise provided by these stores.  I have visited the Deptford NJ location at 3 times in last 2 months and each time I  went to the store it was ALWAYS in lacking merchandise. This has always been the case whenever I went there and their prices SUCK! I wanted to purchase a curling above from a Revlon or Conair product(which they carry as well) and was unable to do so because of the lack availability of mid- priced curling irons. I can get a Revelon or Conair product anywhere.  Now these mid price products the carry obviously sell the most so I do not why the store would not have them stocked accordingly.  The store never has a their large display of OPI nail polish full.  I recently purchased a hair brush for $11.00 and was very DISAPPOINTED in the quality for the money I paid . I now can not return it and get at least a store credit because of their AWFUL return policy. I can not believe with all the revenue these stores generate, I could not get a store without out my receipt. I had the tag still on the merchandise which could have been scanned to get the current price & know I purchased it from ULTA.  Now I have a crappy product from this store I do not want and they get to keep my money. Any store out there give store credits and honors their products. I will never shop there again.  I HATE THIS STORE.

To be fare, there was nothing wrong with my service what I asked for, I got, to a certain extent. I just don't ever want to feel like I've been taken advantage of.

I went in for a classic blow dry which was quoted $37 online. Then when its done I get charged $57 because my hair is longer ((which I understand)) but one I wasn't told that previous to getting it done and two on my check out sheet it said because they used a curler or flat iron on my hair both of which never happened. 

I wasn't going to an event or a wedding or anything of any importance I just wanted to get a blow out. Just a shitty experience. 

To be fare Candace did asked me if I wanted to take the charge off at the checkout counter and of course I said no, slightly because I was embarrassed over 20 bucks. 

I just won't ever go back.

I went to Ulta Cherry Hill for some lip gloss and maybe get a new bronzer. After walking up and down the isles and being asked if I am doing ok a few times, I finally surrendered to David. I said I am looking for a new bronzer, I want a clean natural look. He was excellent. He introduced me to a few new products, showed me how to use them. He taught me a few tricks about how my bronzer and blush can be used on cheeks and eyes. He kept saying, I know you didn't come here for this, but I want to show you how this can help. He usually works at the Ulta in Deptford..... so next time I need some new products, I will be making the drive there to visit him.

I had gotten my hair done here by Juliette. She was awesome and gave me exactly what I wanted. Her manager Rosa and her coworker Danielle were also eager to help her since my hair had lifted more than expected. They all truly went out of their way and for that I am forever grateful.

I actually love shopping at Ulta in person. I've never had any issues with products or customer service. Why I'm leaving a mediocre review is their shipping practices. I purchased 2 items, specifically to receive the free gift that went with them. Not only were they shipped separately...the boxes were enormous!! It is very wasteful not only with the huge box, but also emissions for transporting to me. I will not order online again until their shipping practices change, which will equal them getting less money from me. Pic included is the 2nd box, the first box was just as large but only had 1 concealer in it :/
I had hair color done here.  It is the worst I have ever had.  It is not even close to what I asked for and is orange.   Stay away from here for color.

Organization is on the bottom of their list. 
Specifically went in looking for Kylie Skin toner, all the Kylie Skin products were a mess and not organized. 
No one greeted me. 
No one asked if I needed help. 
4 cashiers were at the front ringing out customers.
Good selection. Organized. Pleasant staff. Easy to run in and get what I need. If I stop longer than that, I know I could get sucked in for awhile.

It was a wonderful day to walk in to Ulta.  I came in to find an item That was on clearance.  Brooke quickly assisted me. Unfortunately the item was out of stock.  Brooke  and another sales associate quickly helped me to find something similar.
 Brooke also called another store it see if they had the item I was looking for.   Made me so happy that you found it and its on hold for me.  The manager  Britney was very helpful and sweet as well as the other sales associates the store very clean. The  product  Displays  were nice we set up.
The only problem that I have is that the lighting in the aisles of make up in the  register side of the store is very poor.   It makes it hard to see the correct color of the product or to even use the testers. If you are a make up person like me  You just find the lighted  Mirrors on the other side of the store. I often had to grab my items in go over to the lighted mirrors on the other side. Unfortunately this is a corporate issue and I hope that it is addressed this soon.  Can't wait to shop there again.

This is one of the worst stores that i delt with as a disabled person. They were rude & crude. Not a place i would bring an impressionable teenager. Horible manners. I just wanted a gift certificate i could give my sister &  walked out of their in tears.

I have always loved Ulta. There's such a wide variety of products and it's pretty easy to navigate in there. The reason for my three star rating is customer service, not product. I was just in this location about a half hour ago. When I walked in, I expected to be greeted. That did not happen. I spent about 40 mins in the store, specifically right in the same 3 or 4 aisles right by the cash wrap. The closest an associate came to any form of interaction was staring over at me, locking eyes for a sec and then carrying on with what he was doing. That irritated me more than not being acknowledged at all. I'm not asking to be waited on hand and foot, just some awareness and engaging with a paying customer.
5 stars for Emily at the Benefit brow bar, don't trust anyone else with my brows! She's so professional, courteous, and gentle.

Thank you Gabe for being patient with my coupons.  Gabe was the cashier. He was patient, answered my questions and pleasant to deal with. Sales associates were very helpful with both the premium and drugstore brands. The manager is super nice and helpful. She helped me pick out the right Maybelline concealer. She also helped me find s comparable product because Ulta didn't carry the brand I was looking for. The  store was well stocked even the products on sale were well stocked. There's a large  parking lot shared with other stores in the strip mall. It was a pleasant experience!

I needed to pick up a few things and was in a rush. I looked around the store but wasn't able to find what I was looking for, so I approached the nearest staff member and she nicely directed me to where I needed to go. I found what I needed and was on my way. While looking for my stuff, I noticed this Ulta offers haircurts, styling, coloring, as well as make up services, etc, and at pretty fair and competitive prices too. Would definitely be interested in getting a haircut here sometime.

This ulta is by far the best ulta. Let's start with Emily, she has been doing my brows for about a year now and I wouldn't ever trust anyone else besides her. She does an amazing job, is very gentle and very clean. I never leave unsatisfied. Staff on the floor is great. They are excellent and extremely knowledgeable when finding and recommending products based on your personal needs.

I have been getting my eyelashes done here for about a year or so. I have never had an issue and love the lash tech but always wondered how much and how often they practiced hygiene and sanitation because the girl never wore gloves, I never saw her wash her hands, clean tools etc. I trusted them Until my last appointment right before xmas/December 2019. The lash tech had been out/not at work for a few months and when she came back it wasnt the same. My lashes/eyelids were itching and hurting for a few days. After about a week I removed the lashes because I couldn't take it-- lash tech said it was the new glue. I went back about 2 weeks later in early January 2020 to get them redone. This time they looked better and felt better except the very next morning I woke up with PINK EYE. I contacted the lash tech/sent her pictures and advised her so no one else would have the experience. She said she would talk to her manager & offered to redo them .... but why would I want to risk another eye infection. I never heard anything back from her or the manager. I contacted ULTA 2 weeks after speaking with the Tech & the manager said she had not heard of the incident. I asked for a refund and at first it was if she didn't believe me... i said look I have proof--Urgent care diagnosis, pictures of my eyes, and screenshots of the conversation between me and the lash tech. I got my lashes done late afternoon Sunday and woke up for work Monday morning at 7am and could barely open my eye. The manager was nice about it though, she contacted her Manager and they said they would give me refund. I was grateful until i went to get it and made some other in-store beauty purchases the manager automatically credited it to purchase instead of  asking if I wanted it back on my card /cash etc. I have also had all bad hair experiences here in the Salon. Would not recommend ULTA for Salon purposes. The 1 star is for the products offered  and how nice all the Cherry Hill employees are at the registers. Salon =0

I recently decided to chop off 11 inches of my hair so it could be donated to Locks of Love. I do this about every two years (my hair grows fast), and I always go to Ulta. At Ulta they have a special program where if you are cutting your hair for donation, they'll wash, cut and blow out your hair for free- how nice!

The girl who cut my hair, Courtney, was great. She was bubbly and easy to talk to. She provided great suggestions for my hair cut and did a wonderful job. She is someone I would go back to. 

My biggest issue with Ulta was the wait. My appointment was at 7 and I wasn't seen until 7:30, brutal wait. 

Otherwise Ulta is great for getting your hair cut or for shopping for any beauty need on the planet- they have everything.

This review is specifically for Jaqueline (not sure on spelling). She helped color match me with my mask on, just by looking and it's the most perfect match. She also recommended skincare products that in just three days have become favorites. She was so helpful and knowledgeable and in no way pushy. Felt like she was really just trying to help a girl out.

I always love shopping here but some of the employees need to pay better attention to customers. I was with my mom and there were 4 girls behind the register one of them checked my mom out and I waited figuring she'd just get me to next not a huge deal. Instead she went back to talking to all the other employees ignoring the fact I needed to check out too and I had to ask to be checked out. Not great customer service. 

Other than that everything was great thought it was easy to find what we needed and the store is clean and organized.

Reasonable price, good service, good haircut.  Wee bit disorganized but hey, it's no frill place with a good price.  It's Ulta salon so there's no pretty deco or anything, but so far I'm pretty happy with what I got.  I first went to this place for a simple trimming, was happy for the job done.  It was time to get my hair cut again, so I went Ulta salon, gave permission to cut more than I did last time.  And my hair turned out so much better than I expected!  Got a lot of compliments.  Both cut were done by Rosa so I recommend her, along with the salon itself. 

Since I don't dye my hair or perm that often, I can't tell for the coloring or other works but I see a lot of people getting their coloring or perm done, so I guess this place is doing a pretty good job.

You have to love Ulta!
This particular location seems to have the best workers though. They are always so knowledgeable and so willing to help.
I'll definitely keep going back. It's my favorite place to go!

This Ulta is okay, but it's not the best one in the area. 

The staff has always been really friendly. My complaint about this store is that it's pretty small compared to other Ultas I've been to and there is a limited selection of products. The samples that they have for people to swatch the more high end products are DISGUSTING and look old and like kids (or messy adults) have slammed their fingers into them. I would never put my hands anywhere near that stuff. Also, they should have tissue next to the samples so that if I do decide to swatch it on my hand, I can wipe it off when I'm done.

I do like that they have a pretty extensive designer perfume selection, as well as a wide variety of hair products. I go to this Ulta pretty regularly out of necessity, but it's not worth an extra trip.

So being a girl daddy, this place is just part of my normal route now that my girls are getting older.

They are happy so I am happy.  They like the selection and sales and since we dont have a BIG Sephora on the Westbank, this will have to do.   I like the Ulta online site because I can find them gifts fast but this local store if filled with friendly folks that have helped me.

I absolutely LOVED my experience at this ULTA.  I occasionally shop at ULTA because I really like NYX and it's not really sold everywhere.  So naturally I applied for their rewards program.  I had gotten an email about a deal to get your hair cut for $25 dollars if you book online.  I was a bit skeptical because I didn't even know they had a salon but said hey if I feel uncomfortable I will leave.  I had a random day off of work because of the rain and booked easily online for 45 min later so I could get in and out.  I got there and the store was empty (the rain was horrible).  I was escorted to the back where they have a full service salon (I didn't even know it was there!).  Cristial was my hairdresser and she's amazing!! She is so personable and listens to what you want. In October I had gone to a different salon to get a long bob bit it wasn't quite a bob like I had wanted so I explained I did want it shorter.  She did a beautiful job and even styled it perfectly (but again the rain messed that up).  I booked a trim in 6 weeks with Cristial because I do not want to take a chance somewhere else!  I found my new hair dresser and it's a hidden gem!!

This is by far the rudest service. Strike 1- how do you leave the customer standing at the frontdesk while you do inventory? 10 minutes later When she is done im asked what Do i need? Apparently service! Strike 2- never have I been to a salon where the stylist states rather or not she feels like doing the clients hair, instead of availability.strike 3- she walks back off continues doing inventory. I proceeded to walk out then she says ohh I forgot you standing there again i have a opening in 30 minutes.

I went to this store after leaving the Sephora in Jcp. While the employee in JCP made me feel like I was disturbing her private phone conversation, the employees in this Ulta were just the opposite. They were attentive and helpful. Next time, I'll just go straight to Ulta.

I went here last week to pick out a foundation for my wedding. I was looking for something light and dewy. I asked for assistance and it seemed like the lady kept giving me the opposite of what I wanted. The shade swatching was a mess, she kept picking pink undertones shades when I told her I had a yellow undertone

The Westbank has an Ulta! Fantastic! 

Michelle was the first person to tell me that Ulta was coming to Oakwood, and I couldn't have been more excited. I got word that it finally opened, so I was eager to check it out. 

For those of you not in the "know", Ulta is basically a huge beauty supply store. They have everything from drugstore brands to more upscale stuff. I saw on their website that they carry by favorite facial moisturizer so I headed down to check it out. They have EVERYTHING here. Not only did they have my moisturizer, but I also found some OPI nail polish that I really liked. They also carry designer perfume, hair styling stuff and pretty much anything else you could need beauty wise. I get the feeling I will be spending a lot of time and money here.

This is a favorite Ulta location of mine. I love everything about this location. Always clean, always fully stocked, always friendly and always helpful. You have questions? You need advice? Well this is the location that you go to. The brow bar, well someone is always there. You want a facial, someone is always there too. You want your makeup done, well guess what someone is always there too! Love this location.

One time about 20 years ago I was going to Jamaica with my best friend Kayla and I stopped at a little nail salon and had my brows done. That woman gave me two totally unfamiliar eyebrows, one being a straight line and the otherbeing shaped like an upside down U. There comes a point (especially) particularly ABSOLUTELY with regards to eyebrows that if somebody effs up your eyebrows once you do not give them a second chance. DO NOT LET them fix it I repeat DO NOT LET THEM NEAR YOUR BROWS. They can't fix it they messed up to begin with. That's when you either have to resort to doing it yourself or going to somebody else to have them fix it. Such was the case with this trip to Ulta.  First it took her 20 minutes to do it and I swear had had it not been for the pain and ripping sound I would not have known that she did anything to my eyebrows at all.
