She literally scrubbed them with her dry cotton pad for probably half the time and in the end they looked oily but there was no shape. none whatsoever. It was ironic because she was telling me as she was doing my eyebrows that a woman had messed up her eyebrows, so I'm not sure if this was some sort of revenge thing like The Ring where the only way to get rid of the bad brows is to give somebody else bad brows.  I don't know. And the cost? Ridiculous! $21 for a mediocre brow wax when there are literally three kiosks within 50 feet of that store that do twice as good a job for half the amount of money and half the amount of time. She gave me her business card (which I left at the register) but quite frankly if I can't trust her with my brows I damn sure ain't going to trust her with my hair.  I guess I should mention that this review was not of the Ulta store itself which while usually understaffed is still a quiet, unintrusive shopping experience and they almost always have when I'm looking for. pardon any typos this review was written via voice to text while driving furiously away from the appointment like Cruella Deville at the end of 101 Dalmationsduring the car chase scene. i'm telling you guys I just don't know I don't know what went wrong. I don't know what I did wrong I got up this morning I ran 2 miles I resisted going through the fast food drive-through for breakfast and then I went and I had this experience.

I received a facial from Nikki and loved it. She is really passionate about what she does. She really took her time and made me feel super relaxed. I enjoyed everything about my facial and can't wait to come back. She knew what she was doing and explained to me why she chose to use the products that she did.

The staff is very knowledgeable and nice. The selection is great and they're always seeming to have good sales! I was just there this evening and the cashier was very sweet and helpful! I don't know why there are any negative reviews, I've always had a great experience and the place is very clean.

Came in to buy a portable hair dryer but upon checkout they said it was being recalled. Why would you keep this on the shelf??? Really bad management. Only a few of the sales people where nice but the others looked at me sideways.

I am new to the area and tried two other places before coming to Ulta. I have to admit that I have been to the store in many cities and never noticed they did hair. What a great surprise. I made a last minute appointment with Lauren and I promise I will not go to another person. She was so great we talked about what I was looking for and she offered great ideas. I felt very comfortable that she had it under control. The end result WOW all I have to say is try Lauren you will not be disappointed.

Love this store! Love that I don't have to go into the mall to shop for makeup... i don't love going to the mall, especially if I just need one thing of makeup. But the convenience of ulta & it's location have made my life so much easier! Friendly staff (sometimes a little too helpful always asking if I need help - I like to just browse.) good selection of makeup & great rewards program. Not just free samples but earning money off my purchases! Love that!!

The deals and selection are wonderful. Most of the staff is great. One manager there I'd avoid tho.... OUaT. Also, if you know anything about health in cosmetics, you'd be leary of having the salon do your make up. MAKE SURE they're using a new mascara spooly and not double dipping. And that they spray the pallets with alcohol. I really just recommend buying a new tube of mascara, your eyes are precious! And avoid sponges like beauty blenders being used on you as they're nearly impossible to disinfect.

This is one of my favorite places to go for cosmetics and hair products.  I love that they have both high end and drugstore brands under the same roof. They also have a great selection of hair accessories and tools. The staff is friendly and willing to give recommendations if you need them.

Love this Ulta. but it's the salon that really made me a lifelong customer. I've been shopping at Ulta since I was a teen and have lived in 6 different states, but no Ulta has shown more integrity to me than this location. Long story short,  had a less than favorable trip to the Ulta salon a few weeks ago, but it wasn't because of the stylist, it was because of their pricing and (lack of) communication between myself and the salon as I went in for my appointment. The salon and my stylist stepped up and welcomed me back to remedy the situation. I was nervous because I was afraid I would be treated badly because of being a customer who "complained". 

My nerves were unwarranted. The salon manager Carry welcomed me in and listened to everything I had to say about my previous visit, and my stylist Sara and her both chatted with me about the miscommunication in my first visit and what could be done to fix it. I was blown away by their integrity and compassion towards me. And to top it off my hair was even better than I had hoped when I left. 

I am someone who likes to give my money to businesses that practice things I believe in like transparency and compassion, even when that business is a little more pricey than the next. The kindness, professionalism, and compassion shown towards me was the icing on the cake for me and my hair, which turned out better than I had wanted. I've already made my return appointment to Sarah and look forward to many more future visits after. I've been getting my hair professionally done since I was 13 years old, and it became a special part of my relationship with my mom and sister, and I will be recommending them to Ulta Salon. Thank you Ulta and the Salon staff of Ulta Greenwood, Indiana. I am proud to continue to shop and get my hair done from a company with such incredible customer service and integrity within its staff. Oh, and if you come to this location to get a cut, ask for Sarah, I thought the best part of mt appointment would be my color but was more surprised with how perfect the cut she gave me was. I left with a new pep in my step.

I enjoyed browsing around at this location. The staff were friendly and super helpful helping me locate items. The selection they have is massive! So many items from drugstore to higher end brands. It was also clean. I wish the items they place near the checkout wasn't so near the checkout because it's kinda awkward trying to look at it without being in the way.

My daughter and I went into do her brows. However, we were approached by a store manager about not paying for our previous services. She approached out in the open. Now every time we go in they look at us like we will not pay. All eyes on us. Long story short, they accused my daughter of not paying. So I had someone at home to find the receipt and BOOM in your face that the receipt was there and paid. Sent a pic to me and shoved the damn phone in her face. This was quite shameful of them to do that and accuse my daughter of something she didn't even do. To top it off, they didn't even look at their cameras but still approached me. What kind of verification process is that! So now you question people prior to getting your facts straight!!!!!?!??? How disappointing of this store!!!!

Overall experience was fairly good but there were a few things that bothered me.

1. I just got my septum pierced literally just a few days ago so it's still super sore. I went in looking for foundation initially and (obviously) got a few extras but anyway the lady that was helping me and did the foundation for me to see how it looked was super rough on me! Like I told her to please be gentle because my piercing was just done and she didn't even care and hit it a few time which really hurt. After I left I was actually bleeding from my nose where my piercing is because of it. 

2. I was JUST looking for foundation but the lady helping me threw 10 different products at me. Like I get that you're a salesperson but if I come in just looking for foundation why are you trying to get me to buy 2 primers, foundation, highlighter kit, contour kit, setting spray, exfoliator AND eye cream? It honestly made me feel stupid but I KNOW makeup and I just wanted to find a light weight foundation that matched my super pale skin tone  

3. It took ten minutes to get someone to help me by literally having stand in the same spot and stare at them until someone decided to help me. I saw multiple different employees but they ignored everyone around them including myself. 

4. I did find the foundation I needed/was looking for. So that's good. And the lady overall that helped me did get me what I was looking for which is good but I feel like it was a lot more work (and nose trauma) than necessary. 

The only saving grace was their tiny section of clearance where I got a bundle kit for 14  but I think the customer service here needs a lot of work. Overall it's a decent store. I just moved here so I'm new to the area and this was my first time going here. I will probably look at a few different places to see which store is best. And to see what store won't make me bleed (from my piercing) again

I scheduled an appointment here last month for a cut and dye. I wanted grey but was persuaded out of it because it takes so long. I said fine can I do purple, not a bright shade but definitely purple. She said sure. She slathered my hair in dye, 2 bottles worth... extra charge of course. When she was rinsing it out she kept going back and forth from the room and at one point came back and put something that smelled like acetone on my hair. After letting that sit and rinsing it out I went back to the chair for my cut, I asked for an aline bob. She took all of probably (generous estimate) 10 minutes giving me a blunt cut. She dried my hair and to my joy (sarcasm) my hair was red with a slight purple tint. She asked if I wanted layers around my face, she just held the hair framing my face and ran the scissors down both sides. I could've done that, I have done that. After applying a discount for my first hair appointment  I paid $122.25 for a crappy hair dye and cut. So disappointed but I waved it off as a loss and moved on. UNTIL today when I got a reminder text message about my appointment this Saturday. Why would I ever go back here?!?! Thanks for scheduling an appointment I never asked for and NEVER EVER want!

This is my first time to visit the store. I wanted to test one of their new products. I went to the check out area to ask for assistance because that seemed to be the only associate. There were two at the registers who were doing nothing. I asked Taylor for assistance and you would have thought I asked her to walk across hot coals. If I buy it will be on line or maybe I'll try the new location in Franklin.

Had an amazing experience with the help of sales associate Julie. Recommended me products helped test it out on my skin, and was super sanitary. Found some amazing products because of her and was finally able to match my skin tone with foundation which I've had trouble doing in the past. She was incredibly helpful throughout the entire time I was there and very attentive and listened to what I wanted.

I was greeted when I walked in. The store is large so it's a little overwhelming as you're looking for things. They don't sell the brands that I was looking for so I spent a while trying to find what was equivalent.
I was in the store for about an hour and a couple employees asked if I was okay.
As I was starting to get frustrated the esthetician came out asked if I needed help, I explained to her my situation. She recommended a product an as I was talking to her in the background the phone started ringing and she said "I have to go get that."
She walked away mid-conversation and I was dismissed.
I thought it was rude to not even come back after the phone call which other employees could have picked up.
So customer service and treatment is lacking.

Horrible company, I know so many who has worked there after all the promises from these yard signs.   It is for holiday help even as the sign doesn't state this.  I am not or ever been in warehouse, this company has screwed so many who counted on a full time job.  Unbelievable companies do this to families at holidays.  POS seriously, I will never endorse or support this company.

Need anything beauty related ? Need some advice on products but don't know where to do? I've got just the place! Went to the Ulta Beauty in Greenwood earlier this week and had a great experience! Regina is an employee there and she KNOWS HER STUFF!!! She was so patient and knowledgeable. I've been to other Ulta locations plenty of times but never received customer service on the level of this location. I would definitely recommend the Greenwood store for any needs you have that are beauty related !

The customer service is so hit or miss in this store. I went in the other day and the customer service was terrible. Items were priced different on the shelf than what they were ringing up at. When I pointed out the discrepancy I was told they had forgotten to change some of the prices in that area. When I asked if they would honor the price it was listed as they said no so I just left my stuff there. I'll just go to Sephora that's right across the street, I get great customer service there every time.

Today I was recommended by a friend to see an Esthetician named Elizabeth here.  Coming from a long line of family men that aren't always careful with there skin she has helped me out greatly.

She put me through a 10 minute facial care routine that felt AMAZING!  The best part though was I felt like I could relax and clear my mind while she was performing the facial treatments and oh man those hot towels are a wonderful treat as well.

Honestly go to this, ask for Elizabeth and let her examine you.  She will put you best of care for your face it's not even funny

I got my first professional hair cut done at this Ulta location by Natasha and she was fantastic. Natasha really listened to me when I shared my hair concerns and goals and was able to give me great advice while also helping pick out products best suited for my goals. And get this... she took the time to EXPLAIN how the product would help each specific goal rather than just telling me what I should buy. I love my hair cut, the scalp treatment, and due to her advice my scalp and hair are looking so much more healthy. Natasha went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable and happy during my appointment. She's a rockstar!!

not the best, not the worst. i only had my one experience with one of the ulta beauty stylist, natasha. she seemed sweet but kept giving like backhanded compliments lmao, and then continued to take pictures of my hair. I dont mind whatsoever but like atleast ask girl lmao. then she never spoke to me once after asking what i wanted done to my hair. she never asked about my comfort or anything hospitality related. usually i dont mind because if i need something i can say something, but the other two stylists were killing it keeping up with their client. i just wished natasha had tried making my experience better, and even tried to tell me what she was doing when versus constantly walking away. Overall, my hair still came out okay

I have a friend who is obsessed with this store and all things beauty/make-up, so I decided to venture over to the new store to look around for a few needed items.  

The store is a fairly large size, so it can be overwhelming to navigate.  

I wandered around for a while looking for a few items. A few of the things I needed I found right away, but I was struggling to find a few other products. Even though the store was basically empty, it was hard to find a store rep.  When I did find somebody to ask them a few questions about an item, she wasn't very friendly or helpful. It seemed to be a chore to answer my questions and to have any interest in assisting me. It was a very unpleasant experience. 
The store ended up not having what I wanted, even though it was a common item and I'd seen it on Ulta's website as well. It's always frustrating and annoying when that is the case.   Sometimes I call a store first to see if they have a item in stock before I bother wasting my time and gas.   Of course I didn't do it this time, so that's just the way that goes.
I already had a few items in my hand and debated whether I just wanted to put them down and leave.  I decided to just rise above her unhelpful, unfriendly, poor, and pretentious attitude.    I looked around a little more, but felt overwhelmed by the fact that the store didn't have what I would consider a cohesively organized and logical layout.   I didn't think it was marked and/or lined out in an easy 'user friendly' fashion.  I decided to go ahead and check out shortly after that.  Thankfully the only friendly person in the store was at the register so that was refreshing. I'm not sure if I'll go back to Ulta.   Their prices were comparable to most prices I've seen elsewhere. Many of the things that I can get there I can get online as well if I wanted and really needed to. 
There is also Beauty Brands, which is closer to where I live as well.  
Same diff for the most part.
I came here once and I had a positive experience. I believe this Ulta location is brand new to the Summit shopping center. The store is clean, organized, and employees were helpful.

This is my absolute FAVORITE Ulta to go to in town. The store is always so clean and organized. The staff are so nice and welcoming every time I'm there. They're always willing to help you find products that fit you best and really have a great variety of brands. All in all, I love this place and go almost once a week to find new products and to pick up some of my ride or die products!

I visited today for specific products suggested to me by a friend. Lily approached me at the door and was so helpful and professional. I found everything and she matched my foundation to my skin tone. I will definitely purchase my beauty products from Ulta.

Walked in today just looking to buy a styling tool to help me on my day to day beautification. I was hesitant based on my previous visits at other ulta locations in SoCal. I was pleasantly surprised by this location at the summit mall. It was pristine! Everything was very clean and neat! The store even smelled clean! It was a great experience and Natalie was amazing. She answered my questions and helped me in choosing the right styling tool. Being a manager myself I value the customer service I received today. I will definitely be coming back to this location. Thank you team ULTA at the Summit mall.

Wow. How did I not stop in here sooner!? 

I've been to all the other Ultas in town and was honestly disappointed. I've never really received good service. Until today. 

I went in for some new face wash and left with a bag full of product that I cannot wait to try. The staff was friendly and helpful. 

The store was incredibly clean. Honestly one of the cleanest stores I've ever been in. With COVID I think that is saying something too since so many places have kicked their cleaning up. I was impressed. 

I won't be shopping anywhere else anytime soon now that I know what I know.

Came in for a quick visit, was looking to buy a couple of things but was annoyed by one of the employees who kept hawking over me and following me everywhere after i told her i didn't need any help. I really hate having someone follow me around a store, especially when im going to spend money. It definitely makes the shopping experience less exciting. Definitely not coming back to this ulta and not recommending it to others as well...

I have been shopping at this Ulta store for a while. On Sunday, I spent $110 here. Today (Tuesday) I went back in to return two items: pack of beauty blenders (2) and a concealer, which of course I never opened and used. The girl at the register didn't seem very friendly, I said I would like to return these, she inspected the beauty blender container for a second and asked me whether I used it. "Did you use this?" I said no, of course I didn't. Didn't even say sorry or anything. Extremely rude. Who would use a beauty blender and stick it back into its plastic container and try to return it? Apparently I looked like one of those people. Not going there again.

I really like this store (clean, generally well-stocked, and the associates are helpful). A big shout out to one store associate, in particular, her name is Marianne (I am not sure about the exact spelling) but she is always nice, takes her time to help, and is truly knowledgeable.

I am giving this place a 4/5 on the amazing job their salon does (however Octavia the esthetician is an absolute 5!). The first time I went, I was greeted by an older woman who though she said she could do brows, would not in a rude manner. Luckily, another woman overheard the conversation and recommended Octavia. Since then, I make a 30 minute drive to see her for all my facial needs. They do have girls who work in the "brow bar", but are never (every Ulta seems like they have that same issue) there, but I wouldn't trade my experience because I would have missed out on finding Octavia.

The store assistance itself has gotten much better. Every time I need help, someone is available (not lurking) to help & know directly where I can find what I need. Had I written this review 6 months ago, it would've been completely different, so I'm glad I waited and gave it a chance.

I went to ultra for a facial it was the best facial I've had in a long time Jessica was wonderful! my daughter also needed a hair cut and Oz was so good to her she had 10 inches cut and she donated to locks of love. Ulta did everything they sent her hair for us and it was a free hair cut. so if you need a hair cut see Oz and for facials see Jess thank you :)

I love ULTA, in theory. But as far as this location and its staff, much is left to be desired. I spend A LOT of moola in this store because the products are amazing and it's very close to my gym. But the people working in this store better get their minds right. On two separate and distinct occasions I went in looking for some Urban Decay products. Three "associates" walked past me like I was a sheet of glass and one guy with super long blue nails actually saw me kneeling down trying to read the selection of Naked Flushed--something I cannot live without--and this dude was actually inches away from me and ignored me! I can imagine it takes acute concentration putting back 6 bottles of Allnighter. Finally, Amanda ran over to me asking if she can assist. I thanked her for noticing but declined. Btw...she's a freelancer not even fully employed with the store and she was helpful and kind; and lastly, Katrina too noticed me at the breast cancer display and asked if i needed help. So kudos to these two professionals. To the 10+ people working the floor today that think their kind of customer service is acceptable...smdh....

I love it here! It's super clean and everyone who works there is super nice and very helpful. I trust Ulta very much with the products they sell me. And they also recommend great things that are very useful. And I love the points that you earn on a card and then you get some money off! It's just great there!

Ulta is a beauty lover's heaven. The mix of high end and drugstore products is great, since I can pick up everything I need in one shot instead of running all over. They also carry some harder-to-find brands like Japonesque and NYX. I have never used their salon at any location, so I can't speak to that service.

I find that Ulta in general is usually a much quieter store than a Sephora or MAC. The employees let me browse at my own pace, which I adore but I'm sure is not for some people such as those needing guidance or consultation. I'm very into makeup and skincare and don't need or want much help ever. I hate "hoverers" or pushy employees, so it's definitely a perk for me to be left alone. 

One employee here is a total standout. His name is Kevin, and he's on the taller side and a bit lanky. He is A-MAZ-ING!! If you ever need help, ask for Kevin. He knows his product like he knows his name, is never pushy, and will give you honest opinions (he's also a makeup artist). He is fabulous, and it's a joy to interact with him while shopping.

Extremely unhappy with this staff. The first time in after moving from Pittsburgh, I was overbooked. My appointment was for 11. The "stylist" was currently highlighting someone else's hair. Just started. I was only getting a blowout and style for pictures. I waited until 11:40. Another girl came over and took me to wash my hair. She took literally 25 minutes just to wash it. Then to blow dry it another 30 minutes. Finally the stylist came over to curl my ends with the flatiron. She pinned them up and asked if I could just take them down when I got home. I told her no, I was paying her to style my hair. I left there at 1:30. 
The next time I went in, after scheduling an appointment for color weeks ahead of time. An hour before I arrived, we got the call that my stylist was leaving to go home and could I reschedule a month later. No. So they scheduled me with a first timer. Well, I get there, show the girl what I wanted, and she consults the girl I was supposed to have in the first place!  Then she walks out with her boyfriend!  Angry already. Then this girl does my color and it's nowhere near what I wanted!  I've had it done many times at a salon in Pittsburgh. Never had an issue. I also asked for layers for my cut. I got a light trim. I got home and noticed spots in my color and cutoff lines near the ends. 
Don't go here for your hair color or cut!!!

Using my rewards points I wanted to buy an overpriced self tanner.  The self tanner didn't work so when I went to return it, I was going to lose points! (Side note- when cashing in points Ulta rounds up to the next dollar. When returning an item bought with points, they round down. .so make sure you love what you buy with your points because there is an unintended penalty when returning points items.) Anyway ... the people in Cherry Hill didn't know what they are talking about so I went to Moorestown.  There, Gabby was great. She spent a long time on the phone with customer service and was very helpful.  Especially compared to Cherry Hill, where they don't know their products or their services, the Moorestown store is great.  The problem was resolved only because Gabby took the extra time to call costumer service and help me get to the root of the problem.

Everyone here is very helpful and generally happy; not something you typically see at a retail chain. The store is clean, everything in stock that I need, and they have great coupons and promotions. Jess, one of the managers, was extremely helpful last time I went looking for spray water. Doesn't hurt that she's also adorable ;)

Oh I love this place.It's my Go to for my products, Hair & nails, to perfumes. Can't go in here thinking getting one thing , I always go in, coming out with more!!! The have a salon in back for hair, One previous associates I knew now works there. They have nice assortment of salon brand products-good prices, some time they have special combos sets , value packs I grab up for hair & nails. From OPI to Sebastian, Bed Head. Love them!!

Just had THE worst hair coloring appointment ever!  The girl was clearly inexperienced and I could tell from the first 5 minutes but still let her continue (regret this now). My appointment was for 6:30 on a Friday. I arrived 10 mins early and was immediately taken which was a bonus.  She asked me what I wanted to do and I explained that I wanted all-over hair color to cover the grays (went into more detail regarding shade, etc), hair trim, and blow dry/style.  I waited while she mixed the color and watched her consult with who I assume was her manager (this made me a little nervous).  Let me tell you that this girl was S-L-O-W! It took her over an hour to apply color to my entire head (possibly 1.5) then she tells me "Ok it has to stay on for 30 minutes".  I said "excuse me?" (Cuz I've never had hair color stay on for that long especially when it took over an hour to apply). As I'm sitting there the salon is quickly emptying out so that by the time she says it's time to wash it out, there is not one customer there and only one other hairstylist who is also on her way out (its after 8 pm by now).  As I'm sitting in the shampoo chair she is washing my hair in the most gentle manner I've ever experienced and I'm thinking to myself "How in the world is the hair color even washing out?", not to mention how SLOWLY she's doing this too.  She FINALLY lets me up and I go over to the mirror knowing what I'm gonna find.  Firstly I notice my forehead is covered in dye then I run my hands through my hair and they come out covered in brown dye.  I turn to her and say, "Um you didn't wash the dye out" and show her my fingers.  Now I'm mad and I say "I'm gonna wash my own hair" and I proceed to do so while leaning over the sink scrubbing my scalp and hair (completely opposite of how she had done). As the water continues to run brown I ask her if this is supposed to happen and she replies that it's demi color so it's not permanent and is supposed to wash out some. Now I had no idea she hadn't put permanent dye in my hair so I'm even more pissed. I go over to the chair and she starts towel drying my hair ever so gently.  Then she starts combing it through and asks if I still want a haircut.  I answer no and she asks if I want t her to blow it out and again I tell her no.  As I'm getting up to leave I grab a towel since my hair is dripping wet.  I finish towel drying my hair and head to the register area.  I tell her I am supposed to get the promotional offer of 25% off, she applies it and I angrily storm off to pay (I regret paying anything now but there was no manager on sight at 8:30 pm anyway). I ask the woman at the register for the managers name and leave.  I plan to call Denise today.  Worst. Experience. Ever.

I had a great experience at the Ulta Salon! I love that they offered me options for conditioning treatments with my haircut! My cut by Beth was great and the blow dry was amazing! Im def coming back for color next!

I wanted to give a shout out regarding Caitlin McMullan, the Salon Manager. I was walking in the store and she came up to me to ask me if she could help. I'm sure I looked upset. I told her how unhappy I was about my hair and she said she could fix it with a beautiful permanent color. She was so understanding and sweet so I booked an appointment. Boy am I glad I booked an appointment! I went in today and she listened and advised and we worked together to get my mess of hair in beautiful condition and color. I left on cloud nine. She is a superstar and I can't thank her enough for the wonderful job she did on my hair. She is professional and worked hard to give me a result that was better than expected. The salon is well run, efficient and professional. Every stylist was on point with their customers and everyone who was there while I was, was obviously more than pleased with their results. I will be recommending your salon going forward. Job well done!

Rushed service. Spent 2 days and a few hours accomplishing accent highlights that either weren't lifted long enough or weren't toned long enough. Had to correct lines of demarcation and never achieved the color or root smudge that I asked for. I paid for highlights that are now way darker that I principally came in with bc the only way to "fix" was to go darker. Nope. Will def not
Go back.

Will not be shopping at Ulta anymore. Every time I go the cashiers are either not at the register, or super slow. I almost always feel harassed by their workers, wanting to push some new product on me. The last time I went I was looking at Mario Badescu skin care, which I have been using for years, and here comes a sales woman to try and "help" me. She tried to scare me from buying the brand, claiming they use a bad chemical(I found out later this was a lie after doing research)and trying to sell me some other vegan brand that I was not interested in. As a result she made no sale that day. 

I also don't like that they push their own political agenda, as evidenced by their advertising campaign. The coupons seem like a good deal, but I'd much rather go to Sephora where I always get a nice sample or free gift for my points as well as a wider selection of higher end brands.

Messy,dirty store and rude employees. Yeah, I had the audacity to use a $3 off coupon (from rewards program). I also had the nerve to ask a question about a product. After being treated like I was an idiot, I walked out with NOTHING.

I've been going to this location for over 10 years. I was once a frequent shopper and had hair done by a favorite stylist. Since that time I invest my $$$ in better things but recently I went in for a little makeup splurge. Of course Ulta is a chain that most know about but this particular store is a 3/4 star. I was inside for 2 minutes when someone checked in, she found what I was looking for and helped apply a sample. Happy, happy because I can't stand wishing someone would find me or vice versa. I know some of the sales people are from the vendor. Either way, kudos on that one. Another person checked in while browsing again...thumbs up.

I moved onto shopping solo and noticed a handful of mislabeled items or things totally wiped out of stock. Honestly, they could have made much more money off of me. They could benefit from an inventory uplift. Also, it seems like the Ulta named products went up in price. 

I spent over $50 and no freebies/samples. Most competition give SOMETHING to customers but eh, that's their choice. Of course I'd be back but preference is the Cherry Hill location or competition.
Go ONLINE Place is filthy half products missing & waited in line FOREVER!! Only reason to be here is Bare Minerals! Will plan better next time-STAY AWAY from here!!!

Let me start off by saying that I love Ulta!  The past few times I've been here though, the employees were so pushy and insistent on selling more expensive products.  Even if the products weren't fitting the description of what I was asking for. On both occasions I wanted to put down my shopping bag and just leave. What a turn off. 

On another occasion, I was just running in and out for shampoo.. two people putting away truck(which was spread out everywhere in the aisle and walkway for customers to trip over) gave me an attitude like I was inconveniencing them by being in the store. 

I'll give the cherry hill location a chance next time, but otherwise I'll do all of my shopping online or somewhere else. It's a shame because the Mt. Laurel location used to have such friendly and helpful employees.

As noted in a previous review, my first visit to this store was disappointing. 
 Recently, I visited the store again, looking for a hard-to-find item.  The store didn't have what I was searching for.  However, a store employee (I don't recall her name) noticed me looking, and offered to help.  She confirmed they didn't sell the item.  However, using her cell phone, she spent a few minutes locating the item at another store, verifying it was in-stock, and getting price info.  Needless to say, this left me with a more favorable impression than my previous visit.

LOVE this place. I travel 30 minutes, sometimes 45 just to get my eyebrows done here and even shop. Have had nothing but good experiences. Always had my eyebrows done in nail salons until I started researching other options. I started going to an upbeat more expensive salon and then found this brow bar. My eyebrows started growing in the way I liked and were shaped the way I wanted. Yes $21 is a lot for eyebrows but it is truly NOT ENOUGH for how good they come out. Made the mistake of going to another ulta that was closer to me and within minutes all the time spent to grow my eyebrows out and get the shape I liked was thrown out. At this brow bar they will listen to what you like, talk to you about it and then draw on your eyebrows and show you exactly what they are going to do before they do it. It does not get any better than this. I do not care if I ever move millions of miles away, this brow bar is worth the price and the ride. Paying for good quality is not even a question when you could be paying the same price for CRAP, and trust me, I have. It's a definite plus that the brow girls are also always so nice and social too.
My first time in ULTA in a while and Jose is so sweet! He made my short experience a good one. I'll definitely be back

Here's an update on my Yelp review. Ulta Guest Services reaches out and asks me for more details. I do so and Lisa Jubanyik, salon district manager gets in contact with me.  She is rude, unprofessional, unapologetic and made me feel like my complaint was not valid.  

Get this. She has the audacity to tell me I lied about how long I spent at the salon and how she checked it on camera. Are you kidding me? This is your response to a customer service issue? If that's the case, it should be clear on camera that I came in around 10 AM for my correction. You're employee came in after 10 AM, with a coffee, and I had to approach HER and ask her when we were going to begin. Also, I offered to come in on MY day off so your employee did not have to. I am an understanding client and I was happy to offer some flexibility there in hopes of a quality service that in the end was not provided. 

And yes Lisa, I did spend more than $400. I paid $299, redeemed points, tipped 20%, AND bought salon products. You can keep my money and I'll gladly spend my money elsewhere. Thank you for wasting my time today.

Great location and helpful staff. My favorite part about Ulta is that the staff doesnt hawk you or twist your arm until you purchase something. I recently visited in hopes of purchasing a dermelogica product I really liked that was used when I went for a facial. I was asked if I needed help when I asked about the product the onsite rep came over and helped me find it. Also, she let me know they service facials there which I did not know. She also gave me her card and a coupon and left me to make my final decision.  This is real customer service. I will be back.

I stop in this Ulta quite a bit, much to my wallet's chagrin.  It is a smaller location and has yet to be remodeled but there is still a decent selection of merchandise.  I like Ulta b/c they have drugstore, salon, and high end products all in one store.  Plus they always have coupons.
Maria at the Benefit Brow Bar is amazing!!!  She took my crazy brows and made them super pretty!  Great Job!!!

Beware of taking Product Recommendations! 
I did and I am very sorry that I did! Always read about the products you are purchasing before you buy them because their employees are extremely un-knowledgeable! I took their recommendation and now I have had to spend hundreds and hundreds of dollars to repair the damage they caused. Big mistake! Huge Mistake! Don't make it unless you want to end up in the same boat.

I've visited this store on separate occasions and have had associates follow me around the store (in the disguise of checking products near me). Initially, thought this was a coincidence, but after giving the store another chance because of convenience, it was obvious that it was intentional. This tailgating experience is insulting, rude and really dampened my shopping experience along with changing my view of the brand! Will not return based on the treatment received at this location! If I could rate 0 stars, I would.

BRIDAL PARTIES BEWARE! 

Twenty minutes before the bride was to walk down the aisle, she received a voicemail from Ulta, stating that I (a bridesmaid) did not pay for (fake) eyelashes when I checked out of the salon. And that if Ulta did not receive the $6 by the next day, that the police would be called. 

Seriously? Such an extreme measure for the mistake of your makeup "artist," who rang the ticket up and forgot to add the eyelashes into the charge for the eyelash application and makeup? As a bridesmaid, I had about a dozen other things to worry about and thought that upon receiving the ticket and paying in full, that I was cleared. 

Wrong, due to someone else's mistake. 

And even worse, calling the BRIDE as she's about to head down the aisle, to threaten her with the police? 

Get a life. Our tips to the makeup "artist" not only would have paid for the lashes, but were also much more than what she deserved. Even oompa loompas looked better than I did before I scrambled back to the hotel to redo my makeup. 

And shame on Ulta, for taking a very unprofessional and childish approach to getting your $6. All you had to do was leave a nice voicemail - maybe on the day AFTER the bride's wedding and NOT as she's about to walk the aisle - explaining the mistake YOUR staff member had made, and that we would need to take care of the balance ASAP.

This store sucks not only do the employees not give a shit but the people who shop there are fucking trash. It's the day after Christmas and I have my nice sunglasses stolen that were right by the register. The employee I asked for help couldn't be bothered. I will never go back here.
I had my brows waxed at the benefit brow bar. I'm not even sure how this happened that they were THAT uneven. Unfortunately I didn't even notice how bad they were until after I left.

I went in for an appointment a little over a week ago with an "Elite" stylist. I felt really confident we were on the same page. Before she ever touched my hair, we had a long conversation about what I wanted (I had booked a full highlight and a cut). I wanted to bring up the color of my 2-year-old ombre into a warm balayage, which was listed under the highlight service. She asked "how blonde", so I showed her a picture of the exact balayage I wanted. She said that had been "exactly what she had in mind," and we talked about how nice it would be for fall. 

I said I wanted to take off 2-3 inches, with a max of 3 inches coming from the bottom, because the hair was pretty broken and dead. She said she could definitely do that and asked how I like to style my hair day-to-day. I said I love throwing it into a messy bun at home, curling it or straightening it for work, and sometimes just wearing it naturally curly by tossing it over one side of my head. I said I wanted layers cut back in because most had grown out. She had cut my hair before and it was nice, so there were no red flags. (Yet?)

Back to the color, she said how good long, choppy layers would look with the balayage I was going for. I had no reason to doubt that I wasn't going to get what I asked for--she went on and on about how good it was going to look once the color in my hair was refreshed.

When she took the foils out at the sink, she commented about how wonderfully my hair had lightened up. It hadn't been colored in nearly two years, so I knew it should've worked well since the dye was mostly on virgin hair. But then she said she wanted to make the color "pop" more, and would I be okay with her "deepening the root" with a little bit of dye? I trusted that she knew what she was doing, so I said it was fine. I thought maybe she had brought the balayage up a little too far and needed to touch it up to shadow the roots a bit. I stayed in the sink for another half hour while that dye set, and then we went back to the chair.

I was confused in the chair because even though my hair was wet, I couldn't see any signs of color. I thought I should've been able to see some of the warm blonde at the bottom, but there wasn't anything to be seen. It's okay, though, I thought, because I've colored my full head and barely been able to tell when it was wet. I'd wait until it was dry before making a judgment.

I didn't have any doubt about her ability to cut my hair, because I've been to her for a cut before. So when she came to the side and showed me where she intended to start cutting--about three inches from the bottom--I wasn't concerned. Until she was still trimming off bits from the bottom 20 minutes later, and I realized my hair had lost NEARLY SIX INCHES. I started to panic a little bit, but wanted to wait until she was finished. 

Maybe the layers would redeem it and it would be fine. Hair grows back, right? Maybe we'd had a miscommunication about the length? I didn't know it at the time ended up taking off all of my remaining ombre. I don't know how she interpreted "I want to bring this color up since I'll lose some of it in the trim" into "take all of this color off." But once she had dried my hair, I was shocked to see that not only had she taken SIX INCHES off, but it was also all one length. No layers to be seen. 

And the color? No slow, gradual transition from warm blonde to my natural dark brown. Just cool blonde highlights from top to bottom, throughout my entire head. And, as I later realized, the highlights aren't evenly spaced... and some have missing brown chunks where the brown dye was unevenly layered over the blonde during the shadow root touch-up.

I wondered if it was the salon lighting that was making me see things. I let her finish styling it, as she gushed about how it's "still long" even though it was barely touching my shoulders when it had formerly gone halfway down my back. I stupidly paid $$$ + tip for this absolute destruction of my hair.

Let's recap.

I asked for:
- a warm blonde balayage
- a maximum of 3" cut off the length
- layers

I got:
- cool-toned root-to-tip highlights
- darker roots on formerly virgin hair, which will now be difficult to color over
- A minimum of SIX INCHES off of my hair, which will take over a year to grow back
- an all-one-length cut

Was it opposite day? Because I feel like I somehow came out on the other side of the cupboard in Narnia with a bad haircut.

The salon manager contacted me, offering to fix it, and told me if I couldn't get there in one to two weeks (I'm from out of town), she could give me 20% off my next service. I thought about going back, but ultimately decided it would be better to go somewhere else rather than risk it getting even worse. 

I asked Ulta for a partial refund for this nightmare, but haven't heard back. I'm not holding my breath. 
 
ULTA-mately, this was a *very* expensive learning experience. I hope you learn from my mistake and stay far away from this salon.

What a convenient idea!  You can shop online and then pick up your order in the store.  At most stores, this concept operates like a "well-oiled machine."  You arrive at the store, show an e-mail to the store employee, and receive a package containing your merchandise.   Unfortunately, at this Ulta store, the same concept is very poorly executed.  You drive to the store, find a place to park, stand there waiting at an unattended "order pick-up counter" while employees ring people up at the cash registers, and then leave without any merchandise -- an hour wasted.  How convenient!

Don't make online service appts! Made an appointment for makeup application a week in advance. I arrived early to the spot and was told there has been a glitch in their online booking service, so online appts weren't all coming through. So I wasn't on the schedule. They blamed the online booking service (still your fault, Ulta!) and were not apologetic. The manager-type lady didn't even make eye contact with me.

Giving it 2 stars only for the polite receptionist.

This was my first time at this salon, never again! A friend and I went and were triple booked. The appointment took FIVE hours! We were 25 minutes early for our 10am appointments and didn't get released until 3. I wanted a touch up on my current ombre to cover my roots and remove the red tinge, instead I have a head full of strawberry dark blonde hair, no ombre whatsoever. $116 later (color, rinse, glaze, barely a trim), I have to have my hair redone to get the copper red out and ombre redone.

I have been to several Ultas and this one by far is probably the worst. I dragged my husband in here when he forced me to stop at Best Buy one Saturday morning. The store was supposed to open at 10 but I found myself waiting outside until close to 10:10. When we finally got in everyone rushed in different directions. It wasn't until I was in the store for 10 more minutes that someone finally came over to see if I needed help with anything. I asked a few questions but felt really rushed by the woman. Finally I told her I didn't any more questions which she responded with a sigh of relief...really come on this is your job. I picked out of a few things and then made my way back to the dermalogica section. I was turned out to Derm when I started working at my current place of employment and was surrounded by it every day. (I work at a spa) I was met by another lady who stated she specializes in the products and started sputtering out random facts, all of which I already knew. She went on and on and I just kept smiling while looking through the products. Then out of no where she starts saying things that I know to be down right wrong about the products and at the point she had my full attention. I know that everyone can't know everything but to lie to try and keep a conversation going? My husband knew right away I was started to become annoyed and finally I asked her to walk up and let her know that she was completely wrong and she should never give someone the advice she tried to give me.

I will probably be back only because its the closest one to me, however I would recommend driving somewhere else if you are looking for good advice or help picking out products!

Okay, so it's a chain store. But I've been to enough Ulta locations to know what separates one from another: the staff. Maybe the few times I've been here just all happen to coincide with an 'off' day for the employees, but it seems like there's only ever one person here at any given time who actually cares about not completely alienating potential customers. 

The last time I visited this location, I went with the intention of getting my eyebrows waxed. The seemingly lone salon employee said that she was busy with another client and wouldn't be able to assist me for at least 20 minutes. Okay, that's totally understandable. The (suspiciously empty) salon apparently had just one person staffing it, as it WAS in the late afternoon.

Imagine my surprise when I watched her leave the salon immediately after telling me she was busy. Imagine my further surprise when, upon exiting the store a few minutes later, I saw the same employee smoking and chatting away outside, looking like she had no intention of doing her job any time soon. 

The few minutes I spent browsing the store were quiet minutes, as not one store employee seemed interested in helping me find this item or notifying me of whatever current sale was going on. I spent one college summer working at another Ulta location and, let me tell you, we were told that satisfactory customer service was our top priority. In that regard, this location brings the fail quite spectacularly, as well-stocked as it may be.

In short, head to the Marlton Ulta if you can. It's worth the extra 10 minutes to encounter employees who actually want to help and have discernible, pleasant personalities.

Well it started off promising as I was greeted as I walked in the door and that was it.  There were several associates running around asking ppl did they need help but not me, not sure why.  Eventually after looking over the whole store I asked an associate that was stocking if she could tell me where something was and she did.  If I didn't really want what I went in there to get I probably would've went out of my way and went to the Haddonfield location.

Positive Review: ULTA has a very nice selection. Their "name brand" products are of fair quality.   But I'd have to say it's their SERVICE that will keep me from returning ever again.  I'm not a huge consumer of these products, but maybe 2-3 times a year I'll drop a $100 each time.  About a year ago I received a % coupon from Sephora.  I had a few other errands to run in the same center as ULTA so I brought my Sephora coupon  along and asked if they'd honor the competitor coupon for the same products.  "No-" was their curt answer.  There was no offer or suggestion of maybe what they "could" do otherwise to earn my business. Just, "No" and a stare.   I left, and went to Sephora, who earned my money. Out of convience, I had other shopping to do in this same strip mall, once again.  I grabbed a cart and knocked off each errand along this outside mall while loading each purchase bag I made in the same cart (I know I was cart-double-dipping-lol!)  I also was carrying my 10 month old son in this cart as well (multi-tasking!)  I was ready to give ULTA another try.  As I was browsing the new fall nail colors, a somewhat stern blonde employee quickly approached me and asked me to please leave with my cart.  She explained that although she saw I was pushing an infant and was hauling other bags that their "shelves were not designed nor sturdy enough in the event I pushed into one with my cart".  Maybe if she had offered to hold my bags behind the counter, or helped me with my purchases while I used my hands to hold my son, I would have stayed.  But again, there was NO effort made to keep or earn my dollar.  There was no apology for the situation.  Not even a half-ass compassion attempt.  My happy little boy, wallet and I walked our butt out of ULTA for the very last time.  (While passing a woman and her baby in a stroller- so how is THAT exactly less of a shelf hazard than the cart I was pushing???) 
Especially in todays economy it's no excuse to be this poor with customer service.  Thank goodness for capitalism. And thank goodness for the Sally Beauty Supply next door to ULTA.  Not only was my purchase less expensive there but  they were very helpful in helping me (and the cart I was pushing!) find my needed products.

I usually love Makeup stores. Ulta is usually one of my favorites because they carry both high end and drug store brands.  What I had no clue about, until today was just how much they mark up the drug store brands.  I know this, because the brands I just bought at Target & Wal-Mart, were purchase-able here but they were a good 2 dollars more. RIDICULOUS.

They do carry many of the brands that Sephora carries, and that's cool, but yeah.. they need to clean up their act. Their displays -the ones for their own brand and that of the high end polishes were really nasty looking, their testers all broken and smeared, the nail polishes all spread out over the plastic. This is not the visual I want when shopping at a store. 

Needless to say, I bought nothing.

I mean yea, it's ulta. If you've ever been to an ulta this one is the same as the rest. I felt this one was extremely over priced, but It had the same prices as online so I guess I was just stuck buying it at that price. The service was fine, I didn't really like how the store was set up, just in terms of where stuff was in proximinty to other sections, but whatever.

Just wanted to  say thank you to Christine For the service I got this morning One the most of professional service person I have ever dealt With The facial I got was just what I needed for the redness on my face due to attic work all week She takes her time with the Client and does not Rush  is very concerned about the client Idea what customers every day with my job and I know how difficult it could be Few times I have gone to see her It's been a great experience Aita should be Proud that someone who works for them  is so professionally she is frist class And a great representative of your company

I am a huge fan of the salon at Ulta.  I was nervous when I first came in to get advice about adding hair. I was expertly guided through the process of adding extensions to my thinning prone to breakage delicate hair. The Redkin color is gentle and natural looking and my hair has never looked better since the extensions were added.  Now I am complimented whether I wear my hair up or down. It's fun to browse the store while my color developes and they have a good appointment confirmation by text message system.  And, BONUS...dollars I spend earn me dollars to spend in the store.

I personally prefer Sephora. Just because I can always leave with 72752916539 free samples, and they actually will walk around with me and help me with my selections. 

I mainly go to Ulta to by NYX products.

Tracey is my Hair Guru! She's been cutting, coloring, styling my hair for 3 years. Not only is she talented, she is honest. I send her hair pics and she will tell me yes or no, depending on my face shape or aging look. I moved out of the close area and still travel to see Tracey.

I just wish they had more in stock ! :( 
Every time I go they never have the NYX Matte lipsticks but other than that this is my number one store .
They're make up artists are terrible. I ended up looking like I did my own make up drunk and left handed. I told them I was unsatisfied and they wouldn't refund me. DO NOT RECOMMEND!!

I love this place. The location is great and easy to get to. The ULTA products are great quality. The carry a large variety of beauty product and even have a salon in the back. I wish they carried more products for natural, non relaxed, hair. The prices are on the higher end. The staff is always pleasant and happy to help!
Nope this is the place where no one helps you. I rather go to Sephora and if I have to go to ulta is cause it's a too faced exclusive

The selection is good but compared to other Ulta stores I have been to in the mid-west this one does not compete.  Customer service lacks and the staff just are not as friendly as they should be.  Another note to add I cannot redeem the money I earned with the point system.  The lady that was checking me out had no idea what I was talking about and looked as if I was stupid.  One of the other staff members came over and  said that this Ulta did not sign up for that but she thinks that a one in Orlando does do the dollar for every point... I am confused, chain store.. shouldn't it have the same policies etc?  Overall, this is a very close location to my home and I will continue to come due to fact that they have what I need.  Like other reviewers do not expect the staff to go out of their way to help you.

My review is based on my experience at the Benefit brow bar.  I had heard very positive reviews and results for Benefit's brow services although I had never tried them previously.  My brows were in need of some TLC and I researched where the closest Brow Bar was located.  Behold they have a location right down the road from me in Citrus Park.  I booked an appointment around lunch time today and they were able to fit me in this afternoon. My appointment was with Arlette.  She performed the brow mapping to help reshape my brows and make sure they were giving me the right shape for my face.  She was extremely friendly and took her time which put me right at ease.  Her knowledge of what eye brow shape would work on me and recommendations on their products that would work with my skin tone and hair color were very impressive.  The service and pricing is very reasonable and comparable to other waxing salons.  I will definitely be going back and may even try their brow tint service.

Gina is by far the best stylist they have. She doesn't just do hair, she knows color, she listens to her clients and that's why people come to her and will continue coming to her. She's a true artist not just a follow the fads kind of girl but a starts the fad, a true leader. That is all.

I tried the Ulta Salon for the first time and I'm very happy with the results!!! So glad I tried it and will continue to go back. My stylist was Natasha and she did an amazing job. She is very knowledgeable and knows what style and color is perfect for you. She works with you to make sure you love your new do. I'm very satisfied!! My hair looks great!

Through some girlfriends and a recent move, I discovered Ulta. It sounded similar to Sephora and being that I am a huge fan of Sephora, I had to check it out. 

Not as glamorous and offers more economic offerings and has a salon inside the store, the experience is mediocre. The store is for your deal hunter or coupon clipper since they do have coupons (through emails and mailers all the time). The thing to be cautious of, many of the brands I buy are not included (Bliss, Philosophy).

Just wanted to  say thank you to Christine For the service I got this morning One the most of professional service person I have ever dealt With The facial I got was just what I needed for the redness on my face due to attic work all week She takes her time with the Client and does not Rush  is very concerned about the client Idea what customers every day with my job and I know how difficult it could be Few times I have gone to see her It's been a great experience Aita should be Proud that someone who works for them  is so professionally she is frist class And a great representative of your company

These Ulta employees act like they just can't be bothered if you need some help or have a question. Also, messy, unorganized displays. They're not that low in price, kind of steep on most things actually. And they were out of what I came there for - Ulta brand foundation and Primer. Go to Sephora instead.
Natasha did my hair cut and I'm In love, not only did she know how to deal with my thin hair but her cut gave me lots of volume. Thanks Natasha see you in six weeks

These high-end cosmetic stores really know how to tug on a girl's heart strings. Ulta may not be quite as nice as its competitor Sephora, but I think I might like it better because they have high end brands, middle range, and drug store brands. I cant afford to buy ALL high end brands, but I love treating myself to them. I'm a HUGE fan of BB cream, as I'm not a huge foundation person and just need light coverage. I picked up Benefit's new "Big Easy" bb cream and I'm in LOVE. It was 38$, but honestly the quality and staying power completely justify the pricetag. With some of this stuff you really get what you pay for. I also ordered a type of Benefit "starter kit" from Ulta's website full of deluxe samples of their best sellers, which is a great value as I can determine which items Id actually purchase a full size of instead of wasting a ton of money. Cant wait for that to get here, in the meantime I'll be enjoying my new fancy Bb cream! Yay Ulta!

Have a facial done on March 17 by Christine very professional and caring told me step by step want she was doing treated me like a person not just a Clint she made me feel comfortable and relaxed let me know what to do to help the redness on my face would recommend her to all my friends male and female was stright forward on want she was doing Ultra to be very proud of the service as she provided will use her again

This location gets the 2 stars for selection, they have a benefit brow bar and the employee at the register was friendly.  However, I walked in on a Saturday morning soon after they opened around 10:20am, needless to stay the store was nearly empty. I stood with my child right in front of the benefit brow section, clearly needing help while at least 5 employees stood near me, doing something I guess, just not helping customers obviously. One smiled while walking past me and as I was about to ask for help she walked away. Finally, I had to literally walk over to another employee and "make" her help me. Ultimately, I left the store spending $65 on 2 makeup items which is no chump change because I really needed those items otherwise I would have walked out. I find that type of customer service unacceptable. I don't know why I was ignored nor do I care to speculate. If you work in customer service, your priority should be to provide that service, especially when it was so early in the day and the store was empty. I won't be shopping there again.

I've been to many salons and I can truly say I love thier work here. I've been a loyal customer for about a year. Love how honest they are. My stylist is Ms.Tracey and she's an expert in getting the ashy look. I'm a dark Burnett and to go from dark to light without the brassy look is extremely hard to accomplish, however, Ms.Tracey has consistently delivered all the way. Thank you! See you at my next appointment:)

I had never been to an Ulta before this past weekend.  I am thoroughly impressed with the selection of hair, makeup, and almost any other beauty item you can think of.  There was a great deal on eyeliner.  Even though I don't normally do much eye makeup, I took this as an opportunity to buy a few different colors and play around at home.  One of the other things that I appreciated is that it was very spread out and the rows weren't narrow and overcrowded like Sephora almost always seems to be.

I found out they do facials yesterday when I was getting my hair done. I had some time so I stopped in the Citrus park location. Chana was able to take me as a walk in right away. They have a room off to the side of the salon. I have only had spa facials at resorts or day spas. I would say this was very much a similar experience just more convenient. I really don't feel like I know what is up with my skin, just I'm not happy. Chana asked me questions and had me fill out a card with info about my lifestyle... Suntanning, medications, etc. The typical things they ask you at spas before treatments. 

After that she got right to it. After cleaning and looking at my skin she suggested I try dermabrasion and since it was my first time I should start with the introductory service. I've always wanted to get dermabrasion but I have been thrown off by this price. This seemed reasonable so I was excited to try it out. I barely felt a thing as she was doing it. I would compare it to rubbing an eraser across my face. On top of that there was the entire facial with a mask and aromatherapy

I thought my skin was worse than it was but Chana let me know it was more that I was dehydrated. I guess the one downside is that my skin felt so good I wanted to buy the whole dermalogica line. I will definitely be back!

The staff is very friendly, as they been on my multiple visits, and the store is very tidy. 
Ulta at Citrus Park is my only destination for hairstyles, relaxers and color treatments. My stylist, Kanisha, is brilliant with all hair types and textures. She's done my ombré, relaxers, cuts and styles for years; I've no need to complain about her work. I rave and recommend her at every opportunity that I get. 
The carry a variety of brands such as NYX, Benefit, Urban Decay and NAKED. I love earning points from my hair appointments to get high end flat irons and styling wands. 
The salon and store prices are slightly above average, in my opinion, but you have to pay for quality. So in the end it all works out.

I have never walked into an Ulta before and not had somebody ask me if they could help me with what I was looking for. I'm trying to switch from Clinique to bare minerals, and a group of 4 workers were just chit chatting and not paying attention to anyone else in the store. I asked 2 girls to help match me and both said they didn't know what they were doing. Needless to say, I walked out and I'm now headed to another Ulta to buy everything I need.

THIS PLACE IS COOL!  Ok, First of all, NEVER walk in there with two teenage girls! This is a like a MEGA mart for make-up, perfume,  hair stuff and anything else a girl could ever want to look good!  It is a bit expensive but they have everything from Elizabeth Arden to Cover-girl
Paul Mitchel to Aussie!  I have gotten my hair colored and cut there also,  Nichole in the salon is very good, she listened to what I wanted and did it. Be sure to sign up for their reward points! You get lots of freebies!  (Free Haircut) They will also mail you a monthly catalog with coupons!  I really like this place.  Of course the girls were in heaven! Smashbox, Urban Decay, Bare Minerals etc.
It is larger than Sephora.  
Their Ulta brand works very well too! Less $$

I went to Ulta today with a coupon and of course when I was ready to pay was told I could not use the coupon on the item I was purchasing. Of course I wasn't surprised. I also read the coupon before going up to the register and it did not say I could not use it on that item. I'm so tired of getting coupons that can only be used on 4 or 5 items in the store. Also when the sales clerk rang me up she asked for my phone number. I thought she asked for my ZIP Code and I gave her that, she then gave me a snotty look and replied that's your phone number? I said I thought you asked for my ZIP Code and she said no your phone number. I then declined because I'm sick and tired of giving my phone number out. First of all it's completely unnecessary for someone to have my private information and most places like to sell your information. So I don't want random sales calls on my phone. She then told me I would not be allowed to return my item if I don't Give her my phone number. Which is completely ridiculous! The only thing I should need to have is a receipt and the item should be returned in the amount of time given to make a return. I told her that was a violation of my privacy if I choose to not give you my phone number and that there are many people who have unlisted numbers. She shrugged her shoulders and said oh well. I won't be shopping here anymore.
Had a facial with Cori she did a great job my skin feels so refreshed. Debony is awesome to I always feel welcomed.

I consider Ulta to be a Sephora wanna be. The stores are not laid out as nicely, the aesthetics aren't as pleasing, and their staff doesn't seem to be as knowledgeable. 

What I do like is they carry dermalogica products and this one isnt located at the mall so it's less of an ordeal to get in and out. 

If you need some cosmetics or hair care, Ulta is a good option but don't expect to walk into a Sephora

4 stars because they've got everything. Hair care, nail polish galore, a salon, prestige brand cosmetics, and drugstore cosmetics. I docked one star because the place is just... dirty. I don't know about you, but I value sanitation when it comes to cosmetics. This store apparently does not. I docked one more star because customer service is nearly nonexistent. No product knowledge, not very friendly, just basically your standard, disinterested cashiers. But I keep coming back cause it's close to my job and momma needs her nail polish.

I love the products that Ulta carries, however my experience at the Citrus Park location today was not good. I was in the market for a new foundation, concealer, and brush. I spent a great deal of time testing many different shades and brands. No one offered to help until I had already chosen a foundation and concealer (20 minutes later), when I was offered help, the lady asked me if the foundation I had on was the one I had chosen to buy. I told her it was. She then proceeded to make a disgusted face and told me my face looked yellow. I told her that I didn't think so and that I really liked what I had chosen, she then went on to tell me it looked bad. Another employee came over and before knowing what had even happened complimented me on my makeup, the other lady  then appeared embarrassed by the statement the employee made (that my makeup looked good) and said "well I'm just going to walk away". The other employee apologized to me after I told her what happened and told me the rude lady was not a full time employee. I spent the rest of my day looking in the mirror wondering if my face looked bad because of the comments this women made. After spending over $100 on makeup, it is a shame someone in the store made me feel this way.

I have been going to Ulta for over 15 years. This is my hometown location where I have been getting my hair, facials, and eyebrows done since I was about 16 years old. I am now 32. My mother and I are loyal patrons, loyalty card holders, and repeat salon clients. I skip Aveda, and Sephora, as I have always preferred Ulta for their prices and quality of services. At this location, Donna did my hair for over 10 years, and since her departure from the store, I have entrusted my problematic locks to the talented Gina for about 2 years. I used to even wait until I would be in town from Miami to get my haircuts! 

Yesterday evening I was in the store shopping and saw that the brow bar was empty so I requested a wax service and was told they had immediate availability. I can honestly tell you that the associate's skill level was questionable (at best) from the beginning, although she was completely polite and professional. She put the wax on far too delicately for it to cover correctly. She also didn't use enough wax, and spent too long pressing it in. (by the time she actually pulled the strip off my face the wax was likely completely cool) I didn't say anything because I figured everyone has their approach and I am a brow bar loyalist (I trust that they are properly trained). She was well into applying concealer (incorrectly) when I myself reached for the hand mirror, since she had not offered to show me my brows at all, post-waxing. I was mortified. Not a single hair that I walked into the store with that evening was missing. It looked only like someone had made my brows red, not that I had had a wax. I showed her the many, many hairs that she missed and she reapplied wax and tried again. Again, too little wax, pressing too light and for too long, and the hairs remained. I pointed it out to her, and she said she would get her manager. That took an easy 15 minutes so I just sat there with the exact same eyebrow growth I had when I walked in. Frankly I didn't know what else to say to the associate. She clearly didn't know what she was doing, and I didn't want to risk any skin over this by allowing her to apply a THIRD attempt. It was awkward, as these encounters can be, but she really was sweet and I think she expected the manager to handle things appropriately. 

The manager, Lynn, came over and told me that the hairs were too short for the wax to "catch". I've never heard such a dismissive load of BS in my life. I have had my eyebrows waxed maybe 100 times in my life. At this Ulta location, several in south Florida, and plenty of private salons and spas. The hairs were not "too short." That is an outrageous thing to claim. A good wax job should get ALL hairs; long, medium, short, baby, and fuzz. I have gone in to that EXACT location with LESS brow growth and come out with clean, hairless brows. She kept repeating that I could just have the associate "pluck them." EXCUSE ME? Um...I can pluck my own eyebrows at home, and believe me, do a better job with tweezers than this associate. I came for a WAX. I was being charged for a WAX. The associate mentioned to me twice that she was new, and apologized, and frankly I don't hold her ultimately responsible. She does need better training, but the decision to charge me all but 20% of my service was left to the unprofessional manager who just lost a lifetime Ulta customer over a pitiful $15. 

I spent over $130 on products yesterday, and a fortune over the years. I even brought my bridal party to this location on my wedding day for our hair services. BOTH cashiers at checkout 100% agreed with me that my brows absolutely were not waxed correctly and they both extended their condolences. They had no choice but to charge me what the manager instructed. I was ultimately charged $15 for my $21 service and not only are my brows WORSE  than they were before walking into Ulta, (since now I'll have to wait a few days to get them waxed correctly) but I am completely turned off from this brand. Every gal knows you can walk into any corner nail salon and get a decent brow wax for about $8. I chose to pay the Ulta premium because it has always been my experience that their brow bar associates are suedo-experts in the trade and the Ulta brand takes care of its clients. I have requested to be reimbursed by corporate, but this taste in my mouth will be difficult to overcome. The economic temperature in America right now is not such that business owners and managers should take the liberty to make clients feel so devalued. I live in Channelside and drove across town to get to my favorite little beauty store in Citrus Park. When someone is making that kind of effort, and spending this kind of money, you only have to disappoint them once. Hope that fifteen bucks was worth it, Lynn.

Such a convenient location, and carries a really great array of brand cosmetics and haircare. Staff is always available to ask questions or help find the perfect product.

I especially like their Urban Decay and It Cosmetics displays.

"there might be a lot wrong right now but the important thing is that my hair looks fabulous!!"dyeing your hair doesn't mean your hair is fake but it means you are a artist and your hair is your canvas"I think the most important hing a woman can have - next to talent, of course - is her hairdresser." 
Thank you Kim 
I love my hair style

If your wanting extensions Evalise and Kanisha are the best. Christine is the skin therapist and the microdermabraisian has changed my skin to be more youthful. Come visit I have had almost everyone in salon do my color and cut and had a great experience every time.

Why two stars?  Well, they started at 4 stars for having a nice selection of drug store brands rather than only high-end cosmetics like Sephora.  I will never be able to bring myself to spend $30 on an eyeshadow - like EVER.  And then Ulta loses 2 stars for always having an amazingly crappy selection of higher end nail polishes.  Half the time they don't even have displays for the latest Essie, OPI or China Glaze collections and when they do, they are always  1/2 empty, picked over and just sad.  While they send out great coupons, my savings are usually lessened by having to go to 2 or 3 locations just to find $10 or $15 of product I actually want so I can use the darned coupon.  If I could rate them 1.5 stars I would, because I find it absurd that you have to carefully check each and every nail polish before you buy it as there are frequently  1/2 empty bottles in the racks.  Because yeah - it fills my frugal heart with glee to spend $8 on a used,  1/2 empty bottle of polish.  Oh Ulta -such promise and yet you mostly piss me off.

"there might be a lot wrong right now but the important thing is that my hair looks fabulous!!"dyeing your hair doesn't mean your hair is fake but it means you are a artist and your hair is your canvas"I think the most important hing a woman can have - next to talent, of course - is her hairdresser." 
Thank you Kim 
I love my hair style !! 
see you soon!!!

Yesterday I went to ulta and got a bunch of stuff. Lots of eyeshadow palettes, nyx matte lip, and some skincare stuff. Half the nyx colors had no testers and most were out of stock. Everything was pretty messy and out of place. I was pretty disappointed but managed to find most of what I was looking for. However, if more testers had been available I probably wouldn't have had to return some of those products today. I did some price matches with the Amazon app and found some that were cheaper here and some cheaper on Amazon.
