I love Ulta but I hate shopping at this location. Every time I walk in here the staff is looking at me like I'm going to steal something. I get asked if I need help every two minutes just so they can see what's in my hands . When you do ask for help they are literally worthless.

Alicia was rude she doesn't have any customers service this is the third time I've been in here and everytime she was unprofessional and very rude . Don't talk about someone when you know they can here you . Won't be back to this location
Alex helped me today! She was so personable and helpful. Great attitude and made my shopping experience worth while.

Raquel is the best!!! She's cut my daughters hair who's on the Autism spectrum. It was her first haircut and I was really nervous. She made it an awesome experience. She's also done several styles for my oldest daughters high school dances. If you're looking for a great hairdresser- book with Raquel at Ulta!

I have been going to the Ulta Salon for about a year now after moving from Southern California. I SWEAR by Maryn. Not only is she a very skilled stylist, she's both professional and personable. When I came to her I was in need of some color help-she was the second person I saw in the area. Maryn was able to take my hair back to a more natural brunette without issue even though she's amazing with blonds! She's great at directing me towards products that will actually work for my hair type and not just something super pricy. I have extremely thick curly hair and she's one of only a handful of people that manages to straighten it without a flat iron and a ton of products. She's also amazing with my eyebrows! When you find a person that you love, you MUST share their information...so go visit the Ulta in Warrington and ask for Maryn specifically. She's probably the one smiling ear to ear, laughing, and having a great time with her clients making them look fabulous!!

Nice big store, but I was never greeted by the many girls that were standing around talking. I got to the register to make my purchase and 4 girls were standing talking to the left of the registers. 2 of which starred at me. I waited a few minutes to let them finish since I wasn't in a hurry. They continued talking and leaning on the fixtures. So I placed my item down on the counter and walked out. Bad first impression!
Maryn has been doing my hair for over a year now ! She always does an amazing job. Color cutting blow outs etc. She has grown to be a true friend and I will never see anyone else !

I get my hair done by Kelley every couple of weeks and couldn't be happier. There is always follow up which helps because I always forget when my next appointment is. There's always a good conversation going on in the salon and you feel comfortable to join in on it. I recommend Kelley to everyone. She's passionate at what she does. The best is that she's honest with you. If what you're thinking of getting is going to ruin your hair she will be up front with you about that. Being someone that doesn't know much about hair chemicals or products having an honest opinion matters.

I shop at Ulta in Warrington a lot.. Whether it's for make-up..fragrances.. ECT.. I have always received top notch service there.. Lines move fast and the staff is incredible..they go about and beyond.. In the past 3 weeks..I've actually felt like a princess in the store..all the various ladies offerings suggestions with beauty products.. I actually met a girl a few weeks ago and I'm drawing a blank on her name.. Beautiful young brunette..sge actually checked me out tonight..she has not only given me compliments..but, was assisting with fragrances and we both joked about KKW body perfume and how it smells incredible..we discussed it tonight again when she complimented my hair..so super sweet.. 2 weeks ago I had Kylan do my eyebrows and assist on the best products..she has a tremendous gift.. She's beautiful inside and out..The charming male manager..his name is escaping me..but..he has been helpful while I've shopped..he complimented my hair tonight..what I loved seeing was a manager that was extremely friendly not only to customers..but, also to his amazing staff.. Praising them..and he wasn't 1 of those managers that just sits and delegates..he was organized and fixing things.. Cleaning up..truly a great leader.. Which brings me to the gorgeous super talented, hard working Karina.. She works non stop and never takes time for themselves and even if she is working on 3 people's hair at once..she doesn't rush (yes she is fast and gifted) but, she gives each customer 100 percent..she goes above and beyond.. 2 weeks ago she did beautiful blonde hair lights for me..that were complimented repeatedly..but, today I went in brave and asked for some blue, purple and pink highlights.. They turned out beautiful and professionally..she added a little curt..and my 19 year old daughter said.. I had fairy/mermaid/unicorn hair.. I have a lot of medical issues and for the first time in awhile..becayse of how I looked and how it was treated I had an ear to ear smile and I felt extremely beautiful.. 1 of the first times in awhile..so the staff left a beautiful imprint on my heart and Karina made me a princess..if you're looking for great hair..briws..fragrances.  Make up a team that works like a family go to Ulta in Warrington...they have a way if sprinkling magic..and definitely go to Karina for hair and Kylan for brows..they have a beautiful talent and beautiful hearts.  P.S. people are quick to leave negative reviews more people should acknowledge the kindness and beauty in people
Absolutely abysmal customer service.  It's almost like the employees do not want anyone to purchase their products.  I recommend spending your money elsewhere.

overall, ulta is a great store. but, i have been sitting here for 30 minutes with shampoo in my hair. the lady still hasn't washed it out. i get that there is a lot of running around to do, but this is getting crazy and too long. i expect better.

This Ulta is very hit or miss. Every time I'm here there is different staff who never seem super knowledgeable. Every other time I check out there is a girl who doesn't know something and has to ask. Which is fine except it seems so frequent like there must be a huge turnover rate. There are a handful of really nice girls that work here and then a handful that are just plain - we'll not nice. I find that every time I'm here a lot of the products I want are sold out. This is a much more frequented Ulta I believe. Many times I am in here too it's trashed. I can't blame the workers on this but people come in here and leave food and drinks everywhere and no one ever seems to go around and clean it up. 
Apart from the store I went to the salon once and had the BEST experience! I was donating my hair so I got the cut for free (the cashier apparently wasn't aware of this policy and tried to charge me - a prime example of the miscommunication in training). I hate getting my hair cut it is my least favorite thing to do, but the guy who cut my hair was a genius, he talked me through the whole thing and made me feel super comfortable. He was very personable and took the extra time to help me style my hair since I had graduation pictures the next day. I would give the salon 5 stars!

Went to Karina again for a hair cut. She did an awesome job and helped me pick a great dry shampoo for my insanely oily hair. Also, had my brows done by Paige. My brows are shaped now and look amazing. I'm very happy with my services. Thank you!

Normally I love this location, but not only did no one help me, each product I picked up was covered in layers of dust.  Covered.  From the expensive shampoo and conditioner I wanted to buy, to the skincare products.  The dust was just gross.  The whole store was dirty.  No thanks.

I get my hair done at the Ulta salon by Maryn. She worked at the Plymouth meeting store where I would get my hair done from her there until she transferred. She's amazing and doing my hair (which is quite difficult because it is thick) and I always leave happy and satisfied. I recommend her with all of my friends! She's a 10/10 stylist! She has turned my hair from black to blonde! Blonde to smurf blue! Smurf blue to silver! Now silver to peacock inspired colors! My hair is still healthy with almost no damage!

Love love loveee this store! Staff is always friendly and willing to help. Also, the store is always clean! I've been coming here for facials by their main Esthetician, Kassie! She's is wonderful at what she does. Kassie gives an amazing facial and is always willing to answer any skin care or makeup questions. I highly recommend Kassie for a facial or getting your make up, she's awesome!!

Worst experience at beauty salon. My hair dresser did the  pathetic job ever. Not at all a friendly person. She did my make up too and let me tell you she just spent 20 mins and done. Customer prefer friendly service over many other things. Not coming back.

Incredibly RUDE manager. Waited at the register for over 15 minutes for her to come fix a mistake the store made. Do yourself a favor and go to Target down the road instead.. lower prices and customer service that actually exists!

Needed a cut as it had been a while and I decided to try Ulta. Making the appointment online was super easy and I made an appointment with Karina. She was very nice and did a great job on my hair. I'll definitely go back when I need another trim.

I had the best of time at Ultra.  m.y stylist was Noel I believe, she did my hair to exactly the way I wanted. The color is perfect...finally someone got it right.. I live 6 hours away and you better believe I'll travel to see her. I'm from Pitts...and I went to Ultra in North Wales, Pa

I am an often ulta shopper and have always had pleasant experiences up until today. My friends and I came in and ended up spending over 100 dollars in an establishment that we felt disrespected in. I'm honestly thinking about returning everything because of how displeased I was with the service. My friends and I were followed around the store by not only one, but multiple employees. Almost every aisle we walked down there was someone following us, which made us feel both uneasy and uncomfortable. Mind you, we are all people of color so we feel that we were racially profiled. We brought this concern up with management, whom seemed annoyed and unconcerned with the problem. I will never shop here again.

I was here with three of my friends and honestly it was the worst shopping experience I've had. We were all shopping and spent over $100 in this store however the employees made it so uncomfortable for us to keep shopping so we just grabbed what we had, bought them and left. We were basically being followed by everyone that was working. Hounding over us everywhere we walked. At one point I was in one section where two employees randomly are at each end watching over me pretending to do something. As I walked out the aisle I heard one employee whisper on her walkie talkie something about watching over the cashier as my friend was there buying something. There was four of us and we didn't need 5 employees following us everywhere. If we said we didn't need help the first time then don't force it. Don't go here if you're of color/black because this was some heavy racial profiling I've experienced!

I have been going to this ULTA for some time now, and have always had a good experience finding what I needed. A few weeks ago, I went in looking for a good green concealer to cover up my mild rosacea and sought assistance. Christina was SUPER helpful! She recommended a line of mineral makeup that she herself uses, which included a green primer and would actually treat my redness while providing great coverage. She even gave me makeup application tips and answered all my questions, explaining why certain makeup brands and ingredients would wreak havoc on my skin type, and what to stay from. I would have never even thought to try this line on my own, and have been very happy with the results. Thanks Christina and ULTA for making this girl's makeup and skin are regimen a lot easier!

We are so glad that we chose the Ulta Salon in North Wales for prom makeup! We can't thank Carly enough for doing an awesome job! We had called Ulta and found out who was working the day of prom and set up the appointment for that day well in advance. Carly's schedule was already booked with a large wedding party in the morning-so we already had a good vibe knowing that she was highly requested! We set up a trial makeup run after securing the actual date (always a good idea) and a 10 minute facial before the actual big day. She created the perfect look mirrored after a picture our daughter brought in and was absolutely calming when it came to the high demand for "cat eyes on fleek" and "shimmering" eye shadow. By the end of both sessions, Carly was more of a friend than just an employee doing her job. She is personable, knowledgeable, and good at what she does. We would definitely recommend Ulta and Carly as an amazing makeup artist!

I went to the Ulta Salon for the first time and I was very happy. Kathy gave me exactly the haircut that I wanted and also gave me a couple of coupons for coloring in the future. I was also able to get an appointment in less than an hour. Their online appointment system is amazing and I would go back there.

While they have a good selection of products, the staff is anything but helpful. I thought it could possibly be just that day, but after going to this Ulta every month for the past 9 months to get face wash and moisturizer, it's just the nature of the staff in this store. 

Today I went in thinking I would try out a new foundation. When I got there, there was no one greeting. As I walked further into the store, one associate was doing her own make up, the manager was having a conversation about not being able to get approved to purchase a house (yes, I know this because she was talking so loud, she might as well had the conversation with the whole store. Not to mention she looked right at me rummaging through the foundation colors and said nothing), another associate was updating the brow bar book, and another was standing at the cash wrap. This has been the norm for many months and today was the last straw. Having been a long time Ulta customer, I'm sad to say, I'll be paying off my card, and switching to Sephora!

I have been to this location multiple times and every time I have had an unpleasant experience. My sister in law shops here frequently and constantly comes home with free samples and promos/free gifts. However, every time I shop here, I never receive any of that. Today I went in to buy conditioner and next to the product I was buying it said, "free gift with purchase!" I go up to the register and the cashier just tells me my total. No gift. This happens every time, so I finally ask, "don't I receive a free gift with this?" She says, "yeah, I couldn't find it." The young woman DID NOT EVEN TRY until I pointed out that I am supposed to receive a free gift! Mind you, I am clearly Spanish and my sister in law is white as day. As these two last reviews state that they feel racially profiled, I do as well. I will never be returning to this location. Sephora will have my business 110% from here on out.

I don't typically take the time to write reviews, but thought it might be helpful. Finding a hair stylist is not an easy task, especially when not finding too many reviews for specific stylists. I wanted to give a thumbs up to Nicole S. at Ulta Beauty Salon in North Wales! I have used Ulta salons in the past, with good experiences, but was crossing my fingers when I decided to seek for a new stylist in a different location. Nicole S. is talented, personable, and super friendly. She took the time to listen to what I was looking for and gave her professional advice.  I love my cut/style! I look forward to returning to her for future hair needs. Thanks Nicole! :)

I went into this store specifically to purchase bareminerals concealer and a few brushes. I was appalled at the state of the display when I walked in. Everything was dirty, half of the sample products  were not in their correct locations so I had to sort through all of them to find my correct shade. The brushes were randomly and haphazardly thrown across the display with no rhyme or reason. The store wasn't even busy so there is no reason the display should have been such a mess.

I am writing this review because my beautiful granddaughter Haley is 17 years young and LOVES this store!!! Today is Sunday and she is visiting me and the first thing on her list is going to ULTA. What she likes is they carry products that she can not find in other stores. So ULTA here we come!

Had to get last min make up application for a wedding.  I just moved to the area and all the salons were insanely expensive for a basic make up job.  I shopped around and took a chance with ulta salon.   I figured for $30 it was worth the risk. And I am certainly glad I took it!

I booked online the day before less that 24 hours in advance.  I didn't know of anyone who had used the salon before, so I took a gamble and booked "any available" stylist.  When I arrived, I was greeted by Kristen, a beautiful young woman whose own makeup look fantastic. I was super excited.  

Kristen did a wonderful job on my makeup, and really took into consideration my skin color and type.  That was the great thing about going to ulta, there was access to every brand in the store.  I wasn't stuck with one makeup type, and she was really able to personalize it based on my skin.

I would HIGHLY recommend this service to anyone looking for a reasonable makeup job.  I will Def see Kristen again!

Update: I decided to go back today for the first time in over a year because I needed something quick. I walked in and was rudely told by an employee that they weren't open yet and I needed to leave.. Why was the door open? Why was it not locked if you aren't open yet? There's no reason to be rude to someone like that. 

I went into this store specifically to purchase bareminerals concealer and a few brushes. I was appalled at the state of the display when I walked in. Everything was dirty, half of the sample products  were not in their correct locations so I had to sort through all of them to find my correct shade. The brushes were randomly and haphazardly thrown across the display with no rhyme or reason. The store wasn't even busy so there is no reason the display should have been such a mess.

Compared to other Ultas this is my least favorite. It's so DARK! No matter when I go it's dark and I don't like the layout of the store. It also is extremely cluttered and stuffed and it's hard to shop around. When you walk in you can pretty much see the whole store from the entrance because they have tall ceilings with their signage up high but a lot of the displays are lower. It just adds to the feeling of how tiny it is. Their employees did not really seem as accessible either, maybe it's because it was busy but I just felt like no one was in the store except at the front check out lanes. The only plus is, and maybe it's because of its location, they usually seem to be pretty adequately stocked whereas a lot of my local Ultas do not. However, I don't particularly enjoy shopping here.

Ulta sells some real good stuff like I love the products and all but holy heck it is very expensive!  I am not sure if they control the price but I shop there way less than I would if the prices were reasonable.

I went to the new montgomeryville Ulta and had a terrible experience. my friends and i needed to go in and a foundation matched for prom which was the next day. i was first and everything was going well, the worker told us she would remove the seals so we could try the testers, after telling us that the testers weren't available to use. Then my friend informed her numerous times that she had gotten a spray tan the previous day, and wanted to match it to her color the best she could. So she still let us put on the makeup, and once we asked her for remover she told us she could not do that. my friend had to aggressively remove her makeup with a dry tissue. this resulted in her improperly removing her spray tan as well. We asked the worker what to do and she stood there and rolled her eyes at us because my friend kept saying to her "i told you i just got a spray tan why would you let me put this on my face without telling me u have remover?" The worker then proceeded to walk away and go to her fellow coworkers and point at us, laugh, and talk. My friend was standing there panicking because of how this woman treated her. i didn't catch her name, but your workers need better training on how to deal with this. She was willing to open the makeup testers for us, but not give us remover, and my friend left crying with a messed up spray tan.

Love the selection of products and especially the assistance from the knowledgeable employees. They are always available but not hovering. I have received excellent makeup suggestions and demos when I have had time. When in a hurry, those great employees can really help you find what you need

I always stop in here for beauty products as its the closest Ulta to my house. I have gotten my brows done here a few times as well as help with foundation matching from the associates that work here. They have both high end make up brands and drug store brands. Their rewards program is much better than Sephora's IMO as they email coupons with specials and you can earn points to redeem for money off your purchase.

I sincerely appreciate this Ulta location. Not once have I received subpar service and I've literally needed help with each employee who specializes in their own area: makeup, nails, hair, eyebrows, and general questions. (I know, I need a lot of help being girly. #dontjudgeme ) most notably, I would like to point of the exemplary service from Cherry, Ebony, and Nory. Every time I come in, it is like Cheers. They know my name, they treat me like their best friend, and they spend the extra bit of time to ensure great customer service. It's awesome!

I reinstalled Yelp (which I hate) just to leave this review. The staff at this location makes me uncomfortable and the register people never apply my points. I rarely come to Ulta anymore, so I want to actually use the points. Somehow they always forget. It drives me nuts.

I had a last minute hair emergency prior to vacation and decided to give Ulta a chance to fix me up. I'm so pleased with my decision!! I made a same day appointment online for a color touch up and showed up to be greeted by Cody. He did a fantastic job correcting my color and making sure I was pleased... He toned my hair 3 times to get it the right shade of blonde. I was impressed by his persistence in getting me what I wanted, and he even styled it beautifully for me. It was so refreshing to actually leave feeling confident about what I just paid for instead of saying to myself "I'll give it a few days and decide..." If you need a new colorist, especially if you're a blonde, go see Cody at Ulta right away!!

I ventured into Ulta needing an eyeshadow palette and serious attention to my neglected eyebrows. Typically I use a razor and prayer, but Friday was my brother's wedding, so I needed a professional. Ebony, the brow specialist who helped me, works MAGIC! She did a phenomenal job & didn't break the bank. I suggest anyone seeking the perfect arch, to visit Ebony at Brentwood, MO's Ulta.

Kelsey at Ulta Beauty is AWESOME! She is the skin therapist there and she works wonders! I have been seeing her for about 3 months now and my skin has definitely changed for the better! She also has great suggestions on products. I recommend anyone struggling with their skin to go see Kelsey at ulta!!!

Brow bar lady sucks. I walked in she said to wait 15 minutes for her break and then she could take me, 20 minutes later she comes back and has someone else waiting also and they started complaining because they had an appointment at 3 and she wasn't there (it's 3:15 now) and then tells me she has to take them first. So not only did she lie to me about when she could get me in but she also missed someone else's appointment. I liked the other girl so much better anyways.

I made a first time appointment for "Signature Hair Design" at The Salon. Online booking is easy and I was scheduled with Kevin. I checked in at my time, Kevin was notified over the intercom I was here and no one showed. After 20 minutes, I walked out and called from the car. I let them know for a $57 hair cut, I did expect to be somewhat on time, or at least acknowledged and told that he was running late. This may be a good store, but my time is worth as much as the stylists. Lost opportunity- I'm a huge tipper!

Had heard about a eye concealer that Ulta Cosmetics and Beauty Supply sells.  Went to the Brentwood store and asked for the assistance of a make up artist.  Shelby came to us and was very helpful and guided us.  She was wonderful.

I had my hair done by Gina V. yesterday and have never been this happy! She managed to get my hair lighter and give it a more ashy/cool tone. Exactly what I wanted. I'm so happy after having had a bad experience elsewhere.

I have to say I like this Brentwood location because it is more diverse but I hate the parking situation over here. This location by far has a more extensive Proactive product line, carrying kits and individual items. They have a great selection of products from cosmetics, fragrances, styling tools and hair products. The employees are friendly and seek to assist when needed. I love the prices and consistant coupons. Also another tip, the coupons are ineligible for use on the right hand side of the store (the high end products). 
Also a huge plus for me is that you are able to try products and if they do not work, you can return them. My hair texture is constantly changing, so when I find my go to newest product my hair likes, once it changes and lets me know it no longer likes the product any more it's not a hassle to switch and try another product. I love their large selection of Shea Moisture products and mascara brands. Ulta is my go to over Sephora.

Terrible service and I've never had a white woman do my hair before and I asked on the phone in a polite way "do you know how to do bi-racial  she said yes and that it was a fare question. I got there and just so happened I was sitting there for 15 extra minutes I even got there early to make sure it my appt was at the specific time. Just very unprofessional I know things can get crazy while doing hair but it felt like more to me. I would give them 0 stars if I could.

Hey Ulta Beauty...I am learning to take my business and $$ where I'm appreciated..Today 2 smartly dressed customer-service reps were chatting up a customer in your Brentwood Store....I needed assistance finding a product and was pointed to where it may have been located...on the other side of the store...I guess the associate who thought she was assisting me...didnt want to missed the end of of the story...Thanks for ABSOLUTELY NOTHING!!!! Bye...

This is for the Salon in the back. I started going to this location because Tara is amazing. I got my hair cut by Gina and she was amazing. I haven't seen her since lock down. I've tried out Kim who did a pretty good job and today I had Erika and I hate my hair. I was there for two hours she was 30 mins late taking me back. I wanted a sharp angled bob hitting at my jaw line. My hair is 3.5 to 4 inches shorter than the picture I showed her. Hitting at my eyebrow instead!

I made an appointment on a Friday afternoon for a Saturday morning Signature Hair Cut. I was nervous about seeing a new stylist for the first time, but all of my nerves were calmed the second I walked into this Ulta. Everyone was so nice and my stylist, Marisa, was incredible! She spent time initially looking through the pictures I provided of different styles that I liked and helped me talk through which ones would work for my normal hair routine and face shape. She took her time washing my hair and even worked in a great scalp massage. After the cut, she  taught me how to dry and style my hair for the look that I was wanting to achieve. Afterward, she provided me with an estimate for some color that I was thinking of getting, and also walked me through the store to recommend the best products for my new style. When helping me pick products, Marisa wasn't just trying to sell me the most expensive item (and often recommended cheaper products), but really helped me figure out what would work for my individual hair. This was great service and I will definitely be back!

I was in the area Thursday, May 12, needing a particular item.

Was greeted and offered assistance. I told her what I needed, showed her the container of the product I needed to replace.

She took me directly to the display, found what I needed.

And I was on my way. No back-up in check-out. In and out in less than 5 minutes. I used my Ulta card. Not sure it got me anything.

This review is for the Ulta Salon in the back of the store.
I didn't have a spectacular experience here. For the price, I thought I was getting to a good salon and a reasonable stylist. I got a quote online when I made the appointment and the quote at the beginning of the appointment was $50 higher. A lightening agent was added so I thought that made sense. What didn't make sense is the end result looked nothing like the color I picked despite the stylist putting bleach for my highlights first. I can't even see the highlights. The hairstylist wasn't apologetic. She said the salon lights were the culprit but I can't see the highlights in direct sunlight either. The haircut was good but I won't be back. I have been to local/small business non-chain hairstylists who charge about the same and do a much better job with my hair. My advice to people with dark hair is to not come here for highlights.

Had been going to this salon for a few years. Noticed it started to look dirty and unprofessional. My last visit a few weeks ago was the last straw. The salon area was a mess, the floor was dirty and the surrounding counter areas were so dirty I didn't want to put my purse on the counter. Very surprising that the stylists appear lazy with their appearance as well. Would be nice if some of the ladies would pretend to do basic hygiene before coming to work. This location has been in decline for the last year. Not sure if it's the store management, salon management or lack of training? Way too over priced for lack of professionalism!

Ouch Jenny. I've been coming here for years. I purchased an in-store pick up for an orange shade of lipstick, the bag I picked up contained the wrong color, a shade of red that was too blue for my skin tone. I tried to return it, but since it was the wrong shade it didn't match the receipt - and she insisted that I didn't buy the lipstick there. Then she began to make suggestions that I did it intentionally. 

I JUST picked it up! Your person put the wrong color in the bag. I just wanted a swap of the color I ordered. I couldn't swap OR return. 

I had to buy a second lipstick and give the blue one to my cool toned friend.

I am really bad with names, but Sadie (according to my receipt), Hannah, and another girl that matched my foundation were friendly and very helpful!
Sadie (hopefully I got the name correct) showed me a variety of makeup options to chose from based on my budget and what I was looking for. I had never been to Ulta before, and she explained everything great. She spent a lot of time explaining the products to me and I didn't feel rushed. She had a very welcoming personality.
The girl who matched my foundation was fantastic as well! (Sorry I forgot her name) She was patient with me since I had no idea what I was looking for. 
Hannah, the "arch expert", did a great job with my eyebrows. She gave good advice on what products I should use to fill them in. She double checked with me on how much to wax and what kind of shape I was going for. She was very welcoming as well.

I will return again when I need any new makeup. I will be booking an appointment to get my eyebrows done with Hannah in the future. Thanks guys!

I usually shop Sephora because I have VIB status but I occasionally end up at an Ulta. They carry quite a few things that Sephora does not. On this day I was in search of the K-Beauty (Korean) products in the store. I ended up with a hair mask that I've bough many times and love and two skin masks. I love that Ulta carries these products and wish they had an even larger selection.

The customer service I received tonight was incredible!  The manager offered to get me a bottle of water when she heard me cough. Then at check out she made sure I got the gift I wanted when I registered for the credit card.

Two of the clerks, gave me such courteous  assistance, even though they were short staffed.  Shopping there was a  pleasure and I will be back because of these 3 women

I've been to this store multiple times and I've even acquired their card to accumulate points with when making a purchase due to a very friendly cashier while I was checking out during one of my visits.  It was actually a very strange day, considering I've always gotten consistently bad to almost mediocre service whenever I step inside this store. I've been to an Ulta in Schaumburg and that was a completely refreshing experience!

Anyway, Ulta is a pretty neat concept for a beauty store because they carry some high end beauty products as well as those you can easily find at the drugstore.  So whatever your fancy, chances are they might have it. They carry anything from make-ups to perfumes, hair products and random beauty accessories! It really can be a one-stop shop for a woman or man concerned with their personal grooming.

The thing I probably like to oogle at when I come here are the shelves of travel-sized products.  They are a great way to try something new and different without committing yourself to a product you might hate.   And if you do end up loving it, you can always come back and buy a bigger one!

Customer service is almost non-existent unfortunately. I've been here multiple times and no greetings when I come in during all of my visits. Yes, there were associates standing around by the door conversing amongst themselves.  I once came in and looked around for a new foundation to try back when I was in-between foundation brands and got no help from anyone so I ended up going to Sephora instead.

I usually just come here for the brow wiz or some lip or hair item. I am more of just an in and out customer now and if I need help with something or shopping for a not so specific item where I might need to consult someone, I know not to come here.

Overall, this store is clean and organized and do carry a variety of beauty necessities.
I went into this location the week before Christmas & was racially profiled as soon as I walked in. BLACK PEOPLE: don't spend your money here. They don't appreciate Us.

The worst Ulta I've ever been to. Workers are lazy. 
Worst customer service. 

Workers and especially manager lack knowledge on how rewards work and telling me to purchase $25 more for my diamond reward after they checked me out for a $120 purchase.

First Ulta I've seen where none of the workers had any makeup on or had no knowledge of makeup...

They were doing some Benefit event with balloons and juice and brownies. We walk in and ask about some banana powder. The two girls at the benefit counter ignore us. Look at us and say nothing. They didn't greet us or respond to our question. They turn around and continue to take pictures and party away. Finally we get some help and they lead us BACK to the benefit counter. You gotta be kidding me. If you want no one to offer help, give you dirty side eye then this place is for you! If you want good customer service and friendly employees try Sephora

Last night i had the worst customer service at this ulta, i wanted to check out this lipstick ive been having my eye on for a long time now, i ask this girl that works there if i can take a look at it she says "uh.. i guess" 
I was like "well theres not a tester" 
So she said i could open it and just put it out as the tester after that she decided to try to be "low key" and follow us around the whole store as if my friend and i were stealing note that this happens often when i come in. Stereotyping people is bullshit and so are all the snobby girls that work at this location
Really bad experience yesterday.  The worst customer service . They don't care if you buy or not.  They are extremely rude

The Benefit Brows in California (Macy's) is 200% better than the services offered at ULTA in Reno. I recently moved back to Reno and went to the ULTA location in Field Crossing (Off McCarran) and the brow waxing was the WORST!!!!!. DO NOT GO TO THE GIRL - NEVADA.....she only knows limited waxing and doesn't complete the brow treatment with trimming or tweezers. Wow....I can do DIY in home waxing better.

Note****I tipped her and paid for the treatment to stop her from talking about herself and boyfriend.

I will return my other purchases tomorrow and order online from Bloomingdales.

I hope to find a professional person soon. 

Good Luck New Residents to Reno.

An A-OK store as far as Ulta goes. Employees were super helpful on a Tuesday evening when I came in to get some last minute Christmas shopping in. I haven't yet had any problems with the store, parking or employees.

I was very impressed with the product knowledge and customer service I received from Jazzy( An Ulta Sales Associate). I've been wearing a particular brand of eyeliner for years and would never think to try something different until she suggested a different product that I reluctantly purchased.  I tried it out the next morning and was blown away at how awesome it was. It made day!!!

omg where to begin?! So i was trying to get color matched for a good foundation. everyone was telling me to use the too faced born this way foundation, so i decided to try it. Abigail helped me out today, and we started discussing the product and how it would turn out with my skin type. She reccomened to try the urban decay all mightier foundation, so we did, and i loved it so much! and she matched my color perfectly. i didn't feel rushed at all, she seemed like she was genuinely trying to help me get the absolute best product/s for what o was looking for. Anyways so i was telling her i had to decide between a foundation or laura mercier setting powder, and she reccomened (since i was on a budget) an amazing 8 dollar one that i love. she even talked with other workers to make sure it would be a powder i would end up loving. she spent so much time out of her day just to help me, which i extremely appreciate especially when it comes to makeup becuase i want to make sure i spend my money well. THANK YOU SO MUCH ABIGAIL much appreciated visit today.

Had a fabulous haircut done today by Anna. My hair is difficult - coarse and A LOT of hair - she looked at the style I wanted and was able to offer good suggestions to make it work. So happy with it! Hard to find a good stylist these days. She was knowledgeable and I left pleased. Will definitely go back.

The women who work there are moody! They stand around and talk amongst themselves unless you accidentally touch makeup they just sanitized. Then when you go to ring up, if you forgot to mention you want to redeem your points you get the big moody sigh, ahhh well I've got to void everything and ring up all over again are you sure?! Well heck, I don't know your procedures. Go to Sephora where they're nice, not moody like these women.

I usually go to this ulta because it is close to work and is the only location with Colourpop. Sometimes the people working there are okay and I get what I need. I'm usually a solo shopper and don't need any help, so it gets annoying when they ask 800 times. Anyway, this time and the last three times I have been there, its been impossible to get help when I needed it. There have been gaggles of girls sitting at the front counter laughing and ignoring anything else in the store or looking out the window because their friends are messing around outside. During these purchases, I was rang up through all of this and then my bag was handed to me without so much as a goodbye. Super rude. Last time I was there without needing help, I was asked if I needed help, I said no thanks, and the girl sat there staring at me like I had kicked her dog. She then turned around and walked off without another word. Today was the last straw. I went in looking for concealer. I asked the nearest staff for recommendations. I asked between two brands, she said the other. She was behind me then, so I asked her how I could figure out the best shade between two. She goes, "um...you swatch it." And walked off. My hands are full, I'm looking for a little direction, and it was not worth any time to her. I ended up having to ask the cashier which looked best after bringing them both up because she couldn't be bothered. Sorry this is so long, but this place has seriously gone downhill since moving locations. The Spanish Springs location has a better variety (besides colourpop, because people shop less there due to distance) and the staff is always helpful and always where customers would need them to be. I am no longer shopping at the Firecreek location at all. I can order everything else I need online.

The worst haircut ever you could ever get! Tried it for the first time yesterday and the result was horrible, my hairstylist at that time was Anna. Though she said I could come back tomorrow if I'm not satisfied with the haircut I just couldn't bring myself back to let my hair get fixed again since she already ruined it and I simply just lost my confidence in her skills. I had to book another hair appointment today at different hair salon and hope to get my hair done right this time.
Ebony did an amazing job on my eyebrows. I absolutely love them. Will definitely be back to see her again.

Used Teddi Hatch for coloring my medium Brown hair and she out is Carmel highlights and did a great job. Very nice and professional and will use her again. They are sorta expensive but in Reno you're lucky to get anyone who knows what they are doing and can consistently do your hair . Ulta  actually has several experienced people and you can get in without a two week wait.
Linda at the salon is amazing. Highly recommend if you need a haircut and/or color. She did a great job.

Ebony tinted and waxed my eyebrows yesterday and they look amazing. I've always gotten my eyebrows threaded, but the threading place is not so great at tinting so I was looking for a place that could do both and Ebony at Ulta is the answer. She did such a great job. I have naturally blonde eyebrows and my hair is a dark auburn, she was able to match the color and the shape is spot on. Thank you sooo much Ebony. I will be back. :)

I am one of those people who never returns anything for the simple fact that I hate feeling like an inconvenience. This time I was making a return, not for myself but for my sister (which was the only reason I went in the first place). I had bought the wrong perfume and it was literally just sitting there collecting dust. 

Julia and who I presume was her manager were super nice. They helped me with the return. Ulta  always has great customer service and the girls are always wonderful. They did not make me feel like an inconvenience, even though I had to come back in because we accidently returned the wrong item the first time. I will forever be a returning customer for these reasons.

I was at this Ulta last week because I was staying at Atlantis nearby.  I had a 20%off coupon in addition to a sample gift offer emailed to me(I think because I'm a platinum member and I spend quite a bit at Ulta).  I bought 2 boxes of Biore that had $1 coupons attached to the box.  I informed the cashier of the coupons & she couldn't get the coupon to register.  Then she asked me where I got the coupons from as if they were counterfeit.  I then informed her they were just torn from the box a minute ago, in front of her.  Then she scanned my 20% off coupon & said all 3 coupons worked.  I then produced my sample coupon & she just said they were out.  Didn't even bother to check or offer a substitute.  I asked for a substitute sample & her reply was NO.   To make matters worse, I found that the coupons were not applied on the receipt, when I was unpacking at home. Cashiers need better training in customer service

This is for the salon service I received on Feb 2. I am pretty disappointed with how my experience went down.

I arrived 6 minutes later from my scheduled appointment so my apologies for that. All the stylists were busy with someone including the person that I had booked my appointment with. Of course that was no biggie. That's how it can get in a salon and I was late for my appointment so simply I just had to wait. There's a chair available to sit right next to the counter so that's where I settled. Several ladies asked me if I needed help or if I've been helped and I told them that I have an appointment with .... at 2 so I'm just waiting for her to finish. I waited an hour until she finished with her client and that didn't even bother me at all.. the one thing that put the icing on the cake for this whole thing was that by the time my stylist was finished and I am still sitting on the same chair I hear her coming and as she's printing out the receipt with her client as she's with another stylist at the computer, the other lady tells my stylist "this person never showed up" and my stylist says "ohh really? Well that's fine just cancel her. She was a kind of a weird one anyway. Let's get so and so set up for her next appointment." Right then and there I wanted to get up and leave. I couldn't believe what I just heard... I guess they did not even know I was sitting right there. After several seconds the other stylist asks me "are you antoinette?" And I turned to her and said yes. Both of the ladies gasp and my stylist looks at me and says "no way! Everyone was telling me that they you never showed up. It's ok I can take you right now." I told them both "I don't know why they would tell you that because several lady's came up to me and asked me what I was here for and I've been sitting here since 2 and even advised I was a bit late" I wanted to tell her off and say that I don't know why you would still take me in anyway to do service if you just called me weird. My birthday is the next day and I really wanted to get my hair done because it's been way overdue and I was in a good mood so I just went in to get it done. Mind you I've seen this stylist before who cut my sons hair on Christmas Eve which I was so grateful for because all salons were closing early and she happened to be one that would wait out for me and that was still in to help anyone when I was calling around. we had a really good conversation and I felt like I clicked with her to be comfortable so I definitely wanted to come back and even recommend her. I still get my service done and she did an ok job. We still talked away a storm of conversation but I didn't forget what happened. I was just trying not to let it get to me because I am nice person and I didn't feel like causing a scene and I am a better person to step down to that level.

Can't be wrong, I am a weird person, but being unaware or being unprofessional at your work, no matter what you think of someone I'd be careful with what you have to say and keep opinions outside of the work area. I would point out the name of this stylist, but I choose not to because the salon itself is just terrible with communication and it's service so this review is not just for her, but for everyone. I just don't get when you have several ladies ask you if you need any help and then later they tell the other ladies that someone didn't show up when the person is waiting and then gets called by the stylist you are seeing that you're a weird one and basically saying that you're not liked and they don't even know you're around. 

I will never be getting service from this salon again even to ask for advice

I went to my appointment and told her I needed my brown roots to be blonde like the rest of my hair. The only thing I needed was to not have it go all the way down to my scalp because I can't afford to come back every few weeks to get it touched up and I didn't want it to grow out with a blunt line between the blonde and my roots (and the last time I went all the way to the scalp the chick burned my head). Then a toner to get it all looking cohesive. 
So, all over blonde on my roots but instead of going all the way to the scalp, just use the brush to feather it in so when it grows out a little it won't look too bad. Sounds simple enough. Except Cici was extremely confused. She kept saying she could do highlights but that isn't what I wanted. Then she said she was going to get the manager so I waited for her to finish her other appointment. While we were waiting, she said that she didn't feel confident enough to be able to do my hair and maybe someone else should do it. So that wasn't comforting at all. 
Then the manager came over and told me that what I was asking for was difficult and kept suggesting highlights and partial highlights and a balayage. They wouldn't listen when I kept trying to say I didn't want those things. I just wanted all the roots to be blonde but apparently they can't do that. So I left without my hair down, extremely frustrated and sad.
I love ulta, but this specific store has terrible customer service. Someone needs to come and give them lessons on how to properly speak to customers. I'll stick to the Mae Anne store from now on.

This was my first time at this location as I am from out of town and I can honestly say the level of respect the employees gave my friends and I was unparalleled. 

We went in towards the end of the night looking for pasties. Right? What the heck lol. We asked someone at the register and they said they didn't have any but another employee who was greeting at the door directed my friend to exactly to that. 

While checking out I realized using a gua sha tool might help the congestion I was suffering from. This same nice employee directed me throughout the store for my different options without any attitude or sass. 

When it was time to go she unlocked the door and that's when we realized we had kept this team 15 minutes past closing. Not once did they rush us or make us feel bad about keeping them late. I was extremely impressed and felt like a valued customer. 

Thank you to the team that helped us the night of December 28th! You guys rock!

Great experience! Hannah was the girl who helped me. I always just got my make up at Walmart over the years and I finally decided to get some real help. I walked in and Hannah offered to help me. I was very blunt in the fact that I know nothing about make up, and did not want to be over whelmed. I told her what I wanted, she she found it exactly. She even took the time to show me how to apply it all and I left feeling great! Also the prices were a lot more reasonable that I expected. I recommend ulta, I swear it was the same price and way better quality than Walmart, and I've been getting my make up from Walmart for years! If your new to the make up world, go see the place! And I definitely recommend Hannah if you don't want to be over whelmed and find what you want.

I booked online using the app for a Go Out Blow Out with Linda. My appointment was at 11am and I was welcomed, introduced to Linda and sat right away. 
She went over what her vision was for me and I gladly trusted her expert opinion. After a nice shampoo I was ready to begin. 
Linda and staff are very friendly, talk to you when you want to talk and also let you close your eyes and meditate if you want to, which is what I did because the service was so relaxing. I wondered why I haven't been getting blow outs on the reg. 
I was going to a wedding at 330pm so Linda set my hair with enough product to last and explained what to do when 330 rolled around. 
The picture is me at 330 ready for the party. 
Thank you again for making me feel great!

I went to the salon to get my highlights touched up and asked for something subtle as I was having a baby two weeks after and didn't want my hair to look too bad as it grew out. The hairstylist I went to was Anna and it seemed like she was rushing through my appointment so she could go on break. I ended up with a big blond chunk right at the top of my hairline making it impossible to pull back into a ponytail because it looked like a big bleach blond stripe. Certainly not subtle in any way. Not only that, the highlights only went halfway down the length of my hair, so even wearing my hair down looked strange. I made an appointment at another salon and got all over dye to cover up the mess I was left with. I will not be going back to this salon ever again.

ulta does not appreciate their customers. I really miss shopping there, but was treated SO poorly. After weeks of trying to allow them to make it right they concluded that I am not important enough of a customer to do anything for me. The salon in Ulta destroyed my hair. I did not pay for the services. They offered me a free salon service to make things right... like I would EVER trust them with my hair again. HA! Then they offered me a thoughtless gift of things "they give away for free anyway", things I would NEVER use. Things you would give to somebody who goes clubbing on the weekends or likes to wear heavy night makeup (which is completely beautiful and fine but I am a mother of two who rarely gets out and I only need my essentials) they refused to issue me a giftcard for the amount of the gifts they offered. (probably because they wanted to skate by on giving me free stuff they hand out to customers and employees as gifts anyway) this MULTI BILLION dollar company couldn't afford to give me a gift card to use IN THEIR STORE to make amends on what they did to my hair, how much money I had to spend elsewhere to get it fixed... HUNDREDS of dollars in services and products to reverse the damage done by the bleach this man applied THREE TIMES in one sitting, a service that took FIVE HOURS of my time. MY time that I had to pay a babysitter for. MY time that I never ever get to myself because I am a full time student, have a full time job, have a family. But us little people are not important to Ulta. Us little people do not matter. NEWS FLASH. Us little people... the moms who shop there, the teenagers who shop there, anybody who shops there IS IMPORTANT. We are what makes your company successful. You should be more grateful. Maybe you guys can't afford to make up for all your mistakes because maybe there are more frequent than you'd like to admit, maybe you would go bankrupt if you made things right for everybody you disappointed. Maybe THATS why your company told me that I should be grateful for what you offered me, even if it was things I would never use, and to "take it or leave it because I was being ungrateful" Thank you for disrespecting me so much. Still waiting for somebody to make this right. My credit card is completely paid off, I am just waiting for somebody to make things right so I can use it again. Until I feel respected, I will let that available credit sit unused... where before I was maxing it out on your products and services.

I came in to get the concealer, and then remembered to get some body care for my boyfriend, who has body acne and dry, flaky skin. Carey (Kerry? Kerri? sp?), who happened to be in the aisle where I was perusing the CeraVe products, was kind, profession, and very friendly. She patiently listened and gave her honest two-cents about recommended products. I don't know how your name is spell -- it has so many variations -- but bless you Carey, you rock. Ulta Kietzke, KEEP HER. She demonstrated excellent customer service -- a very professional general manager -- I hope she never leaves, and I hope her colleagues learn from her.

This was my first time giving Ulta a try and wow just a bad experience overall. They have signs in every window and throughout the store stating free 3 piece gift with a Pureology purchase. Ok, awesome because that's what I was here to look at, and I get a gift on top of it if I buy from here, I am pretty much sold as a customer here. So I end up getting the liters of shampoo and conditioner and bringing to the front by the register. There's only one person working the register, and it's seriously taking her 5-10 minutes per customer. I understand trying to relate to the customer by saying oh I love blah blah, but seriously when customers have to wait in line 30 minutes while you BS and make small talk is ridiculous. There was another woman that was just walking around, I am not sure what the heck she is doing, but she keeps walking to register then walking off again, so she can clearly see the line of people waiting. So 30 minutes of waiting I am finally up to the register, she signs me up for their rewards program, ok not sure what the rewards even are. At least at Sephora I can clearly see at the register what I can get with points, here I have no clue. So finally get checked out and on my way. Down the street when I getting gas, I think wait a minute I didn't get the gift that they have advertised all over their store. So I drive back, of course there is a line where I wait 10 minutes, while they try to find more products around the store for the person at the register. What the heck!?? Why don't you have this lady go to the side, have someone who isn't working the register go help her find what she needs. Finally, she notices that I'm back and looks confused, I point to the sign and say wasn't I suppose to get a gift? She looks confused and said, "oh what are you pointing at?" Ummm... the sign that is plastered all over this place (I didn't say this). Then she says, "Oh yea, I tried to see if we had any when you bought it, but didn't see any, so that's why I didn't give it to you." Ok, this makes it even worse, so you knew that my purchase should have included the gift and instead of saying, "I am sorry we are out," or making the excuse, "We just ran out." You decide to hope I won't notice, which back fires because I now go out of my way to drive all the way back here, stand in line again, and listen how you didn't really care about me as a customer. She obviously could tell I am annoyed then starts looking through their cupboards that are disheveled and finds this crappy looking bag that says Pureology on it and some other lame saying on it, that no one in their sane mind would ever use unless you were a hairdresser. Um thanks. I will never go back here again!

I don't wear a lot of make-up but I spend a lot on face care.  At this location.  More employees than customers this morning but I waited patiently for the young lady in my particular section to finish with another customer ... never to return. Several other employees passed by without a word. When I asked for assistance, a young woman said, "let me do this and I'll be right back."  She also did not return ... when I finally set my $100+ purchase on an endcap and left she was at the register.  Several others were available but socializing with fellow employees.  I will not return to this location, or perhaps any, since this brand is available at Macy's and Dillard's.

Can you believe I have never been to an ULTA before!? The range of products is pretty incredible. I got a more expensive hair dryer that works so amazing it looks like I am wearing a wig. I got tons of stuff from hair products to the Anastasia Beverly Hills Riviera Palette I have been eyeing for a while now. Spent a ton of money and worth every penny. The only issue was that my Anastasia Palette was beeping all crazy in my bag and scared me maybe bc I went towards the front to drop off my hair dryers bc they were heavy and then went to the back again for the hair brush? Not sure but that issue should be addressed bc I literally had to put my bag down because a manager was chasing me down from the alarm on the makeup palette and it scared me. I JUST NEED A HAIR BRUSH CALM DOWN BEEPER! It was funny mostly but not sure why the alarm went off as it never left my bag. Sephora does not have alarms so it was confusing me to keep hearing beeps around the store and not understanding what they were. Now I know... lmao. Don't move too fast with an Anastasia Palette in ur bag! 
Anyways it was really fun like in a dangerou$ way and nice to check something out with more variety than Sephora. I will be back but I am cutting myself off from makeup for at least 6 months bc I have been going ham on the makeup.

Have gone here 5 times in the last 2 months. Always out of stock on everything!!!!! 
The manager explained that they have blind shipments, so, good luck finding what you are looking for. 
Should be ordering stuff that you have been out of stalk on for several months!!! 
Very unhappy. Will only be buying from sephora from now on.

This was my first trip to ulta, and I was (mostly) pleasantly surprised. As far as beauty products go, they run the gamut from hair to skin to makeup and beyond. The store is crammed with well-stocked displays, and top brands are clearly marked. Bonus for having a semi-hushed atmosphere - it made browsing super mellow.

The staff were helpful and attentive without hovering (love that). One star off for the register - with plenty of helpers floating around the store, there were only two people on the till (one bigly grumpy senior employee and one trainee) while the line was ten people deep.

I'm really disappointed in this location. I'm a new mom and my hair wasn't happy with my old shampoo. I went in and asked for a recommendation that didn't have a lot of added junk in it. The girl sold me Bed Head saying how it was a new formula and it didn't have the silicones in it and all this bs because it turns out it literally has everything she said it didn't have in it. Now I'm not a hair specialist which is why I trusted the sales girl to steer me in the right direction. Then I went to my hair girl who said I had so much build up she couldn't even get a lather and told me what was inn Bed Head. This place is a joke and you should not trust them because clearly they have no idea what they're talking about or just blatantly lie to customers.

My husband and I were shopping here on Friday. We were checking out and my husband was having a conversation with the cashier and right in the middle of the conversation she says and I quote "Now sir you are gonna have to pull your mask up over your nose. Now my husband has a beard and every time he says something his mask comes down under his chin. We own 2 successful businesses. We fight the mask fight everyday. If a person is checking out and trying to be nice the last thing you expect would be some one who really doesn't know the struggle jumping on a 55 year old man checking out. If you are gonna pick a fight, pick a fight with someone who is really abusing the mask thing all the time, not the one time you decide to talk to them. Maybe some customer service training is in order. He complied but we were both in shock of the condescending attitude and what would she do if he didn't? Call the police? You know the police that have said they are not gonna enforce the mask thing? We were leaving! And we won't be back. I hope this particular store survives the pandemic but I have my doubts.

I wont be back to this location. The last time I was here the staff followed me around but not to help me, it was just to make sure I wasn't stealing anything. I have spent thousands of dollars here so yes its offensive and not to mention annoying. The girl with the colored hair also gave me dirty looks.
They only left me alone once I got in line to purchase. F this store!

Jay and Nevada are amazing. I see Nevada at the Benefit Brow Bar on a regular basis and she is always super professional and great at making my brows always look on point. 

Jay is always super helpful and willing to assist me if I need help finding something. She never makes me feel like I am bothering her.

This is the only Ulta I will go to in Reno!

My wife used to shop here quite a bit for her hair care products. While they mostly target a female customer base they do carry a small selection of men's products (cologne, skin care, etc). When I would come here with my wife I would pick up a jar of my favorite shaving cream, "Art of Shaving". Needing a refill, we stopped by to pick one up.

Long story short, it was a bust. Come to find out, they seemingly don't even carry Art of Shaving products any longer (there weren't any tags on the shelves for them). They do have the "Jack Black" line but didn't have the shaving cream (or any shaving cream) in stock.

While it was a bust, I do have to commend the employee who tried to help me find some. She asked if she could help me find anything and when I told her, she took me around to a couple different spots in the store to find it. Alas, we didn't, but her customer service was on point.

Cassandra at the Benefit Brow bar shaped up my eyebrows super nice and she was very professional and pleasant to work with. Thank you Cassandra! 
-Carleen Nevada's Curl Expert

This place doesn't know how to hired girls. All the girls are so rude and don't ask if everything is okay you have to ask yourself for help. All they do is give dirty looks left and right! Please management do something about this i always get everything from here or i can go else where if nothing changes i know your numbers matter. Change your lady's attitude. Make them give better customer service Thank you! Btw you only have One women who's sweet and is the best at what she does. Other than that everyone else is rude I had to leave and put the items i wanted to buy.

I love coming to the salon, I have been a client of Anna's for over 6 years now and I followed her to Reno cuz she does such a great job. Now I get makeup, hair tools, beauty supplies and all I need in one stop with Ulta!! Love it!!

Workers were very rude. Would not let me return my product that was damaged when I purchased it. I told them I was not aware it was damaged and they would not let me return it. They got the manager and she said there is nothing she can do. Ridiculous because there is always something you can do. They were eating the whole time I was there. They also got a order of Starbucks while I was there. That was quite unprofessional in my opinion.

I needed a hair cut badly! I am new to the area and it is hard to trust and put your faith in a new hairstylist to you. I was blessed with Celeste! I called and she greeted me and was able to book me the next day!!! She recommended this new treatment for my hair and it was so worth it! My ends were pretty damaged and she was able to style my hair with a fabulous new cut. She takes the time to really understand what the customer would like and she helps you get there. I booked my appointment next month to add some new color to my hair! I am very excited and I highly recommend her. She was very friendly and professional and did a great job with my cut today! She also recommended this serum and heat protector VERB Ghost oil! It smells amazing and I love it. She gave me some great recommendations on how to care for my hair! Celeste gets 5 stars!!!!!!!! Ulta is lucky to have her!

I always love a good deal- and right now Ulta has a FREE plush throw in two different colors or a shower mimis in gray in all sizes with a $50 purchase plus I signed up some time ago for their emails and flyers and received 20% off my total which saved $23- and plus a $25 dollar gift card from our work! We scored big time in the savings!

terrible. I ordered products yesterday and in less than 1/2 hour called to change the ship to address. I did not realize the default address was a place I had not lived in for a few years. There was no place on their order page to change an error. 
No help from the "help center". I was told the order has been processed and there was no way to stop it or change the ship to address. In 30 minutes the process couldn't have been stopped. Shameful way to do business. 
The people who receive the package on their doorstep will be thanking a "Secret Santa".

I actually had a good experience here today. I normally shop Ulta online mostly because being older (okay, old, not older--I'm 60) usually equals not-so-great customer service in shops like Ulta and Sephora. I have money to spend and I wear makeup but sometimes those things get overlooked when you're not young and wrinkle free. 

Anyway......I decided to see what's in the actual store these days. Customer service was on point, I was asked twice if I needed help but then I was politely left alone to shop. The store was fairly empty so maybe that's why they were more attentive but I hope that's not the reason. 

I browsed, I chose a few things, I paid, I left happy. The cashier was super nice. I'm taking away one star for the overall messiness of some of the displays. Items were out of place or sideways, just looked messy.

I got my hair cut at Ulta. I've had my hair cut at Ulta for several years and have always been happy. This time was not one of those times, see images. I'm missing a chunk of hair! It cut so short on the front side! This was supposed to be an A-line. Ha! They gave me a refund and said that they have a policy that if they give a refund on salon services that the customer is no longer welcome there. After all the money I have spent there! I'm not welcome after THEY f'ed my hair up!?! How is this the customers fault??? Not that I'd ever let them touch my hair again! But how dare they! AND during my haircut the stylist was called away to talk to customers 3 times, took a customer phone call, took a personal phone call, and complained about her SO selling their car and her current transportation problems as a result. Unprofessional!

I LOVE this store! When I say love, I mean love and not like. I don't wear makeup everyday but when I do wear it I want the best quality there is. Ulta has an enormous selection of makeup to choose from. On top of that there are testers galore so you can try things out and even a couple of staff members are always nearby to help you traverse the diverse selection of makeup amenities. 

If makeup isn't your thing maybe you want a haircut and color or a brow shaping session. Yes, they have that. I have to give a shout out to their hair care section where you can find just about every kind of shampoo, styling aid, box hair color, low to high end styling apparatus, name it they have it!
Love Ulta, they are very friendly.  Found a few things on sale.  They have a great rewards program.

I didn't think I would have to spend time at Ulta as much as I did today, the cashier Josey, was super nice super scared to her supervisor this big heavy lady who was sooo very rude. At first, as I'm shopping she approached me since the sensor on the perfumes was going off! asking if I needed anything making me feel uncomfortable made me feel like I didn't have money to shop. From that moment on she didn't take her eyes off of me. I felt very judge that I didn't have money to shop and I'm trying to steal something. By the time I got home to register and pay Josey was kind and helped me. So first Josey, rang me up and completed the transaction, but forgot to offer me to use my current points $$$ so Josey, ended up redoing the whole transaction. Josey didn't really know how return works, she called the manager a few times to get help. The manager was giving me a dirty look the whole entire time. I felt very uncomfortable. I am a member at Ulta and I always shop at this location, but this was the very first time I was treated this way. I'm considering not shopping at Ulta ever again!!! If you guys have managers running your stores like this. IM SOO DISAPPOINTED.

I just moved to Nashville and it's such a blessing to find Elizabeth Key at Ulta. 
After Los Angeles it was a quest to find that amazing stylist and colorist. 
Liz FEELS colors! Being blonde, I like to change shades from icy to caramel, with highlights, lowlights etc.
Liz knows all the trends from degrade and ombre to belayage and peach or hologhaphic, she listens and always knows how to color, cut and style, she is a young professional with 10 years of experience. Liz is wonderful! I love my hair!

Quite possibly the worst customer service I've ever received. With thousands of products and about thirty customers one would think they would have more than 2 people working. I came in to buy powder and primer. Both of which I needed help matching my color. I was quickly reminded why I shop at sephora instead. Never again.

Ulta is the only place I can buy my crack, also known as the Exuviance Skincare line. I was so disappointed with the rude staff. I was searching for a good 5 minutes for the luxury skincare products and no one bothered to help me locate it. I am used to better service from Ulta. I guess I just need to brave the bad service because, like I said, I cannot buy this lifesaver product anywhere else. The location is nice though. It is located in a shopping center with a large variety of stores.

Yes, it's an Ulta. But it's also a pretty decent salon. I needed a last minute hair save and my usual salon couldn't get me in, so I walked into Ulta and made an appointment. This is my go to place for last minute appointments - you can almost always get in! And the salon services are very affordable (especially if you are a first time visitor) and quite good. When I went in, my hair looked like straw. When I left, my hair was smooth and looked and felt so much better.

Love this location! Parking can be a bit wacky. The staff is nice and helpful, shelves are well stocked. Items could be a bit more organized, but that's the constant struggle of a cosmetics store, people put things back in the wrong place all the time. After my most resent purchase, I got home and realized I had an eyeshadow from NYX that was damaged and falling out of the pan. When I came back to exchange it the staff was nice and helpful, made it super easy. Which is awesome because sometimes returning cosmetics feels like a crime! I swear I'm here for legitimate reasons! :) I will gladly spend entirely too much money here again.

Staff is always friendly and knowledgable. They are always stocked with product. Lines go fast. They're rewards program is the best. You can save a lot here. They always have things on sale. Their brow bar taught me how to do my eyebrows, now I'm in love with them.

I popped in here for quick impulse purchase, ended up getting a hair cut and blow dry, $46.  with Mr Dexter, long nimble fingers and smoother than a puma cheating at backgammon.  Blimey said Pablo that's nice, and ousted my beloved Lao girls out in a fell swoop, have been back again and I must say he has my cut down to a tee.  Eyebrow wax at $22 a bit pricey so will look for an alternative to that.  Rustling up a cup of coffee was a bit of a chore.  I will go back again.

Will not be returning. The staff was unpleasant and rude. They were speaking loudly making snide comments about customers and when some were trying to assist guests their advice was terrible. For example a woman was trying to find a lip shade for her darker skin tone and a sales associate was telling her color names in Tart saying "this is popular". The woman was not looking for what's "popular" she wanted a color that would look good on her. Management was horrific. Seemed nobody knew what they were doing or how to treat guests in their store.
Love this store! Always very helpful and polite.  Store is always neat and clean. I have never had a problem with parking.

I've come in here to buy products, and whenever I do I'm always greeted by the friendly staff members. They always come by to see if I need help- but no to the point to where its annoying. They are present and aware! Great customer service. I even learned at checkout that I can reuse their magazine coupons this last time after I pulled one out, thanks to lady who was at the register!

To make it even better, I decided to try their salon (Im newish to the area and was looking for a place). Barbara was so friendly AND did a great job with my hair. I wanted the dead ends cut off, but there always seems to be a struggle for stylist to do just that. They either get too scared and don't get enough off, or hack off way more than you ever wanted. Barbara got rid of my dead ends with out dramatically changing the length of my hair! It feels so much more healthy that it was. The other stylists was super personable and chatted with us as my hair was being done. I think I'll go back in a couple months for the same thing!
I love Ulta!! I go in here all the time and the ladies are so sweet and very helpful. I will go here over Sephora any day ;) thanks Ulta for being awesome!

I had such a great experience! I called ahead to see if you had the Caviar shampoo that for some reason Sephora does not consistently carry. I was very pleased that the Ulta saleswoman was so helpful! She said Ulta carried a lot of Caviar products and I was ready to hang up and head on over but she instead went over to check that I had the exact conditioner product I was looking for. She was so helpful via phone and once again super helpful when I went in the store! 
Ulta is just such a great place to shop in general. In very few places will you get such a merge of drugstore and high end products. I mean, look at me. I left with Aveeno makeup wipes and Caviar shampoo. Thanks Ulta!
Now, the only reason I am giving you 4 stars is because there was a very short dark-haired girl circling the hair care section in the back on Friday February 26 and she could see I was in and out of every aisle looking for a particular product but didn't offer to help.

Thumbs Down! Bad management. Staff is not trained so if you want advice, go elsewhere. If you want in store help, forget that too. When I finally found someone, she was busy and referred me to another girl who knew nothing about customer service. What's the point of having a store?

The Ulta has landed in Nashville. Right in CENTRAL Nashville.  I don't want to think of the accumulative hours I've spent in there since it opened in 2013...

One of Ulta's main draws is their complete selection of drug store brand cosmetics (L'Oreal, Maybelline, Revlon). Also, the availability of the NYX line - which now can be found in Target, amazingly.  I've got to be honest - I've found NYX products to be crap.  But they do have a large variety of products, many of which I'd affiliate with higher-up brand make-up (primers, glittery eye liner, chubby stick eye pencils).  

I've been steered well by the same employee multiple times, as to which products to buy and which to avoid.  She'll tell me honestly which are not worth purchasing!  Very thankful for that.

It seems Ulta now offers some high end brands these days, such as Lorac, Stila, Two Faced. I sort of think it's their way of competing with Sephora, which I consider to be the department store makeup SUPER STORE.  I shop at them both. And LOVE shopping at them both, for very different reasons.
