Ulta tends to have some slammin' deals - I bought a full size can of Hard Head TIGI hair spray for $7.99 because it was the breast cancer awareness design.  And here are ALWAYS coupons, available on the ULTA web-site.
Always a good experience at Ulta.  So happy they are now in the area!  Good prices, good products and knowledgable staff.  Would love to see more of them around Nashville, Franklin areas.

I can always count on Ulta to have the largest selection and the most pleasant sales people.  I always receive assistance when needed and the staff is knowledgable and eager to help.  I enjoy shopping this location in particular the most because of their sales people.

I wanted to write this review to actually give praise to the ultra brand. I have the worst luck with nail polish, it always cracks the next day. I purchased an ulta brand polish because it's cheaper and it has now lasted me four days, no chips. And I'm rough with my hands so four days is a lot. I also love their mascara. 4.99 and it is the best I've ever tried. Super smooth no lumps and really gives volume to your lashes. The negative one star is because I do not like their customer service. I never receive help when I need because they are focused on someone else. I'd be there every day if customer service was better.

Excellent selection of makeup and skin care products. Easy parking too. Reasonable prices. I do wish, however, they would carry more cruelty-free lines that do not use animal testing. The Pur makeup line they carry is cruelty-free, as well as NYX, but some of that line is made in China, so look for origin country as well when making your purchase decision.
The store is well organized and carries all the top products.  I love Sephora as well but I like the wider selection of hair products at Ulta.  Plus the emplyees were super friendky and helpful.

This store ISN'T moved! I stopped in there yesterday, and they're still open. I don't why this designation says moved. I asked the manager, and she says she put in word at Yelp, and can't get it taken down. ??? It's a CONSPIRACY. 

I luuurrrrves the Ulta.

The two stars are because Ulta has great deals, but I am writing this review based on the horrible customer service. No one greeted me when I walked in, if I needed help finding something.. tough luck for me. There were two employees at the cash register when I went up - they processed my order, but pretty much pretended like I wasn't there. As they were scanning my items and looking up other items for me they were chatting to each other about how bored they were. Wow. They gave very judgmental looks and responses to all my questions. I couldn't help but wonder, "Why am I even here?" Sephora's customer service is amazing and they are always so helpful and kind. Ulta, I love your makeup supply, but you need to step up your customer service.

Ahhh, Ulta. The makeup mecca. I usually shop at Sephora but decided to stop here because it's so close to my house. There's a great selection and they had what I wanted - just a bit overwhelming with all of the options they present. The store is clean and open, I just hate dealing with that parking lot!

I've loved Ulta since I was a teenager, but since then I've never lived close enough to one to frequent it as often as I'd like. Ulta carries my favorite line of foundation (Studio Gear), but for some reason unlike the Murfreesboro store, this location doesn't carry that line at all. Perhaps it was time for me to move on, and there were certainly plenty of options in its place. 

That complaint aside, I'm thrilled to pieces to have an Ulta close by again. This particular store is shiny and new, well organized and fun to mill around.

Came in knowing nothing about make-up and rolled out feeling like a pro! Talaria was absolutely amazing, she answered every question I had in depth and showed me techniques I never even knew existed. Not only is the store clean, pretty and comfortable but I honestly would go back just because of how wonderful of an experience I had with Talaria.

Now I understand why they don't have the best customer service rating! I called yesterday to see if they had Bumble & Bumble Sunday Shampoo in stock since Ulta no longer has the in-store availability feature on their site/app. They told me they didn't have the item at that location. So I came in to look for myself and there they were, 4-5 bottles of the shampoo I had called and asked about. Also, when I called, whoever answered the phone seemed as if they had no clue of the brand. Bumble and Bumble is a common brand. They thought it was the shampoo's name, no wonder I was given incorrect information. Hire knowledgeable employee, or teach them at the least.

2013/074

This place recently opened and I had to see what my friends were raving about.

Wow. Just about everything health and beauty related can be had in one location.

Off the top of my head, they have: makeup and accessories, nail polish/gel (and lamps), hair brushes/combs, stuff for your brows, bleaching, hair removers, nail clippers, hair dryers, shampoos, conditioners, other hair products, lipstick, etc. Basically, almost anything you can find in a drugstore or average beauty salon can be found here. And more.

They have Ulta brands (there were a few $2/$4 sales going on when I was in) and Sally Hansen and many major brands. 

Because I think certain companies want all of their products in their own dedicated aisle, you may have to search around for items such as lipsticks and nail polish, whether they are all in the same aisle, or in their own major brand aisle.

I think (but I'm not sure) that they even had beauty consultants to help you choose makeup by applying them on you.

If you're into someone greeting you, they definitely have this one attentive woman who made a point of greeting everyone that comes in.

Note: I don't usually buy high-end products, so I don't know if those are carried here. And if you're loyal to certain brands at department stores, they may not have them here. This really is a one-stop place for your day-to-day beauty needs.

Dirty. Understaffed. Missing testers. Low stock. Employees that work for cosmetic brands stand and talk about their personal lives and when they see you go "CAN I HELP YOU WITH SOMETHING?" Like I'm almost not supposed to know what I'm doing, that I'm stupid, and that if I'm not going to use their knowledge that I'm sketchy. First of all, I'm a makeup artist, second of all, I don't care if your dog likes wearing sweaters and you make more money working at the gym. Figure it out Ulta. Dang!

Could not believe the racist and disgusting comments I heard (possible manager) Hannah say. I am a frequent customer of Ulta but I will never return to this store. While in the store, there were several police officers speaking with sales associates about theft that had occurred earlier in the day. The police officer was speaking to three women who worked there about what had happened. The woman who I assume was a manager said loudly "It's always the black people" then her and the other employees started laughing. Several customers stopped and starred at her including myself and the people I was with. I couldn't believe how unprofessional and racist this woman was being in front of customers. I asked an employee the name of the woman on the way out they said her name was Hannah and that she was the manager. As I said I love ulta but will never return to this location.

I have gotten decent service in this Ulta location before, but when I called today and asked if they would take a coupon of mine that had been expired TWO DAYS, the sales girl was so incredibly rude that I couldn't believe what I was hearing. It's a customer appreciation coupon, too! She kept telling me "the date is clearly printed on the coupon, and the coupon has been out for quite a while". I obviously see the clearly printed date, which is why I am calling in the first place. I will not be back with all the other options in the area to buy the exact same things.

I recently got my hair cut & colored at the salon at Ulta, and Heather there did an excellent job. I hadn't had a cut in about six months, thanks to a traumatizing haircut earlier in the year. However, I let Heather cut off two inches- first she took a baby-step of cutting off a quarter-inch, and then I let her cut off the rest. She's a stylist you can trust not to go crazy cutting off all your long hair, which I appreciate. 

She did a wonderful job with my color, and was a relaxing and interesting person to talk to. I'm so glad they opened this salon; we needed something in this area. 

The variety of high-end cosmetics next to drugstore cosmetics is so convenient. I tried their waterproof Ulta brand mascara, and mascara sealer (both $4), and they worked amazing! Idk if they're cruelty-free, though. :/ I'm switching to all CF, so I should've checked. 

Ulta has a ton of fragrances, a lot of the newest hairstyling appliances, and some of the most beautiful hair accessories (barrettes and headbands)  I've seen in ages.

I checked Pricey, because the prices can go from Moderate to $18 for a bottle of nail polish. Also be sure to ask before you have a hair service what the price will be. My hair was $80, not the $55 listed on the menu. That's okay, but be aware to ask, it may be more depending on what you get, like mine was.

Each time the service has been really friendly. The front counter ladies have always chatted and gave me an Ulta card.

UGH. It's amazing how awful the customer service in the salon is. 
I've been there a few times before (after clearly showing them the red color I wanted and ending up with purple and even brown hair) and kept coming back mostly out of convenience, but this will definitely be the last time.

I made an appointment a week in advance with Haley and ended up with another girl who really seemed like she just wanted to gtfo out of there. I know what I wanted was going to take some time (ombre with black and red) but all she said was that she wouldn't have time (when I've had this done before after coming in at the same time). 
Well I'm glad I made a 30 minute drive there, then. 

It seemed like she was the only girl who was even there. She said I should reschedule for another day when they would "have more time" but funny how the day she suggested left exactly 5 hours before the store closed, just like on that day. 
I get that she might not have wanted to do longer work on my hair, but it was just annoying to drive all the way there, and not even get my appointment! No notice or anything that she wasn't there. 
I feel like this girl just couldn't be bothered.

TERRIBLE service.

While visiting this store, they were dealing with a recent theft, police were in the store talking to an employee named Hannah. Who very loudly said "it's always the black people" which made myself and other customers very uncomfortable. 

Later when asking, I was told that hannah was a manager. will not be returning to this Ulta store

I hate to leave negative reviews but I just left Ulta after a somewhat awkward experience.  I was there trying to find cologne for my husband and was hoping someone would come over and offer to assist me, but it never happened.  So I decided to test out one of the fragrances on a card.  Shortly after, I heard one of the salesgirls exclaim loudly "ew it smells like someone SPRAYED something!" And then another saleswoman replied "ew yeah, which means I'm getting as far away as I can."  Hm, super helpful considering you work in a store that sells beauty products and fragrances.  So I stood there awkwardly and tried to be more discreet as I smelled one or two more fragrances.  The entire time, several salespeople looked at me, but didn't even acknowledge me or offer assistance.  Usually I'm fine with this, but today was actually a time when I could have used help, especially after apparently offending them by trying to help myself.  I think the entire time I was in there (20 minutes or so), one man asked me if I needed help when I was moreso just browsing the rest of the store and was almost ready to check out.  I did end up finding a good cologne on my own, but felt like I didn't want to give them my sale after such a poor experience.  I have purchased cologne from Sephora in the past and had a much better experience, so will probably brave the Green Hills traffic and support them in the future.

It's a basic Ulta. Nothing out of the ordinary. And I have to  brag on my hair stylist, Haley. She was so wonderful. However. They have a heavy set blond who worked the register who apparently I was bothering by asking her for a price check on some hair items. (If they were in their right place I wouldn't have had to ask ‍) she checked me out and allowed another customer to walk up to the register with me while I gave my personal info for her to look up my Ulta account info. The other customer either didn't know where the line began or was really unaware of personal space because she was so close I could touch her without even spreading my arms out. It was so unprofessional of this cashier to just allow that to happen and to treat me like I was bothering her. I won't buy anything there anymore; thank god for Sephora.

Well, here I go :(

I knew better but it shouldn't be this way. I need a forever hair stylist that doesn't want my soul to make my hair look good. I called in good faith and asked for a color specialist (they all say they are and that it's their favorite part of styling :-/ )... anyhow, Emily assured me that their newest stylist (Katie) was a color correction specialist and she wasn't new to de industry, well 3 years isn't what I call specialist level specially because I'm pregnant and she obviously used the wrong volume to do the processing of my hair and left patches everywhere. She still uses the board and she dropped it a few too many times on the floor that I felt bad for all of them. It's funny how I was joking with her that I hated 2000's chunks of hair that was called highlights just to make sure she used a fine technique when grabbing my highlights, wishful thinking. My appointment was at 1 but I was running 15 mins late but it didn't matter because I had to wait for my stylist to be done with her previous appointment for another 30 mins (that's 45 mins I would of have to wait if I wouldn't have been late). I told her time was an issue but I wasn't done until 5:30 and unhappy. I told her I was for sure calling back. Color was super ashy with the outside light and she chopped my hair off, not really a real hair cut where she would of have noticed the shorter side on it. Nice girl but need to really practice and listen to her clients and if she can't deliver is best to say so. No shame on that, trust me. 

Mistake #2... going back to "fix" it. 7 years and I don't know why she did what she did... "Your hair looked better with the 1st mistake" ( my husband's words and he is the one that tells me I look amazing even if I'm wearing a trash bag) so yeah. Amber removed the toner Katie put on, barley blended the patchy places and threw another toner that gave me a color if Katy Griffin's hair had a baby with a M&M. She also "fixed" the cut by using some special technique. Well tell that to the ponytail lol (see pic. Lol).

I will say they were very polite and willing to try to fix the mistake and never changed their attitude to an ugly unpleasant experience. 

Oh well at least my husband got a kick at the Pinterest vs. reality moment of my life until I told him I paid $220, not so funny then... Save your money girls. Go to the schools to get this quality, seriously.

I had my share of bad hair business and it seems it will continue but the best has yet to be on "professional salons" with the most experienced stylist :)... I can't even.
Called to see if they had a product. Asked for a certain color, the girl said they did. Go all the way there and they did not ! Like wtf. Get your shit together.

Staff needs a fucking attitude check. I'm a longtime makeup enthusiast and usually know exactly what I need when I go into any Ulta or Sephora. However, I'm always open to a second opinion from staff, since I assume they are passionate about makeup to be working there (won't make that mistake again). I shade matched myself with a product I'm extremely familiar with, the It Cosmetics CC Cream. I have recently started using tanning lotion so I needed a shade or 2 darker than my usual Fair Light, and yes I knew the nature of product's oxidation. As I was reaching for my new shade one of the staff asked me if I needed any help shade matching. Since I was wearing a mask for Covid regulations and couldn't sample the product on my skin (had to rely on bottle color), I said "sure, I wouldn't mind a second opinion." I was then swarmed by 2 other staff members when the first couldn't decide which shade of the 2 I brought to her was best, and then one of the 3 staff members asked me if I wanted a foundation. I said no, I wanted a CC cream. She then responded to me in an extremely bitchy tone, "what do you mean by CC cream??" as if I'm the one with the crazy ideas. Anyone who has even an inkling of the scope of the makeup world knows that CC's creams have become very popular in recent years because of the quality of their coverage combined with skincare ingredients and SPF. Just because Ulta staff isn't aware of them doesn't mean they aren't prevalent - big brands like Maybelline, Neutrogena, NYX, e.l.f., etc. all have their own versions that are named, you guessed it, "CC Creams." It's not MY problem the staff here isn't up to date on trends that are already years old. All 3 staffers then proceeded to tell me neither shade I chose would work, they were both too dark. Well, the next shade up was the one I already owned that was now too light, aka the whole reason I'm in there! I politely said "guess I must be a shade in between, thanks anyway for your help." Silence. Not only does the staff seem to have no concept of the makeup world, they don't even know how to make a sale. I was basically left with no other product options and left the store. Jokes on them - not one person in the staff was even aware that Ulta carries CC creams from DOZENS of other brands that one of them could have showed me and I would be open to buying. Instead I was met with terrible attitudes and made to feel like a fool at something I'm actually really good at. Makeup is very important to me, I consider it an art and I enjoy every experience I get with it, including the buying experience. Thank god the Green Hills mall just opened a much nicer Ulta - the 100 Oaks location just lost a long time customer.

I'm really surprised to see some bad reviews about the location in Hendersonville/ Goodlettsville. I've shopped there many times with good help, but the last time was fantastic. I have tried to cover dark circles under my eyes for ages that get worse as you age. Tried about 20 different products with no good results. I walked in, spotted someone shelving, and started explaining my problem. She had no problem stopping what she was doing walking me over to the product that she thought was going to work and actually putting it on my face right there in the store in the aisle so I could see in the mirror. It worked wonders, and also is not an expensive brand. In addition, I inquired about setting powder and mascara. Again, she took me to where the product she told me work best for her and she had tried them all and they were good products, not high-end brands. Her name was Melissa, I think she was a manager. She personally went and checked me out herself with my coupon discount that of course did not have with me, but found on-line
 If you have a problem with a specific area or issue, I definitely recommend Melissa. She was very pretty and makeup impeccably done. I thank her so much for helping me with my issue and looking out for me on cost. Remember, Melissa!

Beauty land! This store has EVERYTHING I swear. ULTA regularly sends out daily deals, discounts, promotions, etc and you can get some sweet freebies that way. 

The store is laid out very nicely in a way where you aren't too confused. I will say that when you walk into a store like this with SO many choices, know what you're trying to accomplish and DON'T be afraid to ask for help or suggestions from the staff because you could spend HOURS looking for an eyeliner pencil if you lose yourself in the sea of pretty shiny things!

They have a salon, which I have not taken advantage of yet, but plan to. And they also have a full calendar of beauty/makeup events that go on throughout the month (calendar should be right when you walk in). 

Some of my favorite things to pick up here are Batiste dry shampoo, Urban Decay products, shampoo & conditioner, The Body Shop butters and oils, hair dye, and NYX products (LOVE their matte lipstick). 

ULTA has a great return policy. I brought back a curling wand that kind of sucked and has no issues. 

Love my ULTA points! I'm a platinum customer so I keep them throughout the year. Definitely check this store out for any hair, body, beauty supplies whether you're a girl or a guy. They're fabulous!

I bought a $25 mascara that was on sale Monday for $18. I went back in yesterday evening to get a price adjustment with the receipt. Mind you, this has been done in the past at the same store.

I was told "we can't do that as it's on sale today only and because it is the Holidays" WTH?? Do you realize that is WHY I went back? And because it IS the holidays, should be a reason to up your game with customer service. Spent $100+ on Saturday and was looking for a measly $7 back. Need to rethink your approach Ms "Floor Manager".

Sephora will be getting my business from now on. I went to this location tonight and tried to find someone to ask about shade recommendations as you can no longer test products. Couldn't find a soul. Ok, whatever, picked a shade and headed to the cashier. Two cashiers working and the line of 5 people ahead of me moved quickly. It was my turn and one cashier took a call talking to someone about an online order and the other cashier walk around looking for something and then walked away into the store calling back she would be right with me. Ten minutes later comes back and tells a customer she could not find what she was looking for. Still standing there. Cashier one is still on the phone. The other cashier then walks away again to continue looking for whatever she was looking for when the customer says you can help the lady waiting. The cashiers reply was "Are you sure?" Obviously my $50 dollar purchase wasn't important to them so I won't be back.

Let me start by saying i have had the same hair dresser since I was a kid and I rarely go to anyone else. My current hair dresses could not get me in and I was needing a cut. I decided to just give Ulta Beauty a try and I was surprisingly impressed. Bethany was my stylist and she did an amazing job. I told her I wanted bangs and more layers plus a trim and she I'm super happy with it!

Don't know if people in this store are racist or just plain stupid and rude.
My mom and I went in today looking for make up, ready to spend a good amount of money, and some lady wouldn't stop following me around the store that worked there, and kept asking if needed help. I've worked in retail, I know what it means when they do that. I don't know if it was because the stroller or because we're Hispanic. Maybe both. 
Anyways moving on, we have a basket full of makeup and we pay, two different transactions, and little sweetie Mackenzie has to be the rudest bitch I've met as a cashier. Rude. Extremely rude. If you hate your job, then quit. Simple. First she threw my receipt at me, and threw my moms at her. I didn't say anything but when we got home my mentioned it if I caught that when she threw our receipts at us. I'm glad she mentioned it. I'm glad she caught that too.

Super friendly sales people. I went in looking for a BB cream and one lady helped to purchase a tinted moisturizer from NYX that was the same thing basically.  Another sales last helped me find a under eye concealer that I love. 

The only thing that I was unhappy with was the low selection of brown girl products. Many of the products did not come in a dark shade or they only had one shade for black skin.

I went on a whim and the only stylist available was Jamie their master stylist. Great personality and nice cut, however I noticed she didn't blow out my roots as well as I thought she should've, especially at $52 minimum for a cut and style. The wash cut and blow out was done in less than an hour and she offers great conversation which helped, but having to go home and touch up your hair after dropping $70 (yeah I still tipped) is not what I was expecting.

Love Ulta. Huge selection. Only drawback is not al stores carry same items. Some stores are considered elite and carry the better brands. I feel they should be offered at all locations. Good sales. Another drawback is their discount program. It only works on Ulta brands and not on name brands considered elite.

One girl in there was very helpful but i must say as i went up to the counter both of the employees were unfriendly. My mom tells me to use her points and i have been able to at every other ulta i have ever been to and the woman told me she couldn't prove if that was my mom?... uhh okay not really the best way to communicate that and also we have the same last name and she told me to use her number. Meanwhile the other girl seemed to be getting frustrated at the woman in front of me trying to use her coupons and redeem her rewards. Store is very unorganized and looked like it was not fixed up from the day before. Spent quite a bit too and wont be coming back.

To be clear, this is not a 2 star review only because of the first associate who helped me at checkout, she was awesome.  Additionally, there was one other associate asking multiple times if she could help everyone...I just wish she had been there earlier in my visit.
I hadn't been to an Ulta in some time, and I think I'm good for a while.  I walked into a very busy store, which is completely understandable.  I was looking for a contour kit, a concealer, and possibly a brow kit.  I may as well have been looking for a unicorn, a leprechaun, and a pot of gold.  I was desperately trying to find a contour kit and could not.  I looked everywhere, then finally got someone's attention.  She said they have one but the contour color was the same color as my skin (I am black but probably somewhere in between the shades of Beyonce and Oprah- in Maybelline, that is Light Cocoa).  When I saw the color she was referencing, I was astonished and mildly offended due to the fact that my skin color is SO far off.  I could absolutely contour with that color.  I picked up the kit, but then I was so thrown off, I didn't even want it anymore.  I did end up spending a pretty penny in there, but I wasn't in love with this person, who seems to be someone of some type of importance since she was literally speaking into her little earpiece the ENTIRE time I was there.
The first time I went through checkout, the associate was AWESOME, but I ended up having to go through again because I got an incorrect item.  I ended up going to Ms. Earpiece's register.  She completed the transaction, handed me my bag, and as I was thanking her, she just began speaking into her earpiece again.
Yeah. Ulta.com, sorry I cheated on you.

I used to be a frequent customer at Ulta when it first opened in Brandon - I loved the ability to go to a store and buy name brand perfumes, makeup, nail products, etc. while still being able to get brands that I'm familiar with seeing at my local drug store. Also, they had coupons every week (i.e. $3.50 off of $10) that came in handy.

Recently, I've not experienced the best customer service so I've decided to not go as much. I've had to return an online order and an [unopened] package and did not have the easiest or fastest time with the process.

Went to have my hair dyed, first time going here. I explained to the stylist that I box dyed my hair a couple months ago, that I wasn't sure if that was going to be a problem, she told me that it will be fine my hair should take the color that I wanted since it was dark. As she was washing out the color in my hair, she told me that the color did not take and that I should've done the clarifying treatment to strip the box dye out of my hair. I told her she should've told me that from the beginning because I would've done that instead of dying my hair. She then proceeded to tell me that I never told her it was box dyed, and that she still needed to charge me since she did use dye on my hair. I refused to pay for something that didn't work, she went and got the manager and the manager told me I am not allowed back in the store if I refuse to pay. I offered to pay but to possibly have the clarifying treatment for my next visit waived but she told me no. Horrible service.
The store employees werent friendly nor informatitve. I had more info on the products and daily stores sales. also they don't carry mac .

Same selection as other Ultas, but for some reason they organized everything by category and not by brand. That makes things difficult when you know what you're looking for, and, especially, when they're doing a buy one get one 50% off. They also didn't seem to be as stocked on products as other Ultas in the area. I had trouble finding certain products and items in my skin tone.

Why oh why must ulta continue to take all of my money. And just when I think ive had enough, they partner with mac cosmetics and boom more of my paycheck falls into ultas lap. 

No but seriously thus place has all of the latest greatest brands and a huge selection for all your beauty needs. And mich less expensive than Sephora

I called three times to see if they had a product in stock. No one answered the phone, so I called the "salon" part of the store. The girl was pretty helpful for not being a sales associate and answered my question as best she could, but you shouldn't have to call customer service multiple times before someone answers. Also, this location is ALWAYS out of a lot of product or it's been ooened so it isn't purchasable.
Second time in was better. I received help from a kind older, but not old, woman who was very sweet and helpful. Probably like any Ulta, it's hit or miss.
For some reason a centimeter turned into a few itches off my hair and the thinning shears used on my hair. Awful awful experience.
Always helpful clean and friendly staff that greet you at the door with a smile. Always have what I am looking for or recommend where it could be.
They always seem to be low in stock and I find that more often than not, the products I'm looking for are unorganized. Brow bar is the only reason I keep coming back.

Let me start by saying that I love the Ulta brand.  Many years ago I shopped at Ulta  when I lived in Virginia and was very excited that they were coming to Brandon.  But I must say I am very disappointed with this store.  The quality of customer service is horrible compared to the store in VA.  The sales people here are not very friendly or helpful and that's when you can find one!  I hope this is not from the top down and just an issue with this particular shop...

I had $80 worth of brushes in my hands. I had done my research and knew what I wanted so I didn't need much assistance. 
An employee comes over and comments on my selection. We get to talking about contouring and she starts telling me I have too much make up on and all but outright says my makeup looks horrible. She then used a brush from her apron (that's been used on God knows how many people) to buff out my makeup- without even asking if it was ok to touch me. I'm sure she was trying to help, but she did not do it compassionately at all. I had to go to back corner of the store to wipe away my tears before I could make it to the exit. 
I'm not an expert at this stuff, I'm learning and this employee killed the little bit of self confidence I had. 
Sephora is pricey but at least the employees are more helpful and not harmful to self confidence. 
Needless to say, I walked out empty handed. 
Go there if you know what you want but don't seek help with the employees.
All Ulta products are buy two get two free right now! Great deal! Up to $20 in value. M

This was one of my favorite stores...and still is due to their selection, but..

I went in for a facial last week and the lady had me take off my necklace (which had extreme sentimental value)...she even commented on how nice it was. She then draped my necklace over the handles of my purse (which was hanging on a hook on the wall). She proceeded to do the facial...which Included putting something over my eyes for a bit and she got up and walked off.

When all was said and done.. my necklace was not hanging from my purse anymore. I asked around if anyone had seen it... in case it WAS hanging and dropped (I was grasping for straws at that point) and the associates basically said we will let you know if we find it.. yet I had to then ask if they wanted my phone number.

The lady doing the facial didn't seem the slightest bit interested in my "missing" necklace...hmm.

As much as I love this store...I won't be returning...as that necklace meant more to me than any other piece of jewelry I had and things should not just "go missing" in a back secluded room.

As with every other store, each Ulta is not created equal. The best Ulta stores are the newer stores.  That's my opinion.  This does not seem to be a new store.  However, Ulta has a great mix of drug store brands like NYX and Cover girl....then higher end cosmetics like Urban Decay, Tarte and Stila.  My make up stash is a combination of just that.  NYX always has buy one get on 50% off.  That is a freaking steal.  

HERE'S THE KICKER...THIS ULTA HAS THE MARIO BADESCU SKIN CARE.  

Do you read me?  MARRRIOOOO BADESCU!!!!!!! I looked it up online and I was beside myself when it said the Brandon Ulta had it.  These products are AMAAAZZZZINNNGG!!!! The best skin care line ever! The only other option is buying online.  For that reason...this Ulta gets the crown!!!  HANDS DOWN!!!

Love Ulta and was excited to find one in Brandon when we moved to Florida. There were several people working, but no one seemed to be available to help any of the many customers. I approached an associate (who was texting on her phone ) to ask her about a mascara. Felt like I was interrupting her.

I Wanted to buy perfume, so I approached another associate for help, but she sent me over to the area and never showed up. They didn't have what I wanted in stock, so I never got any help until I was paying for my products and mentioned they were out. a pony tailed man went to the back and grabbed one, but I'd already paid and was needing to leave. The girl checking me out, who happened to be the one who wouldn't help me with perfume, had the nerve to say i should have asked pony tail man to begin with since he was the perfume guy. Oh and while standing in the long line to check out, the same male associate allowed a guy to walk in front of everyone to check out. 

After all of the bs hassle in the store, (I Had a platinum member 20% off anything in the store), when I pulled it up on my phone, the associate said it was only for online purchases. Come to find out when I walked out, the 20% off good for store purchases too.

***This store must be where they send the rejects to work***

Just got online to order my chance by Chanel with the 20% off I didn't get to use in store, and they don't sale it online.  ha! I'm thinking sephora from now on.

I stood literally a foot away from 3 employees and not one of them acknowledged me. However, I did get to hear about how much they don't like working there, someone's wedding and other crap that shouldn't be talked about on the sales floor. I came in ready to spend LOTS of money too. Too bad.

Stopped by Saturday afternoon to pick up a nice BB and left with so much more! 

When I walked in I was greeted by three beautiful faces and a wide selection of beauty products. Frankie saw that I was a little over whelmed and offered to help. She picked out three staple products that provided me with a natural look but also highlighted my features. I left with a new look and she also added a cute little box filled with samples.

This is an all in one kind of store, a combination of Sally and Sephora. They offer a wide range of cosmetics, hair products, perfumes, a  brow bar and a full hair salon. There is a free rewards program and you will occasionally receive a 20% discount with some exclusions as well as other sales offers with certain purchases. 

What I like the most is that they sell hair products that you mostly only find online and almost every line of cosmetic (no MAC). Additionally they have their own cheaper brand products. I have used their hair salon and I think is ok for the basics (blow dry, trim and wash) but wouldn't be my first choice for specialized hair services. Combined with their online store you can find pretty much anything you are looking for plus online products are usually reviewed by customers.

This store is dirty and unorganized. Hardly any stock on shelves and clearly they have employee's that aren't very honest. I had a coupon that printed on my receipt one time while checking out and the cashier checking me out CUT the barcode to my coupon off!!!!!! Wth? Discovered it when I went in to the store again to try and use it. Thankfully the cashier checking me out the second time was super sweet and realized that the barcode had been cut off.. She gave me the discount and a little more for that happening to me. 
I go in to this Ulta occasionally and now I pay close attention to everything that happens behind the counter!

Nearly empty store when I got there, though there were no employees to help me.  I had to stand in the check out line to get assistance, and then was told to go wait in the section I needed help in for someone to come to me.  I asked about a product that I've bought at Ulta many times, though the employee had never heard of it.  She suggested something else, but it was not close to what I was looking for.

Asriel did my hair and it was perfect she was so nice and helpful. She also recommended I did my skin treatments there. I came in and saw Stephanie and she was very knowledgeable and my skin was glowing. I had no idea Ulta offered so many services! I will definitely be coming back!!

This place is packed with what looked to be every type of makeup a person could want. 1000's of various colorful containers of all types of products promising to make your skin healthier and you look better. 
There is an aisle for men's products, but most of the store is (obviously) geared towards women. The staff was helpful as needed. The check out lines were a bit long, but moved at a good pace. Prices seemed high to me, but I know very little about make up products, so they could be right on par for quality items. The store was well laid out, clean, well lit, and overall a nice upscale place to shop. 
There is also a hair salon in the rear of the store.

Today was my fourth time getting cut and colored by Asriel and I couldn't be happier! This girl knows how to cut thick curly hair, listens to exactly what you want and puts her all into it every single time. I haven't had a hair dresser I liked in years and I finally feel like I have found the perfect one. I love going to see her, I love her skills and the price is right! My hair is dramatically healthier and finally growing. She recommended a Demi-permanent glaze color that stays put for a really long time and yet never leaves a line when it it's growing out. I have to thank you, Asriel, for your TLC! I have more confidence and just enjoy my time in the chair :) I would definitely recommend her and the salon overall. It's so convenient to go shopping afterwards and pay all together. Color, cut, style...anything you want she will get it done!

I had the best experience having my hair done at the Ulta Salon.  This was my first experience at this salon, Sharleen is an amazing hair stylist.  She really listens and explains every to keep your mind at ease.  I had a lot of breakage and damage and I brought pictures and she took her time to explain what I can do to save length but yet get my healthy again.  My hair feels and looks amazing, I will be back to have my color done again and when it's time definitely to get my trims.  I would highly recommend Sharleen for your hair needs.

Just got a haircut and color with Veronica in the Salon. It was my first time ever getting my hair done in Ulta and I have to say I was really impressed. The salon is in the back of the store and at first I thought it would be strange getting my hair done in a store where anyone could walk by but it really does feel quiet and secluded.  The store has so much stuff! I really wanted to spend more time playing with the makeup and creams but I was short on time. I had to do a couple of double takes when I saw the brands I usually have to go to Sephora for. I don't know why but I always thought they just had grocery store brands at Ulta. The store was really clean and organized and there seemed to have a lot of people walking around doing demonstrations. 

Veronica asked me a lot of questions since I wasn't sure what I wanted a far as color went. She offered several suggestions and showed me what the color would like next to my skin. Honestly, I was in such bad shape she could have just dyed my hair black and it would have been better than what I had. I knew exactly what I wanted for the cut and Veronica said she understood exactly what I wa looking for. Her prices seemed to be right around what I was paying across the street at the mall so I wasn't stressed about that but I really appreciate her telling me up front. Veronica also told me that if I had an Ulta loyalty card I would earn points for all my services. BONUS!!! Can't get that at the mall. 

While my hair was processing I sat in a separate room where the shampoo bowls are. I saw that they a nail station. One of the other stylists told me they just do gel polish and that she had some time if I wanted to freshen up my nails. I desperately needed them done so I said yes please to that. That stylist, Carly, was really sweet as well and did a great job and she saved me a trip later in the week!

Veronica came back, shampooed me out and then took me back to her chair to do my cut. Veronica started talking about skin care and that they offer facials and waxing, that she only does hair but she could introduce me to those people before I left.  The next  thing I know I was done. I totally did not even recognize my self in the mirror. I had all this volume and body. I thought maybe she had used a curling iron or something, but nope just a leave in conditioner and a round brush. I rescheduled for my color next month because I guess she gets booked up really fast. I didn't have time to talk to the skin care person but I am really thinking I need that in my life.

I had no idea they had so much to offer! I definitely recommend Veronica! I will definitely be back next month to rack up even more points.

Tip of advice-If you think a patron might be a shoplifter, don't say It in front of them! If you're wrong-you look like a huge ass. I don't typically leave reviews. Ever. However, a week later-this is still bugging me.

I stopped into the Brandon Ulta to browse and pick up some new products. I'm not a huge make up person-so it does take me a bit longer to look at products and determine what I need. 

I was looking at some on sale UD lipsticks. An associate asked if I needed help, and I asked if they had a shade that was missing. They were out. No big deal. I kept looking and comparing shades. The associate kept hanging around me. It was getting awkward. Here's the kicker-

I heard her, only inches next to me say on her intercom "hold on, I need to watch her". She then proceeded to stand there and stare at me. I regret not saying anything. I should have. I don't steal, and this was insulting and uncomfortable.

I kept shopping, but moved to the other side of the store. I went there with a purpose, and it was a long drive to turn around and leave. I however, won't be back.

Teach your staff how to handle these circumstances. And teach your staff not to treat your patrons like criminals. I had a terrible night the night before and just wanted to buy some new makeup as retail therapy. You made my day even worse.
I just want to tell you that the salon in Brandon is awesome. The salon manager Brittany is super nice and very accommodating.

I don't know why I keep coming in this location to find things. The customer service is rude (act like they don't want to help you or you are being a bother) and they never have the products I want or need. I guess I want to use the coupons they email to me, though they can never be used on the products I purchase. Today is my final visit after there was no one ready and willing to help. Also, I received wrong information that the products I love could no longer be purchased. I am now online purchasing directly through the makeup company (they do still sell the products) and I'll be going on Ulta.com to purchase my other items or directly to the next company. So frustrating!! Skip shopping here, find another Ulta, or go online directly to the makeup company. I like Ulta, though not this location.

I am in town for a week, and needed a trim. Since I didn't know the stylists, I decided to just walk in without an appointment. Krista took my appointment, and did an amazing trim! She listened carefully, and gave me the exact cut I wanted. I have naturally curly hair, and many stylists just  don't know what they're doing. Krista did an amazing job! The employees in this store were helpful when I asked about a couple different products. Definitely everything I expect from Ulta! I absolutely recommend this store, and especially Krista! Thank you!

I just left the store and normally I would never let any one and all to color match me but after seeing Nathan's make up I knew would be perfect person to color match me not only with his customer service amazing but his make up skill to color match me to a new product was very impressive
Awesome sales and they generally have stock of items on hand at all times!

Always love this place. I wish they had what i was looking for but They're always my main go to for beauty and hair products. It does seem like it's hard to find assistance there for my needs. I have to somewhat wonder around looking for things I want.

This review comes 6 months late, mainly because at the time I was so upset I didn't even want to think about my hair. 

I went in Feb 2014 for a haircut with Sara Dame a hair stylist at Ulta Salon Brandon. I came in with pictures and a very clear idea of what I wanted, which was the haircut Jessica Alba got around the same time, medium length hair in the back and longer in the front. Totally even all around except for obviously the front. What I came out with was extremely short hair that reached the nape of my neck and got progressively longer with the hair at the front reaching just above my collar bone. AKA a bob. Not what I wanted at all, nor resembled the pictures I had shown. Before she cut my hair we discussed how short I wanted it and I honestly thought she was going to stick to that. When I said it was so short she justified that I could still put it into a pony tail... a very low pony tail. She turned me away from the mirror during the whole process so I could not see what she was doing and cut. Then she gave me the absolute worse blow out ever given which she offered to fix with the straightener for extra charge! I was left with puffy, frizzy hair and she twisted up pieces and cut again. My hair was and still is uneven in places. The left side of my hair is longer than the right, it looks choppy and looks like it was cut off with a blade. NO two pieces of my hair are the same length!! Six months later and my hair still looks horrible but is more manageable when curled or waved.. straight hair is a disaster. Do not cut your hair here, idk about the other stylist but I would not after that nightmare. Last time I have ever stepped foot at Ulta.

I love the store Ulta although they run out of stock with some of the products I use. The salon however, is a different story. It took them almost 10 minutes to acknowledge that I was standing there. The stylist in the back saw me but didn't feel the need to come up to me to check me in. 20 mins later the stylist still wasn't there. I wanted to walk out but I need my ends cut bad.

I came here on a whim because my usual salon is closed on Sunday and my hair was in need of TLC and change. I can say that this little place in the back did not disappoint! I wanted to warm up and trim my hair and my stylist did just that. I went darker than my natural hair color and went with a warmer undertone. My stylist listened to me and gave me everything I could have wanted.

I also want to say how great she was because I have curly hair that was terrible because well I don't take care of it during finals lol. She detangled and gave it the love it needed.

On Sundays when I can't go to my salon (I'm loyal) I will be back because this place is definitely worth the cost.
Love having Jamie Fox in the hair salon! Been going for 1.5 years now and she is amazing with red hair!

Today my boyfriend and I went in to  get the Amrezy palette and 35I morphe palette, both of which launched today. We were at this location exactly at 11am. The women opens the door up and allows us in. When we went to the anastasia Beverly Hills section, the palette isn't there. Okay cool, let's check the morphe section. We again find nothing. So I approached the cashier kindly but some other lady was like can I help you with a nasty tone. So I politely ask do you have the amrezy palette in stock and the morphe 355I, the Ulta app stated that  they're both in stock in this store. So she had no idea what I was talking about and then asked another associate who said we've been told to hold them. Excuse me what ???? It says In stock on the app and according to Ulta they're in stock. My boyfriend asked her why she wasn't able to sell it and she gave us a nasty look and shrugged. So my boyfriend and I just Left. We went to another location which sold it too us and then said that's weird why wouldn't they sell it. Theirs no hold. I've decided that even though this is the closet location I will not be going here anymore. No customer service and lack of understanding of new launches. Ulta can do a lot better.

This isn't the usual ulta I shop at but it's not too far out of my way on the way home if I need something. I've never had a great experience here and I've never really been able to get exactly what I went in for. The last time I was here was a perfect example of why I don't like coming to this store. The employees are unfriendly and walk by without acknowledging you, they have a lot of product out of stock, and I can never get anyone to help me find anything..
I left empty handed.

Having moved to Tampa from Los Angeles over 10 years ago, I had the hardest time finding someone who could properly do my hair...until, thankfully, I found Dawn at Ulta! She is just AMAZING! She does my cut and color perfectly! I am so grateful I found her. If you are lucky enough to get an appointment with this fun, talented young woman you will not be disappointed! Thank you, Dawn for doing such a great job and keeping me happily blonde!

I usually avoid Ulta because of low or no service and low or no stock.
But this location surprised me.

I wanted to pick up a few items for a friend, and was happy when someone offered assistance, and they actually had I wanted.

Service was great throughout, and I cannot believe I'm writing this, but I would actually return to this Ulta location.

I like this store because they have a massive variety and carry a lot of cheaper brands that you can only find online, however I'd say the employees are really what's wrong with this store. I went to purchase about $65 worth of items and lady at the register was nice and allowed me to use two separate coupons on the same transaction. I left satisfied and decided to bring my mom with me the next day so she could use the online coupons to buy some christmas gifts. However, the employee at the register told me I wasn't allowed to use more than one coupon. Fine i get it, store policy maybe the girl from the day before was being nice. But when my mother went to a different employee to ring up her items and tried to use the same two coupons I used the day before they told us that we couldn't use both at once. so I told them "hey I used both of these yesterday why can't i use them now?" and her response was "oh the computer physically won't let me do it so I can't". I GET that companies want customers to limit coupons to get the customer to pay more but when an employee straight up lies to your face when I have physical proof that both coupons can be excepted? I don't tolerate that. Get your employees straight.

Great selection of skin and hair care for men and women. It's also a great place to get perfume and fragrances for both. 

The makeup bar has the higher end products like IT, Tarte, and Benefit,  however there is another section for Loreal,  Maybelline and other brands. 

They sent out their 20% off everything coupon , so it was time for me to get those pricier items I normally avoid. Less guilt with a discount.
Horrible customer service and there's always at least 1 thing that I need that they don't have. Selections are limited.

Customer service is HORRIBLE!!!! The lady with the  nasty looking drawn on eyebrows & nose ring is a total B****!  So rude and slow.  I almost said something to her but its just not worth it. She acted like she was Kim K and I was bothering her bc I needed to check out. 4-5 girls working in the store & only one working the register, with a line of customers. Also she said the system was slow.....NO she was a MORON! I will never return. Much rather go to Sephora & deal with mall parking for my makeup. No Thanks!

I am sorry that this review will affect others who work here but this review is for Dawn, who butchered my hair.  I was met by Dawn who was on an emotional high - so high she could not focus on my hair.  We were in early and as other stylists walked in she was loudly describing how they had each been on a wild girls trip and how much fun they had.  Not everyone was as excited as her but I thought that's great - she had fun.  Except she never really stopped talking to everyone.  She would cut some hair and walk away, they cut one or two more clips and walk away..... all to keep talking to other staff.  I noticed she wasn't checking my hair or looking in the mirror, or checking with me so I was ready to take off the cape and walk out because I was getting nervous.  I was honestly a bit intimidated by her antics.  Unfortunately I stayed in my seat.  And then "it" happened.  She grabbed a chunk of hair without looking and took 2 inches off where it shouldn't have come off.  I could see on her face she realized it too.  She spun my chair around and showed me the other side and said I was done. So dishonest! No apology or effort to blend it in.   I was burning up but didn't want to create a scene.  I went to pay and was asked to leave a tip.  I wish I had asked to speak with a manager, but instead I tipped her and left because I was so uncomfortable.  I had a stressful day ahead, I decided not to sweat the "small stuff"  But it has bothered me every day since then that I have a chunk of hair missing because it was more important for her to brag to everyone about her trip than to take care of my hair.  I had to get this off my chest and warn others.  It's time for another cut and I will not be going back - surely management has had opportunities to see this side of her and did nothing?
Came in today and Jeanne dyed and waxed my eyebrows- it was very needed! Thanks again, they look great!

DO NOT GO TO THE HAIR SALON HERE!!!!!
This Ulta has been going downhill for a while. It's always messy and unorganized, there's bins left on the floor in the aisles, the employees on the floor are rude and will point out flaws in your makeup, it's not clean or well kept, the employees seem miserable, and they're always out of stock of popular items. Me and my mom had a terrible experience at the hair salon in particular.
Last year we went to get our hair done here because we've always liked buying makeup at Ulta and figured we would have a good experience. I wanted ombré with platinum ends. My hair was chocolate brown. My hairdresser explained to me she wouldn't be able to get my ends all the way to platinum in one sitting and that I'd have to come back probably one more time. I didn't know anything about bleaching hair at the time but I was okay with it and wanted her to do what she could to get it as blonde as possible. My senior pictures were the next day so I still wanted it to look nice. She asked me if I wanted a solid ombré or this choppy style ombré she had done on other clients. I specifically said solid ombré and had a reference picture. I ended up with an orangey gold, unblended, I don't even know what to call it. I think she tried to do the choppy style ombré with streaks that she had done on other clients when I specifically asked for solid ombré. It looked terrible. There was a line between the brown and the orangey gold. There were parts that were so patchy they looked like hot topic patterned hair extensions. I even showed my hairdresser as she was leaving and she acted like she didn't see anything. My mom's hairdresser saw how bad of a job mine did and ended up blending some parts more with toner for me because my hairdresser left. I don't know what my hairdresser used on my hair but it didn't look good at all. I've seen good hairdressers take brown hair to platinum in one sitting. A few years back I had the same thing done at Fantastic Sam's in Sun City and they got my ends to platinum without major damage, and the ombré was nicely blended. It was much cheaper than Ulta, which ended up being about $200 each for me and my mom. My hairdresser at Ulta could have at least blended it nicely and toned it right.
My mom had a bad experience too. She wanted a balayage and had dark brown, almost black hair. Her hairdresser claimed to be the best colorist at the salon. She ended up taking forever on my mom because she had to strip the box color first, then work on the balayage. She took on another client about halfway through and worked on them both at the same time, which was a problem. She was rushing on my mom's hair and we didn't end up leaving until after 9:00 at night (started around 4:00). She wouldn't even style her hair at the end! My mom had to style it herself and this other hairstylist gave her an attitude when she asked for some hairspray. My mom ended up with red and orange streaks on the back of her head. Needless to say, when we walked out of there we were not happy.
We talked to the manager about the situation afterwards and she wouldn't refund us; instead she offered to "fix" our hair for free on another day. When she did my hair she was really nice and apologetic about it, but I don't think she even did anything but tone my hair because it looked the same, just gray, and the ombré wasn't fixed. My ends eventually faded back to that orangey gold color a week later. My mom's hair looked the same too, just slightly less orange.
This salon doesn't have top notch hairdressers. Don't waste your money here.

I can't say I'm a fan because I only shop here maybe once a year. They have a great "Buy 2 Get 1 Free" sale on hair products. It's a great deal when buying name brand items like Redkin, Matrix, and others. I also like receiving the 20% coupon that is sent out periodically to ultimate reward members. There are many other good deals which is why this store is very popular. 

Unfortunately, I don't go very often because it's so difficult to get in and out of Regency Square because of the traffic situation. Also, I don't think I've ever had any of the sales staff volunteer to assist me with anything. In fact, the staff at the register rarely smile or say much of anything except when asking for your phone number to add your reward points. The service is more friendly at Sephora.

I am highly disappointed with my latest experience at Ulta. It's ridiculous that on a Sunday no one is really working there. I figured I would try out their benefits brow studio as I was told on the phone I could try popping in if I wanted to get them done. Well I did no one was in the section to help me and apparently only one woman works there on sundays despite many chairs and she was out and no one could find her. Usually if a place can get me in even if I have to wait for a bit I will stay and usually means I will buy more because I'm waiting but it was chaos and off putting I'm sorry but if you need your brows done your not waiting a week for an appointment that's absurd. I usually go to sephora anyways, I like this place for its ability to have other things but if you can't pop in and be helped relatively fast with someone whose section it is many people won't ask they will just leave. I probably won't be back unless necessary

Just the rudest staff I've EVER experienced, anywhere. The place was a mess, terrible disorganized. They had testers in wrong places for different brands.  On top of the staff that looks like they wouldn't know the difference between eye shadow and lip gloss, just avoid this one in general. Rude staff. Dirty store. Fitting.
Alisha is the best hair stylist in the universe, and that is, by no means, an exaggeration! I leave every time, looking and feeling like a freaking mermaid!

Luckily the staff actually let you walk around freely without an escort like Sephora, however, when I went to pay I didn't have my wallet and asked if I can give her my card numbers. She said no unless it was an Ulta card. I never had this problem pre-covid anywhere including here. Very condescending and annoying because regency plaza is a nightmare already and having to go back was annoying. There were 12 people in line behind me so I didn't make a stink about it, more like "where the hell is my card?" But if I was alone I would have asked for a manager cause I've been in this pickle in their store before. I guess I just need to be more organized. Two stars still stands, this place sucks and you're better off going anywhere but here

The only ulta around for miles, usually pretty clean inside. Staff is mostly friendly. However I do run into the problem of the store not being stocked on popular items and/or trying to find an associate can be very frustrating. Usually when I find an associate, I have to ask them to check their stock because some will look at the shelf and just tell me there's nothing there without looking in the locker drawers below. Check out lanes do take a while be it the line is long or short with one or two people. Prices are decent but I stick to ulta brand and/or NYX which are heavily shopped in my area. It'd be nice if they kept it stocked on the floor or have backup stock, especially during sales.

I've came here twice in the last 2 months and both times were not that great. I will say both women were very kind but I won't be coming back again.

First Appointment: I got a very basic trim and some layers but the women was very rough on my scalp. I should have said something in the moment when she was parting and brushing my hair (so i take fault for that). I realized when i got home that i had minor cuts on my scalp. 

Second Appointment: I decided i wanted to color my hair and get some highlights along with a minor color correction. The full color is fine but the highlights are thick like Britney Spears from he early 2000's and are warm toned when I obviously have cool toned skin. The picture I showed her is very subtle, cool toned highlights which she said she could do. I paid $200 for this and am very unhappy with the result. I should mention that she was also very rough on my scalp.

I'm not sure how to get any form of a refund.

I got my hair cut here as I've never had a problem getting it done at any other Ulta location I've been to, even in different states. I left with a blow out and my hair looked fine, not usually how it looks but I could tell she didn't add layers like I asked so I figured that was the problem. 20 minutes later when I arrived at home and the blowout had fallen and it looked like she took a weed whacker to my hair. I even went back to have her fix it and it was still so horrible I had to drive to a different location to get my hair cut (since I had been there before and loved it). Will never be going to this location again for salon services, -10/10 do NOT recommend.

If I could leave less than one star, I would! Worst Ulta I have ever shopped in! I'm providing this opinion based on multiple visits. The customer service is terrible! The employees are on some kind of make-up knowledge power trip! Most of them all have the same shitty personality too. I wonder if there is a test or something they all had to fail in order to get hired there. Hmmm...

Made an appointment on a whim to get my hair cut and instantly regretted it. Asked for a shoulder length cut, got that. Asked for the blonde in my hair to be darkened, got that. Asked for the ends to not be so blunt, kind of got that?? Then the stylist said she'd do some face framing which I was okay with.....until she did it. She saw I was looking at the cut and reassured me it was not the cut that was bad but the previous balayage that made it look that way. 

When everything was said and done, she gave me a blowout and somewhat curled it. Needless to say the cut added a good 10+ years on my age. I was speechless and lied about liking it because I'm not one to hurt someone's feelings, so I paid and left.

Awful customer service to the woman who answered the phone to tell me they close at 7 now. Rude with an attitude. Not sure why her day was so bad but if you're going to be a sales associate you should try to make customers want to come in. Should have gotten her name!!

Had gone to someone to get my hair cut and colored for an event and ended up with a horrible chop job. I called and was able to get in with Alisha~ all I can say is thank goodness for happy accidents! Alisha was able to salvage what hair I had left and had me looking myself in no time at all! That was two years ago! Since then, she's consistently done a phenomenal job which is no easy feat with my coarse and wavy hair! She even found creative ways to color and highlight my hair following a major chest surgery so I could feel as normal as possible! I can't remember the last time I had a someone I was able to count on with my hair~ and I truly love the personal connectivity! Thank you Alisha!!!

Mixed bag: got my eyebrows done on a whim here and was disappointed.  They were uneven and not the same "height."  She was very helpful with finding a product my daughter was looking for, though, and went above and beyond to accommodate her needs.  I'll probably shop here again but will never have anything "done."
Always does a great job, never been disappointed with the services. All the stylist are professional and courteous. Highly recommend.

Had a hair and makeup appt in king of Prussia ulta. 2 hours before my appt the salon called to tell me they had to cancel as my stylist to do my makeup and hair got a bad case of vertigo. While the salon was extremely apologetic they did not have a back up or anyone to be able to do both but she was trying to "call around." FAST FORWARD past that annoying incident which pulled me into panic mode- I called ulta in collegeville and immediately Amany Dewes who is a master stylist said come in now and I will take care of you! ALL of the stylists were wonderful and accomadating. Amany- thank you for a wonderful job! I am so happy! Made my day- THIS salon is the one to go to!

I went to Ulta today with a very bad perm, (frizz fest on my head).. looking for advice on what I could do to make it look better. I met with a stylist there named Heather. Heather cut my hair, layered it and straightened it and made it look absolutely beautiful. I would recommend any ladies out there wanting an awesome hair stylist to go see Heather at Ulta.  I went in hating my hair and came out loving it!! Thanks Heather!!

I had a very very complicated exchange that I needed to make at this location. I did not know if we were going to be able to accomplish the exchange, but we did.

I want to take a moment and personally thank the Manager named Heather for doing what she could for me. Thank you Heather, you are the best! I look forward to visiting your location again in the future.
Spent 15 minutes testing fragrance. No one greeted me much less asked me for help. Hope it's not this way all the time.

Don't bother going here.  We made an appt for a haircut.  They were 30 mins late and didn't even bother to apologize or let us know how much longer we had to wait.  We walked out. No one even noticed.

Lauren gave me the worst up-do and hair cut, she ruined my wedding day, I asked her to put clip on extensions because I wanted my hair longer, she put the clip ons and after that cut the extensions and Mu hair, I wanted to leave there crying it was so horrible, please don't go see Lauren. Brianna was great and did my make-up I love her! She saved the day.

Very disappointed with my last two visits, won't be going back :(
Cut, color and highlights $212.00, and I keep my hair very, very short.
My daughter said "what happened to the back of your hair, you look like a calico cat"!! 
The back of my head was all spotty. I couldn't believe they allowed me walk out looking like that after three hours of being there. The last two times my color faded within two weeks.
Great makeup selection when they have it. The ladies are somewhat nice, but they are definitely knowledgeable. I would recommend because it is in a great location and it is perfect for makeup lovers.

Drove 40 min to an eye brow apt to find out the benifits brow girl called out. They said the called me and my answer machine said mail box full, I said that's weird bc I don't have any saved messages, then the story changed to well is this your number and I said no, and they said well that's what we called.... Ulta customer service is horrible to begin with, this is just the icing on the cake for them.
Strange vibe at this store , staff seems uneducated about sales in their store. This has happened on several occasions when I have gone there , and when asked about it they almost seem annoyed .

My sister came here to get her eyebrows done. She's had them waxed many times, without issue. This last time they ripped off her skin on BOTH EYES. What's even better is they tried to blame her, asking if she has dry skin or is using a product that would cause this. After calling the manager they asked if we wanted to reschedule. HAH- good one. Had to ask to get a refund, they had the gall to not immediately offer. If she scars, let's just say, a refund is going to be the LEAST of their worries.

Had a great make up experience with Imani from the salon. She's an artist and takes make up seriously. I felt glam for my event and she couldn't have been nicer. She even did my make up after her hours were over bc my original stylist was sick.

I made an appointment with Lisa. I wanted to dye my hair to plum purple but my hair color wasn't even close to what I wanted. 

She cut my hair good but bummer about the color. I wouldn't return here again for hair dye. 

This place is ok ok. If you want your hair just to cut then this place is good. But if it's dye. Don't, waste money.

Wierd vibe at this store. The stylist in the makeup area never greet me, never ask if I want to sample anything, I bought the devacurl hair care, if you spend $30 you get a free gift. As I waited in line the women before me had bought 2 things, the cashier asks her if she would like a free sample. She offered things like face cream,sun block, lip care etc. I got up in line and get through with my purchase and I asked for the free gift that was advertised all over the devacurl section. She told me no, they are out of the free gift. I asked her if I could have a sample then of what the lady before me got, she told me no, that lady bought basically nothing.. I think this place is rude and I get the "I'm better then you" atmosphere.

Unprofessional especially the General Manager, Kelly. The salon manager after two weeks on site did not have the "tools" to do my hair. She said she couldn't do my hair. Alexis stepped in and made biased comments. When I requested to speak to the GM, Kelly arrived with an attitude so I left. This is a horrid location. Always has been. Don't waste your time or your money.

Do not get your eyebrows done here! Every time I went I would tell here to not make them thin and she would almost wax the entire thing off each time going pencil thin.  The lady whose always there has horrible makeup and overplucked brows that was in style 10 years ago. If that's the style she wants that's fine but don't make your clients look like that.

1 Star is too many. The whole staff is dumb and unqualified to make decisions. Their benefit brow bar privilege should be revoked and whoever works at it will have to pay the price. They are incredibly difficult to reason with and I'm boycotting the place because of it.
Staff could not be LESS knowledgeable and less helpful. Trying to find something in this store could not be more frustrating. Worth the time to drive over to Sephora or Mac.

I just had an awesome facial with Emma. She was super knowledgeable about the products she used and did an amazing job. I would absolutely recommend her for any makeup or skin care needs. I would have bought every product she used if I had the money at the time. My skin looks and feels awesome. Thanks Emma.

Staff is rude and pestering, I know what I want and where to find it when I enter Ulta. If I say No to your help, do not follow me around and keep asking. Also, the cashiers at this location are very rude and as an Ulta customer who uses the app.. I should not have to ask if i have Ulta points to redeem... the cashiers should let that be known upfront. This is not an isolated event, this has happened at multiple locations at Ulta and has taken me many years to finally get to the point that i have no choice but to go online hoping for change. It's not that hard and has been getting worse and worse. I will go to Sephora instead

Hello, I went in to your Collegeville pa store for an appointment to go blonde. I walked out with purple roots, orange banding, balding, loss of hair. I have been coming to the ulta salon for years and had fantastic experience. I decided to try someone new because my usual stylist was booked for the holidays. Not only did the stylist not inform me of my hair falling out (I had to point out the top half of my head was an inch long now) , my scalp is now burned and I went home in tears. This was an absolutely horrible experience and I feel truly violated. I am unsure of what to do moving forward short of shaving my whole head. This just isn't right and I will be scarred for years because of this. DO NOT GO HERE. They will blame the customer for their ignorance.

Okay-let me tell you about my girl, Jenna. She's like this magical hair wizard who can perform miracles. I came in wanting extensions-I lost about 80% of my hair due to illness and my hair was a little below my chin length wise. As far as thickness and color, it was a mess. Of course, I was devastated. I missed my thick blonde hair and was willing to give my right arm to have it back. Now enters Jenna. Not only did she nail the color of the extensions-she placed them so perfectly that you never would have guessed I had extensions in. This is how awesome she is-she picked the color of my extensions before she colored my natural hair and was able to get my natural hair and extensions to match PERFECTLY. Who does that? Literally no one. It was so perfect that I nearly cried while in the chair. She's also the best to talk with and so so sweet. In reality-all the girls at this location are so sweet. Jenna is a hair master, so if you're needing quite literally anything done with your hair, ask for Jenna. I'm SO glad I did.

This place has been a life saver! My daughter had issue after issue with hair and makeup scheduled appointments for prom.  This place totally saved the day and I highly recommend going here for all your beauty needs. We will totally use them next year.

The store is bright and clean. A few displays needed to be restocked as they were empty along with a few shelves. The store staff seemed somewhat knowledgeable, helpful, and friendly. I had called ahead to make sure they had an item in stock because it was sold out online. I was informed it was available without being put on hold. I normally shop online or at the Fashion Mall Commons location, but I'd visit this one again.

We went here for the first time and it literally smelled like a port-a-potty & was very hot in the store. I don't know what was up with that, but it made it unbearable during the visit and we don't really want to go back because of it. Shelves were kinda messy in the hair care areas.

I wear makeup once every two years - I'm going to be in a wedding next week so it's that time again. 
So, as someone who doesn't wear makeup, picking and buying makeup is nauseating to me. Before I came in, a friend recommended some products and told me questions to ask the staff. The staff was so helpful - I think there were four people working and all four asked if I needed help during my visit. And I did. So they were all super helpful pointing me in the right direction, color matching me for foundation, and recommending products. 

I had my toddler with me and noticed upon entry that they don't have carts (understandable for a store that sells mostly very small things) - so my little guy was in his stroller the whole time. When I left, someone grabbed the door for me and I really appreciated it. 

Thanks Avon Ulta!

I went in looking for a particular item they carry. It took a while to find it. No one working asked if I needed help. They seemed to be hanging out with each other. However the cashier checking me out was super sweet. She helped me with my birthday item and was very nice.

Not too impressed by this location. Staff wasn't friendly and a lot of products that I've seen in the Plainfield store was not at this one. Smaller. I wish we could get a damn Morphe store already. Probably won't go back to this location for my MUA needs.

First time that I have been to this location. The store was clean and well lit. I went at a time where it was pretty slow. 

I was able to locate what I was looking for. I saw associates walking around but I was never approached by one. 

I was essentially in and out with no problem.

Visited this store a few days ago. Very impressed with all the products! It's a woman's candy land and also dangerous for my wallet. Lol There were several ladies there who were very helpful and knowledgeable about the products. I was looking for a particular hydrating eye cream that they did not have.
