I scheduled with Arlene, an Elite Stylist who was determined to make a miracle happen for me when I informed her how tired I was of having horrific looking hair. I wanted to get back to my roots (literally) so I could grow it out and focus on helping my curls opposed to color care. Arlene worked on me between her other clients to ensure I was cared for, and was a very colorful person who had more years of experience than I've been alive and a beautiful mess of curls herself so I felt confident in a potentially terrifying process. She gave me lots of good information, and made me feel cared for. She had me come back the next day as my hair hadn't reacted as planned to fix it, and I felt very cared for in the process. In love with my new brunette locks and love that she took extra care to match to my roots and not disrupt the natural hair that had come in. My retail experience was nice as well, I got help from several staff members who helped me shade match the Urban Decay Brow Blade to my new color so I can look sharp tomorrow for work. Everyone here is amazing, and I've heard the new General Manager has been doing a great job helping the staff transition. Will definitely be back and love that it's only a few minutes from home!

I love that I can order online and pickup in store. Very easy process. Store no longer has testers due to covid but staff is available to help and will open items so you can see the color before purchasing. I learned today that you have a 60 day window to also return items if you're unhappy. Which I do have to say they've been very accommodating to me in the past. With no having testers out, it's hard to judge your color so they've allowed returns of foundations and such. Masks required and distancing markers throughout the checkout line area. Right now they are having their Black Friday sales and I've gotten so nice deals!  Some items are but available online for pickup or ship so it's nice to go browse the store for those. 

One feature they have on the app that I discovered today and love is you can scan items in store to view the price and see the color options.  Be sure to join their rewards program as well!!

Messy. Is the first word that comes to mind as I review this particular ULTA. I came here with the intention to look at some new NYX products in store and check out some Vichy skincare items. I walked in & was greeted by a woman at the front desk, I then continued my way through the store. I made it to the NYX section and it was just plain ugly for lack of a better word. There were SEVERAL items missing (do they even do stock check/inventory here?), the display drawers are beat up, colored & drawn on, have used makeup all over them. They were so covered with makeup that when I pulled my hands from the drawers my hands were red from lipstick. Now I know that the staff isn't putting makeup all over the drawers (the customers are) but you would think that the staff would reset the areas and keep them presentable. I can tell this staff doesn't care much about appearance because the other makeup displays/area was completely in disarray. While the staff could have been cleaning up/ organizing on this fairly slow Sunday they were chattering in front with one another. No one even bothered to ask the few customers in the store if they needed help or bothered to greet the people. But there was a very nice & helpful woman who works in the skincare section, she single handedly improved my experience at this store in less than 3 minutes. Other than that this is the messiest ULTA I've ever stepped into and I can't say that I would return.

I am reviewing only one stylist, Kelly, who worked on my daughter's hair. While she is a good stylist, she was VERY disrespectful to me. As a parent who took her 13 year old for a cut, her job was to consistently consult me before doing anything. She dismissed my presence and everything I was saying by repeatedly looking at my daughter for a description of the hairstyle we wanted. My daughter felt VERY uneasy and kept looking at me to save her. 

I am my child's legal guardian and Kelly should have known that without my permission she is not allowed to do a thing to my daughter's hair unless I say so. 


Never going back. This was my second time with her and she was the same. I even tipped her. 
Kelly was just rude. plain and simple. She also started scheduling my daughter's next visit without asking me.
Ugh!

I recently visited the Salon at Ulta for a basic color retouch and trim. I'm new to the area so I was a bit hesitant to start back up with a brand new stylist. I had my appointment with America and she was absolutely wonderful! I am SO happy with the work she did and I will definitely be back. 100% recommend!

Ulta, is a great place to go for all of your beauty needs.  They have a salon on site; and offer several different products to include: perfumes; colognes; facial care; make up; hair care products; and different styling tools.  The staff members are always very helpful and listen to what you need and always seem to recommend the best products.  If you go there; sign up for the Ulta Reward card to get special offers and free products.

I love ulta , great products you can find anything . even the ulta products are great. the staff is very nice unlike Mac where they sometimes want to act like they're better than everyone . It's a great place

This Ulta is literally the worst. I don't know who the hiring manager is, wait.. I've dealt with one of the managers on a separate occasion and well, she was  just as rude and oblivious!
Every single time I walk into this specific Ulta, the customer service representatives are about as rude and unpleasant as it gets. Down right unprofessional, and could care less about making us, the customers feel welcome. Who do these ladies think they are?... making $8 and change as a CUSTOMER SERVICE REP! Get over yourselves. Do your jobs and make the guests feel welcome and help without being distracted. I've had enough encounters with these reps who are completely stuck up and rude. Answer my questions like you actually care about helping, instead of treating me like a nuisance. Your attitudes are disgusting. There's absolutely no reason not to be nice, especially in the field you're in- CUSTOMER SERVICE.

I love Ulta!! But if your careful you will spend the majority of your paycheck and even some of your spouses. They always have what I need for the most part. The bonus points come at the perfect time when you need that little extra discount. Because I'm on there delivery catalog list, I always have an additional 10% or $3.50 off coupon.

My hair stylist America is now at Ulta. I followed her from another salon and I'm glad I did. She is very professional, sweet, and very skilled. I have been very happy with her cuts and she is spot on with color too. It is fun getting hair done at Ulta, it is a bright and positive atmosphere.
So, I highly recommend America at Wesley Chapel Ulta.

This place is a hair and makeup lover's DREAM.

Full of products that range from bargain basics to pricy designer favorites, Ulta has it all... and then some! I was struck by the cute bargain areas too where you could get random items at a fraction of the price.

Moms be forewarned: it's not exactly kid-friendly. As in, the two year old that I brought inside almost tore everything off the shelf with one movement. Definitely be careful and watch your step.

On my most recent visit, I tried to use a coupon to purchase an item for a friend. They refused the coupon saying it didn't apply to that specific item. Turns out, they did accept it on previous visits, just not for me. Le sigh.

I see my stylist Amercia here, she has been my hairstylist for over a year now and is VERY compassionate about what she does. Not only does she always do great styling but her hair cuts always stay beautiful even when grown out and her coloring skills are superb. I just simply won't see anybody else!

This review is purely based on my experience at the salon. I had never been to the salon portion of Ulta but I'm really glad I went. 

I had a botched bang cut with a hair dresser in Clearwater. I asked for side bangs and got what the picture shows.Naturally, I didn't want to go back to her to have her fix it because who knows how those would have turned out. I called ulta because they were the first in the list of salons that could get me in last minute for a good price. 

Christina was the hair dresser available and she did a magnificent job! She wouldn't let me leave her chair until she was satisfied with every strand of hair being in place and made sure I was satisfied. And for only $13!! I wish I would have gone to her first!

It's an awesome place with great staff! I went in to get a free 15-minute eyeshadow makeup session with Savannah and she was FABULOUS! She took her time with me and was very kind and skilled at what she was doing! I appreciate the accommodation and the help with getting my makeup done for a photoshoot. I highly recommend y'all stop in here for whatever makeup, hair, face needs you have. If you're wanted a makeup session, ask for Savannah with Clinique! She's the best!

This is for sure the worst store. **never been into this Ulta before.** It's absolute GARBAGE! The selection is down like 10-20 percent of other Ulta stores. EXTREMELY unorganized it was a mess in there. And all the samples were either missing, empty, or in a different area? They were out of stock for many many products that I was searching for. Morphe, MAC, Maybelline, Too Faced, Tarte. Many NYX products were missing. I really wish I could've bought things but they didn't have anything I was searching for (And they weren't even new products.) just in need of a little restock. I have been to many many Ulta's all over the country, and I was appalled when walking into this one. How do you expect customers to buy products, when there weren't any on the shelves?

I love makeup Which means this is pretty much heaven haha
This is a decent sized store with many good brands. I appreciate the coupons and deals they have (especially the ones in December).
I will say that it's a 50/50 chance on if you'll encounter a friendly employee. Sometimes they are amazing and sometimes they ignore you when you actually need help and act stuck up.
My mother, sister, and I were trying to find our shade in the Tarte shapetape concealer when we noticed two employees leaning on a counter staring at us. Eventually one asked if we were doing okay. I said that we could use some help finding our shade. They both walked away..... What the heck guys? 
Another negative is the fact that they are always out of a lot of the product you go in for.

I wish I could give this location 0 stars. 

Do NOT come to this location. I have religiously gone to Ultas all around Tampa and really- ANY ONE but this one. I went to their salon and asked for a medium, ash blonde right? Well, I got this. A nice mixture of red, pink, and black. Because I'm not usually an aggressive person, I'll let the photo speak for itself. The best part is, they refuse to fix it. The best they'll give me is a ten percent discount on corrections. (Multiple processes- easily a $200 fix) I had to deal with the manager who saw my hair and told me there was nothing she could do. I went to Sally's afterwards absolutely hysterical, and luckily a hairstylist felt so bad for me after seeing my hair that she offered to do it completely for free, and believe me, there were some serious gratitude tears going on. I would've kissed her feet if I could for being such an angel to FIX ULTA'S MESS FOR THEM. Hopefully corporate will give me a refund, dontcha think? Check out the photos below. The first two are my hair; and the third was the "example photo".

UPDATE: The Ulta actually got angry with me for posting to social media after they denied me a refund. Hahaha! Hilarious. I'll stand by other Ultas but after what these guys did to my hair I'll happily drag their name across town. It's super damaged! And red!

The manager of this store is an incompetent fool. I walked in and there was barely any workers on the floor, almost no one to help me. Some lady came after almost half an hour with no help, and she honestly had no idea what she was talking about, I asked if she was a beauty advisor and she said she was the general manager. I didn't catch her name. I could tell by the makeup on her face that she clearly has no clue about makeup..lol. anyways, she was running around like a mad women, and was extremely rude to me while i was speaking to her. It seems she has no employees to help around, which I can fully understand why since the attitude on this woman was horrendous. All other ulta locations are fine, but this one? stay home and save your money

Incompetent is a compliment. Nancy has terminal cancer and just wanted to get her hair done. Reservation made, confirmed, they called yesterday and went over the COVID stuff. We received two (2)!! Confirmation text today. When she arrived today she was told she had no appointment, but stated that the girl that was supposed to be doing her hair was doing a haircut and they could try to squeeze in her 1 1/2 hour appointment. If she didn't have an appointment how do they know who was going to do her hair? How do you squeeze someone with 11/2 hour in when they have no appointment?? Nancy was in tears when I went to pick her up. She had struggled through a pain filled morning to fulfill her appointment but due to the gross incompetence of Ulta it was not meant to be.

The salon is a solid 5. I fist visited the salon because it was recommended to me by a lot of friends. I made an appointment with Nicole and long story short she is a miracle worker. She transformed my red/Orange mess of hair to a beautiful shade I am absolutely in love with. The salon is more expensive than you're in and out Fanatic Sam's type of place. Book your appointment online and you can see the different prices of each stylists. 

The store is self is a consistent hit and miss. For weeks they can be out of a certain product that I have been able to find at drug stores. The store is cluttered and many of their displays (particularly Nyx) are constantly unfilled.

The workers there are hit and miss as well with their knowledge of products. I was looking for makeup brushes and an employee from that department approached me. I told her I was looking for a foundation blending brush and she looked puzzled. I had a brush in my hand and asked her if it was a good choice. Her reply to me was "oh yeah that looks like a foundation brush".... I then asked her if she could recommend a brush for me and she said all of the foundation brushes were good. I've also run into the same problem asking about makeup swatches and concealer. 

Over all it's not an awful store. If you're looking for something particular I would call the store first before heading over to make sure they have the product. They will even save it for you at the counter.
They seem to have a wide variety of products. Staff is usually friendly and ready to help with any questions you may have. Stock is well organized and easily accessible.
This is the worst Ulta EVER! The employees are all super rude and not helpful. I love Ulta, but no longer will be shopping with the company until they clean up who they hire.

This Ulta Beauty is located inside The Grove Shopping Center in Wesley Chapel. 

I came to use a $5 off of a Ulta Beauty purchase of $15 or more coupon I received on a previous visit to this location. Once I entered the door an employee at the register yelled "Welcome" to me while she was checking out another customer. The store is clean and organized. As I walked another the store, staff members were trying to help me and answer any questions I may have had about the products or location of other items. I love the new line of workout makeup products by Ulta Beauty. The mascara, lip stain, and brow gel last the long sweaty runs and lifting sessions. The prices for the products are reasonable when using a coupon or when they are on sale. 

After locating my needed products, I headed to the checkout. They had two registers up and running. The line was up and moving. At the register I handed over my coupon, and she scanned it. The coupon did not work. The cashier read the "rules" and said she did not understand why it was not working. Finally after repeatedly scanning the coupon, she said sorry and did an override to give me the discount. Thank you for  helping.

Located in the Grove Shopping Plaza. I came here to get some make up. The manager was super helpful with helping me match my color for Bare Minerals. She picked up all that I needed, and it was perfect.

Standing in line took the longest. There were three people servicing the front area. They did their best to make sure the line flew as fast as it could.

My friend has been coming here for quite some time and recommended her hairdresser to me. I really like the idea of a free consultation. Unfortunately, their first impression was so bad, that I did not stay for my consultation and doubt that I will be returning.

I arrived 5 minutes before my appointment, checked in, and told the person helping me that it was my first time there. The staff member told me that my stylist was "just finishing up" and asked if I would like to take a look around the store or have a seat. I said that I would like to be seated, but I had to ask where because she failed to show me where and I couldn't identify the seating area. 

As I waited, I noticed one stylist that seemed to be finishing up. However, when she finished, she asked someone else that was waiting to the chair. I was dismayed that this was not my stylist as all of the other stylists did not seem anywhere close to being finished. By this point, it was 10 minutes past my appointment time and I was finally able to catch the attention of someone. This staff member pointed out who my stylist was and said that she would make sure that my stylist knew I was here. The staff member (not my stylist) came back to report that she is "just finishing up." After 5 more minutes, the woman's hair was still so wet, and I was not impressed with how long I had to (and still had to) wait.

I am not sure about you, but "just finishing up" means 5 minutes (10 minutes at most). I went back to the front desk and asked the woman to cancel the appointment, the woman asked if I was sure since my stylist was "just finishing up." My appointment was supposed to be a 30 minute consultation that would have been half over by this point. I know that my consultation was free, and I would have felt differently if this was not my first time there and I had met my stylist before. However, this was a horrible first impression. I felt that my time was not valued--that I was not valued.

I sincerely hope that anyone who goes here as a better experience that I did.

These stars are for my hairdresser, NOT the store. I don't have any interest in coming for makeup, hair products, or having conversations with other people who work here. The cashier looks at you like you are the turd under her heel. That one experience to pickup foundation was a hot mess. I'll drive 10 minutes to the ULTA closer to me for makeup and hair products, but I'll drive 45 minutes to this location and 45 minutes home for Taylor. In 15 years, she is the FIRST hairdresser that I can confidently say, "Surprise me", when I come for an appointment. I've never had that trust with ANY other hairdresser. I'm complimented on my hair everywhere I go. If you want hair that's on point, visit this ULTA for Taylor. Don't waste your time for anything else. 

** The first photo is my hair about 3 weeks after color application. The next is just under 3 months. Being a brunette and constantly using heat and washing every other week or so, I'm blown away at how long these colors lasted. Can't wait for my next appointment!

I love shopping at Ulta and I love this location. 

On my last visit I was in need of makeup and some facial items. I arrived and was greeted promptly. I did ask about the makeup that I use to make sure that I am using the correct kind for my face, and she agreed that it is one of the best items. I also wanted to purchase some facial cleanser and toner, but they were out of the kind that I needed. No biggie; I knew I cold order it online later. I just really needed the foundation. 

My mom, sister, and I walked around the store and found some other good deals on items that we needed and were able to cash out quickly. I love using my Ulta points card when I cash out since I almost always get a discount and/or a free gift!

I come to this location about once a week and honestly i love the stuff they carry but if I'm also being honest the customer service is a hit or miss , Ive only had ONE encounter with someone who actually treated me like a human rather then someone that makes them stop what they are doing and acting like I'm an inconvenience. Everyone is always talking to eachother , no one is asking you did you find everything okay or anything . the last cashier I had ignored me after i mentioned if something was on sell , i said it twice and she just continued to ring me up . I've worked in different types of customer service for over 5 years and I just think this shouldn't be tolerated .

The manager Lynn of the store is very unprofessional in regards to customer service. I went in and bought products and was supposed to receive a promotional gift for the amount that I spent in Ulta. The promotional deal is until the 8th of February. The manager said that they were out and disappeared. Here is food for thought. Take the promotion down. The girl at the cash register had a very nonchalant attitude. You guys lost a valid customer.

I love Ulta!! But if your not careful you will spend the majority of your paycheck and even some of your spouses.  They always have what I need for the most part. The bonus points come at the perfect time when you need that little extra discount. Because I'm on there delivery catalog list, I always have an additional 10% or $3.50 off coupon which can be downloaded on your phone.

Worst experience I've ever had today on Black Friday at Ulta. 11/26/21. I came in to buy Christmas gifts for family and wanted to use KLARNA to check out. The girl told me I had to do it myself on the app and when I was done to let her know. But I explained I've never used it before so I needed help. She didn't look thrilled to help. So I finally get to the point of of checking out and the app is glitching on me... I had pressed "pay with KLARNA" multiple times and it didn't work. Then it would switch up and say "pay with Afterpay" so I tried both. Neither of them were working. So finally I check out but I don't get a confirmation so I was confused and did it again.... And got the confirmation. I show the girl and realize I made an online order to be shipped not for pick up in the store. I was so angry because if she had just helped me the way I needed I could've left the store with my items. Instead she told me I had to call customer service and there wasn't anything they can do. But here's the worst part..... I realized that somehow my old adresss was selected randomly to be my mailing address & I was billed TWICE. I call customer service and they tell me there's nothing they can do and I have to wait for the packages to be shipped and have the packages be refused by the person..... I explained that I wasn't the one who was gonna be receiving the packages and that it's going to a random person. They said there's nothing they can do at that point. Ulta's customer service is the WORST I've ever dealt with in my life. How is it that 5 mins after I ordered something you have my control to change my address???!!! Because of this situation I will NEVER be shopping at Ulta again. I refuse to support a company like this who doesn't care about their customers and has an extremely strict policy.

Came here to browse since the hubs was shopping next door. My daughter and I love us some Ulta. They are recommending face masks for all shoppers and all associates are wearing masks. We did end up finding a face cleansing tool for my daughter that was only $20 that the associate advised was actually really good. She explained that she was looking for one and didn't want to spend a lot. She has this one and is very happy with it. Was very nice of her for the recommendation and we ended up purchasing.

I have been a long time loyal customer. This shop has all my beauty needs in one shop . Thankful to the consultants that work their that can help in a snap . Glamorous makeup, hair accessories, top selling perfume & beauty tools under one roof who could need more . Kamillia helped me find the new look I was going for her expertise and knowledgeable feedback was a life saver . Thanks for all the help . I'll be back soon !

I don't come here often, but when I do, I haven't had a bad experience. The only reason I'm rating it 4 stars instead of 5 is because half the time I come there for a specific reason and they'll be completely out of what I wanted. Also, because the lines take FOREVER to get thru if you go on a weekend. But other than that everyone has always been friendly! Also love the coupons they send for signing up for their rewards, just used my $5 off $10 today!
I love this store! Has all the beauty products you need in one place! Everyone is always friendly. My go to place for all of my beauty needs. Madison was especially helpful and friendly!

So where do I begin. Not only did the cashier make a snarky remark about me using "all of my only $11" to save on my purchase... I was double charged. I went into this store to make a purchase that came up to 231.00 with my "all of $11" savings it totaled up to 219.00. With this transaction specifically I paid $100 on Apple Pay and the remaining balance I paid in cash. When attempting to make the purchase with my Apple Pay at the first register I was told that there were issues with the Apple Pay so I was sent to another register with the same cashier ( I'm assuming she didn't even know what she was doing due to her constant need for assistance). The transaction went through seamlessly, or so I thought. This all took place September 19, 2021. This morning September 21 I logged onto my chase mobile account to see an additional charge of $100 from Ulta, which doesn't even reflect on my Apple Pay transaction. I call customer service to only be told that I have to wait 7 business days to see if the charge will fall off and if not then they can do a follow up. 

All I have to say to this bs is that I'm highly disappointed. I'm an avid shopper, I have shopped at numerous Ultas all over the state. Not once have I received poor customer service and not once have I had the issue of fraudulence. If your cashiers don't want to work or apparently not in the mood to deal with customers send their ass home for the day because they make your store front experience feel like shit

I'm not a big makeup fan so don't expect to see me there for that reason. Ulta is the only place I can find my hair care products in this area. I have naturally curly hair aka frizzy hair. After years of searching for something that would somewhat manage my curls, I found it here. The brand in Ouidad. So, for my curly girl friends, check them out.

I recently had a baby shower and went to Ulta to get my hair and make up done for it. Although the staff were very polite, I absolutely hated how my finished look ended up. My make up looked very cakey and too dramatic. I asked for a more natural look, showing a picture to my makeup artist, and ended up walking out looking like a clown. My hairstylist kept pulling my hair and getting my hair stuck in the curling iron. I asked for a blowout curled look and ended up having a very flat unflattering curled look instead. For the price I paid it definitely was not worth the experience! I do not recommend Ulta for any event that you are looking to get ready for. You are better off doing it yourself.

I had full highlights and a corrective cut. My previous color and cut was with a very expensive and reputable salon in Tampa. Myra at Ulta did a fabulous (better) job in my color and was able to fix my cut. Ask for Myra... I wouldn't have thought Ulta would have a great salon buy they do. Highly recommended.

I've had several stylist do my hair at this ulta. Most do a decent job, however, I will only allow Jason B. to do my hair. He truly is an artist and can make any hair 10/10 glam! He always provides me with top notch service while maintaining the integrity of my hair. He is always willing to try new ideas to deliver my request.
Ulta's customer service is garbage. Such a negative experience. I'll be driving to the Morphe store or shop directly with the brand going forward.

I'm decidedly a fan of the retail aspect of Ulta--I haven't tried their hair/makeup services.

What I like is that they have EVERYTHING.  Go to your local drugstore and you're faced with a plethora of the big name/inexpensive brand choices.  Go to other beauty supply stores and you have your pick of high end beauty merchandise.  Here?  You have it all.  This, I love, because my favorite mascara just happens to be one that can be found almost anywhere.  My favorite tinted moisturizer, on the other hand, is a more exclusive brand of organic makeup that can be difficult to find.  I like being able to get both in one place.  It's a one-stop-shop for all your beauty/makeup/hair necessities. 

I'm a big fan of their Ulta brand liquid hand soap (I haven't purchased a scent that hasn't proved to be fabulous).  Around the holidays, they have a wonderful supply of gift ideas that are sure to stuff your stockings full of loveliness.  They carry Bare Mineral products (yes!).  And, have an impressive array of perfumes in their perfume section.  

The service is a bit spotty and I recommend always checking to make sure you received the sale price you were expecting on all your items before leaving.  It's not like it's a HUGE problem, but has happened enough for me to always check.  

Get to it!

Check your receipt before leaving. Better yet, buy elsewhere. I had a coupon and wanted to try out a new concealer (I hate paying full price for something I may end up not using/liking), and the brand I decided to go with was NOT on the list of preferred brands but I was charged full price anyway. When I talked to a manager she basically said too bad. For $5 they could've kept a customer, but oh well. I found the Pur concealer online for half the price anyway!

I am new to the Boise area so I have been searching for somewhere to get my eyebrows done and it has taken me almost two weeks ! I usually thread but threading reviews I have found are horrible !! So I was scared to try ulta out . I walked staff was very friendly and they had one brow expert there named Taylor , Taylor was very welcoming and reassured me it was going to be okay . Well she not only did my eyebrows very beautifully but she also kept them thick like I asked her too. She totally mapped out my brows and made the arch perfect. Gave Taylor a try!

I'm from out of town, but I really needed a hair cut. I went to Jenni at the salon and she did a great job on my hair! I scheduled with her again and she also highlighted my hair. Both Jenni and Josi were really great, I would definitely recommend them!

Had my makeup done and was not impressed. My makeup artist flitted around the store putting various samples of product on my face. I felt like she was trying to sell me on all the different products. Being in a hurry I didn't have time to listen to why this foundation and that blush were so amazing. The application of my makeup was horrendous, I literally cried when she showed me the finished product. Most of the makeup had to be removed afterwards because it was so heavy and thick, I could not go to my event looking the way I did. I was incredibly disappointed for what I paid and I will never go back there to get my makeup done.

I have such an issue of what happened to me with one of your stores. Extremely poor service topped with outright lies over and over again.  I went to my local store and saw some Whish products on clearance. I purchased some and went home and used them. Loved them and came back for more the next day. I loved them so much, I contacted family in Idaho to see if they could go to their Ulta to purchase for me ( I am in Indiana). My sister said she would and went to the Boise Towne Square Location on Milwaukee. She got there and saw a full shelf of product, (she sent me a pic) but it was not on clearance. I asked her to see if she could get a price check on it. She asked an associate if they could price check it for her. The associate took one to the register and it rang up 1 cent. My sister said the associate looked like a deer in headlights, like something was wrong. She called over her manager (Alicia-spelling might be incorrect) and the manager told my sister that this was incorrect and that the product is no longer for sale. I sister called me and told me this. This did not make sense, so I called the manager myself after my sister had left. She told me that the product is defective and that they were all testers and they can not sell anything. That she has to return it to the manufacturer, that they wont allow her to sell anything. Still, this made no sense. What made sense to me, was this was supposed to be on clearance, this store did not have their act together and have it marked on clearance, and perhaps it was time to get rid of the product.She told me AT THAT Very moment the product was being pulled to send back to the manufacturer.  At this point, there is nothing she or I could do. After that conversation, I reached out to Whish company themselves and wanted to verify this information. Just as I thought, the response I got was that it is up to the STORE, not the manufacturer what they do with the product. They would not be requesting this product back. I let them know that this store is OUTRIGHT refusing to sell it to me, and I believe it is because of a  mistake they were making but did not want to admit to it. I was told again, that this is Ulta's issue and that is had nothing to do with them. My reply was very courteous and informative. My husband decided to call and talk to the manager. He was told that there was NO PRODUCT but some self tanner to be sold. (This is contrary to what she told me and my sister-before she was not allowed to sell anything!) She also said that it was not on clearance and would not be (same thing she told me). My sister came back the next day to see if in fact this was true.  SURE ENOUGH, my sister found shelves of product FOR SALE and ON CLEARANCE! She sent me pics of this as well as the original shelf where she saw the product the day before. This is OBVIOUS they messed up and were correcting what they did not do, all the while lying to me, my husband and my sister. Against my better judgment and giving this store ANY BUSINESS, I had her purchase what I wanted, because I could not get it anywhere else on clearance. That night, my husband called and talked to the manager again. We have both conversations on recording because his phone defaults to this in case we need it for anything. This blows me away...seriously. This manager replied to my husband after he noted that my sister went in and saw shelves on product and on clearance for sale...that it must have been product people returned. She said that she has no idea how that product got there and marked on clearance, because SHE is the one that did what "little" product they had. My husband told her we have pics of the product they have, she said again, she did not know how it got there. She failed to admit that this product was NOT to be sold as originally noted, she did say that perhaps the manufacture sent MORE!!! She said that there was some mixed up information provided to him and me and my sister by someone that thought they knew what was going on. Um...we have only talked to her...so she is blaming someone...but she didnt realize she is ....blaming herself. This is completely unacceptable for anyone to be treated and that she took no responsibility for any of it. I was REFUSED to purchase product (through my sister) and had to come back time and time again to be lied to, JUST LIED TO by your manager.

My best friend, my one year old son and I, walked in looking for new makeup. No one greeted us. I used a uncapped tester, and was ACCUSED OF STEALING WITH MY SON IN MY ARMS by an older looking woman (who worked there) who rolled her eyes at me after I asked where this occurred. My friend also asked for advice for face cleansing masks and was told that she needed special treatment for her skin type, when she didn't even ask about her skin type. She was offended. She then went to a different girl and asked for a good eye cream and the lady was snobbishly short and gave no information on the products. Most poor experience I've ever had at this Ulta. Not a surprise though. Apparently there are more complaints than just mine.

Very friendly customer service, although with my situation (returning an item) it did take a while for additional help to come to the counter.
I purchased a rollerball fragrance online and after only a couple uses the rollerball part broke off completely in the cap. They were kind enough to let me exchange it without the packaging, however next time I'll know better and keep the box for it in case something like this happens again (which would be rare for me). 
Anyways, very friendly customer service just a bit slow when it comes to getting additional help with there's a line

So frustrating!! I went I for the 2 holiday gift sets I wanted- they didn't have either of them.  When I finally found something else they wouldn't honor their coupon "it is a premier product". Sephora you got he back!!!

Carly gave a GREAT PRECISION haircut!!!!! She listened to me and spent a good amount of time at the beginning with a consultation. They use Redkin product (which is what I have always used). Color came out vibrant! I will be back.

Terrible customer service! I spoke with an online rep and they told me I could print out my order confirmation and return it in store. This location would not accept my return because I didn't have the original packing slip or box it came in. They were VERY RUDE and told me that what the online customer service said had nothing to do with them and that it was just too bad and I should keep everything from the package next time if I wanted to return it. I am an Ulta member and that made no difference either.

Just an overall I don't give a shit attitude and it wasn't appreciated. If I knew I was going to dislike the products I bought I would have kept everything but over time if something doesn't perform like it was supposed to then most people would have tossed the packaging too.

I think it's the second, third time I've dealt with a certain tall, blonde associate that is, put simply, quite rude to me.  And not the outright, I don't want to deal with being at my job rude, but rather a, i don't want to deal with the likes of you kind of rude.  This isn't an accusation I make lightly or frequently because firstly, it doesn't happen often and secondly, because I don't give a damn.  But when you're the only gig in town that carries my beloved eye cream (H2O Plus eye mender is great for under eye puffiness, ladies!) when I've forgotten to order it online, I'm forced to deal with you.  So chew back that condescension, I've got money to spend.  And I will never be ashamed to speak Korean in public, don't look at me like I'm crazy.  

Additionally, I had to return an eye cream that I purchased recently because it was the consistency of a balm, and not cream.  I opened up their sample and it was also the consistency of a balm.  Stop hawking old product, guys.

I don't ever have an issue with what I am looking for here. But i don't like how the coupons you get are useless on practically 90% of the store. They don't qualify on any of the prestige brands, which is everything I like.
I have been to their salon and esthetician too. I just had my hair cut by Erin, she took the time to listen to me and I was over all very happy with the end results. The facials are a little awkward. I tried them out only because a friend had recommended them. And they seem to always have openings. They have you wear the velcroed gown but you have to walk around the corner to the bathroom to change, in the store full of people. Thankfully they aren't terribly busy in the back by the restrooms but it's not always just women in the store. The area where you have your facial done isn't fully closed off from the other customers either. So someone shopping the dermalogica line can in fact walk in on you. I'm probably not going to go back for anymore facials but I will go back to Erin for my future hair cuts.

I walked in and spent 20 minutes wondering the store and was not greeted one time. I walked past at least 3 employees and got not one word. Usually their customer service is great but today was just sad. To top it off one of the "beauty advisors" told me the reason no one acknowledged me was because they were busy with the truck. That's not my problem. I'm a paying customer and want good customer service.

I have been in this store a few times for facials and I have to say it is one of the best experiences for not a lot of money. There are multiple facial options from fast a easy to a solid hour. The facial massage was amazing and my skin is in great shape plus she gets your neck and chest too which some chain places don't do. The esthetician (Christy) really tries to make you feel comfortable and does a good job. 

It would be 5 stars but..
I don't like that the area where the facials are done is basically open to the store. Changing is an interesting experience so wear a tube top or tank top. It is uncomfortable knowing that someone could walk around the corner and basically look at you while you lay there although I don't think anyone would be that rude. It would be nice if they completely separated the facial area.

Two weeks ago I was in Boise for our son's wedding. Had no idea where to go for hair and makeup.  Took a chance with Ulta and had a great experience with Mandy. She was very professional and did a great job. Ask for Mandy and you won't be disappointed...Judy.

i love ulta!!!! there selection of makeup and hair products and face products is insane and i love that they carry everything from stuff you can get at drug stores to high end products!!! 
i am curious if anyone has ever used there salon for a hair cut and style????????!!!?? 
im in desperate need of a hair cut and a change and my old hairstylist moved so i do not know where to go because my old hairstylist is the only person who had cut my hair since i was 14 and im 33 now!
Madison gave me a great haircut and coloring. I didn't even come in with a photo, just described what I wanted and she managed to exceed my expectations. I feel great with my new hair.

Josie does my hair in the salon and is freaking amazing. She has very tasteful style and knows how to get you that hairstyle you put on your Pinterest board. Her professional demeanor mixed with her artistic talent and taste leave you in the safest hands when making a big decision with your precious locks. Weather its the best trim you ever had or a total overhaul she is the go to gal!  Seriously you won't be disappointed.

This is by far the worst Ulta I've ever been in, and I usually prefer Ulta to Sephora. They don't have many products. They only had one nude stix item, so shop online if you want something specific. I'm most infuriated that I bought the Kylie skin vitamin c serum and it was shattered. I buy Kylie skin from Ulta and from Kylie's site all the time and have never had this happen, except from the one time I tried the Boise location. Employees should make sure to check any glass bottles before purchases at the register since clearly they don't check their own inventory because their busy talking with each other than caring about their products or customers.

I have avoided this place for quite some time now. Had an unpleasant experience in the past with what I feel was bait and switch on sale items that were "sold out" when I came in on the first day of the sale. I asked an associate about it, and she told me that they only received 20 of those items to actually sell. WHAT? That was over a year ago.  I thought I would give them another chance today... I was looking for a particular perfume "SJP NYC Crush".  Couldn't find it, so I asked an employee who was stocking near the fragrance area; she looked lost and apparently didn't know who Sarah Jessica Parker was (that doesn't matter to me BTW, but the "put off" LOOK on her face spoke volumes).  She said she didn't think they had the "Sarah Jessica whoever thing" (like, what-ever!) and then asked a "manager" about SJP over her communicator, but she never told the manager what the fragrance name was (NYC Crush - I did tell her this while she was asking).  She then replied "Nah, she says we haven't had her for a long time" - done. Didn't show any empathy, didn't offer additional assistance, just put her head down and probably wished I would go away...which I did.  Its the attitude of the staff that turns me off.  No one ever approaches me or acknowledges me when I am in there.  Maybe I am just expecting too much? No, now I realize why I have been spending my money over at SEPHORA...they have exceptional customer service and are very knowledgeable about the products they sell.

Poor customer service in the store.  They weren't busy, whatsoever ... Sunday early afternoon.  No one in line, and I had a question about a product.  The gal behind the desk was busy with her own project, and had no time for me, or answering my question kindly or with any interest ... she just wanted me gone to get back to her underneath the counter and paper in her hands.  I then went back to the product isle and tried to figure it out ... couldn't, so went back to the counter again, hoping another person could help more.  Nope.  They had no clue and the first gal had to step in, again with a snippy, rude attitude and wanted to just have him help me ... he had NO clue how to order anything online.  Management might be interested in knowing I went to another store and spent over a hundred dollars .. and, had great customer service!  Normally ULTA has great help, but not today!

I always take my kid and myself here for a facial. Chrissy is amazing. The girl knows skin care! And she doesn't try to sell you anything which is a big plus. She gets a 5 star. 

What doesn't get a 5 star is the little cubby hole they gave her for facials. Seriously, there's no door, people can just peak in. 

Laurie, I believe she's one of the managers, is also fantastic. Always say hi when you walk into the place. 

I do Ulta. The fact that your rewards comes in cash that you spend at the store is amazeballs. That alone makes me visit Ulta more than Sephora.

Tooba is just amazing she I've been doing my hair for the last two years since I had moved to Idaho. She did a beautiful red color with some rose gold highlights and then she started doing my extensions she did a beautiful job. When I first went there to do the red I was blonde I had to going to another salon in Seattle. I wanted to try something new we did a red color and she didn't like how it looked and asked if I had time to do a correction. It wasn't really a correction she just wanted to make sure the color was perfect like the photo I had shown her. She is honest and after that we had the formula written down and the perfectShades of rose gold and copper and red. If you're in the Boise area I highly recommend that you go see her she is a color expert she really cares about your hair and is really a perfectionist. On top of that she's a great conversationalist and she does all the work herself to make sure that you have a perfect experience. I had even brought my daughter with me one time and she got her a snack and a water bottle and Saturday down in a chairAnd checked up on her. I only was she very accommodating to me and my child she was very kind to her and asked her questions while she was there. Not once did I ever feel like she was distracted or that she I was thinking about another client. If you're in the Boise area I would recommend you go see Tooba!

So my boyfriend and I became inspired by RuPauls drag race to dabble in some makeup, however the process of getting started in makeup is major time overwhelming. We went into Ulta and shuffled around dazzled and confused for a solid 45 minutes and then we asked for some help finally. The sweetest girl, Ellen, helped us and she was so cute and so helpful. All the employees made us feel so comfortable and it was just a great experience overall. We are excited to come back!

I LOVE Ulta! I am not really a girlie girl, but when I am in Ulta I just cannot resist and I end up spending a bit of money. The Ulta on Milwaukee by far is the best store.
I say this because when I go to the one on Eagle I am not able to locate anything I want and the staff ignores the company's promos.
The one on Milwaukee? I always find what I am looking for. I get freebies whether I am aware of them or not. The staff is just mahvolus! There was a Nefertiti eyeshadow collection that I was looking for and two people helped me find it and they were quick!
This place is a good go to for your beauty needs. Why? Because even though they are expensive they are more affordable than say Sephora. Ulta always has some cool offers to!

I have never had a poor experience at Ulta! The staff are always welcoming as soon as anyone walks in the door. They are always smiling and courteous and are always available when/if I have a question. I also have a HUGE compliment for my girl Mandy! I went in for a hair and makeup appointment for a dance show I was in and she made me look so beautiful! She is extremely knowledgeable about the products she uses and is great at conversations! I will always come back to her because her service is absolutely amazing! Thank you Mandy and Ulta staff! (:

Madison did a brow wax and tint for me today. She was so nice, did a great job and I will be back for sure.
I always love going to Ulta, but now I have a real reason to!

Finding make up that is perfect for you is a struggle. (Can I get a witness?!) So I must start this review by saying hats off to Ulta for helping me figure out what works best for me/my skin.

They have consultants who are available to help color match you (#PRAISE), answer questions, and help you find the right products for YOU. A few years ago, it was suggested to me by one of their consultants that I use Bare Minerals. Three years later, and I've never looked back. My skin is very happy with this makeup, plus it wears really well throughout the day! (If you're exploring makeup options, I highly recommend trying out this line.)

Beyond Bare Minerals, they also have a great selection of other products from Too Faced (love their "lip injection extreme" lip plumper), to drug store brands like Loreal (their voluminous mascara is my fave), as well as hair products, and nail polish/utensils.

Added bonus: it feels like they always have some sort of sale going on. Plus, they have an awesome rewards system! I swear, it feels like every time I check out, I'm given an extra 20% off from accruing points from my previous purchases.

I loved Ulta. Great selection of wonderful products at a decent price. As a once avid Ulta shopper I am sad to say that my last experience there was less than pleasant. As I was at the check out counter I asked the cashier if Lancome was no longer being carried by Ulta, the cashier in a very nasty tone said "No we have never carried Lancome" as she continued to ring up my other items, another sales associate told me that this specific branch did not carry Lancome but other Ultas did. Awesome I thought to myself! As the cashier taking care of me was throwing my newly purchased items into my bag I showed her my Ulta rewards card and she rudely said "Why did't you show me this ahead of time? I can't run it. You have to show me ahead of time" I had no problem with not using my reward points but as a once avid Ulta shopper (around 2-3 times a month) I was never told of this process. Since the cashier had such an attitude and such a nasty demeanor I will no longer shop at Ulta. Beware of the older woman cashier with a tad bit too much sun and glasses. She will have nothing nice to say and will be less than pleasant.

Very nice place. Such nice people! Got my makeup done here and it looked great, but my make up did not last for the price that it was. I was very disappointed that my lashes fell off all night and right when I got home from my appointment my makeup was already fading..
They have ALL the hot beauty supplies here that a girl needs.....and then some! Nail polish, a hair salon, makeup, perfume!

This has been my first Ulta beauty store trip and I LOVED IT!
Its bright and super clean and very large with a salon in the back! 

Pablo is one of the sales assistants and he is truly amazing. He is very well educated in cosmetology. I would search for him or ask for him for assistance with anything. He is NOT pushy at all and doesn't force you to purchase the product if you don't want to at the current time but he will educate you on it all.

Went in to buy some makeup.  The girl that was supposed to help me out was more interested in chewing gum than helping me.  Got what I needed and left.  Will be using the one I n Cherry Hill from now on.

I'll admit that I'm a huge Sephora fan , but I did try to give Ulta a chance .. the three times that I went in there and asked for help with picking a product and shade, the employees were not very knowledgeable.. I feel like they need to educate their employees on all of their products.

I went in to get highlights as my previous ones had grown out. $130 later and my hair is DARKER than when I arrived. It appears as though they do not understand what the word highlight means. My hair reeked of hair dye when I left, which makes no sense as I am a natural blonde, so my hair only needed a lift. There are absolutely no noticeable highlights in my hair whatsoever, and everyone keeps asking me if I dyed my hair. 

I would not recommend coming here. They are ridiculously overpriced (I got partial highlights and my total was 130) and have no idea what they are doing. Now I have to pay AGAIN to have another salon perform the same service.

If you are looking to change up your make up routine and you need help, you need to go to this location and see the representative jessie. She is incredibly knowledgeable. I am sitting in work feeling amazing about my skin! She makes honest and highly educated suggestions about products for each specific customer. I purchased a serum and a spray per her recommendation and it has completely changed the way my makeup looks. Great experience at this store, will be back to pick a new concealer soon!

New-ish location in Deptford next to David's Bridal and Old Navy makes this store easily accessible.  The layout is large, clean and bright with a nice selection of salon quality goods.  

There is also a full-service salon located in the back of the store to make this a one stop shop.  The hours are very convenient & the prices are maybe a little above average for the area but still competitive considering the products they use.

My sister went in today with her 3 month old infant in her carrier in a cart. The employee was extremely rude saying no carts were allowed due to COVID. Frustrating since there is a child involved, but understandable. HOWEVER, another employee was standing there without a mask on during this. If you're going to enforce something, be consistent. You can't pick and choose which rules you want to enforce. Rude staff.

Real nice place- very big actually and a big selection.  They carry everything from makeup, hair supplies, nail polish, perfume, and they have a salon in the back.  Very reasonably priced items, and friendly staff- I decided to sign up for an Ulta card; pretty sure you get some sort of free gift your birth month, and I'm all about free stuff.

My girlfriend and my son were kicked out of the store because she was using a mini shopping cart from Home Goods to keep my son in one confined area while she shopped. An associate told her she couldn't have a shopping cart in the store while a lady with a multi terrain stroller barreled through got no grief. I didn't realize that Ulta was doing so well that they could turn away customers and to top it off my girlfriend used to work for Ulta where there was no such policy! Thanks for saving me the money she would've spent there but needless to say WE WILL NEVER VISIT YOUR STORES AND WILL TELL OUR FRIENDS NOT TO EITHER!

Employees act very stuck up and annoyed when you need help finding something. None of the employees are on the same page either. Each one will tell you something different from the one before, if they even acknowledge you at all. I had to ask at the register for help after hopelessly wandering the store without assistance for over 20 minutes. 

One employee was extremely condescending when I asked if they carried the ClarityRX line. She said, "oh is that a drugstore brand? I've never even heard of that."  I hope afterwards she googled the brand, because her skin was pretty rough and could use the help. 

Seems like unless you're dropping $200+++ on the latest trendy makeup, no one in this store cares to help you. Sephora is such a better experience. 

In conclusion, ladies: please stop acting like you're professional makeup artists working for Beyoncé and Rihanna....because you're not, you're in Deptford with the rest of us peasants. Get a grip.

This is probably one of the Ulta's with the worst customer service. 2 times I went to this ulta in one week and the employees are just overall rude.
The first time I let it slide but this has happened twice in one week. I may be young but my money spends the same as anyone else. The first visit, I asked an employee where this certain brand of makeup was she didn't even look at me, didn't say anything to me, and asked another worker to take me there. Seriously? The second time was when all of the workers were in little groups talking and goofing off, I go to a group because I cannot find a single person working by themselves and ask my question and everyone except for 1 person looked at me and just walked away. I think I've met about 2 nice employees at this location.

I went shopping at the location in Deptford, NJ. The store was clean, the products were nicely displayed and the staff were friendly. As it is the holiday season there was a line to check out (which is to be expected) but the cashiers did a great job with checking out customers in a timely matter. 

I don't typically shop here but I will return because most of their products in store are cheaper than if I purchased them elsewhere.
This is a new Ulta that has opened in the past 4 weeks. I'm glad they opened here because its really convenient area and super clean store and great staff. I will reutrn soon

I went to the Ulta salon last night for a balayage with Andrea. She took 2 hours just to apply the bleach on my hair so of course when she was done 2-3 hours later my hair is completely fried. She was a nice girl made me feel at home but she has completely ruined my healthy hair. I am devastated. Please everyone do not go to her for a balayage. Will not be returning to any Ulta location ever again. 

Oh and top it off instead of charging me for a partial balayage she charged me for a full head of highlights.

Wayne Collins is my all time favorite stylist. I've been going to Wayne since 2015 and he never disappoints. His keratin treatments last longer than other stylists and that is because of his meticulous, thorough approach to the process. My hair always looks great when I schedule with Wayne and he is a pleasure to be around.

The customer rep no longer asks if you want to apply your points to purchase. After I was checked out I asked if I had points to use. The rep said it's my responsibility to ask prior to checking out which is completely new to me. I've always been asked. She was reluctant to check and expressed frustration with my question. I had 9 dollars to use and asked to return purchase in order to get 9 dollars applied to purchase as I load up on cosmetics only twice a year and this was a significant purchase. Once I returned and repurchased the amount of points went to 3 dollars because of the purchase/ return. Manager would not honor the original 9 dollars and said it was up to me to notify them that I want to use the money I've earned toward the purchase! I will be purchasing my cosmetics online direct from the manufacturer from now on. This store has lost my business

Went in to purchase some shampoo. It was supposed to be on sale for half price. Got to the register, it rang up incorrectly. They wanted me to walk them to the sign and point to it, which I did. Then we walked back to the register and the checkout girl called her manager over to adjust the price. The manager asked me to show her the sign also. To which I replied, "your cashier just told you what the sign said, and so did I. Do you think we're both lying?" Her reply? Never mind, I'll check myself. Poor employee- your boss doesn't even trust you to read a sign?!?
She then went to the sign and instead of honoring the price, said it was a mistake and they could not help me. Talk about terrible customer service and rude to boot!

The problem I feel with this location is when I return something I get treated like I'm some kind of thief. I returned the Tarte Tartlette eyeshadow palette, I only used maybe a tiny bit of one color, and it would not blend for my life, I used a great base, and tried my Morphe brushes and my make brushes so I returned it. The palette was $48.00 that's a lot of money for something I am not going to use. So I returned it, the girl who rung me up says " your returning all of this"? I said yes just the palette as I did not like it, I then started asking her some questions about which brand has great shadows and she acted like she didn't hear me and I had to wait a very long time for the transaction to be approved by a manager as it was over $40 I basically felt like I was being treated like a thief and it made me feel extremely uncomfortable. Then after I was done the transaction I went back and purchased Benefits porefessional primer and I got the same girl in line & she did not say a word to me at all.it was a very unpleasant experience

OK, I'm a HUGE fan.  The staff is helpful, the selection is awesome and the coupons are the best part!  Sign up for the frequent buyer program.  It costs nothing and they send you coupons!  I just bought an amazing make-up kit for next to nothing and 20% off.  My husband says I've become a make up tramp...I'm ok with this.  The salon and brow bar seem a bit pricey for me but eventually I hope to try both.  All my favorite drugstore and high end make-up in one spot?  YES!!!!!

Walked around for 15 minutes didn't get any help.   Finally found someone who worked looked like she was cleaning so I asked if "we could get some help" her response rudely was "not at the moment, there should be plenty of people to help you"  I was SHOCKED to say the least.  Any time in there I'm welcomed, but god forbid I need help they are nowhere to be found.

Of the many times I've stopped in this ulta to look for something or pick something up, the staff has been really friendly and very helpful if I had any questions. They have some pretty good sales during the holidays and I always managed to find something. Always easy parking. 

The reason why I'm giving this 3 stars is because of their inventory. They are always out of stock of something, never fully stocked, and the products are a mess. Very unorganized. I can rarely ever come in and find something if I'm looking for something in particular. Better off going to cvs or walgreens for the drugstore make up.

It took me months to figure out what Ulta was, and it is a women's dream.  Beats having to drive to the a mall to get high end (and even low end) makeup, toiletries, etc.  Products seem to be priced the same as they would be at Macy's, Sephora, etc.  there is a hair salon in the back of the store and beauty advisors that will apply the products for you in store, which helps a lot when you are trying to pick between the brands that you're not too familiar with and will also give you good tips, which helps the non-beauty experts like myself!   They also have a "frequent shopper" card and you earn points for each dollar you spend to get additional discounts, which is always a plus!

First of all, the people here are absolutely lovely.  The salon folks hooked me up with Tiffany, who gave me an amazing facial.  It was my first facial ever, and I really didn't know what I needed.  Tiffany explained what the different facials did and made a recommendation for my hyper pigmentation and lines.  It was a wonderful relaxing experience, so much that I was ready to fall asleep in the chair!  I did not know a face massage was even a thing you got with a facial, shit changed my life!  The best part was that my face looked amazing after...my lines in my forehead faded, and I was glowing.  I didn't even put on makeup that night.  Thankyou Tiffany!  Can't wait for my Go and Glow on Thursday!

The store has a smaller selection of brands than Sephora, (hence the 4 stars) but I'd go here over Sephora any day.  You still have Tarte, Clinique, UD, and some obscure drugstore brands, not to mention Bareminerals, Pur, and Dermatelogica.  For me, it's all about good people and customer service, and the men and women here make this store what it is-amazing.
Waited in line 10 minutes for gift cards at salon and the man took care of a lady that just walked up . Take my business elsewhere...
The staff are so friendly and willing to help you with any needs. I am in love with the ulta brand it is affordable yet at a high quality product!

Although I prefer being able to get all brands @ Sephora, this is my frequent go to for items due to location.

Made an appointment before hand because I wanted some help & had questions.  Nobody could find my appointment & put me with someone from the Brow Bar who pushed lots of Benefit items on me.  

Seems hit or miss with service recently at this location.  Guess changes in Managers.....I spent a ridiculous amount of $ loading up on everything I was out of.  Had to exchange some items only to find out that their was special upcoming events for one of the lines I purchased 4 products from.  Also, never received one sample after spending so much $.  Think I'll stick to the experts & only stop in when I have to.  Sad, service use to be great here.

Meynor at the Benefit Brow Bar is the best! He always does a great job in waxing my eyebrows. If you're going for full, bushy eyebrows, then you must book an appointment with him. I always leave Ulta feeling satisfied. Too bad he said he's moving back to California this April. I hope they hire someone who is as good and friendly as he is. I've been wanting to try their facial because I heard Tiffany is very good and is almost always booked. Can someone please leave a review on the Dermalogica facials? I'd love to hear about them.

I have been to many salons and seen many stylists, but I can genuinely say that I am willing to drive over an hour each way just to see Britt at Ulta because she gives me the absolute best experience. Highly recommend her!!

I've stopped in the Ulta at Clearwater Mall numerous times and they are always out of the Bare Minerals foundation that I use. I stopped in yesterday to grab a few other non-Bare Mineral items in order to save myself a trip to Macy's and they actually had it in stock, but their systems were down and they couldn't process my transaction. I understand stuff happens, but I've never been able to purchase what I need there. It's not even worth going, just go north a few exits and hit up Macy's. Same prices, better selection, better service.

Ulta is my go to for makeup, hair supplies and perfume.  The points rack up so you can splurge on yourself.  I go to Shantelle for my hair.  She is great.  Always leave her chair feeling like a new woman.

After moving from Chicago, and no longer having those awesome boutique brands at my fingertips at Marshall Fields, I started wondering, "What's a girl to do?!' Enter Ulta.

They have everything. There is just no other way to put it. Smashbox. Urban Decay. Tarte. And the 'Ulta' brand is awesome for trying out new styles or looks as they are decent quality and super low priced. Plus, they have regular sales that make their name brand products $1-$6. Crazy talk. 

Styling equipment, travel size perfumes, every shape application sponge. I could go on. But you should just go. And sign up for their club. Freebies GALORE!!!

This Ulta is very small, and not very organized. I couldn't find anything that I wanted, plus the make-up selection was minimal. I rarely go to Ulta anyways, but If I do then I'll make the drive to the one in Tampa.

Thomisa is awesome! (Sorry if I spelled her name wrong) 
She asked me what I wanted and gave me exactly it! I would definitely recommend her if going to this ulta's salon!

I went to the salon at Ulta in Clearwater for the first time this week, for a hair cut and style with Thomesa. She did an AMAZING job. I usually struggle to articulate exactly what I'm looking for in a haircut, but she totally got what I was going for, and gave me the perfect haircut. I definitely will be coming back. 
I also like this salon because they have many options for appointment hours. I work a late shift, so it was nice to easily book an appointment online at a time that worked for me, even if it was late evening.

It's Ulta, they should call it the ultimate!  All the brands you want in one location!  The rewards program is pretty nice too!  You can never go wrong with giving an Ulta gift card as a present either!

The customer services on the floor are so bad and most of the ulta employees does not have any experience on the product. I rather Google the products and look up on the reviews.....Hey manger/supervisor why don't you give your employees a quiz on a products every 3 months...

Brittany Cooper in the hair salon is wonderful!  She has been doing my hair for several years now.  She is a master colorist/stylist and will always steer you to the right choice for your hair!  You can't go wrong with her!

Great product selection. Jessica is a very attentive, smart and talented stylist who has high-end technical skills; she listens to my concerns, and cuts/styles my very-difficult hair into a totally manageable state... I'm always getting compliments on her work.

Love me some Ulta! Everything you need under one roof. That's the way to shop! 
Salon is terrific too! Very talented stylists there. Do yourself a favor, and give them a try!
The retail side feels short staffed at times, but hey, it's retail. Payroll budgets being what they are.... These folks do the best they can with what they are given. It's not the stores fault...they ALWAYS try to help even when they get overwhelmed with guests. Cut them some slack, and check it out. You'll be glad you did.

Meynor at the Benefit Brow Bar is the best! He always does a great job in waxing my eyebrows. If you're going for full, bushy eyebrows, then you must book an appointment with him. I always leave Ulta feeling satisfied. Too bad he said he's moving back to California this April. I hope they hire someone who is as good and friendly as he is.

Went in to re-stock on some items and also looked for some new products.

Staff knowledge and application was hit and miss at different counters.  Some had very limited knowledge or couldn't even put the product on.

However, I was very happy to have someone assist me throughout all my purchases and not leave me fumbling around trying to find my way.

One disappointing aspect...the staff is not knowledgeable on all promotions, etc.  I would recommend that you do your own research online before entering the store.  Also, if you are in need of a sample to test prior to purchase look elsewhere.  The staff has told me "just purchase it and return if it doesn't work".

I am used to Sephora, with way more selection. This was my first time in here, and I really expected unique and hard to find items, not basically CVS under a different name! 
So many perfumes they didn't carry. The idea of a salon in the back is really sort of weird too.
Only plus was CLARISONICS in the back with a nice selection of replacement heads.

Would I come back? Only if I really had to.

My mother decided to stop in to Pick up a small pallet of urban decay makeup another makeup artist who was a older lady came up to her to ask if she would like to see some make up that didn't age her. After being insulted she graciously said no thank you she knew what she was looking for and the older makeup artist made another snotty remark and turned to grab another client. You would think some one working in the beauty industry would have poise but obviously has none and lacks any respect for another. I am discussed by this treat meant this makeup artist only cares about a commission or reaching some kind of a number to hit a goal. Obviously she does not care about the reputation on the store or the brand she was representing. If your looking to purchase makeup in this area I would look into Sephora or MAC makeup as the makeup artist don't just see you as a commission.

I went here on a Saturday and it was sort of busy. I was looking for makeup brushes. On the right side is a brush display but all the brushes are mixed up and I couldn't find what I wanted. One of the makeup girls asked if she could help & I mentioned the mess. She just said "that's what you get with self serve." I grabbed a $50 brush kit that I thought I might like and walked around looking at the rest of the store. On the left side of the store is the "cheaper" makeup and the have more brushes and makeup supplies. I ended up buying a bunch of EcoTool brushes (I had read good review for these) for about $35 and I was able to choose the ones I wanted. 

They also had a huge amount of NYX makeup. A less expensive brand that a lot of YouTube tutorial makeup artists use. I ended up buying some brightly pigmented powders and some fun liquid liners.

I really hate false advertising. I had an offer for 20% off of nail lacquer in-store at any Ulta and when I tried to by nail lacquer the cashier said she know's nothing about the promotion and can't help me. A long ride in traffic, time to pick my colors and time waiting in their long checkout line with only 1 cashier for nothing. I'm heading to Sally Beauty across the street instead.  Perhaps they should train their employees on the promos and not hire employees who act like they don't have time to figure out how to enter that promo in the computer. See the offer that I had for Mother's Day weekend that the refused to honor in the uploaded photos.

Super friendly customer service. Everything nice and neat. However, I was looking to purchase a foundation and when I opened them to see if anyone else had opened to swatch it, they were all opened. So I ended up not being able to get a clean bottle of foundation.

Out of all the Ulta locations in the bay area this one is my favorite! The staff is just amazing and helpful without being overbearing. You know how some beauty store harass you to buy something super expensive, you won't experience that at this location. If you ask for help someone is always there to help you with a smile. The best part about this location is the selection, they always have popular brands in stock and everything is super organized and clean. The only downside is that they put more staff members on the floor than at the register so check out time can be a little long and sometimes annoying but that depends on the day and time you go.Other than the occasional long lines I never have any issues at this location.

Messy, over priced and horrible customer service. I was given a lotion as part of a gift and wanted to return it . I had no receipt but, the website says if you do not have a receipt you will get store credit. The person working the register said the item I was returning came up as $0.00 , meaning since someone in one of the Ulta stores has received the item for free I could not get store credit. This made no sense and contradicted their website policy. I left the store and returned shortly to suggest the cashier look up the phone number of the person who gave me the lotion since I had no receipt. As I was in line, the same cashier had a customer in the same predicament and suggested to her that they look up the phone number since she did not have a receipt. This should have been an option for me but never was given as one. I'm not sure why anyone would shop the items can be purchased elsewhere for much cheaper.

I have been to the store a few times and each time that I go I am never greeted with a "welcome to our store" by anyone. But listen as they greet others walking in the store after me.  While I'm in the store no one ever approaches to ask if they can help me, even when I'm wondering around as if I'm looking for something I can't find.(But I see clerks asking others if they can help them find something).  When I get to the checkout, i'm usually greeted with attitude even if I smile and say hello! (That makes me sad, it's just a common courtesy to say hello)  I believe my money spends and helps this business thrive just like the next person's dollar!  If businesses continue to hire people who can't control their personal opinions of others to do their job and don't correct the issues when they see there are bad reviews (not just one or two) that's an issue in it's self!  I fretted over giving this review because I typically hate giving bad reviews!  However, my last experience in the store made it the last time for me to enter the store! Since I am not welcome, neither is my money!  There are many more places where I can purchase the same items... where they appreciate both me and my dollars! I hope they pay attention to some of what is being said in these type of reviews (not just mine) and correct the issues for others who may be feeling like me. However, I'm done.

So far The worst Ulta Beauty store I have been at. They don't greet and they don't offer any assistance. I was looking for a shampoo and conditioner but wasn't sure which one would help me to restore my hair. I saw some staff walking by me but they even didn't try to ask me if I needed anything. Very disappointed in Ulta Beauty. This place should be about assisting people to find their beauty but not ignoring them!

I'm so glad to have an ULTA on my side of town. It is a solidly stocked store...you can find your "drugstore" makeup items, as well as a selection of designer brands. I do wish the staff were a bit more helpful...the couple of times I've been in the store I have been greeted at the door, but after that I haven't had anyone offer to help me find something (even when I've been standing in one of the sections for an extended period of time).
