They were all so nice and I really appreciate them being so cautious with infection prevention.

Step 1: Book a haircut with Vincent. Step 2: Watch him work his magic. When in need of an awesome haircut, repeat Step 1! 

Vincent is an awesome stylist and such a great spirit!  It's always great to sit in his chair and watch him translate what I want into an awesome style.  I've had a hard time finding a good stylist to just keep up my haircut since moving to Indianapolis and I come here about once every 6 weeks to get a trim and Vincent does a great job! 

Come check him out!

Ulta Beauty Salon transformed my platinum blonde hair into a total disgusting rainbow colored swamp disaster. It was supposed to be a total blonde appointment which their professional completely ruined and damaged my already platinum hair. Supposed to be a root touch up not swamp throw up. Totally disgusting. Steer clear of the salon for hair color services.  https://youtu.be/vYUo7B5jq_M

My favorite store to get cosmetics and other items.

The employees here are really helpful and friendly.  The store is enormous and is 3 floors.  The girls that work there are happy to help you and direct you to the products you are looking for.

Large selection of items compared to other Ultas I have been too.  Of course, they let you use any coupon you pull up on your phone.

John swept me off the floor.. Gave me an amazing color service and the best cut of my life. I highly recommend and can't wait to come back to my next appointment. He even recommended the best products to use. I also was in and out in under two hours   Picked up my favorite Tarte mascara. And had fab customer service

This store is so horrible and ghetto!!! Don't go to this location unless you want horrible service!!! The cashier Arielle was an ignorant B-I-t-c-h I had a gift card ... I swiped twice and the computer said not completed... so she looked at me and said swipe again (looking irritated ) it said not completed so she looked up and said would you like to use a different form of payment..( very rudely ) ... obviously if I'm standing here swiping this card no I want to use this card ..so I handed her the card and she said "what u want me to do throw it away?" Ummmmmmm no I'm handing it to u so u can figure out what is wrong ... then she said there's no money on it ..I said call the manager and then the manager came and I handed her the card and she typed something in handed me back the card and I swiped and it worked... the girl didn't apologize or anything instead she handed me my merchandise and said have a nice day didn't make eye contact ( rudely) and I left .... never again will I return to this store ... I love ulta but this location was a horrid experience

My roommate and I decided to try this brow bar after reading the reviews. We went to Dianna like recommended and wasn't disappointed. She did a fantastic job. We were both very pleased with the results definitely going back.

Ulta in City center is just around the corner where I live, so its easy to shop there. I love beauty things and spend a lot of money on it. I have visit the store about 20 times, now I have finally decided to never go back again. The staff is extremely rude, ignorant and fake. There is a guy upstairs which is very friendly and cute. But the girls in the check out is the worst service I have ever met. From now Sephora have a new loyal customer!

Well, this Ulta is usually my favorite place in the world. Until tonight I would have given it 5 stars. 

The Benefit team are fantastic. Most of the reason I have shopped at Ulta for years. I won't let anyone else near my eyebrows. 

The general staff are usually pretty inattentive, or too chatty amongst themselves, unless you're looking for a specific recommendation, then they are hit or miss. I guess if I think about it, the products I love are the ones I pick myself, and the ones I try on and return were sold to me. 

Stay away from representatives selling mineral makeup. 

We all know and acknowledge that mineral skincare and cosmetic products are fantastic. But their sales people must be facing hard times, because once they have your attention, they will show no mercy. To the extent that they will follow you to the register to make sure you buy the items you have now been carrying for them. And then you'll get home with 5 different red lip sticks, because you originally were asking for help choosing one, and instead you got a full makeover and an eyeliner pencil and a lip thing and a bronzer and the first 4 lipsticks you were thinking about, and never got to make a decision on. And I genuinely liked this woman, I just wish she would have treated me more like her daughter and less like her meal ticket. 

If you're anything like me, you might go home feeling like you want to return it all tomorrow out of principle. That kind of aggressive sales pulled out on passive, indecisive customers who only came to make a return in the first place is so uncomfortable. I feel violated and taken advantage of, all because of the search for the perfect red lipstick. Oh, to be a woman in this world.

Danni did an amazing job with my brows!!! I've been to a lot of Benefit Brow Bars, but my experience at this location has been the best yet! Compared to most other Benefit workers who've touched my brows, Danni made sure to explain everything she was doing. She took her time to map, wax, trim, and pluck, and she gave me tons of useful advice on growing back my brows to make them thicker, fuller, and more even. I've already planned my next visit to have Danni retouch my brows. I definitely can't wait for her to help me reshape them!

I went to Ulta to receive a makeup application for my prom night. Prior to the night of prom I scheduled an appointment and called the day of to check if the time was still good. They said yes and I came in ten minutes before my appointment. Ten minutes after they were STILL looking for the person who was supposed to do my makeup. I got this lady named Kelly.
DO NOT GET KELLY. She seemed to know what she was doing at first because she got all these lovely products to put on my face, but when I looked in the mirror half way through I almost cried. My eyeshadow connected to my eyebrows, and my eyebrows were uneven. She concealed under my eyes but then began to place grey on my inner corners, instead of white, and it smeared down to under my eyes making me look half dead! Not only that but the eyeliner was horrendous. I wanted a winged cat eye look and she tried to do that with an eyeliner pencil. The winged look was dull and not clean or straight. I had to take out my own liquid eyeliner to show her how i wanted it done. She simply replied with, "I could have done that if you told me". Since my eyes were dark i wanted a more subtle lip color and she picked out hot pink gloss. HOT PINK. Is that subtle? No. My makeup was horrible. Everyone but her knew it. Even the other employees that walked near me were staring at me awkwardly. I even pin pointed one employee out. I told Kelly that I wanted my eyeliner like the other employee, and she still failed to do it! When it came time to pay they charged me for the eyeliner they used on me when i had to FIX it with my OWN eyeliner. The service was terrible. Do NOT get KELLY.

If you find yourself standing outside Ulta wondering if you should go in and browse, do yourself a favor and walk the 2 extra blocks to Sephora. Yes, Ulta has a wider selection of lower end products, but their service is atrocious. I have tried this store 3 times now, and every time I have been disappointed. The employees are not only unhelpful, they are out right rude. It is really unfortunate because it is a beautiful store and a great location.

I have been here a few times and it's a more upper scale place.  the staff was very vice and kind. They have everything from foundation to make up and lipstick. You can easily browse all the products. They also have perfume.

I originally went to get my hair done last Thursday. I wanted to get my hair blonder than the color I originally had. As much as the stylist tried, it just didn't work out and I ended up with a darker color than I wanted. The following day, I received a call from the Salon Manager - Jon. After some discussion, he offered to fix my hair. 

I went back to the salon a day later and received VIP treatment! It was amazing and my hair is absolutely gorgeous. The color is perfect! A very special thank you to Jon!!!! He was an absolute sweetheart and is very talented. Another special thank you to the nail technician - Hann (I know I'm butchering her name. Sorry :( ). She did an awesome job on my nails. And another special thank you to the manager - Aviva. Great customer service!  I am one very happy customer and will definitely be returning to the salon!!!!!!

I love shopping here. There is a huge variety of products and brands. I always walk in only intending to buy one item and end up purchasing a lot more. They employees are great and the Benefit Brow Bar is amazing.

This Ulta is great! The store is big and well lit, and the staff is helpful and knowledgeable. 

Leah, the salon manager, is funny, personable and talented. She shaped my thick South Asian hair into something smooth and manageable, and gave me lots of  product recommendations. At one point, she even passed the hair dryer over to me and walked me through the motions so I could re-create a blowout by myself at home. 

I've also gotten a facial with Katie, who was very gentle but effective. My sensitive, acne prone skin was calm and refreshed.

I'll definitely be back often!

The products are great.  I would rather go here to buy my drugstore products than a Pharmacy.  They almost always have a 20% or $3.50 off $10 coupon.  Great deal!

Main floor are higher end makeup products and downstairs is the drugstore hall.  They cary a great amount of NYX products and is much more likely to be in stock than say Nordstrom Rack.  With the coupon? Sold!  Second floor are higher end hair products, including Paul Mitchell and their beauty salon bar. 

The service...it's hit or miss.  Whenever I ask for a product or a brand, they say it's on "___" floor.  I end up going back and forth 2-3 times asking someone where exactly it is.  Most of the employees don't even know what exact products Ulta carries, which is really a shame.  I asked if they had Vinylux nail polish and they sent me to the drugstore area.  Hold up, they obviously have no idea what this is because it certainly is not a drugstore product.  Then they said, well then look behind the cash register (right where they were standing and no they didn't turn around to help look)....I tried.... No luck.  The second time I come back, there it is! Hidden behind an open service door in the way corner.  Finally.  By the way, did I just say that they cary Vinylux?  The best and longest lasting nail polish ever!  And it is not that horrid gel formula that ruins your nails.  

Sign on to their Ulta member card for the coupons and your free birthday gift.  

Find products on your own and your golden.
Love this salon team! All gifted, Stephanie leads a diverse team of talented individuals. Stephanie is my go to for color and cuts but I have seen all of them work and I would trust any of them.

Ron is SO great. He's the nicest and gives wonderful recommends wonderful things.
(They also got rid of the girl who gave me a terrible manicure)
Dianna is the best! I'll never let anyone else touch my eyebrows. The $20 is totally worth it and you only need to go once a month or so.

Love love love this salon! Steph is the go to for all things blonde. She's made me gray, lavender, platinum, anything I ask for, she delivers. I'm almost afraid to write this review because I want her all to myself! A very comfortable location to uber to then go shopping. Just blocks away from Nordstrom Rack, amazing restaurants and the subway. Don't try driving here, my favorite thing to do while getting my hair done is watch people get tickets or towed! Very unforgiving street for such!

Fair price for the service I get, superior results and great location.

I love shopping at Ulta, however I will never come back to the Ulta store here.

My friend and I went to this Ulta, because she's looking to replace her old Origin's moisturizer. She asked one of the woman that works there (with dark brown curly hair) if she can recommend her any good facial moisturizer that's kinda similar to Origin's. That woman rudely answered her "No we don't have that brand here." My friend already know they don't carry Origins in Ulta, she was asking for a recommendation for something Similar. So my friend was like "oh I just want to know if Ulta carry something like the Origin's Moisturizer." And that woman Yelled at my friend...yes she Yelled at my friend sooooooooo loud even I was shocked. I was scared. That woman was like "NO!!!" 

I've worked in the customer service industry for years. You should Never..never ever ever Yelled at a customer so loud that everyone at the store can hear you. I thought that woman was possessed or something, like seriously why yelled so loud like that? I was like no way! The manager needs to know about this. But my friend was like just forget it. And this one other worker felt bad that she yelled at my friend, and she asked my friend if she can show her around at the moisturizers that Ulta has and see if any of them would interest her.

I will never come back to this Ulta. I am afraid of that woman. She is scary...no normal person would just scream so loud at her job for something so small unless she has psychological issue.

I have never seen a sales staff so bad. With a full line and only two registers, the check out girls just walked away for a while. Finally got to the front and the two associates at the register just stopped and chatted for a while. My check out person just dropped my bag in the counter and said "next!"  I'll just go to Sephora next time.

I had a great experience at Ulta. Vee was my stylist and she was great! She took her time, gave me a fantastic cut and did a great blow out. I've done my own hair a couple of times since, and styled or unstyled, it looks great. I would highly recommend her as she is wonderful! I'm definitely going back to her when it is time for another cut.

Just had my brows shaped and tinted and they look great!  Also had my lashes done and they look extremely natural.  Ebony was so helpful, patient and a very talented cosmetologist.  I didn't walk out feeling I broke the bank but instead got a big bang for my buck!  It was a fun time in Philly's freezing temps.   I would definitely go back and request Ebony.

I had my brows waxed by Cassidy on Saturday after making an appointment a few hours before. She was really sweet and took plenty of time to find out what I wanted my brows to look like before getting started. I haven't had my brows professionally done in years after so many bad experiences and I'm so happy I went for it. It's definitely worth the money and I would 100% go back. She even took the time to give me pointers on how to fill in my brows and what products to use. My only minor complaint was that the brow bar is right at the front entrance and on a cold January day we were both uncomfortably cold whenever someone entered the store.

I highly recommend going here, I would also suggest calling ahead for an appointment to make sure you don't have to wait.

Ulta, you always make me smile! 

I love that Ulta has now come to center city - of course, that comes with some growing pains, but when the staff weren't sure of how to proceed with an issue I had the manager stepped in and was AMAZING! She just fixed everything in an instant, giving me peace of mind and feeling warm and fuzzy about my Ulta experience - this is customer service at it's best. Ulta has earned my loyalty, and for anyone who has has dealt with bad customer service/unfriendly staff at other beauty stores, switch to Ulta!

Ugh. So I hate to give bad reviews. I work downtown and needed to get my eyebrows done during my lunch break. I usually go to another brow bar closer to where I live. So I figured I was in good hands. I had Dionada and she was very sweet and professional. However, as I was walking back to my office my eyebrow began to really hurt. When I got back to my desk, I noticed she had burned me. Not only that, she got wax in my hair. I had made a future appointment when I was there with her but will most likely cancel due to seeing the results at my desk.

Why in the bloody hell did the security guard follow me around while I shopped? It's annoying.  The products are great so i'll try another location if that turns out bad I think I'll stick with Sephora.

So I have never ever written a yelp review, but my experience on Saturday was so great that I felt compelled to share.

I usually have a fear of larger "chain" salons, as I've typically not had great experiences. I have long, straight, blonde hair that I just began highlighting about a year ago. I have noticed that my hair gets a really yellow/brassy tone every time, even though I always explain to the stylist what I like (cooler, more ashy blonde tones.)

I thought I would just be stuck with golden hair, until this weekend. I had a coupon from Ulta for a salon service, and thought I would give it a try. I booked an appt with Scott, and don't think I will ever let someone else color my hair ever again. He knew exactly what I wanted and wouldn't stop until I left the salon happy. I could tell even when my hair was wet that all the brassiness was gone!! He even recommended products to help me maintain my new hair, which I have subsequently ordered. Furthermore, he was incredibly personable and my two hours in the chair flew by with great conversation. He even gave me some great restaurant/nightlife suggestions, which I appreciate since I'm new to the city.

The rest of the salon employees were very nice, and kept offering magazines/refreshments. I don't find the downstairs store employees particularly friendly, but LOVED my salon experience and have already booked my next appointment. Make an appointment with Scott, you wont regret it!!

Dianna is by far the best I've found for a brow wax in center city and at $20, I'd say she's a bargain. Schedule an appointment though, she books up quick and walk-ins are hard to come by. Definitely worth it though!
Not so friendly staff but this is the only Ulta in center city location so I still go... I'd rather order online.

$20 for a brow wax might seem a little crazy, but when your brows end up looking like they do when Dianna is finished with them, it's worth the extra cash.

I have very fine brows, so I usually self-maintain - but I'm unable to recreate the shape and arch that Dianna is able to achieve.  She is extremely meticulous - starts with wax, trims them with scissors if necessary, and finishes with tweezers to catch any stray hairs.  She will also fill your brows back in with Benefit products and will add concealer to hide the inevitable redness that happens when you get a wax.  

Definitely make an appointment - she is ALWAYS busy when I walk in.  She is usually running a little late, but I can't even be mad about it because you can't rush good brows.

Ive given this location 3 stars for a reason. I've been visiting this store on a regular basis since December 2015. Great location, have always found what I wanted and have received great assistance via the phone. Discovered NYX products here and now am a total fan however it still has several issues that need to be addressed. I will tell you that every time that I walk in I notice the employees are usually chatting with each other. I have never felt " special " here. I have always had to look for whatever I wanted by myself. Thank God I'm capable of doing that however how about those individuals who need assistance? 

This place is the best when it comes to offering sales/discounts on products. Have made out like a bandit when NYX offers sales and would recommend this place to buy those products that you would normally purchase at the drug store.

Pros: Ulta is a great addition to the neighborhood. With frequent sales/coupons, you can pick up a nice mix of low-end cheapies and higher-end products, generally at a better price than you would find at the drug stores or Sephora, respectively. They also have a wider variety of brands/products than the other stores.

Cons: I haven't found the floor staff or cashiers to be particularly friendly or helpful -- in fact, I'm not sure any of them have ever even asked if I needed something on ANY of my trips there. If you ask a question, they give a curt answer which 50% of the time is "I don't know." Not awesome. 

I also wish they had a better return policy and offered more samples like Sephora does.

The Salon: LOVE! I've had a variety of services here, with several different staffers and been very happy each time. Pricing is on par or a little cheaper than the local salons, staff is friendly, and they know their stuff. They also don't hard-sell you on products, which I expect whenever a salon is located in store. 

If they can get the uninterested sales help to perk up and at least pretend to care, this would be one of my favorite stores in the city.

I recently got my hair done by john at the ulta salon in center city, I love my hair! My hair is amazing I couldn't have been happier, not to mention that the salon is beautiful and everyone who works there was so nice and helpful. John is definitely a great stylist, if your looking for a new stylist don't hesitate, go to ulta and ask for John!

This place is a little tricky to review because I think it 100% depends on the aesthetician that you get. In my case, I am writing about Dianna, who I made an appointment with after a recommendation from a friend of a friend. I was flustered and running a couple minutes late to my appointment and called the store to let them know. The woman on the phone didn't seem to care and said that Dianna was with another customer anyways. However, when I got there (10 minutes late), she was still with that same customer and didn't finish up for at least 10 minutes more. I guess I am just glad I didn't show up on time?

I rarely get my brows waxed anymore because they're really not that out-of-control (I am a natural blonde with fine hair). But, I did this as a treat for the first time in two years. Dianna suggested a tint as well as the wax, but was not pushy about it. I decided to go for it and I am glad I did. Everything else was great- I loved Dianna's personality, and she is someone that you don't mind being all up in your face (some waxing services can be a tad awkward). The end result was great- nothing unimagined or crazy, but my brows look clean and fresh. I'll be back, hopefully before two more years go by.

I had received a $10 off coupon for the Brow Bar when I had purchased a Benefit gift set around the holidays and had been waiting to use it until my brows had grown in a little so there was more to work with. I happened to stop in Ulta one Sunday afternoon to pick up a few things and noticed the Brow Bar wasn't currently servicing a client so I asked if she had an opening by chance. She was able to take me right then which was a plus. However, she didn't ask me any questions about the shape that I wanted, instead if I had tried any Benefit brow products before (which I had). The actual waxing job was fine, and the fill was OK, but I noticed when I got home that she had missed some hairs that I then plucked myself. If I hadn't had that coupon I would have been more disappointed, but I only had to pay $12 instead of $22 so it was acceptable. I likely won't be returning though, because I can get a much quicker and better eyebrow wax at my nail salon.

I think this franchise cosmetic supply has better prices than Sephora. I like their varieties. I agree with some reviewers that customer service assistance is not so great. I am a customer and will continue to buy.

Very nice reps on an empty July 4 store.
The "high-end" stuff is on the main floor while the drugstore, clearance and "ulta-brand" is in the basement. Very clean and organized, very easy to navigate and find brands. The bad thing is that the basement doesn't have service so it's hard to find stuff online if you want to google a product or price.

This would be my frequently visited make-up store if I reside here.

This review is specifically for Kelly and her lovely co-worker this week in THE SALON...I called last minute to get in for a root color, I live out of town, was in for vacation and couldn't take the gray anymore. They were able to take me at the time I asked for and worked as a team to make it happen. Kelly was easy to talk to, talented, and I appreciated her laid back but professional demeanor. Not pushy at all, and listened to everything I said and delivered what I asked for. My gray is hard to cover and she got it PERFECT. I don't know the other stylist who was working that day but she helped out by giving me the BEST shampoo I ever received. A huge thank you to these ladies, definitely recommend them. The price is ridiculously reasonable, I only had to pay 62$ and it INCULDED a blow dry which is hard to come by in more high end salons these days. THANK YOU THANK YOU!

I came to check out Ulta because there was a specific Nyx eyeshadow that I wanted. I started by browsing the first floor of high-end products and I was struck by how products were not arranged to encourage or even allow customers to test products. Maybe I'm biased as a frequent Sephora customer but I expected to be able to try high-end cosmetics before buying them. Unlike Sephora, there were no applicators or makeup remover set out, and half of the products didn't have a tester available. I also got dirty looks from staff every time I touched something, and at one point a security guard started following me around as if he thought I was going to try and steal something! I had on my professional work clothes and my purse was closed, so I have no idea why he would go through so much trouble to make me, the customer, feel uncomfortable. On top of that, floor staff was incredibly unhelpful - not only did they seem unfriendly, they also were not knowledgeable about the products at all. I ended up going downstairs, picking up only the eyeshadow I came for, and then making a bee-line for the check-out counter. If this is their business model I do not see how it could possibly be successful. 

Bottom line: Unless there's one particular item that you definitely intend to buy and nothing else, go to Sephora where you can browse at your leisure and test out a product or get helpful advice about it before you put down your money.

The fact that Dianna isn't there anymore, I don't find a reason to come to Ulta! She's now located at Sun Myst and more talented than ever. My eyebrows looked like Chewbacca having a fight with a cactus and she made it look fabulous.

ULTA has never been a favorite place of mine, due to its employees never caring or just watching you walk around, having to make you approach them rather than asking whether you needed help or not. They're always gossiping or huddled in groups, like they're not at work.

I prefer going to Sephora, unless ULTA changes its management, I won't go there for my makeup needs. All the good employees they've stupidly fired or let go.


Anywho, if you ever need your eyebrows to be shaped or want to feel like a goddess, make sure you head to Sun Myst and ask for Dianna!

This is a review for the retail side of Ulta and not the salon.  I only stop into Ulta maybe once every two months, so maybe it's just my bad luck. While the first floor/high-end cosmetics floor is well organized, the bottom floor containing more common brands (Revlon, L'Oreal, NYX etc.) needs some attention. Shelves are a bit disheveled and there are a lot of empty spaces everywhere. Does nobody restock products or is it a matter of once it's gone that's it? The NYX lipstick display had 1/3 of the lipsticks missing or just misplaced. The same for the nail polish section. And it's always like that when I stop in. It's too frustrating to bother making a stop there. Hey Ulta folks: head over to Sephora to see how to do it right.

Dianna is absolutely the best!  I'm not sure how I didn't know about her sooner, but I somehow stumbled upon her reviews here on Yelp and decided to give her a chance.  I have gone to her a few times now and my brows always look amazing! I'm very critical about my brows because I have had horrible things done before, but she is now the only person I will let touch my eyebrows!  Trust Dianna and use her!

FINALLY Philly has an Ulta! Since the day Sephora opened, I have been complaining that we don't also have an Ulta, more so since Sephora stopped selling Laura Gellar. And even more so since I realized it's freaking hard to find NYX in the city. 

Now that Ulta is here, I have to find a new first world problem. Sigh.

This location is a three-story flagship location which includes a salon on the top floor and a Benefit brow bar. You'll find prestige brands on the ground floor and drug store brands downstairs. There's a great selection of everything, including a wall full of OPI and Essie polishes, the full line of EcoTool and Japonesque brushes, makeup cases, tools, you name it.

Staff seems friendly. They're there to help if you have questions, but don't get in your face if you just want to browse.

Like Sephora, Ulta has a display of impulse buys near the registers, so you can spend even more money than you planned.

I do have one gripe. While I was trying to remove makeup swipes from my hand with alcohol because it was the only option, someone handed me a bottle of eye makeup remover. It was very nice of her, but why wasn't there a bottle of makeup remover available to begin with?

I wanted to visit this location three times before I can make a formal review and the third trip definitely over ruled any judgments I made from the first two visits. I was completely thrown off when I was looking at the Naked 3 palette when one of the ladies came up to me with a nasty tone and told me it's $52, "don't touch it if you're not going to buy it." Excuse me? Mind you, I just stepped foot in the door and I didn't even have time to decide what I really wanted. To make the experience more uncomfortable, I was being hawked at with daggers thrown at me the whole time. Very pathetic and I was offered no assistance the whole time, not that I really wanted it from any of the nasty ladies there anyway. After spending a grand total of over $200 from this Ulta location, I will certainly never return again and it's a shame because I actually did enjoy spending a few of my hard earned money at this beauty retailer the first and second time.

I went there earlier today to do a skin treatment in the salon. I have had already booked an appointment online. When I went Maggie was putting makeup on someone else so she finished her eye makeup and got one of the other ladies to complete her makeup.
She was so professional and nice! It was my first time there so she got me to fill a paper about health/skincare/medication .. Etc. She took me through every step and explained what she was using and why she was using it. She has a magical soothing touch!! I felt so relaxed and my skin feels so fresh, clean and hydrated!
I will certainly be going back soon.

This Ulta is amazing! If you think any ol' Ulta in the suburbs is good you'll LOVE this one! It is humongous with its two stories and very well stocked. Also, the staff is super knowledgeable about both higher end and drugstore quality products. I love the organization of this place and how they have both high end and drugstore brand products.

This review (my first ever on any website) is for John Smith, who has cut & styled my hair several times now. He consistently makes my hair look beautiful! I'm very particular about my hair. So the first time I went to him, I provided pictures and gave details as to what level of maintenance that I want, how I wanted it to fall, etc. He listened and then used his hairstyling genius to make it even better! I continue to go back to him because the hairstyle he gives me continues to look good as it grows, which I haven't found in my previous hairstylist. Now, I trust him that I only say what length, sit and let him do his scissor magic :) Talent aside, he also has a great chair-side manner!

The three stars are for Jasmine on the hair floor who deserves 10 stars. She is educated on the products and knows hair types, tool materials and all the tips/tricks for any purchase. Other than Jasmine, unsure I will return. It is not just messy but dirty, there never seems to be anyone available for questions on any of the floors and the shelves are very disorganized. Nonetheless it is conveniently located for that quick Ulta stop but if you have time possibly try Sephora on Chestnut.

DISCLAIMER: This review is exclusively based on an interaction with one horrible employee. I have previously had great experiences at this Ulta and other Ulta locations, but today was so bad I felt compelled to share. 

I had been wanting to try a new NYX foundation after a bunch of my friends have been raving about it. Ulta is the only place I knew sold it. It has been selling out like crazy, so Ive been checking in a few times a week on my way home from work to check it out. When it kept not being in the store, I considered ordering it online but decided i really wanted to test it first to determine which was the right shade for me, as that really depends on the product. I was thrilled to arrive at the store today and see that they had all 8 shades available!! Sadly, there was no tester available for the one shade i really wanted to try. Since there were testers for the 7 other shades, I decided to ask an Ulta employee if they maybe had a tester in the back I could try before committing to the purchase.

I walked upstairs, and approached an employee (her name was Taren or Taryn, not sure about the spelling.) Before I could even finish asking her about the tester. she put her hand to stop me from speaking, and begin telling me that they no longer leave testers for this product because they kept getting stolen. Now, this may very well be true, but seems unlikely to me as there were testers available for EVERY other shade, and testers available
for wayyyy more expensive and higher end products. When I went to make this point to her she again put her hand up and said, "let me finish." At this point, I was embarrassed and upset about how dismissive she was being so I said, "Dont worry about it, I can tell Im inconveniencing you", to which she abruptly turned and walked away.

Upset, I went to the register and asked the girl (who was very sweet and empathetic) if there was a manager available to speak with. As luck would have it, Taryn walked over and said she was the only available manager, to which I replied "Nevermind." She then laughed about it right in front if me, as if it were so funny that there was no other manager available to speak with. I was visibly
upset and she stood there and laughed. I immediately left empty handed and disappointed.

I would like to say that Ulta customer service has handled the situation appropriately, and this is much more about the individual than the store or the brand. I really hope that this manager improves her customer service skills as well as her basic respect for other humans. She may have been having a bad day, but she was truly heinous and it makes me nervous to think of encountering her should I shop at this location again.

Diatribe over.
Highly recommend facials here with Katie! The best facials I've had. She's very attentive and makes my skin look glowing. Very reasonably priced and they use dermatologica products.

Finally Philly catches up with the rest of the civilized world and gets an Ulta. What's next? Transit cards? Maybe not. But they do have an Ulta.

This Ulta is divided into three stories but it's one really beautiful store. Nicer than the ones in the burbs and even the snottiest, well-heeled New Yorkers would feel right at home with the fixtures they chose. And Ulta seems to have crammed in a lot of merchandise for having such a small footprint, as the selection was very good. 

Granted I am no Mr. Know-It-All for beauty products but this Ulta had what I was looking for and saved me a trip to the mall. Now that's worth something!

I returned a lotion that I purchased over the weekend. I realized that it was the wrong one when I arrived home. When I returned to the store few days later to return the product, the cashier took it out of the box, and sampled some on her hand. It appeared as if she was making sure I had returned the bottle with the original contents. It was a crappy thing to experience during a return, and made me feel as if she was accusing me of emptying out the bottle and filling it with something else. Do people really do that?! Never had this experience before when returning a product anywhere, so I will not be shopping at Ulta again. It was really unprofessional and disrespectful to the customer. They have lost me as a customer.

I decided to try the brow bar at Ulta after reading all of the positive yelp reviews. I was attending a formal event and having my makeup done (not at Ulta) for the event so I thought it would be great to get my brows done prior to getting my makeup done.  I scheduled an appointment 7 days in advance, I left work early the day of the appointment, I arrived for my 5pm appointment and was told to have a seat.  I was then told that Diana was not in that day, i was immediately p*ssed off since this was planned in advance and there wasn't time for me to find someone else. Also, they had my number and could have called me to tell me that she wasn't in.  There were two Ulta employees there, one was trying to be helpful but the other seemed upset at the fact that I was upset. They also let me know that Diana told 'her regulars' that she wouldn't be in that day.

I don't care how good Diana is, she's not professional and the lack of customer service is appalling. This would have been my first time patronizing an Ulta but needless to say I took my money and business elsewhere. No to Ulta, No to Benefit cosmetics, No to Diana

Yikes. Any Ulta is a better Ulta than this location--I've experienced way better service, even when out of a product...Also, good luck trying to navigate through this one. I have to resort to coming here since it's walking distance from me..Someone said this location was Ghetto, and that couldn't be truer​. I ordered some makeup online that came broken, so I came here to return. Luckily​, online indicated this store was in stock​ with the product. There were only two people working the register, so the line wasn't getting any shorter. The girl 'helping' me was doing anything other than that. It's not that she was rude, but I was the one who kept apologizing to her!? For some reason whatever I ordered online wasn't matching up to the in-store​ system? I mean I don't know why it wasn't matching up, I don't work at Ulta. She kept telling me 'this isn't on your invoice' 'do you have another invoice, this isn't the right order' 'are you sure you got this from here' 'i don't know what to tell you' ect.ect..um call a manager..i don't know what to tell YOU? I've given you my phone #, the invoice, I've even shown​ you my order through my email on my phone..what else do you want from me? This isn't my first rodeo with returning at Ulta, when you give them your number they see every thing you've bought?...finally someone else helped me and what do you know, I walked out with the exchange. Like what did she think? I made it all up? Okay, for real though, she should have been apologizing to me, and do you think I got one? Instead, ​I felt like I was doing something wrong.

I was kicking myself when I forgot to pop over to Ulta at home in Jersey last weekend, as I had run out of my giant one-liter bottles of Paul Mitchell shampoo/body wash. Thankfully, there's an Ulta in Philly, and the folks who work here are so nice! There's a Benefit Brow Bar right by the front door, and a hair salon up on the second floor. Unfortunately with the promo they're running this week, they had sold out of the giant bottles of my brand/type of shampoo, but one of the sales people helped me find a comparable product that they use in the salon.

New store is pretty but staff is laughable. Some strawberry blonde chick with heavy eye liner behind the counter should not be employed by any retailer. I asked her opinion on a lip bomb and her response was "I mean, I don't use it" than she completely turned away and went right back to her conversation with another employee. Super annoying considering it was the first time I stepped foot in there. Definitely the last. 

Isn't ur title "sales person" your terrible at your job.

got an amazing platinum blonde from Scott. He is so great. He was super friendly and funny and understood exactly what i wanted, and told me he would quit until loved it! and he came through 100%. i came in with a bad brassy and uneven home bleach job. in a matter of hours he corrected it and lifted me to a gorgeous white blonde, which is what i originally was attempting. he made me feel really comfortable and said i could come back in the next few days if i wanted something tweaked, but it was honestly perfect. he knows so much about all the process and made sure my hair had as little damage as possible. it feels and looks great. Scott is the best!!

I went into Ulta to get my make-up done for a wedding last week. Cathy did my make-up & it was such a great experience! She was super nice, informed me of all the products she was using, and did an amazing job. It was great to see someone so happy at work doing what they love! I usually purchase things from MAC, but because of Cathy I will now be going to Ulta!!

I've never been in Ulta so I was excited to check it out today. I went in with my husband and began to browse. We're both 29 but look younger.  Soon a security officer started following us around the store! Sure I was touching products to check them out - but isnt that the point of shopping? It was so uncomfortable that we just left - even though I really needed some shampoo and other products. 

None of the staff said "hello" and it was a very cold, unwelcoming environment. Maybe their staff should go check out the customer service from Lush and Apple to learn a few tips about not profiling based off of age, race, and/or ethnicity (I see many other reviews regarding this issue there).

Today was my birthday shopping trip. You lost out Ulta and I won't be back.

I will never understand why some sales associates or any person holding a position in customer service have horrible attitudes. It's almost like some of the employees are actively trying to be rude and unhelpful. The kindest person I spoke to there was the security guard. Ulta-I love you. I really really do, BUT please someone needs to re-train the employees at this location.

Just left this store and customer service does not exist. There were 10 employees on the floor, 3 putting on make-up and the others just chatting. Only 1 cashier. Went downstairs to find my product and there was not one employee on the floor. When I found my product and wanted to pay....Only one cashier and all the other employees just around. Very poor customer service and too many employees just doing nothing, besides putting on make-up.

So glad ULTA has finally come to Philly! The store is absolutely gorgeous...so well laid out, and such a wide variety of products. The employees are extremely nice and friendly. Such a pleasure to shop there. And they often offer awesome coupons, so sign up for the mailing list!

I really love this store. The manager is such a sweetheart. When I went in looking for a new skin care regimen he knew exactly what to recommend (Travel size sampler set of Mario Badescu) and I wound up going back to buy the full sizes of everything. I'm also obsessed with Diana at the Benefit Brow Bar. It's not cheap but she is the best and since going to her for the past 6 or 7 months I refuse to go anywhere else in fear that they may mess up my perfect eyebrows. 

The selection of makeup is not inferior to Sephora at least from my perspective as they always have everything I'm looking for. They also have a large selection of lower prices makeup, fragrances, and hair products. 

I think this is a great store!

I love this place. My pockets however, do not. First of all, they offer you beverages... Coffee, water, etc. Second of all, the setup is so chic and clean, I feel like my hair/nails are in the best care. The stylists are very talented and wonderful. You definitely pay for comfort here!

I know that from what I've read, a common theme I keep seeing with Ulta in general is rudeness of the staff, but I've never had any problems at all when I've gone there, & I go there quite alot. I've always been greeted & asked if I need help, & when I say no and that I'm just looking, they leave me be, which I like-I hate it in cosmetic places when the sales people are constantly up your rear end,& is the reason I avoid department store counters, I always feel so awkward when I'm just browsing or swatching or can't make up my mind & need time to think. I like that they have a large selection of brands, anywhere from high-end to drugstore brands, & they have a huge selection of NYX, which I like because the only other place near me that sells that brand usually is picked clean of their items, & either way doesn't have as big of a selection. And their selection of Urban Decay is actually slightly larger than the Sephora down the road, which is important to me because that's one of my favorite brands. They also have alot of sales on their brand & the drugstore brands. The reason I'm not giving 5 stars though is because sometimes it seems to take them a bit to restock some of the really popular items-like last 3 times I was there they still didn't have anymore Naked 3 or Lorac Pro palettes, which are very popular items. No biggie because there are other places nearby that do, but I just prefer to do one-stop shopping if I can.

Bethany is great!! She is in the process of fixing a disaster created by another stylist in Fishtown a few months back. She has been patient and gradually changes/touches up uneven/unnatural parts of my hair that were utterly destroyed. My wedding is in 2 months and I began seeing her in August. She has a vision and a plan for how to fix my hair in time for the wedding without using unnecessary chemicals. I totally trust her and her professional ability to ask, listen and careful craft what I envision. You won't be sorry if you book an appointment with her!

Scott did an AMAZING job on my highlights. Definitely request him, especially for balayage, I love how it turned out! He made me feel super comfortable (it was my first time dyeing my hair) and was easy to talk to. Not only is he a pro at what he's doing, but he genuinely cares about making you look good and will go out of his way to get you the look you want. 10/10 would recommend!

I just left this store! And I am very disappointed there were at least 1 customer in the store and 5 sales associAte and nobody even bothered to assist me!! They were too busy chit chatting and gossiping nonsense things!! It so tacky and unprofessional!! One sales associated was too busy putting her lipstick when I asked her something! I love this store but today I am very disappointed!!!! Even there store manager was busy laughing and chit chatting!!!

Stephanie @ Ulta Salon!!! AMAZING!   I coveted the hair I have now for over two years.  No one could ever get it right so I settled.  Not only did Stephanie nail it the first time, she was patient, she listened and didn't give up till it was right.  
I would recommend her to anyone, the cut was precise and color was spot on. 
Everyone was extremely professional.  If haven't tried this salon, do it!  You won't regret it!
The best brow wax that I have ever EVER had.  The brow artist there will truly make you see your face in a new light. Go now!

It's great that Philly has an Ulta, and I'm happy with the  variety of products they carry and the layout of the store. Like many previous reviewers though, my issue is with customer service. It seems like every time I go in, there's a backed-up line to check out, with one person handling it all (often rudely), while 3 or 4 other sales people stand around and chit-chat. I find the counter people to be rude at worst, and abrupt at best. Hello, please and thank you go a long way. Ulta, please send your Philly staff to charm school - otherwise, it's off to Sephora I go, where the sales staff are much nicer.

There's only one Ulta store in New York City and it's located ALL the way in Rego Park so you can imagine my excitement to see an Ulta in Philly.

The staff was friendly and asked if I needed help, which I didn't since I was just browsing. I like that each floor was dedicated to certain products. There was so much to see that I felt a bit overwhelmed, but in the end I bought myself a new foundation and a Macademia Oil, hair product. I wish the staff had been a bit more helpful, however, when I went to the other floors.

Get an appointment with Diana. She's the best at shaping eyebrows. I have mentioned in other reviews where I say that I do not let many people work with my eyebrows. But once I saw the eyebrows of a coworker of mine, decided to give The Brow Bar a chance. Have been there twice and Diana has done a great job. She can take her time or can be very quick. At the end, she's super confident and makes sure that you leave happy. Highly recommend.

I'm upgrading my review to 5 stars instead of 4 based on the helpfulness of the salesgirls and stylists upstairs.  I often come in or call with hair questions and they always answer them willingly and thoroughly, with lots of attention and knowledge of various products.  

I'm a fan of Redken, Living Proof and now Kevin Murphy but I'm not sure that they carry KM, anyways, I always seem to find what I'm looking for, it's fun to browse here and there are good deals here!  I feel like the prices are a little cheaper than Sephora and competitive with Beans.  Among my purchases are a steam roller set which produced gorgeous curls, a CHI professional dryer which was a Christmas present, I can hardly wait to use it!  

I haven't had any services done here as I am quite happy with my current stylist.  That being said, I think it's $37 or $38 for a blowout so I might give it a try someday.  I recently signed up for the UltaMate Rewards Card, I'm excited to earn double points in their store and online!!

It's unfortunate they don't train their security guard on the make up. He seemed more concerned about my presence in the store than any of the employees. I was standing in the store for 10 minutes, literally right next to an employee waiting for their attention, and she blatantly looked right over me and helped someone else. Another customer was standing near me and said "I wonder who works here" I said out loud "I have been wondering the same since no one else is on the floor are paying attention". Someone helped another employees leave the store by checking her bag, stares me right in the face, and also proceeded to pass right by me and help the customer who was waiting for attention after me. I work retail, I understand being exhausted from the insane BS we put up with, but to blatantly ignore someone looking for help to purchase something is mind blowing. Have your security guard worry about people who are actually trying to steal, and teach your reps to actively engage with customers and at least feel noticed.

The lady that did my brows had a major attitude problem. The cashier was expecting me to tip by constantly asking: "do you want to leave a tip?" I constantly said no but she was annoying me. I just wanted my receipt so I just tipped a dollar even though I shouldn't have. She did a crappy job on my eyebrows. All she did was just draw on them. I just discovered Aisha's after this experience and they're better and cheaper.

I have to give myself rules about how often I'm allowed to go to Ulta. I am completely incapable of getting out of there spending less than $60 and I don't even wear makeup except for special occasions.

My confession is that I'm a skincare and haircare junkie. High-end toners, lotions, conditioners, tonics, you name it I love it. I hate myself for it a little bit because I managed to content myself with drugstore buys for the first 26 years of my life, but when I turned 27 I realized that grownup ladies need to take great care of their skin so they don't look like old ladies before their time.

Of course, the most simple step of always wearing sunscreen still eludes me...

Pro tip: best cotton cleansing pads ever are on the lower level, and great travel-size versions of salon-quality hair products are on the top floor.

I liked this Ulta. I've only been here a few times, and haven't stayed too long on both occasions but I've found the staff to be helpful. I made 2 returns with ease and was able to get there and leave relatively quickly each time. Psst... there's a checkout line in the basement, in addition to drug store brand makeup.  I went to the Sephora close by and it was elbow to elbow. Overall, I prefer the spaciness of this store, since it has 3 floors.

Normally I buy my make up at Sephora and spend good money over there every year. But every once in a blue moon Sephora wont have a particular brand and Ulta usually will. I went in today for a NYX lipliner, I went downstairs and 1/3 of their lipliners were out of stock. Apparently I'm not the first to mention this problem. I was looking for the shade "Brown" so you'd think they'd have such a simple shade in stock, but no. I know in Sephora they keep extra stock below the shelves but Ulta doesnt have that so I went looking for someone (I was on the lower level) and there wasnt one person working down there despite there being atleast 10 customers downstairs and it being a Saturday afternoon. I waited to see if someone would appear but nope, no salespeople. I went to the counter downstairs and no one, customers were just walking behind the counter. Several of us were looking around for somebody. I gave up, went upstairs, and ended up getting a different lipliner with another company for $20 when I went in there for a $3 NYX lipliner. I shouldnt have to hunt down people who work there. They're on every corner of the store in Sephora, always asking if you need help and are so cheerful. In Ulta I felt like I was on my own and most of the employees couldnt give a crap. Though I will say the one girl who helped me find a replacement lipliner was nice. But I wont be back unless its necessary.

Every time I go here, the staff is beyond rude. The salon also isn't so fabulous. I had gotten my nails done and the polish peeled off the next day. I went back to see if they could fix my nails and was turned away.

Every time I stop in here for a wax, no one is working the brow bar. It's really disappointing! Ulta and benefit changed things about a year ago so that walk-ins would be easier to come by... well, they're definitely not easy to come by when no one is working! Sucks, because it's hands down my favorite wax.

Updated review because as awful as the manager below is--is as off the charts STELLAR as the district manager who called me the next day . She was amazing . I still can't change my stars (yet) because the first experience was beyond the pale , but I hope this prompts a change .


How do you spell "worst customer ever ?"
"C-A-R-M-E-N."
Went in with my Mom today to treat her to some nice perfume and dr Brandt 's eye depuffer.
We were pointed to the "back of the store "
We were clearly looking around as 2 women talked amongst themselves --both obviously spotting us--both ignored us completely . Guess the conversation was more important . Stood there for about 20 seconds while they talked and then finally walked up and ventured to ask--the one girl finally helped us and was pretty nice --this Carmen chick , as her name tag pronounced --turned on her heels and arrogantly clicked away .

Fast forward to me purchasing said items for mom at register and more clueless looks from mindless automatons . My Mom asked nicely if they possibly had any samples (you would have thought she had asked for their first born child)

Rude rude rude .

Fast forward yet another time in the same DAY because I had sprayed a perfume I loved and wanted to return and buy it and figure out what it was .

Walked past the counter where not 1, but FOUR to FIVE sales associates were congregating and shooting the breeze. I was about 2 feet from them for at least 5 minutes obviously looking for something and still not one of them asked if I needed help .

Ask again --same girl , Carmen, Rudely turns on her heels while same sweet girl (wearing a head scarf ) and another associate help me.


See Carmen blandly poised at the register where she looks severely put out that she has to deign to lazily ring someone up.

I asked the girls who were helping me "
Is that your manager " (knowing that sometimes the manager will have better things to do than answer questions (not really !) and defer to the associates .

Nope . Not a manager . Just a brat .

And to top it off the whole back of the store is a hot MESS and jumble of racks that need to be Re shelved.

Wonder if these girls could be doing something useful .

I will return because it's right by my office , but not for the awful and rude customer service .
 I'd rather give my money to sephora if I van

Do not buy a gift card from the coked out cashiers in this store. The experience to purchase the gift card was questionable when the cashier repeatedly failed at activating and processing the transaction. Selling a gift card is retail 101. This cashier was clearly too high to manage that. I was uncomfortable witnessing it. The drama as only escalated as I have repeatedly and unsuccessfully tried to cope with the horrendous Ulta corporate customer services team who is incapable of rectifying the worst transaction experience ever. When you don't pay your staff, they get coked out trying to work 3 jobs and steal from store customers in the process. I'm grateful that there are so many other beauty stores, drug stores and salons within a 3 block radius of this store. I'll never shop here again. It's too scary of an experience to put myself through that again.

My review is solely on the Brow Bar. I had some free time on a Monday so I called for an appointment. I was able to get right in. Being behind on the trends, I am not big on brows and get waxed every 3 months or so. I was scheduled with Christina who was warm and friendly. The waxing did not hurt at all. She gave me a great shape and after showed me how to pencil/tips for creating an arch. Will be going back.

Not a single person approached me in the store. Employees would rather talk to each other than help other customers with products. I only use Ulta because points turn into money instead of gifts, but the service at Sephora is much better and the employees are actually knowledgeable about what's best for your needs.

Went in to see if there was an opening at the brow bar earlier in the week, she said no she had an appointment in thirty minutes. Which seemed odd to me because no one was there, and many times they will squeeze someone in if the next appointment is not for 30 minutes. I said I would come another time. Went back today, and three staff were talking in the front. I asked if they had any appointments and was told she was going to get the book. Again she had an appointment 30 minutes later and would not take me. I went across the street got my eyebrows done, and peeked in Ulta on my way back, she was still talking with the other employees and did not have a client. This Ulta has lost my business.

This location is hit or miss...you are usually better off if you know exactly what you want and limit your interactions with the employees. Awesome selection of products but I've been greeted by too many people that make it clear they are too busy to answer my questions.

My first experience I went to buy a new hair straightener and wanted advice on a good brand in my price range. Who would be better to ask than one of the hairstylists? Well she obviously didn't share that same enthusiasm because she was annoyed that I was even speaking to her, but that didn't make me stop because I needed something and I wasn't leaving until I was satisfied with my purchase.

My next experience I went to get matched for some makeup since I had recently started a new job and wanted to feel a bit more polished. My roommate told me Ulta would match me to foundation and even show me some makeup tricks to apply them... well here's my luck, I asked if someone could help me with this little makeup tutorial but I was told they weren't doing that at that time because they were "too busy this time of year".... let's keep in mind it was about noon on a Wednesday and I was 1 of 4 customers there.....they ended up hurriedly matching me to some makeup and sending me on my way.

Alas, I return because now I want to get more, I'm a little puppy eager to learn new tricks! I approach someone and ask for a suggestion on a liquid eyeliner and listed my needs. Employee points me to her favorite.... which didn't fit any of the criteria I specified. Thanks for taking the time to let me know what you like, not what I want! Love that! 

Oh and to top this all off, website hours said they were open until 9, I arrive at 7:55pm to pick up something and was greeted by a slammed door in my face by security saying they were closed. I knocked on the door until finally the manager came up and she was SO RUDE saying that it's not her fault the website says 9pm. I would think someone in a manager position could push to get that fixed..

I will say I have had a few interactions with employees that are incredibly professional and knowledgeable, so I will be back, but I wish I didn't have to feel like I'm walking on glass whenever I'm here.

Sigh...please hire more customer oriented employees and this review would get bumped up in no time

I've had mixed experiences at this Ulta.  The staff are sometimes so eager to help (when the store isn't busy) that you can't get them to go away when you just want to browse, or sometimes are nowhere to be found when you need help.

I came in here looking for a specific concealer that was a part of their 21 Days of Beauty promotion, only to find that they didn't carry it in-store.  I felt so pressured to buy an alternative full-priced Stila product by a rep in the store, that I felt the need to walk away with the product, browse around and then returned it to the shelf later.  I don't need that kind of anxiety while I'm shopping!

I recently had a great experience with Lauren at the Salon.  In late May they were running a promotion for new Salon customers - $25 for a haircut and style (normally $45).  All I was looking for was a trim, and Lauren got rid of my split ends and I left with a head full of curls for way less than I would have at an expensive Center City salon.  

Five stars for my Salon experience, but overall Ulta is still a solid three for its inconsistent (and somewhat awkward) service.

Great products. Terrible staff.

I am a 20 year old, Asian female.
I walked in here on Christmas Eve morning to get some last minute stuff. 
Nobody said hi to me despite the fact that there were two staff standing at the doorway. Nobody asked me if I needed help, despite the fact that I was looking all over to find something. I usually don't mind if staff people don't come and try to help, I actually prefer it that way if I don't actually need help. But the problem was that they were being selective with their customers- they would say "hi how are you? welcome to ulta! are you looking for anything in particular? we also have blahblah on the third floor and blah blah in the lower level... etc etc.." to every other woman in the store, except me! (WOW)

I also like to touch and try everything before I buy something (might as well if I'm paying for it right?) and instead of asking me if I needed help, some blonde chick with heavy eyeliner (she is the manager- i found out at checkout) sends the security guard over my way... (WHAT?!) 

Needless to say I was pretty offended and did not feel welcome AT ALL in this store. 
It's unfortunate that the store should be judged on the employees but hey, that's a huge part of the whole shopping experience. I will not be buying my cosmetics from this store anymore.

Love the Ulta Salon; so excited we finally have one in Philly! If you're looking for a hair stylist Kara is great with color and styling. It's been hard to find a stylist in the Philadelphia area with an eye for hair trends; have a great creative vision; and actually listens to my needs/wants pertaining hair care, until now. She never cease to amaze me, and I love leaving with suggestions and tips.

I hadn't gotten my eyebrows done professionally since someone burned me about 5 years ago. I recently was wanting a little more shape than I was able to do myself at home, and had heard good things about the Brow Bar so I was happy when I called and got a same day appointment. I wish I remembered the woman's name who did my brows because she was super friendly and did an AMAZING job giving me the shape I wanted!

Lovely selection, nice, clean store in a great location. 3 levels of beauty!! I usually always find what I need here. They seem to always have some kind of deal or special going, and I've never one seen this store look anything less than pristine. What I really Love? The sales associates are not overbearing like Sephora. They let you shop in peace but are always around if you need them. Competitive prices and way more options than the competition.

Wish I looked at the reviews before we scheduled an appt because it seems like TERRIBLE customer service in their forte.  Grab a cup of tea and settle in for this story...

 My sister and I brought our mother here for a full makeup makeover as a birthday gift. We were hoping for a MUA who could give a brief tutorial so we coud purchase ALL the products and she can do it later herself.

 Upon entering the store we were told to go upstairs to check in.  We were RUDELY spoken to by a hairstylist who didn't even look up when we asked to check in and just curtly said go downstairs, we told her we were sent upstairs... and she SCREAMED for another woman to come help us... (who happened to be sitting in the corner just watching, not even attempting to help)  She then denies we have an appointment, until we show her confirmation and she just goes "oh your right here"????  Makeup artist was completely unprepared for us.

This doesn't seem that bad, but when your mom gets all dressed up and excited for  a rare moment of pampering...... !!!!  It just STARTED the experience off on a bad foot, oh but wait.


Finally she is seated for her makeup, the girl is nice but honestly it doesn't make up for the rest of the s*** show:

1. The makeup area is by what looks like the workers break area, thats fine, but its not fine when there what looks like day old chinese food and trash everywhere. I added a picture.
2. She applied moisturizer and primer with HER FINGERS.. EWWW, and I didn't see her wash her hands IMMEDIATELY before.... again my mother is being pampered im not going to interupt and make her feel grossed out.  She used brushes from a big tuberware container full of makeup and other things for the rest of the appointment which is again unsanitary
3.  The originally rude hairdress... proceeds to chomp on doritos about two feet away from my mom getting her makeup done and just watches?  in what world is this not annoying and bizarre.... then washed her hands without soap  and went back to the girl who's hair she was coloring =)
4.  A random customer came up out of nowhere and started asking questions, and the makeup artist left my mom sitting there for 10 minutes while she went to help her....where are the other workers?  It was a saturday evening!? 

Overall, her make up looked ok.  Nothing I couldn't do myself but its extremely frustrating that they got 300$ from us (again for the sake of my mom and her gift we didn't raise hell).  My sweet mom tipped her, and the makeup job was 45 dollars, plus the product that we bought.

Do better or atleast try to give any effort at all. You are in Center city.  I would love a reply from any person that was in the salon that day or a manager to answer to these multiple crimes.

Bethany is the go to for all things hair!! I have extremely high expectations when it comes to hair and Bethany exceeds them. She's very knowledgeable about what styles and products make different types of hair beautiful (mine being thin). I have been going to her for over a year for cuts, treatments, color, etc. Recently she did balayage and it looks beyond GORGEOUS  and HEALTHY. Bethany is the cutest and invests a lot in her clients!!

I came here often and I liked the service here.. except today (5/25/14). My friend who's visiting me from Asia wanted some american makeup products so I took her to Ulta. She was excited and happy how big this beauty store is and literally wants to buy everything she sees, until she noticed that the security guard has been following us for the past hour. I brushed it off and tell my friend to ignore him and we walked away to see another brand.

I finally got ticked off when I catch him checking every makeup packaging to see if we stole anything. He literally opened every package that was on the stand we were at a minute ago and see if the package was empty. And he continued to followed us. (creep) 

As we were in line to purchase our stuff, my friend told me she wanted to switch another shade of a foundation. So I went to the basement floor real quick and change the shade. When my friend was in line, she noticed that the security guard was whispering to one of the register lady and he pointed at my friend and pointed down (assuming me, because I was in the basement floor at the time). 

As we were heading out, he walked beside us and perhaps expecting for the detector beep. But guess fucking what? It didn't. 

I personally think it was very rude and unpleasant of him to follow us to every corner of the store and assume that we were stealing. I come here a lot and wandering around to find the right kind of makeup is pretty normal. But for him, it didn't and made us look suspicious for no good reason. My friend felt uncomfortable and made her experience at Ulta horrible.

Update: I read another review and this reviewer (20 yr. old asian woman) claims that the manager sent the security to escort her to the door and they assumed she was stealing. 

jesus christ ulta, you're fucking racist. I was once a loyal customer, but I guess I'll be Sephora's loyal customer now.

My love affair with Ulta began a while ago but I'm glad there's finally one in Philly! Yes they have great makeup and products to beautify yourself, but my favorite part is THE SALON!!! Everyone is talented but my favorite is Kara! If you go, ask for her! My hair came out better than expected. I went in with an idea and Kara incorporated what I thought I wanted into her expertise as a master colorist and I came out with the most amazing color of my life! I get complements on my hair EVERYDAY! She was working on me (a black girl with natural coils) while also finishing up amazing color on a white woman and a karatin on a Indian girl. I appreciate that she can do ALL types of hair lengths and textures! A true renaissance woman when it comes to hair care! I definitely suggest you make your appointment if you want your hair to look fabulous and be healthy as well!

I've been waiting for an Ulta to open up in Center City!! This location was definitely worth the wait. Its a beautiful, bright, clean store w/ three stories:   high end makeup on 1st floor (street level), hair products & salon on 2nd floor, & less expensive drug store brands downstairs in the basement. 

Their products are great, but their customer service here is hit or miss. You'll either get super nice & helpful, or rude & unhelpful... no middle ground. Definitely worth a visit, but don't be surprised if you have to find everything yourself.

I got a great blowout by stylist Bethany Blessing; she did an amazing job, was pleasant, and very knowledgeable about what kinds of products work best with different types of hair.  She knows her craft! The week before I had her do my hair, I was looking for a dry shampoo and she happened to see me testing out a few and took the time to come over and help me find one that worked best for my hair type (Living proof is my new go to!). Based on that encounter, I decided to book an appointment with her rather than go to my usual places. It's the first time I ever walked into a salon without pointing to a photo of what I wanted, and she nailed it based on a few descriptions I stated. I highly recommend asking for her.

Had one of the best experiences at this store today! A total newbie to the brow bar, i was confused and Dianna was amazing !! I've never had such great customer service before! My eyebrows look flawless & she even assisted me on getting the right product! Worth every penny !

My review is solely based on my experience at the Benefit Brow Bar. I originally booked my appointment with Cassidy for my brows but on the day of the appointment, I got a call from Ulta saying that Cassidy could not come in. Hence, they scheduled me with Ebony. Know nothing about Ebony, I came in with an open mine; as long as my brows get a decent service. I came 20 minutes early just to be safe in case I could not find parking. On a Saturday afternoon, the store was pretty busy. Ebony came right on time for the appointment ( I was her first customer that day) amd she warmly welcomed me. She explained about the process and was very friendly. She was very gentle on my brows and the waxing process was not painful at all and I was very pleased. She diligently made sure I was happy with the tint color and that my brows shaped exactly how I wanted. I would recommend Ebony to anyone and I would come to her again for my brows. She gained my trust in brows :)

I've been coming here for 3 years now. I get my hair done and go shopping while it processes. Every time I make an appointment, I say the words "double process" and they know just how much time my stylist needs to work her magic.

Stephany is the blonde whisperer and everyone I know calls her that. What can I say? My friends and I are a gaggle of fake blondes ;) From ash, platinum, silver, she makes it happen every single time. Blonde used to be a chore. Even if I saw the same stylist for years, I walked out with lines from one touch up to the next. No consistency! That's a thing of the past here. Oh and she doesn't fry my hair. 

Everyone at the salon is super pleasant and professional but I love love LOVE Stephany! She's like the saint of my devotion lol Always has it under control. If anything goes wrong while processing she saves the day. Never gets in over her head. My mom wanted a short hair style and she was frank with her and pointed her to an other stylist who did just wonderful. I believe she's the manager? She really knows her team! Above all (wrapping up my praise here, promise!) she knows her way around blonde!

Diana did an excellent job on my brows. She was obviously very experienced and gave me excellent shape! Be sure to call for an appointment....they take walk-ins, but do tend to book up with appointments! Only reason why I'm giving 4 instead of 5 stars is because I think $20 for a brow wax in the front of Ulta is a bit high. But it was definitely the longest, most thorough brow wax I've ever had!

I'll preface this by saying that my makeup artist was a sweet woman, very friendly and accommodating. My negative rating has more to do with the overall experience. I was at the store by 11:15 for an 11:30 appointment. I was told by the manager that it would be "just a little while" until the girl doing make up on the first floor was done with her client, so I patiently waited and walked around the store.
When the girl doing make up on the first floor was done, she told me I'd be seeing someone upstairs, so she took me up there to wait...for 20 minutes. By 11:45 I went down to the manager and asked if someone would be with me soon, only for her to take me back upstairs to wait some more.

When my makeup artist was finally ready for me, we went back downstairs...after all of this running around and insanity, I didn't sit in the make up chair until 12:15. And, like most of their clients I am sure, I was pressed for time and rushing to get to a wedding. Ultimately this is unacceptable to me. You can't have stylists so behind in appointments that they make people wait for 45 minutes WHEN THEY HAVE AN APPOINTMENT SCHEDULED. Ultimately there was little creativity offered to provide better service, and I left very unhappy.
As for the make up, it wasn't what I wanted, but it stayed put and I received many compliments. I'm not sure how else to convey the look I wanted other than showing a photo and asking them to aim for it...yet somehow there was still something lost in translation as I walked out with chiseled eyebrows and dark eye shadow, after I'd requested a more natural style. Again, I genuinely enjoyed my make up artist and I think she did her best given how anxious I was surrounding the situation. 
For someone who wears minimal makeup and was apprehensive about giving Ulta a try, the overall experience confirmed that I'll never be back to this location.

Do not go in here unless you want to be ignored or if you do happen to ask a question, be treated like dirt. The workers here seem to think they are too good for the customers and act annoyed if you interrupt their personal conversations. I would have like to browse the store for some items but after being looked at like I was a nuisance (after asking where something was), I decided to not spend my money here.

I called in advance to make sure they had a makeup revolution lip topper. They confirm they did and I told them I'd be there within the hour. I arrived searched up and down for the item on my own. No one asked if I needed any assistance. Then I came back upstairs to ask for help. They explained they didn't have the item in stock. I asked "Why would you guys tell me you had it?  I traveled here just for it". The reps had no response for me.  Waste of my time. smh

3.5/5

Loved how large this Ulta was. The organization was also easy to understand. I figured out where to go right away--which is good because there wasn't much staff at all. No one came over to help either my friend or myself. I know if someone helped me friend she would've bought something. That's the type of person she is. So money lost for them.

Ulta is always a good option to have in a major city. I'd go to this one again but I wouldn't rush out there.

Finally an Ulta in Philly!!
