I'm originally from New York so after a few minutes of this nasty woman I dropped my New York attitude on her. Steer clear of the sales person with the big round glasses. Finally the sales person with long gray hair helped and she was a doll. So were the other staff on the floor and the cashiers. Only bad penny is the one with the glasses.

I absolutely love Ulta.  They have almost all of the name brand products as well as the drugstore products.  They offer salon services as well as waxing services.  This is my go to place for beauty/spa products!

Sierra and Ulta have done it again!

I don't own a pair of tweezers, I have never tried plucking my own eyebrows. And why would I? Sierra is a master at her craft. I never feel cuter than when she waxes my eyebrows. 

This Ulta continues to be a role model business for social distancing. The employees are so cheery, the masks are on, the social distancing is super enforced. You can't even touch makeup anymore! They have taken this so seriously, and the efforts have paid off.

I'm specifically reviewing the Benefit Brow Bar at Ulta!  I started getting my brows done here with Becca, who has since moved to another Ulta.  Becca was amazing and I was so sad to see her go.  Ciara was the woman who took Becca's place and at first I was nervous to have a new person, but I was quickly relieved!  Ciara is super friendly, always tells you what she is doing before doing it, and does a fantastic job.  I recently went to another Benefit Brow Bar and the service and end result was far from what I experience with Ciara.  The only bad thing is she gets booked up fast!

I take great pride in my eye brows I mean they are like the main event on your face. I trusted Becca to work her magic and I'm glad I did. She did an amazing job. I will be back worth the 45 min drive.

This store hasn't been open very long, but many times they're out of products!  When asking what happened to run out, the answer varies but usually just a shoulder shrug.  Very disappointing when you make a special trip to restock items.

2 stars to this SNOBBY location. I stopped by after my beach day was cut short by afternoon showers. So, I obviously was dressed down and not wearing make up. I'm young, so I guess that means I wouldn't be buying expensive make up...at least, that's the way the make up artist treated me. She was complaining about her job to friends and didn't even acknowledge me. She acknowledged a lady that was older than me right away that was looking at the same make up as me. Wow. So rude. That lady didn't even buy anything.The guy at the Benefit counter was alright and helped me find a lip tint. I was just reading other reviews of this location and there seems to be an on-going theme that the customer service is very poor and most of the customers leave feeling disrespected by rude employees. Not sure how long this location will stay open for if they don't start training their employees properly. I hardly ever give less than 3 stars, so my rating is saying a lot!

I'm leaving this awesome feedback for my stylist, Jenna. This girl is the BEST when it comes to Keratin treatments. Originally, I came in to have my Keratin done by another stylist, and it didn't work out. It was an expensive treatment, and Keratins are VERY different from brand to brand, so I think there was confusion on what this particular brand needed to go in successfully, and then there was some misinformation about after care, so of course the Keratin didn't stay in, it washed out right away and looked BAD. I've had Keratin treatments many times before, and knew it wasn't right, so I got in touch with the salon manager and was assigned to Jenna. 
Needless to say, Jenna busted A** to make it right for me. She did a fantastic job and really made sure every step was correctly done, every single step of the way. She made sure I had the right after care products and gave me advice on how to make the Keratin treatment last for the full 90 days, and then some, if I am diligent :) Jenna's super fun and hilarious personality was just icing on the cake. She is awesome and I had a blast hanging out with her while I had the treatment. Jenna will always be my stylists so long as I live in this area. If you are lucky enough to get an appointment with Jenna, make sure you leave this girl a huge tip because she deserves it. I just hope I'm able to get another appointment with her after this very positive review!!

Jenna does a fabulous job!  Be sure to make an appointment with such a professional.  Everyone at the Salon was courteous and friendly. Ignore any of the poor reviews. I highly recommend this location.

Always great prices, great sales, and great coupons at Ulta. I prefer to buy my hair care products at Ulta instead of at my hair salon because I can get the same products and the prices are better at Ulta. The staff was knowledgeable and helped me find a new dry shampoo to try. She suggested the trial/travel size so I could make sure I like it before switching brands. Good idea! She also helped me locate other items I was looking for, such as the hand soap that I used in the restroom. I had a coupon that I received in my email, but I forgot to use it when I checked out. Fortunately, I was still in the parking lot when I remembered. I went back inside, the cashier returned everything and rang up everything again. The cashier was very nice and friendly during this transaction and I was very apologetic for forgetting in the first place. I will say that I wish they would ask if you have any coupons or rewards to use because it would save us both some time! In the end, my 20% coupon saved me almost $16 so it was well worth my effort to go back inside the store. I highly recommend Ulta to my family and friends.
It was a little expensive but the staff was very nice too me I was a little disappointed  I didn't git the  James Charles palette but love  the Store

I had my third appointment at the Salon at Ulta Beauty Seminole yesterday and I love the results.  Evelina takes the time to discuss with me what I'm liking and not loving so much about my hair on each visit, and we go from there.  Her skills are top notch, and I always walk out feeling beautiful.  

The salon staff are friendly and cooperative with each other, not just nice to the client in the chair at the moment.  It is a comfortable atmosphere, which adds to the salon experience for me. 

As for the store itself, my first time in it was a little overwhelming, but I have never been in the store longer than 45 seconds without someone asking if I need help or if I'm looking for something in particular.  

I look forward to my next visit.

I'm rating it 1 star for the lack of customer service. I love Ulta and was really excited when one opened up near my house so I decided to check it out. Every ulta store is set up differently so it can be quite hard to navigate. I had a list of things I needed and couldn't find any of them because it was either out of stock or I just couldn't find it. I walked past probably 8 employees and didn't even get a smile. Finally I asked someone for help and she told me she wasn't sure and gestured to the isle where she thought it was. So I left and do not plan on returning to this location.

The first time I came to this location they were very newly opened & it was the most rude I've ever been treated by Ulta employees. Since that first visit I've been back twice, I don't enjoy being treated rudely, they're just the closest location to my house & they have fully redeemed themselves. Last visit, the first of the nice ones, I had the pleasure of working with a very polite professional lady with gorgeous long gray hair & this visit I had a very sweet younger lady behind the register who was conversational & helpful even though her shift was moments from being complete. The store is new, so expectedly it's very clean but has also remained organized & well stocked. The parking is ample & thankfully this gorgeous new shopping center is not overcrowded yet, so you don't have to park far from the store entrance. I left feeling happy & eager to return. My go to Ulta for location as well as courteous employees.

The brow bar here is subpar. Girl who did my eyebrows was friendly but my eyebrows look like hell. There are strays left behind and they have 0 shape. I paid $22 so I expected a job well done like I have experienced at other Ulta Beauty brow bars. Not the case here. Don't waste your money.

Honestly, I'll never go back. I went to this location for a color collection (going from a dark box dyed color 5 months grown out to a few shades lighter). At first the experience started out well- my colorist balyaged some lighter pieces but only glazed my root so all my gray hair was still showing. So I made a second appointment a week later with the same person- told her I loved it! I just need my root to match. At first she told me it wasn't possible, then she grabbed another colorist who said it was and helped for a large portion of the service ( kinda felt like my colorist was inexperienced and didn't fully know what she was doing). First round my roots were a hot orange so I had to be reglazed and then 2nd round my roots were an orange brown. She left me like that and charged me $85 on top on the $170 I had paid for the balyage the week before. I realize this stuff can get pricey, but that should have been talked about before she started AND why am I leaving with orange roots?! At this point I'm upset, annoyed and a little resentful. I'll never go back and I'll just stick to my center city ulta :)

I've been in here 30 minutes and nobody has asked me if I needed help. I was also just waiting patiently on line and the clerk literally looked at me waiting then ushered another customer in front of me. I won't be coming back to this Ulta.

HORRIBLE customer service.
 Received something I had gotten as a gift and just wanted to exchange it for a product in the same shampoo brand and line which was the same price. 
  Manager made me return it first..gave me back a whopping 3 dollars for it and then said i had to buy the one i wanted at more then 3 times the price.  Told me i had to take the lowest sale price for it rather then just exchange it for the EXACT same item at the same price in the product line.  I lost money in the return and then more if i wanted to repurchase what i wanted.
  I could understand this if i was returning for a totally different item but it was the same price exchange and same product line.
  I will now be shopping online elsewhere rather then in this store.  
Great job!!!  You lost a customer.  
 A word of advice..this is why so many places are going out of business...lousy customer service.
Staff is very friendly and helpful. Store is very well organized. The salon and brow bar here are both AMAZING!

Let me tell you how I only trust my hair\brows with this place. It took a while for me to warm up to the idea of a new salon ESPECIALLY a chain, as I'm sure most black women feel given how quick that can go wrong. After an intial consultation with Sarah, I felt reassured and she hasn't let me down yet. What I appreciate most about her is her willingness to do her research and seek guidance to properly attend to her clients. She does a FANTASTIC job with cut and color and it willing to advise her clients through the process. Dawn does my facials and brows, ALWAYS keeping me informed about what goes on my face and educates me about what I should do when I'm not in her lovely hands. She's super friendly and literally never forgets a face  awesome ladies and I'm glad they opened so close

Natasha has done my hair and for years! She is amazing! She's great for big changes or just your ever day look. She's does cut, color, updos, and makeup! She did my wedding as well! Can't say enough good things about this lady and her talent!

The first time I went to Ulta Salon to get my roots, highlights, and toner done. Instead of matching my natural root color, they used a lighter color and my roots turned orange and, instead of the white/lightest ash blonde highlights I asked for, they put in dark gray highlights. They also up-charged a couple of treatments without telling me so my bill was well over $200+tip. The 2nd visit: I returned to get everything fixed with a more highly experienced stylist, Sarah. I told her I did not want any of the "extras" and that I wanted a highlight that complimented my sparkling, bright white 'grays'. She did a better job than the than the first girl, giving me the root color I asked for, but kept saying, "I love it when women embrace their natural color." Ummm, ok. I didn't say I wanted to be gray, just get rid of the brassiness in my highlights, but I didn't think much of it at the time. 
Well, I should've paid attention to that statement the 3rd time I came to get my hair done because Sarah ignored my requests and went for her own vision of me as a gray-haired woman. First, she used foils when I wanted balayage to give a few, strategically placed highlights. The foils added a tremendous amount of highlight in areas I didn't want anymore, and no root color. Next, she used a toner that was darker and grayer than the last so I looked ancient. I was very unhappy and said I never asked to be made a gray-hair. I'm middle-aged but she made me look elderly! Who ever says to their stylist please make me look older!!! 

The coup de gras was they called me and said that since I was unhappy with their work 2 out of 3 times they didn't want me back as a client---say what? Instead of trying to fix the issue they blamed me. They blamed me for their incompetence. The manager never once apologized for what happened or how I was treated. They returned the last money I paid, but kept the tip, which earns them the single star.. 

I went to Sally's right after that phone call and bought everything I needed to fix my hair; roots dyed to the proper color, added a few, balayage highlights, and got a bright white toner and it looks fabulous! I look 20 years younger and I got exactly what I wanted. I even cut my own hair, saving $260/month + tip! :D

I went back to this Ulta for a second time, for makeup application. I was so unhappy the first time (about a year ago) that I went home, washed it all off, and redid it myself. I typically only go to Macy's MAC counter in Center City.. but because it's so close, I figured I'd give Ulta one more try with a different person. The one and only thing I said was "no warm tones." An hour later, I left with a face full of warm neutrals and complete holes on my face where makeup was not even applied, and forget about blending. It was actually an embarrassing mess, and a complete waste of $60 as I (again) washed it off. Save yourself the frustration.. go to MAC!

Well stocked -but inconsiderate staff. Was in there with my mom today and the associate left the register and said the next person would help us. The next person was selling everything she could to a man shopping for his girl. Ten minutes later, we're still in line. I'll just keep going to the location on City Ave.

Today was the 2nd time I've been to this store and also the 2nd time I've felt profiled! I was greeted by a very lovely women when I entered which was great and why I've given 2 stars instead of 1. But as I browsed around the store I felt like people were literally following me around the entire time. Especially the security guard. I am an avid beauty shopper and a licensed esthetician with a skincare blog and like to try and test new products but to my dismay every time I looked up from a product I there was the security guard or another employee literally feet away from me staring. It got to the point that when I walked up to the counter no one was there because they were all following me around the store. Alexis the rep who rung me out was walking behind me as I walked to the register and didn't greet me pleasantly when she finally got to the counter. It was as if she or any of the other employees didn't want me there. I do not experience this type of treatment at any other establishment that I shop at. I've literally been to this store twice and have felt uncomfortable every single time. This is a new store so I have them the benefit of the doubt the first time. But I expect customer service and training to be better in a newer place. Instead they're busy following people around the store hoping they don't steal than making sure their customers are happy. I hope nobody else is treated the way I was here. I will not be back.

Wanted to do a major hair cut so I randomly chose a hair stylist at Ulta and it turned out to be the best decision ever! I highly recommend SOPHIE. She walked me through everything before cutting 12 inches off my hair. She answered each and every question and was patient. Sophie showed me what products to use especially since short hair is a different ball game! 
Apparently at Ulta, you can book a stylist, bring all your home hair products and they will walk you through how to use them effectively!  That is such an amazing idea especially for people who struggle with home hair care! I am yet to use this feature! 
I walked out of the store happy and satisfied with my hair, which is very rare for me! Sophie was amazing and so talented. She does color too! Everyone was so nice and friendly. So what are you waiting for??

I wasn't considering coming back to Ulta after my hairstylist left for very good reasons. Stopped by because I got a gift card and I almost wish I had just given it away to someone who was in the store and would've had a better shopping experience. It's very hard to find knowledgeable staff so hang on to whoever you find that does know their products and drag them from section to section. Once they are gone, the next person will just have no idea. They never have any of the promotions advertised or offer anything in its place and the store specifically doesn't carry a lot of the brands other stores have. " we don't carry that brand in this store" shouldn't be the repeated answer more than three times in the same visit. The checkout process seems rushed. It's kind of hard to ask a question when they're reading the entire script about their credit card. Literally said no twice and they didn't hear me. Kind of just talked over me. I don't think you can pay me enough to come back to ulta much less this specific store. Sephora now has my business permanently. I really haven't felt taken care of or appreciated at Ulta in the last 2 years.
Had hair and makeup done by Tara for my wedding after being recommended to her by swiger photography. She is amazing! Makeup was perfect! Hair and makeup stayed all throughout the night!
Sarah has saved my hair from breaking off while still keeping me blonde. She is a lifesaver and I thank her for giving me gorgeous goddess hair.

I am making a complaint to the ulta beauty store located on 1851 south Columbus blvd. Unit 6. Philadelphia pa, 19148 store number 1477. 
I wanted to purchase a clarins item in the store and the packaging and item was super filthy and dirty looking. It had make up stains all over it and i brought the issue up with the manager on duty which was on 01/20/2020 at 5:48pm. 
The managers name was Catalina Gomez. 
I politely asked the manager, Catalina if she can accommodate me by giving me 10% off on my clarins face masque i wanted to purchase. She disregarded that fact that the item was in filthy and dirty condition and she sold me a dirty looking face clarins after she looked at it and said no to my request. 
So i didn't know that ulta beauty (despite the company name) sold and sells dirty looking items to customers and would not even clean off the packaging at least for me to make me feel like at least she did something about my item i wanted to purchase and helped me out with my experience in the store which she totally didn't even do. 
I was highly dissatisfied with my experience at the store after spending a lot of money there and with the company. This is not how a manager is suppose to handle a situation and is totally unprofessional; in addition, unacceptable.

Okay so I'm new to the makeup world and I stopped into Ulta after a few YouTube tutorials because I was inspired to give it a try. Lead cashier Brandon was happy to assist me during my visit; helping me pick out the best products as well as giving me a few tips and pointers along the way. I am happy with everything that I purchased, and I look forward to coming back to this location again! Thanks Brandon for all of your help!

I have been going to Rachel S. for several years and intend to travel the distance to her new salon (Ulta) in the coming months (when I am ready for some more highlights). My hair has been highlighted, balayage and ombré, cut, and styled by her and she also does an excellent job on my eyebrows. She is extremely talented, listens to my desires on styling and coloring and brings my ideas to life! She is always cheerful to be around and truly has a passion for this industry! She continues her education and attends conferences regularly to keep up with the trends and it truly shows in her work. I have and will continue to recommend her to my friends!

Had my first Ulta experience today... a color and cut with Kate. I enjoyed it although it's quite different than the Aveda salon that I go to at home. Kate was uber-professional, did a great job and was fun to chat with to boot. I'd give the experience 4.5 if that were an option. BTW, re the woman who said she felt ignored... uh, I've walked into this Ulta a few times before I had a treatment there and am always greeted as soon as I walk through the door... and trust me, I don't look like much when I walk in. :-)

This review is for the salon. 

  I called ahead and got an appointment for the same day, which was nice; plus, they were offering a Memorial Day weekend discount for new clients, which was a huge factor in my decision to come to Ulta.  Before I went in, I had long layered hair that went down past the small of my back.  I had been thinking about making a drastic change to short hair for a while (it's hot here!!) and I found several photos of the cut/style I wanted on Pinterest.  That was perfect, because I could bring in my phone, show the stylist all the pictures, and discuss them with her before we started.  I was very excited, and ready for change.  

My stylist was very nice--I believe her name is Rachel--and I enjoyed talking with her about my cut.  The very first thing I said to her when I sat down was that I was "ready for something edgy--I've been rockin' variations of this same cut for about 10 years."  That must have been the wrong thing to say.  She forgot the part about wanting to be edgy, and instead (I think) became really intimidated by the amount we were cutting off.  I wanted a steep A-line bob, but instead I got the frumpy bob my mom gave me when I was 12.  As she was blow-drying, she stopped and said, "you look like you're going to be sick" and indeed, I wasn't feeling so great.  Instead of an edgy look, I felt like my head resembled a mushroom.  There was barely any difference in length from front to back--there was no other word for it than FRUMPY.   I stayed positive, and had her go back at least 3 times to take more off the back to make the cut more like I wanted.  This was a drastic change, and I knew if I didn't walk out of the salon totally in love with my new look, I'd never convince my husband to like it.  After several attempts at getting my stylist to correct the cut, I finally gave up--I was afraid that we'd reached a threshold where more cutting would just do more damage.  In the end, I ended up with a puffy, uneven bob (the back looks like a kindergardener took a pair of safety scissors and cut off my pony tail) that only looks good if I use a small curling iron to give myself beachy ringlets.  

I thanked my stylist and tipped her because I enjoyed talking to her (she really was very nice) and appreciated her trying over and over again to make the cut right.   In the end, though, the cut is wrong. It looks horrible if I try to blow it out.  And now I am waiting for it to grow out some so I can find a different stylist that can hopefully fix it.   Apparently this salon is just an over-priced Supercuts or Great Clips. I don't think I'll be going back.

I actually swore off Ulta for a long time after having gone to the location by the Tucson Mall several times.  They had very rude, unhelpful employees every time I visited, and was not a fan of the service for how much I was paying.  

However, I sucked it up and visited this location with my Mom to find a new Urban Decay lipstick and was...pleasantly converted.  The store is large, clean, and well-stocked.  We were greeted by one of the Clinique girls (I think her name is Kelly), who helped me find my lipstick and helped my Mom locate a good Clinique foundation with coverage that was appropriate.  She was patient and informative and completely changed my opinion of the Ulta name.  I have gone back to the store once or twice since and will continue to visit this location because of the quality customer service.

I recently got BBL treatment, so my face needed some serious coverage. I have olive skin, so color matching is very difficult. I went to Ulta and I was matched and out the door in minutes. Harvey was at the checkout and he added to the excellent experience. I'm in love with Ulta right now, they truly turned my day around.

Organized and wonderful Ulta! Girls are super helpful here and gotta LOVE the "buy one, get one half off on NYX products." Great brand that is cruelty-free.

Save your time and energy and go to this Ulta and not the one by the Tucson mall.

Came here as a guy buying Christmas gifts for family, totally out of my element. Elizabeth helped me. I didn't feel out of place or judged for being there. She helped me find everything i needed, and i even bought some bear oil for myself that i didn't realize Ulta carried. I will be visiting this location in the future

Do not go to this store if you can help it. Today was my first time shopping there, as I usually get my makeup from sephora, target or department stores. Anyway, I walk in and am greeted and asked if I need help. I politely decline. Big mistake. Later when I need help one associate pretty much walks away from me and tells me to hold on (she never came back) and when I asked another associate if wet n wild cosmetics are sold there she gave me a crazy look like I had asked her for sharpie lipliner. wet n wild cosmetics are not beneath you, you incompetent crazy. I go online and I find out that yes, WnW is sold there -_- Now I need to find another ulta to go to. Also the cashiers had trouble using some coupons I had for makeup. Pretty incompetent and rude associates here...
This location has a great selection of Clinique products and excellent customer service. I had a really nice shopping experience.

The employees at Ulta beauty we're just so nice to me they helped me pick out my Foundation color and told me that my concealer should be a tone lighter and it really helped me out so I don't have to look like a pumpkin everyday and they were just so nice and caring and as a young male this just felt so welcoming

I've gone into this store many times just to ogle the makeup. I was particularly happy with a recent experience where I went in with my mom. We were looking for some specific items and Cindy came to our rescue, she was super personable and helpful. I would recommend signing up for their beauty rewards program and taking advantage of the coupons. I'd consider myself a makeup junkie on a budget so I'm always looking for lower price tagged items that still perform well, and I'd say that Ulta has that.

Was browsing at this store looking for hair product, Tess, a stylist, happened to ask if I needed help and that was the beginning. Tess helped me find the product I need, and gained a new hair client and eventually a color client as well - she rocks at what she does with both style and color; she's confident, but always learning new things. In fact, just recently moved an hour and a half away and haven't gotten my hair cut yet - still miss Tess.

I love having an Ulta so close to home and the people here couldn't be friendlier or more helpful.  Join their free "club" and you won't have to worry about keeping your receipt if something doesn't work for you - just bring the product back for a refund or exchange.  The points on this plan add up fast and it's great getting free stuff.

In general, I love Ulta. I don't love this Ulta. Why you ask? Because I can never find what I want here. I love NYX cosmetics but for some annoying reason this location is always out of stock for this brand. I come back every month or so to see if it was restocked and of course end up leaving with nothing. The customer service also leaves a lot to be desired but I could deal with that if I could just get my hands on that dang concealer!!! Sigh. Ulta, you disappoint.

The customer service in this store is considerably lacking. My sister, niece, and I walked in yesterday evening looking to buy cosmetics and instead of a warm greeting we were given strange stares. I felt as though I was being judged. Assuming there was a reason for the staring, I asked if the store was closing soon and the response was a snide "No." After such cold treatment, I told my family that we needed to leave because I certainly will not spend my money in a store that treats customers so poorly. One of the employees then proceeded to follow me outside to confront me. I will not be returning. I can only hope that this store comes to realize that customers are not expendable and without decent customer service, people will choose to go elsewhere.

I am a bit of a hair freak, for cut -- and really fussy about color.  I was lucky enough to have a great stylist in the Village in New York City.  So I am spoiled.  I usually introduce myself to strangers if I like their hair, and ask them what salon they went to and the name of the stylist.  I have probably been to over 10 salons in Tucson in 10 years.  I have been satisfied with Ulta on Oracle for over 4 years.  Valerie "gets" me.  The salon is clean and cheerful.  I get coupons for the great variety of products in the store, and twice I have gotten a free haircut due points accrued.  I find the atmosphere very professional yet personal.  Right now it's my favorite place to go, and I look forward to my hair appointments.  (Since my original post, I've seen Lizz as well, and she's wonderful.)

I am not a person to complain to a company but this store has to have the worst customer service I have ever experienced and have the worst return policy ever. They once refused to just exchanged an unopened gift I had gotten for a different shade. I went in with my sister once who tried to exchange an Ulta branded product unopened for a different shade which they also refused to return because it had not been bough on a beauty insider acount and she had lost the receipt, it was their store brand and obviously bought there. Any time ai go in for my free gift with purchase they say they never recieved any. I recently went in and asked about a free gift with purchase coupon I had the sale person said she "was pretty sure that offer expired" and when I got in my car after I paid I pulled up the coupon which ssid it was valid for another week. I've refused to go back to this location or really any ulta in general. IF I ever shop at Ulta it will only be online which means less shopping because im not going to spend the 50 dollars to get free shipping everytime and refuse to pay shipping just because their in store experience is awful. I Can get everything they sell at sephora, beauty brands and Walgreens.

I come here a lot. Like more than I should. I bought the Curl Secret about a week ago (which is amazing, but the way- I'm completely obsessed) and then got an email from Ulta a few days ago that held a 20% discount. I brought my receipt and the sales associate honored this coupon which saved me $20. (okay..the Curl Secret is so worth 100$, but getting it for 80$ makes me pretty happy too). They definitely did not have to do this for me since I did buy the product prior to receiving the coupon. Great service and friendly sales staff.

I just moved from San Jose to Marana literally the night before I called this Ulta salon.  The day before I had went to "my" Ulta in San Jose and was able to use my points from my reward card for a free haircut and conditioning treatment with a stylist I'd used previously (and had no problems with).  Unfortunately, when the haircut was done, I was in such a hurry to get home and finish packing, I threw my hair up into a ponytail and didn't even check to see if it was ok.  After I got to Marana the next day, showered, and fixed my hair, I couldn't help but be annoyed with some of the uneven layers around my face.  Nothing major by any means, but enough that it would bother me until I got it fixed.  

I called this Ulta, explained that it had been a rewards points' cut in California and asked what their policy was on fixing it, the charge, etc.  After checking with the manager, the gal on the phone apologized they couldn't get me in sooner (so I'm thinking 2-3 days), but she means they couldn't get me in that afternoon!  I was scheduled for noon the next day.  

The manager shampooed, cut, and blow dried my hair for no charge.  She did an excellent job, and it's sad that (I think she said) her last day would be that following Friday.  This salon, compared to other Ulta salons I've seen, was very neat and organized.  I hope it stays that way with the new manager as well.  

Appreciated the help these gals gave me, hoping I'm able to send some more folks their way.

Went to Ulta Oro Valley looking for Tarte Maracuja Concealer and an Eyebrow pencil.
After entering the store, a nice lady that was from a different company (just organizing products on the shelf) showed me where Tarte was and where the eyebrow pencil was.
A young lady working for Ulta intercepted me from the location of the eyebrow pencil and asked  if I needed help.
I told her that I was looking for Tarte Maracuja Concealear and she took me to a stand (completely different that the first location I was shown) and matched me to an yellowish color...
As I stayed in line at the cashier I looked at the package and noticed it was not Tarte Maracuja!
I went back to the associate and asked again for Tarte Maracuja. She showed me the original location the first lady showed me and left me there.
I picked up three testers, sat in front of a mirror to find a match myself. One of the testers didn't have a shade sticker on it.
I glanced at the associate several times, hoping to get some help. I did sit there for 10-15 mins, and all this time the associate was chatting with other two associates.
I left the products on the counter and left.
I will not buy any time soon the expensive products from Ulta.

I liked my previous salon and stylist but couldn't continue to drop several hundred dollars every six weeks, I needed to make a change. 

I just started shopping at Ulta on line. I love browsing in my jammies and stuff showing on my front porch. 

I had never been in a Ulta store and had some time to peruse the store by me. I was happily surprised to all of the brands that Ulta offers. So many choices! 

I was surprised to see that they had salon services in the store too. In one of the emails that I receive from them, I was able to see the services they offer. 

I scheduled my appointment blindly, with no idea who my stylist would be. They have evening appointments for the working girls (good play on words, eh?), like me. 

I was blessed to be set up with Cy. Cy is very knowledgeable and we discussed several...or many options. Because of her explanation and experience,I felt comfortable telling her to do what she felt was best. 

Let me tell ya, I am very happy with my hair. The color has depth and shine. This is my new salon and Cy will continue to be my stylist. I'm a fan!

This Ulta is okay but it could definitely be better. I feel ignored every time I come in, even if there aren't very many customers. I've come here on several occasions looking for something needing help and being unable to find someone on the floor able to help. I have been able to track people down, mostly by following them through the aisles to ask a simple question. I have purchased nail polish and makeup here before and I was shocked that there was not ONE sales person in the makeup area. 

The selection is fair and the stock is decent, but if you need any help you may want to go elsewhere. But if you know what you're looking for it's just fine.

It's interesting to me that anytime I enter this store with us wife, we are swarmed by associates eager to help us, but when I come alone I am treated as though I'm a leper!  I stood in the store for nearly 20 minutes while exactly ZERO associates acknowledged me or bothered to ask if I needed help!  

What a joke!  Hey Ulta, you can keep your overpriced crap!  It saves me the worry of having to save for things that actually matter!

Terrible service! I made an appointment for my mother and to get pampered for a wedding. I finally convinced her to get strip lashes and lip stick. I was coming to get lashes as well as Event make-up. We arrived on time for our appointment, however, when checking in with the stylist she informed us with a major attitude that she doesn't do strip lashes, she doesn't use highlighter and if that's what we were expecting, she couldn't help us. I said, ok who can help us with the services we had an appointment for? So, she just stormed off and didn't come back to let us know..we spoke with the manager who made it seem like we booked the at the wrong store, then it changed into we see your appointment but, it doesn't have any services booked. After a half hour of trying to get seen we ended up getting strip lashes install by a cashier. She did a great job my Mom was still however, very disappointed by the way we were being treated so was I. I didn't get any make-up done and was only meet with a ton of strange excuses why we couldn't be helped. I didn't have any make-up done for the wedding and it totally effected my mood. I will NEVER visit any Ulta again.

Due to extended holiday hours, I was able to get in for a 9 a.m. haircut and style on a Saturday. The store was pretty empty, but I suppose most people weren't aware it was opening early for the season. I'd imagine this store is as successful as any other Ulta, but they don't quite have the foot traffic of Park Place.

Robin, the salon manager, did my hair. I like how you can book a stylist based on experience here. You can get a service slightly cheaper by going with someone with less experience. I think Robin was a mid-level. She was very pleasant to talk to and recommended a conditioning treatment. Why not? My hair could use some rehab. We had a lot to talk about, and I always appreciate when a stylist can carry on a conversation beyond small-talk subjects like the weather.

She styled it a bit messier than I preferred, but after brushing and fluffing it a bit, my hair looked great. It came out a bit shorter than I had asked for, but I very much liked her cut and layering. She seemed to know what she was doing. I would go see her again.

The manager at this location is awful. She is so rude to me specifically every time I enter the store, but I see her being nice to other customers. I plan on complaining to corporate. I don't appreciate being treated like garbage. And it's not just me imagining things. My husband came into the store with me and he noticed too.
Get my eyebrows done at the benefit bar. Erika is a master and very customer oriented. She does a great job
Very confused as to why the door says store closes at 9:00 PM and I show up at 8:45 to find doors locked and no one in the store. Pretty sure that's not allowed and will be reporting to corporate

Mon-Wed special "Cut, Color, and Style" for only $60 (you're getting a CUT FOR FREE!!) All stylist are AMAZING. even when not going for the special, Robin, Tess, Cy, Rachel, and Sammi, anyone in the salon can do whatever you're wanting to achieve with you're hair. I've made my rotations through all of them. Very talented group of women. When it comes to retail side of things, associates are more than happy to help and go out of their way to help. They take the time to ask questions to make sure you get exactly the product you're looking for. Very genuine staff, and will continue to visit Ulta for all my beauty needs!!

Amazing service provided by Olivia and Erica! Not only were we greeted with a genuine "welcome" , but also  provided exceptional service and knowledge. I will definitely go out of my way to visit this team! The store was also immaculate. Thank you so much!

Do you have extra time to shop around and get the sales of all sales. They have sale racks that are unbelievable you just have to look around and you will find fantastic Bargains it is in the shopping center at the crossroads. I say go when it's not busy and you can get personal attention like I got today it was marvelous. I like when they color match you for your makeup

Went there to get my hair cut a few days ago, and had the pleasure of meeting one of their stylists, Katie.
I knew my hair was going to come out great just from the consult. She listened, and asked enough questions to make sure she understood what I was looking for. And she set clear and reasonable expectations. Namely, that my hair will not turn out like the picture I brought in, because it was a wig (I had NO idea!) but we could get it close.
She was a blast to hang out with, the hour I was in the chair just flew by. And when we were done, my hair turned out PERFECT. ABSOLUTELY PERFECT!!!! No exaggeration, I've been trying to get this look from different stylists for 3 years now. And she NAILED it!! It looked so good my boyfriend was rendered speechless when I showed him. THAT good!
Ask for her. You will not be disappointed!
Definitely not going back after finding out one of the employees Val Garcia is trying to get notorious antimasker Ethan Schmidt to harass people in here for wearing masks.

I came here initially looking for purple shampoo. When I walked in , I was distracted because I saw a table full of Madison Reed. I've heard of this product from Facebook and was curious to try. A nice man asked me if I needed help. He assisted me in finding the right shade. He even walked me to a different Madison Reed aisle for more shade selections and was so patient as I went on the website for suggestions. After finding the correct shade he asked if I considered using a purple shampoo. Wow, he read my mind. He then helped me find a purple shampoo. I then went to look for foundation. I have plenty of it, but am not impressed with any I own, another sales guy showed me a line called PUR. I actually haven't heard of it. He helped chose a shade for me without trying it on my skin due to COVID. I have been using Jane Iradale because it's recommended by dermatologist, but I am not impressed with it due to the color is always off. I bought the one he suggested. As soon as I got in my car, I tried on the foundation right away. Omg... it was the perfect match and it looked amazing on me. It's now my favorite foundation ever. I use to work at Nordstrom in Cosmetics and I haven't found service as good as Nordstrom, until today. I wish I knew these men's names because they deserve recognition. Thanks guys. You're the best!
Had a hair appointment at 1pm didn't take me til 1:40pm. While I waited I got stalked around the store by one of the cashiers. Great experience. Lol.

We went in this weekend to get a style for my daughter, she was having some photos taken and her hair it so so straight we can barely do anything with it. First of all we hen we got there the woman said she was an hour behind and that we could reschedule, not possible so she said she would do her when the other client had her dye in. i really appreciated that so we waited. All we wanted was her hair turned under, and told her that my daughters had would not do it without a lot of work and a good amount of product. 

   The stylist could not understand that we wanted the hair smooth with just the bottom turned under, we got up a picture of when it had been done that way before. She proceeded to spray the tiniest amount of heat set in and blow dry it under, while telling my daughter that her hair was cut wrong and she could do this herself easily if her hair was cut correctly- her hair was cut two weeks ago and had lasted all day- So we go to leave and her hair is already popping out. I did not leave a tip.

This is not the first time we have dealt with weird stylists here. Once when my daughter was ten we got a trim and afterwords when I asked her how it was she started crying because the woman had kept snapping at her when she shifted and blamed my daughter for her hair being crooked because at one point she had crossed her legs. Of course it's good to give direction but this kid has been having her hair styled professionally since she was little and knows the drill, all you gotta do it remind her.

I went in to the store yesterday and took my sweet time browsing through sections as this was my only break from being home with my kids. 
I noticed that the larger woman with short hair who had greeted me at the front door was inconspicuously (I'm sure she was hoping she was) following me from department to department.. first through the make up aisle then the hair section. I actually stopped in the hair section and started asking her about straightening products they offered. She was very helpful with showing me a few items. 

I usually get my hair products from Aveda salons where I get my hair done so I'm actually rather skeptical of anything they had to offer. 

I then started browsing the skin aisles which are on the complete opposite side of the hair section and the larger lady with short hair seemed to find her way there too. I didn't say anything because I had nothing to hide.. but it's a horrible way to feel as a customer. 

I'm actually a licensed esthetician who has worked at Miraval, massage envy and European wax center in the past and am used to much more expensive products than what was offered ULTA.. I was here because I was completely out of face wash and moisturizer at home and instead of ordering my usual products online and waiting for shipping I would just rather go buy something. I had used Clinique as a teenager and my mother sold Lancôme as well and I knew ULTA had SOME of their items. 

I went to pay for my items and low and behold the larger woman followed me there and even had another worker come around from behind the counter while I was paying for my items to see if I had stolen anything there.. like I said I didn't say anything because I had nothing to hide but the entire experience was an embarrassment for everyone involved. 

Now I walked in wearing a $200 coach purse, my $300 lucky brand eye glasses, my Tommy Hilfiger sandals and was not dressed down.. the only  thing I could think of that COULD have made me look suspicious depending on the level of intellect the person had that was judging me, was that I was black. There were plenty of other people walking around the store but I was the only person being followed. 

I will never shop here again. I may as well have gone to a Walgreens in the hood.

It's fine enough product-wise, but I was the only customer in the store the evening I was shopping, and I was stalked by the employees.  From the second I walked in, there was an eerie feel as though I had just walked in at an awkward time and interrupted something going on that I shouldn't be privy too. Either that or they thought my shy, mousy appearance and careful scrutinizing of lotion brands was a red-flag for shoplifting. There were about 3-4 employees, and each one asked me if I needed help several times. They would stand near me and acted as though they thought it was a theft in progress, and with each check-in, they became increasingly more agitated that I was still in the store without purchasing anything (I was there a total of 15-20 minutes). After being approached, YET AGAIN, asking if I needed help, I finally just left and got lotion at the Walmart a few stores over...Nobody stalks you at Walmart!

Amanda, I believe is the young lady's name (tall brunette) who has helped me today and in the past if I'm lucky.  I'm a seasoned veteran in customer service myself and that girl is a total gem.  Her service shines and I have complete trust in her which also creates a lot of sales from me and I'm sure anyone who's fortunate to get obtain her service.  She also is very humble probably because she's a complete natural at this and truly seems to care. Please Ulta do whatever it takes to keep her and I will, and surely others will look forward to spending our money there.

I went to find a new foundation and asked one of the ladies if they would help me color match. Because of covid I couldn't test any of the foundations which is totally understandable but she basically accused me of testing them and taking off the tape when they were already previously tampered with. Had I been able to test them I wouldn't have asked for a second opinion so obviously I wasn't messing with the tape...

Don't go to the salon. I got a Nioxin blowout. A blowout gives you volume, my was flat to my head. She brushed my hair from root to tip ripping through it all. I called to let the managers know and they said there was nothing they could do and made it seem like I was making it up or that it was normal. I think there is a reason people don't know there is a salon in ulta, if they do, hopefully now they will know not to go. She also started working carelessly when her next client came. The manager said the only thing she can see wrong was that she over booked, but I shouldn't have to take the brunt of it. Don't waste your money.

As a shopper, you have a choice. Do you prefer the Walgreens beauty department staffed with folks who will shrug and say, "I don't know." when you ask a question about a product or Ulta which is staffed with people who will just lie? Because I'd probably prefer the honesty of "I don't know" over a rapid tour of the bullshit department. 

When I stopped by to pick up a new lipstain, I learned two things:
- the stain I wanted was discontinued.
- I could only get good advice if I was buying from the premium side of the store. Oh, hello, $30 lip color I don't want. 

The store is divided roughly in half: premium stuff on the left as you walk in and "budget brands" on the right. If you are there for a budget brand, I hope you know what you want! There is very little help available for those folks. The stock is deep, deep, deep with a lot of options so you can find just about any product from just about any drugstore brand. 

On the premium side, you can get samples and color tests and hand-holding to walk you through your big purchase. Again, the stock is pretty deep there, too. 

Ulta occupies a niche of "one step below Sephora, one step above Walgreens" which works when you know what you want. But to explore, it's probably best to head to Sephora for the first round or go over-the-top and hit up the beauty counters at your favorite department store. 

Ulta def. left me cold. Although maybe my new lipcolor is the right color...?

Accessibility notes: Doors open out. Some shelves are high up. Aisles are wide enough for shoppers with mobility devices to maneuver, although the floor is cluttered with endcaps often. No Braille signage. Checkout is a medium counter. Most mirrors are mounted for standing height.

I love Ulta so much and this one is fantastic!

First of all, Ulta is awesome because they have everything under the sun- beauty wise. If you are a girly girl, like me, this place is heaven. This particular store is not in a mall, so it's really big and everything is nice and spread out and easy to find.

I dropped in here looking for my favorite moisturizer combo: Olay Regenerist serum and Neutrogena moisturizer with retinol. If you want a couple of my beauty secrets, there they are- I use them both together. ANYWAY, I am always sure to buy these particular two products here because they usually have a "buy one, get one half off" deal on at least one of them. You just have to make sure you stop in at the right time. Sure enough, I was able to grab them for a great price. Yeah, it's only a few dollars cheaper than a drug store, but that kind of thing adds up.

They also have a really extensive perfume section and you can sample all of the perfumes before you buy them. This is a big deal, especially for someone like me who is obsessed with body sprays and perfumes (it must be the French in me).

If you are able, skip the Westbank Ulta and get to this one ASAP, for all of your beauty needs. They are sure to have something you can use.

Went to Ulta for the first time tonight. Walking in I was a little overwhelmed and made my way over to the higher end cosmetics section.  After years of drugstore makeup and skincare,  I wanted to see if these Ulta/Sephora stores would live up to the hype.                After about 5 min of fumbling awkwardly through the myriad of choices,  a sales girl by the name of Zoe approached me.  She was awesome!  I had no idea where to start, just said ugh.. Concealer. .ugh Primer... ugh Skin care... Help.  She was so professional,  and showed me different choices for items I was looking for.  Asked about my skin type,  and what my coverage needs were.  Tested out different products to fit my skin color,  and was very sweet and helpful.  I spent $277 but feel like it's money well spent.  When I got home I immediately tried out the Philosophy Miracle Worker products I bought and I'm in love.  I'll definitely be back!

Everyone is always super nice and helpful.  I'm not a makeup pro, and I love how the girls are so eager to help me out, even when I am being super picky on my lip gloss. It's my go to place for makeup.

I really love the people at this Ulta.  They are extremely helpful when you ask for it, but you have to ask because they aren't too forward (which I personally really like).  I have my two that I go to that I actually trust with recommendations, and I am such a picky little finicky customer, too.  The one thing I don't love for them is that they seem to be a liiiittle but on edge, which makes me feel like the security needs a little pumping up (hey corporate, listen up!).  Happy associates equal happy customers, and as good and educated and helpful and sweet sweet sweet as they are, if they don't feel safe, people will pick up on that energy. 
Anyway, love this Ulta, I go here all the time, probably always will.  One last thing:  more NARS and MAC, pretty please.

I went on the grand opening weekend so there were a bajillion employees in the store and I was offered help almost that many times. Everyone on staff was really nice and if they didn't know the answer to my question, then they found someone who did.

The store is clean and shiny as befits a brand new location. The signage was clear and while some areas were understocked...like the shipments hadn't made it in for opening day, in general I found the selection to be great.

Yes, this is a chain store, but a national chain in Orleans Parish is a reason to celebrate. This new location is walkable from my house rather than a drive out to the suburbs.

The police officer at this store looks at you as if you're going to steal something. I've never had this problem at any other Ulta store. I understand this Ulta isn't in the best neighborhood, but I'm not from this neighborhood. I live in a much nicer area and just happened to be in the area. I'd appreciate if I (being a well spoken, well dressed woman with three university degrees) was treated with respect. I DO NOT recommend this store if you want a good Ulta experience. Go to the Ulta in Harahan- better customer service (the associates at this store didn't speak to me or know where the one brand I asked for was) and you won't be stared at like a common criminal by the security guard.

Very disappointed. I thought a blow out was cheaper than my normal blow out spots (blo and others) because I had asked before and they told me $27. 

So my dumb self just figured that it'd be $27. Well plus shampoo/conditioner=47. Plus tip=52. Not worth it at all! I will stick to my normal blow out spots and will not return here. 

Such a rip off! Stylist was nice, and I hate to say it, but this was the worst blow out I've ever had :-(

I went to the salon for just a wash and blow out, the stylist Ashley asked me if I would be interested in a color (my hair was a drab brown color).... I said sure! OMG, she used a funky blue by City Beats and it is absolutely LOVELY! I was nervous because dye jobs in the past have left my hair dry and brittle but she recommend a few products to keep it healthy and moisturized until I come back for a touch up! It was such a pleasant experience and it'll def be going back!

My two most recent visits to Ulta have been great! And my review is pretty munched based on the services I had.  I had a hair cut, color, and my brows done on these visits. All the staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful. Racheal in the salon did an absolutely wonderful job on my hair. She listened to what I wanted with my cut and really helped me get my color where I wanted it to be. The girl that did my brows was fantastic and they look so good! I will continue coming here for my hair and brows.

First time review, with room for improvements and more review updates! This was my first time to Ulta, and I've heard both good and bad things about this particular location so I was bit leery headed in. Unlike some other reviewers disparaging comments about visits in the past, the store today was quiet, clean, well stocked, organized and there were no alarms going off with no one taking notice. I wasn't approached for assistance which I usually hate, but this being my first time, I was looking for a new product all together so a little guidance would've notched this up one more star at least. I asked for help and showed the rep two possible items I'd be willing to take home. She showed me the closest related product which was moderately priced compared to the other two I had pulled up on my phone. Elijah was my check out clerk and he was very cheery, helpful and polite. I'll definitely be back to check out the Ultamate Deals!

I visited Stephanie at the Benefit Brown bar and my brows - for the first time EVER - look excellent! She shaped them / cleaned them up. She was knowledgable and friendly and professional (Sometimes hard to find in NOLA). I'll definitely be going back! ((I have really dark brown hair and full brows that can get unruly - I challenged her and she rose to the task!))

Ulta is like home to me ... Its like Sephora's American cousin..... Tons of brands to choose from and a salon in store ...which Sephora is lacking. I only wish they had more men's cologne to choose from ...other than that it was a cool experience

You've got to be kidding me!  Finally a Ulta beauty shop close to my home.  In fact, on my way to work.  I was so excited about this new store opening that I went by to check out the store as it had just opened a few days ago.  First let me tell you I am an avid shopper and shop at Ulta all the time.  I love the mix of highness/lower end cosmetics.  Excited to be there I walk into the store to be greeted by a SECURITY GUARD not 3 feet from the entrance.  It went downhill from there.  I walked around looking at the new store to see if there were any specials, opening deals or coupouns.  NOT ONE SALES ASSOCIATE EVEN LOOKED AT ME OR SPOKE. I was in the store for about 30 minutes browsing when another customer comes up to me with a 20% coupon in her hand.  I inquired about where and when she got the coupon and she told me that someone from the store had been giving them to potential customers outside.  I took my bag that had about $80 worth of cosmetics in it and went to check out.  No eye contact, no smile, nothing.  I asked the sales associates before I checked out if there were any more coupons.  Complete silence so I asked again.  No one had an answer until finally one lady tells me there aren't anymore, they were handing them to people outside.  Even when speaking with me no one looked up or acted concerned that I had a question.  I simply put my bag down because at this point no one cared whether I spent $1 or $1000.  I prefer to spend my hard earned money somewhere where at least I get eye contact, a friendly smile or at least acknowledgement.  As I walked out one sales associate said 'Look it up on your phone.  There's a coupon.'  I asked what site and she replied' on your phone.'  Forget it.  I'll drive to the west bank and shop or go to the one on Earhart Blvd.  Or better yet Sephora at Lakeside where they give a damn.

I needed false eyelashes and long lasting eyeliner and other such supplies for parade day. The sales clerk was very helpful and kept checking in with me to see if I needed anything, not hovering but checking back. This store is very clean and bright with a big selection of all things beauty.

As soon as I walked in, I was greeted and felt welcomed. The staff is very helpful. I was checking out the perfumes when I sales associate approached me. I fell in love with the Jimmy Choo Illicit perfume, but was not in the market to make the $125 purchase. She told me to wait a second and returned from the back of the store with a package full of the rollerball version of the perfume which is priced at $24. It made my day!

I was out here for a wedding, and like an idiot, left the one foundation that I like at home. I stopped by this Ulta to buy a new one... but they were out of my shade. (Of course). The ladies were sweet enough to check back stock just in case, but no luck. They got me a sample cup with enough foundation to get me through the wedding with the right foundation on. THANK YOU for helping me!

It's a nice, new store, but all of the hair appliances can be purchased at amazon for $25 cheaper. Also, if you want to return anything, they require you give them your first and last name, phone number, and email. Only other option is that you wait 20 minutes for a manager to 'waive' this requirement. Not a big fan.

Only stopped in for some specific lashes and the staff was super helpful in helping me to locate them. The line was long but moved quickly! The store was surprisingly clean and I enjoyed my visit. Typical Ulta. Although I didn't know what to expect because of the neighborhood it's set in, but I was pleasantly surprised.

Sorry to have to leave a negative review but I got eyelash extensions at Ulta salon and I believe the esthetician was young and very inexperienced. First of all a hurried process in which she glued my eyes closed several times and had to pry then loose , I left with gobs of glue on my left eyelid which she assured me would dry and fall off ( two weeks laters still gobs of glue on left eye) it's embarrassing so I don't feel I can go out in public it looks like I have I eye gunk. I called to express my disappointment they assured me the manager would call me back... She didn't. Please don't go here for services it's a rip off and did I mention the chair is extremely uncomfortable for such a long service. Pretty salon but not paying for decor.

I went to a well-know, trendy hair salon where they told me they weren't able to do a one-process color without doing balyage and charging at least twice the original quote and then was asked if I wanted to add treatment for roots. I left. I was looking for a beauty supply store so I could just do it myself. Found that Ulta has a full salon in the back.

CC is amazing!!! It was the perfect experience getting my hair done. 

When I got home and saw my hair in my own bathroom light, I didn't like how it turned out. Sometimes that just happens when a stylist has a new client getting used to each other, the words a client uses to describe, the chemistry of how hair reacts to new products. I called back, CC got me a new appointment and we fixed it right up. As is industry standard, I wasn't charged for the second appointment, though I did choose to tip, which she declined and I insisted. It was exactly what I was looking for. CC will be my stylist that I will go to from now on, I even let her trim my very curly hair because I trusted her so much, and she's proved that she genuinely listens to what a client wants and cares to make sure they're happy, and has excellent skills. It certainly helps that the price is very reasonable there, but I feel loyal to CC even if it was more expensive. She knows her color, how to trim curly hair, and is a delightful person.
Closing before actual closing time! I can assume because worker are going home early.

Makeup wise - I buy everything but mascara here. Oh, best nail polish selection! 

Everything else, you can literally walk out of the door, take a right on the sidewalk and trot your happy ass ten yards down to T. J. Maxx where you can get the same lotion/shampoo/perfume for half the price. 

Best shopping tip: 

(1) Sign up for the rewards points. They add up quickly. 

(2) When the weekly flyer comes, put it in your car immediately. You'll swear you won't need it but you will. Saves an average of $5.00.

(3) If you buy Bed Head, Big Sexy Hair, Sensories Shampoo/Conditioner, any of the holiday store brand lotions, HEMP BRAND LOTION, or any of the fragranced cleansing cloths. Check out T.J. Maxx first. Literally (and I only use that word to say don't be dumb) half price next door.

Cheers!

Came in here with the lady-friend so she could buy some make up. I'll try to be as fair as possible in analysis based on my observations and her input, as I am unfamiliar with women's beauty products.

Products: Make-up and beauty products for face, hair, and nails. The selection sure looked rather large. Of course, I've never been in a big box beauty supply store before, so I have no point of reference. 3 stars

Service: Cashiers and floor assistants. The cashiers were okay. I don't think we utilized the assistants, though. 3 stars

Facilities: This store is in a new strip mall that is right off South Claiborne. Parking is easy, and it is clean. Signage is readily visible on the whole, but the silver on brick is a little hard on the eyes. 3 stars

Overall: I guess if you're looking for make up in New Orleans, this would be one of your stops. 3 stars

4/7/17: Had my hair colored and it turned out nothing like I had described. I was frustrated and upset because this was the first time I was getting my hair colored and I was there for over FIVE HOURS. I was ask to pay and return the next day for a "quick fix".  
4/8/17: I arrived 12:40 for my appointment and was there for an hour and had nothing done to my hair because the manager stated that she "has the right to refuse service" to me. She didn't even apologize or ask what had happened. The other stylist offered to fix my hair on Wednesday.
4/12/17: Returned today and the stylist was nice and kind, but unfortunately, my hair is actually back to my original hair color! 

To summarize: I came in with healthy, curly naturally, virgin, black hair and now I am left with chemically treated, chemically smelling, dry brittle hair. 

The hair salon manager and the store manager were defensive and didn't even apologize. The manager, Brittany, said "sorry" today ONLY after I gave her a piece of my mind in front of the customers. I received my refund, but I found their customer service to be unprofessional. I was never addressed with any concerns I had and when asked how they will prevent this from happening to another customer, they didn't care. The manager, Brittany, just tried to brush off any responsibility stating she knows nothing about hair. It's not about the hair color, its about the customer service. I have left upset and crying twice. I will not be returning to this Ulta again and will be filing a report with the Better Business Bureau.

So far my experiences with this Ulta and shopping center have been great! Parking has never been a problem, and I think it's easy enough getting in an out. 

Upon walking in, I was greeted by a staff member that helped me find the Rimmel brand makeup, though they didn't have what I was looking for. I ended up going with another drugstore brand eyeshadow that's working out really well. I also tested out about 20 different eyeliners, and settled on an Urban Decay color. BTW, make sure to use their makeup remover at their makeup station so you don't look like a crazy person with lines and makeup all over your hands!

The staff was very attentive while I was there, and I saw them helping other guests with their makeup needs. This one is just as extensive as the one in Elmwood, though maybe just the tiniest bit smaller. 

I found most everything I needed besides the specific Rimmel eyeshadow color, and was checked out promptly. My only issue with Ulta is I don't really understand how to utilize their point system, and they never have deals on Bare Minerals which I use religiously for concealer. 

Also buyer beware of things that are on sale. I bought Almay eye makeup remover pads on sale, but usually go with Neutrogena eye makeup remover. The pads don't work half as well as Neutrogena's more expensive remover and I'm going through at least 2 everytime with eyemakeup still left over, just an FYI.

I'm vacationing in Nola and needed to buy my beauty essentials that I didn't feel like flying with. So I decided to come here which was a bad idea. At first I was looking around for like 3 or 4 minutes to locate the things that I needed and also was reading reviews online of some new products I was looking at but then out of nowhere comes the security guard. That lady might as well have holded my items because she was on my ass the whole time. I am very light skin and obviously look like a tourist so I can just imagine how she is with the locals. Let's just say I only bought 2 of the items I needed because I was dieing to get out of there. I have never experience that before and really shows the lack of training she has. Just because the store was empty... you do not chase your only customer out the door. It really sucks because I saw they had a lot of sales and needed to buy other items. She even stood near the cash register. I was cracking up inside because what is an old lady going to do if I had decided to steal something. She looked like she coul3dnt even run. Anyways went to Sephora right after where they don't care if you spend few extra minutes reading product labels and reviews.

I stopped here this morning on my way home from uptown. I recently found out that I'm allergic to carmine (red dye used in most lip color) and a preservative in a lot of beauty products. I asked a girl working there if she knew of any carmine free lip color and her reply was "honestly I do not" and walked off. I knew Sephora brand has carmine free so I'll bring my business elsewhere!

Ahemm. Lemme clear my throat so I can tell it on the mountain. 

Leah has gotten my eyebrows together! They are beautifully shaped and cooperating and she did it! 

Ok. Other reasons I'm in Ulta include the awesome selection, sales, and customer service. There's parking right out front & everyone that I've met in there is knowledgeable about the products and what they do. 

You need a conditioner that won't make your scalp oily? They have that. A primer to keep away the shiny? They know which one. A setting spray so all your flyness stays in place? It's right over here. You meant for your hair? They have that, too. 

True, they run out of certain popular items... Last time this issue popped up an associate checked the shipment that they were putting out to see if my item had arrived and not been put out yet. And then.... You guys... She helped me order it online. Even looked up my rewards card number so I could still earn points for the purchase. 

That's service. 

And if you need somebody to handle your brow and makeup action, you already know they've got you covered.

I'm guessing this is the only one in the area.  Every time I come for their matte lip cream the colors I want are sold out. Also I heard two other people asking for things that they were sold out of. I think they can do a better job with training staff. The girl who I asked for help wasn't able to find a product even close to what I wanted. One girl was very knowledgeable but by the time I found her the store was closing. But one good thing about any Ulta is that they always have some kind of sale!

I have totally transitioned from going to Sephora to going to Ulta for Purity face wash and Bare Minerals. Ulta will always have these products and it's just way easier to get to on Claiborne than trying to speed walk through the mall. 

That being said the last couple of times I've headed in here, I've felt that they're curbing their mid-level beauty products for higher-end makeup and hair products. So when I can't find the economically-priced makeup that I know is still available in drug stores like CVS, I get pretty bummed out. Also if you like glitter-y makeup, get it before seasons like Carnival and Halloween because they usually run out fast and don't restock very quickly. 

It would be great if they knew your purchasing history and could recommend a similarly-priced option when your usual buys are being discontinued in the store. The staff is still nice, though I feel like they could be more well-informed about alternative products. 

Also...not sure why but an alarm was going off in the store the whole time I was there this last time. No employees mentioned anything about it, it just. kept. going.

Keysha did my hair today and charged me full highlights when all she did was roots. She blow dried my hair with me facing the wall so I didn't see the color. When I got home my hair looks awful, dark and red (no highlights). It's a joke when I I had to pay full highlights. Will never go back. Wasted $185. Wish there was a negative star here.

They cancelled a couple of hours before my appointment...after making an appointment and finding someone to watch my daughter they cancelled with no explanation and said their stylist just had to leave early. I will not be rescheduling after going through the trouble of coordinating someone to watch my child so I can go get a haircut, only for them to cancel a couple of hours before I go in!

I'm not a fan of this Ulta location. You might get service. You might not. Just depends who is working. Clean and usually not so friendly staff. Everyone at this location is usually really rude or they act like you are bothering them. If you have a question about anything, don't bother. Go to a different location. Also don't get your eyebrows done here. If they even decide to do them.

It's been about 1 month since I got my hair cut by a "Pro" at Ulta in New Orleans. I was waiting to write this review to see if ULTA would contact me back, because I have not heard from them I am writing this review. It was 1 week before my big birthday and I went in for a trim all around including my long bangs. The pro stylist did not  ask me how I wanted it, and then I decided to tell her what I was there for and as I ALWAYS get the same length, I asked for my bangs to flare out with the shortest length below my cheek bone. When the stylist turned me around towards the mirror, I see my bangs (a pinch amount of bangs) 1 inch away from my hairline! I of course flipped out by what I saw and was outraged because I was having a birthday celebration in a week and was left with just a pinch of hair right in the middle of my front hairline which did not blend into anything. My hair literally was sticking out like a little girl cutting her own hair. The stylist by the name of CC stated to me "I'm sorry I was not able to see where you were pointing because of your mask". Im sorry but me pointing to where I wanted the length had nothing to do with my mask because I'm pointing in the same place with or without the mask, it's still on the same place. I sure did not point onto my forehead! I can say this was the worst experience I ever had with ULTA and I will not go back there again for any services! Please be advices about their cervices and know if you get a "pro" it necessary won't be one.

Whent to the store to buy some makeup and decided to get my lip waxed while I was there. The esthetician that saw me was very nice but waxed hair and some skin from half of my lip! It is incredibly painful and I am sure I will end up with a big scab for a few days. The part that really upset me was that when I went to talk to a manager, she made me feel like the incident was my fault. That I should have known better than to get a wax because I use tumeric to treat hiper pigmentation on my lip! I went into the store to do something nice for my aperance and now I am leaving with an injury, which will most likely leave a mark and upset with the way I was treated. Not likely to shop there again.

Only giving a 1 star because of the customer service. I was looking for something specific, and tried to look for someone to help so I could find it faster. I ran into an associate saying "Hi, do you work here?" I asked simply because I couldn't see a name tag. She said nothing, but looked down at her little apron and flipped it motioning she does work there, still not opening her mouth. I could then tell how deeply she enjoyed her job. She was a little larger set with reddish hair and glasses. Couldn't tell you her name, since like I said she wasn't wearing one. The associate greeting customers walking in was friendly, as well as the cashier. However, because of ONE associate, I will never come back to this location.

One day last week I walked inside of Ulta beauty on South Claiborne to purchase some makeup by Juvias Place. I had been wanting to try this makeup for so long. Once I got inside no one greeted me or even acknowledged me so I continued on my journey to finding my product. Once I located it I then asked for assistance from one of the workers who were standing in a huddle with the security guard watching me as if I were about to steal. She didn't really help me with the product she didn't even give me an answer on helping me find the right color concealer. I just left. Thanks Ulta for hiring people without any customer service traits.

I was so excited that a location would be opening closer to me than Plymouth Meeting or Exton. Unfortunately the 3 times I have been in this location I've experienced horrible customer service. Not because of the girls on the floor or the girls who ring you out but by the management team. Anytime time I've been waiting in line to check out a manger has been either discussing something that should be spoken about off the floor or scolding and belittling employees. It's horrific the way they speak to the employees and these conversations should NOT be had ON THE FLOOR or IN FRONT OF CUSTOMERS I've literally heard the words " you're being stupid, shut up and listen" a manger speaking to an employee in this nature. Awful. I'll drive the extra time to the two other locations just so I'll never have to experience the horrible ways the mangers treat the employees.
