It's always never the same manager 3 separate mangers, 3 separate times. Again. The girls one the floor and ringing me out, so incredible, so knowledgable and helpful. Managers a nightmare and I'll never shop at this location again.

I find Ulta  be a pleasant experience if you're looking to find many of your beauty items in one place. You are able to find the most popular or lower end brand such as Maybelline and Revlon. The most interesting items are in front of the register on a three to four tier stand. It's like going to the supermarket ,while you're standing in line, you pick out two or three pieces of candy because they're inexpensive and you want to munch while you wait. 

When shopping the items are clearly marked off by brands, the type of items such as lipsticks and the are separate from eyeshadow or mascara etc. While the store is easy to navigate by the signs posted on a Saturday everyone is ringing at the register. I walked around for about 10 to 15 minutes and there is no one to assist you on the floor. There were about 15 customers shopping when I was in the store and I could not find anyone to help me locate the item that I was looking for. Because I really wanted the item I was able to locate it on my own. This works out for me because Ulta generally has a coupon in the Sunday paper that I can use.  If I save money then I can look for the item myself, but I would probably spend more money if I had assistance!

Ulta is kinda like Sephora meets Duane Reade.
Beauty supplies galore (at full retail), includingnails, hair and skincare.

Visit Jan 29, 2015 I've soooo wanted to love this place but after 2 visits it's just nice to drive up the Blue Route to the one in Conshy.
Salespeople here seem to seek out the well-dressed and ignore the other people. If you ask for help they pretend they don't hear and walk away. If you get their attention, twice I was told to hold on while they went to other customers who asked for help after me. SORRY, but both times I've come here after the gym with no makeup on so I didn't make the "cut" for being important. Well I am because I spend !
And the cashiers---- Rude seems to be the best word to describe.
Ending this review on a positive note: The manager offered me assistance.

Renee did a fabulous job with my hair and make up. She was patient, and really understood my preferences. She added nice curls for my hair that lasted all day and till the end of the night, frizz and hassle free. Only one feedback-mayb the foundation or highlighter/concealer used under my eyes gave a whitish reflection in pictures. Might have picked a shade too light for my complexion. Otherwise a great experience at a reasonable price. I got a lot of compliments on my look.

The ULTA at this location is only so-so.  The shelves never seem to be fully stocked, and the testers are frequently messy looking.  The BENEFIT area tends to be the worst; always lots of used cotton balls and tissues lying about, and the counter is grubby.   Having said that, the customer service is good.  I always get offers of help and everyone is friendly and polite.  The bright star is Kiana in the salon.  She's been doing my hair for the last few months and does a stellar job!  The salon is always clean and orderly, and they offer coffee or water when you arrive.  So, if I need cosmetics I go to MACY'S down the hall and just do ULTA for my hair.

Our love hate relationship continues but I'm adding a star because they are slightly improved and I had a coupon. 
- there are always at least 4 headsetted people on the floor and only 2 checkers with 15 plus people in line. Today I counted 20 people. I almost walked out. 

- when you ask the on the floor headsetted people for help they can't hear you because either management or or coworkers are talking into their ears. 
I had one tell me to hang on today because someone was giving her instructions through her headset. 
*******. NO! tell the person on the headset to hold on !!!!!!!!!!!!

Ulta just try to remember the customers drive your sales and profits.

Every single time I go in here it looks like a complete mess. Almost every lipstick is sold out, opened or smushed. The store associates tell you to come back because the next shipment is coming in tomorrow. I'm pretty sure they need to order more inventory. Ulta, get it together, you're a hot mess.

Eh not a fan - Only visited the store not the hairstylist.

The staff was not very friendly.  I asked where checkout was and she said "front of store".  Um There are two doors which do you consider the front.   It was actually off to the side near the mall not the parking lot.

I came to pick up gel but the price was a bit much $44 vs $24 on Amazon.  They DON'T price match.  I really want to support brick and mortar stores but that's a huge jump.  I really wanted the product so I picked up the smaller container for $20 thinking I can use the $3.50 coupon (off $15) but of course it's excluded (gotta check the website for excluded brands).  I ended up buying the product but was not happy about it especially for $4 more I could have gotten over double the size online.

I probably wont 'be back.   Just not impressed.

I got my hair done by Roxy and I showed her a picture of exactly what I wanted. She did an amazing job recreating the look. I am so happy with how my hair came out! Definitely see her if you are thinking of doing something different. You can't go wrong.

I went here to get a blow dry a few weeks ago. I don't usually get my hair blown dry but I decided I wanted to treat myself because I was going to go out with my friends that night. When I called to set up my appointment, I specifically told the receptionist that I also had tape in extensions and I double checked to make sure if the stylists were comfortable with working with them (if not i wouldn't have gone) and she told me yes and that I was going to be with Brittany (I believe that was her name). I got there and when she took me back to the chair I told her I just wanted it blown out and beachy curls. She said okay and brought me back to the shampoo area and didn't even attempt to make any type of conversation with me at all. It was awkward and I felt uncomfortable. We went back to her station in the front. I sat down and she started to comb my hair through, so i tried to make some type of conversation about my hair extensions. I asked her if the front desk told her I had hair extensions and she told me no. I shrugged it off assuming it was just a mistake. She then began blow drying my hair with an old flat bristle brush that was not even cleaned out from her clients before i'm assuming. It had broken bristles and was full of other peoples hair. She turned my chair away from the mirror the entire time and every time I turned it a little so that I could see my hair she turned me back the other way. After drying it, she started trying to curl my hair with a flat iron to make a body wave...... This entire time (over 2 hours) i was faced away from the mirror in silence and hoping that my hair will turn out okay. At last, she turned my to the mirror after completely frying my expensive hair extensions and i was completely SHOCKED at how ridiculous my hair looked. I took my bill and went to speak to a manager who was unavailable. I grudgingly paid my bill after talking to the front desk (they couldn't do anything about it)....$37 dollars!!!! Like WHAT I could go to a nice salon and pay that amount. I literally looked like George Washington. I left and had to go home and completely redo my hair which made me late for my plans for the night. I tried to call the manager the next day and never heard back from her even though the person who picked up the phone assured me that they would call me back.

This was literally the worst hair experience i've ever had. 0/10

As a new individual to the area it was really hard to to initiate the search for a stylist. It is doubly hard for an African American female. Luckily, I got ahold of Kiana at Ulta. She has done phenomenal job with my hair. She is open to questions and always advises me on the best course of action. She even gives alternatives. I appreciate her hair knowledge and her professionalism.

I wish I could give less than one star. I've been to this Ulta several times as it is in my neighborhood mall. I'm sitting here with an Ulta coupon dreading going to this location because I know the staff here will be little to  no help in assisting me pick out new makeup. Also, everything I go to buy will be either picked through or out of stock anyway. It has been the last THREE times I've been there. Want plain black UD eyeliner? Gone-you can get purple or green though! On the off chance there is someone there to help, there is a 99% chance they will blow me off or offer a really rushed recommendation. 

I really wish I could go to this more convenient location, but based on several past experiences, I know it will be well worth it to make the trip to the one in Exton or DE. 

I never write reviews, but I'm sitting here really mad that this location is so bad that I won't go there to attempt to buy something for fear I'll just be wasting my time (and obviously theirs).

This Ulta location has potential. It's always well stocked with brands available via Ulta, fairly organized and clean, offers salon treatments and even today I had their skin care specialist offer to assist me with finding a mask suited for my skin needs. However their cashiers are either downright careless, lazy or in a rush to move on the next customer. I have never once been told by a cashier the number of beauty rewards I have available to use (thankfully I check my email) and have to tell the cashier "I think I have beauty rewards available", it's always uncomfortable as if I'm telling them they didn't do their job. 

Also I usually just sprint through the store, grab the things I need and go however today I had more time on my hands, shopped around and racked up a pretty hefty bill. So I definitely noticed the sign on one of the pricier skin care items that said free gift with purchase. After the transaction was complete I mentioned it to the cashier who seemed bothered I pointed it out and had to refund the item to give the gift. Sorry? Anyway I'm sure I'll be back to this Ulta given its convenient location but I'll be double checking rewards & promos and recommend you do the same.

I am only reviewing the salon in Ulta as I've never shopping in the store itself.  ROXY (stylist) is simply AMAZING! She is so friendly, yet professional. She is passionate about her clients and her work. Her stylist skills are very impressive! I keep going back to her because she knows her stuff! She listens to your wants, then makes it happen. You will NOT be disappointed!

This review is not necessarily for this Ulta location, but a specific employee, Ne'Ana (Nay). I walked in today looking for items I needed to repurchase. I was quite disappointed in the selection of the Ulta brand cosmetics due to a messy and unstocked display.. I almost just turned around and walked out, but I decided to walk around and look at some more products. luckily I did, because I ran into Nay! she simply said "hello, how are you doing" not pressuring me with "do you need help?" or "you should try this!" We ended up spending about an hour together playing with the brands Soap & Glory and No.7. she showed me so many new products and was extremely honest with her opinions and suggestions for me. I felt comfortable talking to her as if I was talking to a friend. She completely outshines ANY other employee at this location. I will absolutely be returning specifically for Nay to help me in the future.

I just left the Salon at Ulta at the Springfield Mall. Thankfully,  I was able to get an appointment right away to fix the awful haircut that I received at another local (and we'll reviewed) salon. Bless the girl up front! 

Roxanna  (Roxy) did an amazing job and I left with nearly the exact cut I was going for in the first place.  She completely understood the look I wanted and explained each cut she was making before doing it so that I would be remain comfortable and understand the process. 

I strongly recommend seeing her, as I will be going back for trims from now on. I also received two compliments from other customers while  standing in line up front to pay! 

I would also like to add that the salon and surrounding workspaces were very clean and that the other stylists were pleasant as well. 

Very, very happy new client.
Love this place! However, never stocked with the items I'm looking for, so I have to make multiple trips.

Don't have waste your time at this store, and you will waste valuable time you can never get back, shop On-line. While I am a huge fan of Ulta as a whole this store is awful, and will not return. As a former Retail Manager Ulta Corporate should be embarrassed and ashamed of the managers they have in this location. The line was more than 12 deep with 2 cashiers in December. There were 2 managers helping one of them. When they looked up and saw the line their eyes bugged out and they WALKED AWAY, without even saying anything. I had to exchange a defective item that arrived and they tried charging me more for the exchange. The manager came over and said she would honor the price like it was a favor not what she was supposed to do. They then said I owed them tax. I explained it's an even exchange and I paid tax when I ordered it. She told me not her problem, she already adjusted the price. I took my original, left and called on-line back. They were extremely nice and seemed genuinely horrified about what I told them and rectified the situation.

The staff here is honestly terrible. I went to this Ulta because I did not have the time to drive to the Sephora at King of Prussia. I went in looking for a very particular type of brush. I was in there for 20 minutes or so looking around the whole store for brushes and when I was not making progress, I decided to check with a salesperson. She looked me up and down and after hearing my description of the brush, she told me to check the front of the store. 

I did and I still did not find what I was looking for, so I went back to where the staff was standing around. I asked the same salesperson and her coworker who was standing next to her again. One of them said, "No, we do not have it." I said, "Do you know if any of the stores around here would?" to which she responded with "I honestly don't even know what you're talking about." I showed her a picture and she said, "I'm not sure, you can maybe try Michael's(the arts and crafts store.) I said, "Why would an arts and crafts store have that?" and she said that's probably your best bet....




(The brush that I was looking for all over the store was Yachiyo Brush #27 by NARS. I know Ulta does not carry NARS, but I really only wanted something similar to it as I really needed it that day and did not have the time to go to KOP.)

I got my eyebrows waxed & tinted by an expert brow specialist named Chi. I love, love, love the job that she did. It was well worth it. The cashier was dry and wouldn't give me my birthday gift without an email although I didn't recurve one. She was able to look me up by my number and knew it was my birthday so I thought that she sucked big time. The 5 stars are solely for the brow specialist. I'll definitely be going back to ulta just for her. Btw, no problems with my birthday gift at Sephora. Customer service really is key.

I go to this Ulta because it's close to my home, if not I would avoid going to this store at all cost. Why? They never have anything in stock. Their products are all over the place. After I asked them about if they had any products, they looked annoyed but proceeded to anyway. They told me there wasn't any in the back but they get shipments on Tuesday. I came on Saturday of next week and the shelves look the same as it did last week. Brands from nyx, revlon, Tarte, etc. will be hard to find because apparently most of their products are popular and run out not even a week of receiving shipment. 

I recommend going to Ulta in the city. Products never out of stock and great customer service!

I got my makeup done by Christina on Saturday for Halloween. She did an amazing job, she really took her time and paid attention to detail. She was very professional as well.  Almost a week later people are still complimenting how great my makeup looked! I would definitely recommend Christina to anyone that needs their makeup done, and will definitely be contacting her for any future occasions!

I have been seeing Kiana for about a year. She is amazing. Great color, cuts, and my hair is healthier and lovely than it has been in years.She is also the fastest hairdresser I have ever used. Hard to find someone who does all types of hair well, including African American women like me. She is the stylist that all of the other Ulta hairdressers go to for hair advice and suggestions. Try her she is simply amazing!

This is a review for Roxanna at the Ulta Salon in Springfield, PA. I had my hair cut by Roxy yesterday, and I can't rave enough about her! I've been going to a more upscale salon that costs twice as much for a while now, but I started looking around because I felt like my old hairstylist wasn't really listening to what I wanted. On a whim, I decided to try the Ulta Salon, and I'm so glad I did. Roxy did an incredible job of listening to exactly what I wanted, walking me through each step to make sure we were on the right track, and delivering the perfect cut. I will definitely be going to her from now on!

I've been getting my hair done by Roxy ever since my first review and so has my husband.  She does any amazing fade and cut for men and I have been so in love with my hair.  She is the best and I will never go to anyone else!

I am absolutely baffled by the customer service, or shall I say lack of customer service in this store. I can't speak for managers, as I have not had many interactions with them, but let me just say that girls who work here are completely condescending, rude, classless, robotic, I mean the list can go on and on. They are very "judgy" against anyone who doesn't appear to be completely fashionable and well-off, which is interesting because you would probably expect that clientele out of idk, a higher-quality store like Sephora, but WAIT, people don't normally have bad experiences there, maybe because they hire better people, regardless I'd just like to send a special shout out to the customer service associate who completely judged my cousin on her visit the other day, for her lack of makeup knowledge and said to her "oh, I'm guessing you need the broke college brand." You're very lucky she is a nice person, because you would have not liked my response if that had been me.
Just got my hair cut by Roxana and she was absolutely fabulous! I'm in love with my new hair.
This is a great Ulta in the Springfield Mall with good customer service and plenty of products available.  I don't shop at Ulta much, so when I do, it's always a treat :)

have only been a client of Travis for a few years now but he is absolutely fabulous!! He is an expert at his craft. I remember my first visit with him. I was referred to him by one of my girlfriends and even though she looked amazing, I was still nervous about what he could do for me. From the time I arrived I felt welcomed.  The young receptionist at the salon was so friendly and offered me coffee. Travis soon after came for me with a brilliant smile, introduced himself and we began to chat about my hair. I, of course was all over the place but he listened to me and formulated a plan and look that was right for me! My color and cut was beyond what I was looking for!! I picked up some things for maintenance and the lady in the aisle was complimenting me. Needless to say I see Travis every six weeks. I just couldn't have anyone else touch my hair lol. He is not just talented but a really nice guy. I love what he does for my hair but he has become a friend too!

Amanda the manager here is amazing! I recently moved to this area and do not know a lot of people around here which can be extremely lonely. I also am in chronic pain recovering from 3 broken vertebrae in my spine and a torn MCL in my left knee. So when I feel good enough and my pain is somewhat manageable I love to shop for makeup. Since I don't know many people here so I don't have girlfriends to go with but I love chatting about my favorite brands, best products ex. Amanda made me feel like I was shopping with one of my close girlfriends. I told her what I was looking for and she showed me her favorite products and helped me find what would look best with my extremely pale skin. Not to make this really corny but it's people like Amanda who keep a company thriving. Makeup is a hobby/lifestyle for me and I love other woman who are passionate about it as well. Finally being able to walk without a walker and get out and meet people in my area is a really big deal when you were bed ridden for months. I am so glad the woman at this ulta all helped me and educated me on different products and showed me what would help fix the dryness of my skin. The store is clear and organized and the ladies who work there defiantly helped pull my out of the funk I have been in. Amanda especially deserves recognition her makeup was flawless which obv makes you trust their opinion more and I ended up leaving with $220 on account of her educating me on the best products. The store itself and the staff here are incredible great work ladies!

I just got crazy great service from Melissa !!! Was looking for a particular eye shadow brush. She found what I was looking for and provided different price options!! Thanks ,my makeup will look great tomorrow!!!

I recently had an appointment with Lisa at The Salon at Ulta for color and cut.  Walking out of the salon looking amazing felt  wonderful. The cut she gave me is so easy to style...it's perfectly cut and falls right into place.  I will definitely be seeing Lisa on my next appointment.

I love ulta as a company for the products they offer, but this location is a mess in terms of customer service. The staff are constantly clustered around the "prestige" section talking to one another. I was last there on a Thursday night, and there were 25 people in line at one point, with only two cashiers working the five available registers. After waiting in line for half an hour, midway through the conversation/transaction, the cashier turns to the other and says, "I guess people aren't in the Christmas spirit anymore." Seriously?? I may not have been at my absolute friendliest after waiting in that line, but I was still being completely polite to her. In any event, totally uncalled for. 

On my way out, I saw no less than six staff on the floor. The manager walked past the registers several times, stared at the line, and walked away. I get that they need people on the floor to assist customers, but throw a few people on registers for five minutes to kill the lines. They're only talking to each other anyway and rarely actually have product knowledge beyond the most popular prestige brands. I've given it so many chances but this type of stuff has been happening for years at this location, and there's never a "sorry for the wait" or even a smile half the time. I wouldn't dream of letting someone from their salon touch my hair or face. It's honestly worth it to drive thirty minutes to the next nearest store at this point.

I came to the salon after following a variety of stylists on instagram to see their work from multiple Ulta locations. I found Travis' instagram and kept my eye on it for a bit because I had seen he did work on someone with similar hair color to mine (icy blonde), it is hard for me to trust someone with my blonde because i am very particular about the way it looks. I jumped right in and Travis was quick and took every little detail into account. my color is EXACTLY how I wanted it to come out in ALL the right places and ways!! I am so happy with the job he did and I will definitely be returning to him! not only did he nail the color, he gave me a beautiful much needed cut, Definitely suggest him to ANYONE in need of a stylist who listens and makes you feel comfortable in his hands! thank you Travis!

I had placed an order with them and they said it was delivered on August 14th.   I never received it.  They sent it to a different address.   I called customer service and they said it couldn't be replaced. Now I'm out of money.  Don't shop here or order from them. Don't waste your time or money.  I'm very unsatisfied.

This place seems to be very well organized, plenty of products to choose from. So why the one star for this place. Well for me it is not always the establishment, more or less it is the people that are working at these establishment; and this place has that problem. Employees here did not seem interested in my money or us  being there. 

I was there with my wife looking to purchase some products she was interested in. When we walked in there were 4 employees; three females and a heavy set gentleman, doing nothing except walking around looking busy. as we walked pass by each person; not one ask if they can assist us with anything. the looks on their faces also said it all. what their facial expression showed that they really didn't want to be there.
 
Lousy first and last experience. never again!!!!

Such nice people 
But a big mistake was made on my hair 
My scalp burns 
My scalp is so dry and flaky 
My grey want not covered

I have gone to this Ultra twice and have had great customer service each time. I just wanted to say that today I went in for some retail therapy after receiving some distressing news. Kate (pink hair) was working in the Smashbox section and was really great! She helped me with a mascara and to find a contouring palate. I apologized for seeming a bit upset and told her why and she gave me some confidence back. So just wanted to say thanks!

"Excuse me, I'm looking for hair lighteners?"
"Uh, I dunno. That area over there."

Well, gee, that was super helpful...

I might be getting my money back but I will not shop here anymore.  I'm throwing out my rewards card.   I'm very unsatisfied.   Don't send me any emails.   I'm going to leave all my friends know how bad you do business.   I'll make sure everybody i know will be told not to shop there..
I love Ulta..they have everything I need..This is truely a "girl" store..I love the atmosphere. .

Travis did such a horrible job on my daughter's hair and makeup today for her senior prom. After $165. you would expect her hair to actually look good. He either has no skills, education or experience OR he hates his job and takes it out on his customers. Either way-Travis is a disappointment. Thank you to the manager-Ella-who was very professional and offered to refund the money.

I was expecting a cleaner area when I arrived to pay for my items. The cashier doesn't wipe anything down after each guest & the card reader/keypad was sticky!! Why is it sticky?! We're in the middle of a global pandemic people. Keep it clean.

Roxy did my hair today.  I got a complete new look. Cute cut, perfect color...I am super happy!

Thanks for your patience and skill. I love it and will be back.

There is always a line to the back of the store no matter what time you are there. They only have one or two people at the register and the managers and other staff walk around and don't come help the line move. Poor management there. Will go to sephora instead.

Since there is no Sephora in Media, we head to ULTA to play with SOME of the brands we like.  Lorac, Urband Decay, Murad, Dermalogica, Alterna, Redken, OPI.

The staff is not nearly as knowledgable as you might think - it really depends on the person and a few of the "gals" seem harried and hurried.

Also there is ALWAYS a line at check out. (At least on weekdays after 5 PM and Saturday mornings, which is usually when we go.

Read the circular, use your points - and some GREAT sales (Like LORAC glosses 50% off - $8 instead of $16) can be found!

I went in Ulta to get a product to cover my blemishes for an event I was going to. I usually don't wear makeup so I had no clue what to ask for. Latifah was a life saver. She helped me find a product that covered my blemishes perfectly. She was so nice and welcoming. Thanks Latifah.

Not a great deal of high end product, rude store clerks (not all) store workers were not aware of their own sales, did not know they didnt even carry a line they told me was " up front". I mean I should not have to tell 3 clerks that there was a bogo sale on all lipstick. When I get up to register? The lady rings me up under another name...Im like who is Denise? So I dont know if I got the credit for the purchase or not! I gotta tell you there was nothing fun or enjoyable about shopping there. Made me sad.
The manager racially profiled a black man who went in to purchase some products. Absolutely disgusting behavior, save your time and money and go to a Sephora instead!

Have gotten my hair done here a couple times before ranging from prom updos to standard haircuts, and everything has always come out amazing! I used to go to Great Clips for a cheap haircut, but once I got my hair done by Ulta Salon I could never go back. Travis and Renee are particularly talented in their craft. Highly recommend for any type of hair style or type.

Really needed a haircut and was able to schedule an appointment for the next day. When I arrived there was a short wait while, but I was warmly greeted and offered a beverage. Renee was amazing! The length, layers, and bangs are exactly what I wanted! I will definitely be coming back for future haircuts!

I'm used to receiving a credit card spiel at checkout, but I told the cashier clearly and firmly that I wasn't interested. When the buttons to accept the credit card offer appeared on the screen, she told me "Just hit yes because you were approved." If I was just being absentminded and listened to her, I would have signed myself up for a card offer I explicitly said I didn't want. Luckily, I read the screen and hit the correct "no" button. Upon realizing I was going to reject the offer, the cashier once again pushed the card asking "Well, how often do you shop here?" The answer is not enough, and definitely not anymore. I may consider shopping online where I'm not bombarded with credit card offers, but there's no reason for me not to just shop at another retailer instead where there's a better online and in store experience. If what I've experienced is commonplace, I feel bad for all the folks who have come into the store who have unintentionally set up credit cards. That is such a predatory practice.

This is an updated review . Although, I initially had a really bad experience at ulta with a stylist, the salon manager,  Melissa, was outstanding. She offered me a full refund for the services I paid for and is giving me a free style done by her. The reason I am giving 4 stars this time instead of 5 is because of the horrendous original experience I had. However, Melissa deserves all the praise in the world. She so sweet and understanding about the bad experience I had and promised me this was not the Ulta Beauty standard and that that would fix this for future appointments. She turned the experience all around.  Thank you!

I got some MAC foundation as a gift but it was the wrong shade. So i came to this store to exchange for the right shade (with the receipt within the 60 day exchange time) and the cashier was so rude to me when i asked her where their MAC section was located inside the store. She was super snooty and kept brushing me off and pointed me to the clearance section. When i told her there was no MAC section there, she said with an attitude "well we don't have MAC products anymore." I took my wrong shade of concealer and walked right out. Educate your staff on customer service. Thank you.

I had an interesting experience at Ulta, as I went to return a gift I received so I wasn't eyeball deep in "omg look at all the pretty things"! The staff was not really that friendly, and made it clear from the start that the item I was returning was going to be hard for them and was going to take a while to do. They even asked me if it was only going to be a few dollars I'd get back, did I really want to return it? 

"I'm here to return it, I made the trip to your establishment, so yes, yes, I would, thank you."

After we waited a while, two separate times, I finally checked out with my exchange items in hand, two Ulta brand eye shadows, and we made our way out of the store. I was not overly impressed with either eyeshadow once I got them home in the end - I would have done better picking up some Cover Girl...I think for my make up shopping, I'm going to stick to Sephora. Or maybe even CVS.
I just had my hair cut by Kiana, who was absolutely amazing! She is so professional and fun, and really knows what she's talking about. I'd recommend her to anyone new to the area like myself.

Worst experience EVER. Today I was treated with absolute disrespect by Ashley. I can't even believe it. First of all she did not introduce herself or even greet me.   She barely said a word the whole time. Besides complaining with her coworkers about how much they hate being here on mondays. Apparently the customer is never right or allowed to be upset right? When I explained to her what I wanted for my hair I was a bit confused on how to explain it. She just started without really saying anything or for further explanation. When I explained to her I didn't like it and was thinking something different she rudely said "well that's what you showed me in the picture." She argued with me claiming I didn't know what I wanted. It happened again when she did my makeup. She was like basically arguing with me.  I can't even believe it!!!!!!!!  And eventually told me "well sometimes we don't like the way the hairstyles look on us" She made the entire experience negative as hell. It was not fun. She did not tell me the products she was using. She didn't make it fun. This was for a fun event and this ulta experience literally ruined my entire day. This was so cruel. I even strayed to cry during the appointment because she just didn't give a crap and was so apathetic towards my nervousness. She didn't even ask if I was ok or offer a tissue. Oh and after the experience I went to the food court to grab a pretzel to help make me feel better. When I was walking out she and a few other salon team members were clearly talking about me and gave me a dirty look. This was downright a mean human being. I called back and the store manager was appalled. The manager was so sweet to me. That meant a lot to me. They are even giving me a refund. However. If you go to ulta  DONT GO TO ASHLEY!!! She doesn't care about you, your hair, your makeup, or even your feelings

Placed order through Ulta and did not realize my old address was on shipping information.  Product was delivered to my old address and cannot be retrieved. Contacted customer service and they said nothing can be done so I'm out money with no product.

I've never worn makeup and wanted to start experimenting. Summer and the wonderful Too-Faced rep (sorry u forgot her name!) helped me match foundations, concealers, find the right primer and brushes- literally everything! I have no complaints.. I also got an exfoliating body sponge and I feel sooooo smooth. Great team here!

I have been looking for a fragrance with the KKW line.  I have been told by various sales associates that they are no longer carrying the brand because the brand was doing some type of rebranding.  I was told that it is unlikely I will find it in the store but I can try.  I have been to several stores and each time the sales person checked and there was not one available in stock.  I get to this store and the person scans the tag and says I think I have it let me check.  Sure enough, she came back with it.  I get it home and my niece loves the scent I go back to the store a few days later and explain that I did get one from here a few days ago and could she check.  I explained that the previous sales person scanned the tag on the shelf and was able to learn that there were some 9or at least one) in stock.  Not this person she refused to even try to scan it to see and told me that there were none.  Shame on her for not even taking the next step to please the customer.

second time this happened to me I booked a simple hair treatment...On Line....left work early to make a 2:30 appointment...never waste your time...they refused me service hence I received a confirmation...on appoint....crazy thing was they 
sent a cancellation text while I spoke to manager

Not the best experience. I came into the store looking for help and guidance for products to use for my skin type. When I walked in I wasn't greeted even though two employees were near the door entrance. I wanted around the store for 20 minutes to see if anyone would offer to help and nothing. Two employees were in the corner talking about another employee, and another employee walked right pass me and then asked another lady if she needed help, even though she never made eye contact with me. I was going to go ask for help, but figured if they wanted my business one of the 6 employees in the store would have at least said hello or offered to help as I clearly didn't know what I wanted as I searched through the store. I doubt I ever come back to this ulta.

This is the time of year when I start to go crazy at my two favorite beauty stores. With all the promos, reward points, special value sets and freebies, by the end of the year I will be loaded up with products to take me through the next three seasons.

I am a Sephora devotee and for years now I have bounced between them and Ulta trying to determine who was the best. I concede that both stores fill a special niche for me. 

What Ulta does really well is blend drugstore beauty with prestige beauty conveniently divided by the left and the right sides respectively. So in one trip I can get my fav Urban Decay Naked Palette, maybe some Philosophy or Benefit as well as my favorite drugstore stuff like EOS, Rimmel and NYX. Plus on the latter items you can use the $3.50 coupon that's always available. 

Speaking of Benefit Cosmetics, at the Ulta on Concord Pike their counter is super cute just like their brands packaging and they have a full service brow bar. Yeah, pretty awesome. There is also a hair salon in the back of the store. 

Add to all of this glory some pretty impressive freebies ( I have gotten a very nice weekend travel bag, a robe, and a face-brush!) and the ever popular 21 days of beauty events and it's easy to become obsessed.

Never been in an ultra as I'm a guy and typically don't need their products.  I needed a face wash that was gentle to the skin, but could remove dark spots. I received decent service as they answered all my questions.

Though I prefer to spend my days shopping via the internet sometimes you actually need to go into a store and actually shop. Ulta isn't normally my go to for beauty products especially since Sephora carries all my favorite brands. I had a remaining balance on a gift card and was in need to some new foundation. Ive been into this store before and felt ignored at times,however today i had the full attention of the Bare Essentials girl who helped me match a foundation. She explained to me how to use the products and gave me a a few pro pointers. I was sold once i saw the transformation of my face.
 Ulta has one up on sephora they offer everyday products(neutrogena, oil of olay) in addition to some "prestige" brands (ultas' verbiage not mine).
Todays visit was a 5 star experience , but a few previous stunk like college football players gym socks.
its four stars for now

I rate zero. First off they open at 10am. I arrived at 9:56 and so did an employee . The employee was let in of course that's not the issue the issue is that their customer service sucks !!! One employee with red hair slammed the door in my face without even saying anything. I work in customer service and I would never do such a thing . It would of been more polite to say ma'am we're opening in a few minitues literally. At this time it's 10:59. I was highly pissed off by this behavior especially when I am a customer coming in to spend money! But it's okay I learned my lesson I'll be sticking to Mac cosmetics .

I traveled an hour from my home to shop at this store to take advantage of their "buy two, get one liter free" sale that happens for a very limited time in December.

Unfortunately, they did not have the exact type of product I was looking for; but had several others within the same brand...and the sale ends in less than a week!

A Manager named Frank was very very helpful, and told me I could easily exchange one type of shampoo for another type once it was in stock. He even offered to vouch for me if I wanted to exchange the product at another location. I made the purchase and got the liter free, knowing I could exchange it for the correct product once it was indeed in stock.

Frank at Ulta Wilmington saved the day for me. Thank you, Frank!
Good selection of hair products and they are always running specials and coupon offers. Make sure to become a member of their rewards program to get free things a few times a year!

This is the time of year when I start to go crazy at my two favorite beauty stores. With all the promos, reward points, special value sets and freebies, by the end of the year I will be loaded up with products to take me through the next three seasons.

I am a Sephora devotee and for years now I have bounced between them and Ulta trying to determine who was the best. I concede that both stores fill a special niche for me. 

What Ulta does really well is blend drugstore beauty with prestige beauty conveniently divided by the left and the right sides respectively. So in one trip I can get my fav Urban Decay Naked Palette, maybe some Philosophy or Benefit as well as my favorite drugstore stuff like EOS, Rimmel and NYX. Plus on the latter items you can use the $3.50 coupon that's always available. 

Speaking of Benefit Cosmetics, at the Ulta on Concord Pike their counter is super cute just like their brands packaging and they have a full service brow bar. Yeah, pretty awesome. There is also a hair salon in the back of the store. 

Add to all of this glory some pretty impressive freebies ( I have gotten a very nice weekend travel bag, a robe, and a face-brush!) and the ever popular 21 days of beauty events and it's easy to become obsessed.

the salon manager is the rudest person I've ever encountered, beside being unprofessional, dishonest, with a nasty and vicious attitude; no wonder why people who work there are even worse than her with that kind of training .  They manipulate customers' good faith for their own nasty and despicable dishonest interest.  DO NOT GO THERE FOR ANY SALON SERVICE: IT IS THE WORSE RIP OFF EVER

I tried Ulta's salon (Concord Pike, DE) for the first time last evening.  I made 5:15pm appt online which was convenient and allowed me to choose the price point I desired. I received an email confirmation as well as a phone call to confirm time and price.  In my experience, the prices range by expertise so I chose a $46 stylist from the range of $36, $41, $46, $56. I was also entitled to a 25% discount for the Salon. So far so good.

I checked in, was offered water and took a seat in the small waiting area by the desk. There was hair on the floor.
My stylist came by to tell me she was running behind and that someone would bring me back in 10 minutes or so.  She looked at my hair and asked what I wanted. That was my consultation.

As promised, I was brought into the shampoo area 10 minutes later by another sytlist. I sat, she left.
The floor was dirty...hard to miss since it's white tile. After a few minutes, she came back, barely uttered two words and proceeded to give a really bad shampoo. I could barely feel her hands on my head. She just touched my hair, which is short, so that was quite a feat.  Next came the conditioner, it was rinsed off as fast as it was put on and missed one side of my head. She brought me to a chair in the style station, again without a word and left. The floors in this area needed to be cleaned and swept. There was hair and a comb on the floor beside by chair.  The chairs were dirty and stained.

At 5:30p my stylist appeared, apologized again for the delay and started cutting my hair.  Although the chairs are capable of being raised, she never did that.  She did not take the time and care I expected from an experienced stylist. After a quick cut, she blew dry my hair.  She did not ask how I usually wore or dried it. I was not offered product - odd for a place that sells a boatload of stuff.  My hair looked a little like a helmit when I got in my car at 6pm but it was ok when I washed it this morning. 

All in all, this was a very disappointing experience. Calling this place a "Salon" is a stretch and while I could try another stylist, the lack of cleanliness will keep me away.

If you're looking for a good esthetician go see Lacresa at this Ulta location! She is amazing! She's very knowledgeable and knows what she's talking about. I went to her because I was suffering from acne and she gave a skin care regimen and other helpful advice about my skin. After 3 days of following the regimen I already see a difference in my skin. She's seriously a miracle worker!
I am sad to say, the employee answering the phone tonight was a GROUCH. A shame this time of year to have an employee answer the phone with little to no people skills.

Very poor service. Highly disappointed. I got keratin treatment done from here. My hair feels same as before the treatment. I am doubtful if they do actual treatment at there store or not. They are fraud.

Shanon is awesome!  
I had a blow out from Shanon on a whim, last minute because I learned my VP was coming to town. Now, with that said, I have had blow outs all over Europe, NY, Chicago, Miami, Phila, along my work travels. My hair is long, brittle and burnt from the stylists not having a clue how to blow dry your hair without burning it! Really you need to put a hot blow dryer directly on my hair and burn the hell out of the ends! 
I learned the way NOT burn your hair, from a stylist in Florence, Italy. They have to take the hair is small sections and hold the blow dryer far. Yea it takes a long time, but so what?

I asked Shanon to do that and not only did she do exactly what I asked, she gave me one of the best blow outs i ever had. WHAT AN UNEXPECTED SURPRISE. She is amazing and a great listener. I have spent about $300.00 over the last few weeks trying to fix my bad dye job at high end salons in Philly...She is a great stylist..my hair looked amazing and it never frizzed out in the high humidity last week in Philadelphia. THANK YOU Shanon!

I only come to Ulta for high end cosmetics or Matrix hair products.  Since Ulta charges too much for common brands such as L'Oreal, Maybelline and Cover Girl.  Although the staff is nice, this location is almost always a mess.   I have been to several other locations and this one is definitely messy.  Maybe the Ulta Co. needs to hire more staff.  It may very well be that they are so busy at this location that the present staffing levels aren't sufficient.  It is right next to the Concord Mall.

This ulta used to be nice - but lately, the customer service is lacking. The sales associates seem extremely rude and unwilling to answer questions. I also had a horrible experience at the salon. Just wanted a simple cut, but my hair turned out to be a disaster and the stylist removed way too much. Will not be returning to this ulta for sure. I would not recommend this salon.

Very bad customer service. I went there for haircut and hair stylist gave me the worst hair style, I ever had. When I complained , American American hair studio hair stylist was extremely rude and raised her voice. She was doing all this in front of store manager who asked me not to come back there again. Very poor customer service and very rude people.
Great place for QUALITY products- excellent selection. Clean atmosphere. They do not give you a hard time about trying/sampling items. For the Product-junkie, it makes a fun outing.

I went there for a haircut and a perm after moving back from California.  Denise in the salon was very efficient and friendly and did a great job.  She did a good job of cleaning up my hair from a poor hair cut from 4 months ago.  

This store is also great because you are able to try most of the products to see if you like them before you buy.

I cannot say enough good things about this Ulta! 4 stars because the regular staff has opportunity in their customer service. But the salon staff-  a dynamic group of perfection. This is my third Ulta salon I've been a client at on account of moving. Before my first appointment, I went in and specifically asked for someone who works magic with blonde highlights on brunettes, I was taken over to Amanda's station at which she had that specific type of client and I've seen her since- about a year now. She is friendly, intuitive and talented. I never leave dissatisfied. During all my visits the whole staff is chatting with clients and engaging and never negative. I adore the culture here and the care that the girls put into making clients happy.

Ulta has always been my "go to place" for all my beauty needs. Today was no exception, except the waiting to be checked out. Who ever decided they needed two lines should be fired. One line always worked. I waited in line over 20 minutes not realizing they had  two lines . No one to explain the floor plan, as there was only one staff member on the floor. Plus they had the one line blocked off so you had to go all around the cosmetic stalls to get out. If there was a fire this would cause a problem! Not a happy customer.

I have been a platinum customer, specifically with this location, for nearly four years. Have gotten to know many of the sales people over time and typically enjoy coming here. The last few occasions that I've been to the store however... The attitudes have been pretty unsavory. I am generally a very polite, conversational person and a performance artist so I know what I want 90% of the time and don't really need much help. I just had the displeasure of dealing with a very unnecessary negative attitude from a young woman named Lahti. Being in the industry working with customers, you really need to mind your manners. I have done retail and restaurants for years and I never project negativity onto others, even if I'm in a frustrating situation. There was a promotion going on for a particular Foundation and it was the entire reason I came in today all the way from Philly. There was a giant sign right next to her behind the counter as well as Flyers everywhere and a table in the front. When I asked about the brush, she said she wasn't aware of the promotion and I was made to feel stupid for even asking. Needless to say, her co-worker asked her where she been because it was all over the store and I got my brush. Typically I let snide stuff go but I've been coming here for a long time and her attitude was completely unnecessary.

What is not to love about Ulta?  They send you coupons, they have great bargains in the scratch-and-dent department, they have el-cheapo makeup (is there any lip gloss better than Bonne Bell?) and fancy-pants prestige makeup too, along with non-pushy reps to slather expensive sparklies on your face.  They also have every obscure OPI nail color available.  Rock!

Their prices are pretty decent, and they're better than decent when you use their ubiquitous coupons.   Getting an Ulta club card will earn you free goodies every three months.

Best thing, which I just learned tonight: You can return stuff after you've opened it and you'll still get a full refund.  Don't be afraid to try new stuff, and see how it looks at home.

Love.

Over the past two weeks I have gone into this Ulta store and both times have been treated like literal garbage. 

On the first trip, was in the morning. I was going in for a new shampoo and conditioner combo, I was about to run out of the Kenra that I use and wanted to try something new. I wanted to go for something either vegetarian or vegan, I'm trying to cut back on harsh chemicals on my skin/body. I was in the store in the hair section for about 20 mins. No one ever greeted me, and there was no one to help me. I ended up getting frustrated and leaving without purchasing because I wasn't helped at all. 

Then the second trip, was mid day at about 2pm. I went in for makeup wipes and a new cleanser (again something either vegetarian or vegan). I walked in and there were about 5 girls gossiping about one lifted her head and said hello, then went back to their convo. I found my makeup wipes and was roaming around the non elite brands and the elite brands, every SINGLE employee was gossiping, giggling and not paying attention to the MANY customers that were roaming around with a blank confused looks on their faces. Myself being one of them. 

I know a lot about makeup and both times I went without a beat face and my hair up. I'm not sure if they are profiling women that already have makeup on or if I just caught bad timing. However, I have never been treated like this in any other Ulta stores. Other Ulta stores are nice, friendly, and helpful not looking like a bunch of cliques of girls.

Was there yesterday with my husband for Acqua di GIO after shave balm and stuff girl quickly show up for help, but not because she really wants to help us - she wants to notify us that store will close in 5 minutes! When we asked about balm she couldn't find it and recommend us shop online... I found it on the bottom shelf by myself... it looks like they don't care about clients, they only care about store closing time.

Zero rating in my book. First off an employee and I arrived  at 9:56 am. Of course she was let in and I wasn't that's not the problem . The problem is their customer service sucked ! Without any words the employee opening the door attempted to shut it in my face. I explained that was very rude and she could of said hey mrs we open in a few minutes but she didn't ! Her reply to me was oh okay . At 10:59 I was still left standing outside with others . Moral is I will not be spending my hard earned money in this establishment who's employees are disrespectful! I will continue to take my money to mac cosmetics !

I bought a $50 gift card then before I'd left the store I realized it wasn't the right store. When I tried to get a refund I was told that it was 'legal tender' and they wouldn't give me a refund. The clerk didn't warn me it was non refundable before I made the purchase and there was no sign at checkout either so I am out $50. Beware of this company!

I was visiting the ULTA store in Wilmington, Delaware on 1/13/2020 and it really reinforced for me the reasons I go to Sephora or really anywhere other than ULTA. When I walked in, I saw 2 staff working the check out and 5 staff in a circle near the middle/rear of the store. I wandered around looking at different products for about 10 minutes and since no one approached me, I approached the check out staff and asked for assistance since the people in the back were heavily involved in a conversation. The person I spoke with approached the circle and I saw them scatter except one and that one came over to me.  The person that came over did not provide me with what I would refer to as 'help'.  When I asked her questions, she responded with "well you would have to try them" or "I don't know", mostly she stood there fidgeting and sighing.  I assumed she wanted to get away from me.  I couldn't tell you her name since she wasn't wearing a name tag but she did have dark green short hair.  It was surprising to me that a makeup artist couldn't tell me anything about the different brands of makeup or how to match foundation to skin tone.

Excellent customer service by the cashiers - a woman was confused by the two-line set up while checking out and made a snarky comment to my mother and I, who had the common sense to realize with two registers open and two "wait in line here" stickers on the floor, that there were two lines. The woman made multiple comments about my mother and I, which were handled professionally by the cashier. I really appreciate the customer service, especially during these trying COVID times. I've been a customer of this store for over 10 years, and will continue to return!

I have shopped at Ulta for years! I absolutely love their products. I want to recognize an incredible associate that went above and beyond for helping me with my breakout questions and makeup products. Alissa was there for my every need and she made me feel a lot more confident with the products I was investing in. Ask for her if you have any questions or need assistance when you walk through the doors. Thank you so very much for your assistance today!

I don't know what it is, but maybe because it was Sunday and they were very busy, but I just felt like most of the associates working here didn't want to be bothered or were just plain flustered. The cashiers were fine, though! No real issues there. I was looking for a specific beauty sponge and the guy who I asked for help seemed to be so rushed and so frantic, that I thought that I was doing something bad by asking him for help. I didn't appreciate him telling me "maybe you should have called before you came over" after telling me that it was not in stock. I was going to Shoprite across the road, so what the hell buddy?? At least he told me when they were getting their shipments in. That brings me to today. I called the store and was on hold for just around 18 minutes while someone said they'd check to see if this sponge was in stock. I ended up hanging up, calling back and getting someone else on the phone who did tell me that they did not have it. 

I love the fact that Ulta has a crapload of cosmetics, hair care products, accessories, etc. etc., but sometimes the people working here seem like they don't want to be there or they don't want to be bothered. And God forbid you try to engage in a conversation with them regarding a product, it's like you're taking away their 'chat' time that they could be having with co-workers. It's a shame that there's no Sephora closer, or else I'd shop there.

The store itself is just like any other Ulta, big with lots of products offered. My problem is the customer service. No one is ever around to try and help you, and the help that you get is so half-a**. The people who work in the high end makeup have no idea what they're doing when applying makeup on someone who is trying to find out whether they like it or not. I was trying to get someone to help me for 7 mins. Someone said she would be over shortly but had to go to the bathroom first. Waited another 10 minutes, finally someone else came and attempted to help me but really didn't apply the makeup well. Then another woman comes up to the woman helping me and tells her another person is there for her, so the girl starts to rush my application and I tell her to go ahead and take care of the other person, simply so I could apply the makeup myself, because I knew I could do a better job. I won't be going to Ulta anymore for high end makeup.

I had the worst manicure I ever received here. The lady who did my manicure was shaking, as she told me, "she was hungry" so I had gel nail polish all on my fingers around my nails, she missed whole sides of my nails, then yelled at me for, "tilting my hand in the dryer and making it slide off." ... she only had one gel dryer on my left side so when I crossed my right hand to go in, since she was painting my left hand, it was at an angle and kept getting screwed up. I had this manicure on a Thursday evening and by Saturday it already started coming off (because it was polished over the skin and cuticle!) Such a waste of money!!!

On top of it, the lady who did my manicure was telling me how her "daughet isn't stupid and won't move in with a boy until she has a ring....." As someone living with my boyfriend, I was very surprised that she would start saying tihngs like that, not knowing my situation. And personally, I wanted to tell her I don't find it stupid at all, It's practical in that I would rather find out that we weren't going to be able to live together now before we're married rather than after!

DO NOT RECOMMEND. I've gotten my hair dyed and touched up there a handful of times and never really had any issues. I usually get basic all over color. I decided to change up my hair and get the front dyed purple which I knew would entail bleaching the front of my hair. The "master stylist" bleached my hair once which I knew was not light enough because I had the darkest shade of brown on my hair (previously done at Ulta). So I had faith in her, she knew it was not light enough but proceeded to put color on the orange/caramel sections. She then realized after she was drying my hair that the color was not showing up. Be mindful this cost close to $300 with a tip. So she stripped my hair and bleached it a second time (bleach wasn't to my roots). The purple came out patchy and brassy. I had excessive dyed stains all over my skin. They rubbed my skin raw when trying to remove it and caused me to have abrasions and scabs on my forehead for 2 weeks. I tried to get my money back, but they only wanted to give me the $85 back from the bleached part despite my ears, neck, and forehead being covered in dyed for days. I am extremely disappointed and I would not recommend getting serviced here.

I've never written a review before, but I couldn't keep this wonderful experience I had at Ulta to myself! I went into Ulta in need of a new foundation and setting spray for work. I usually just find things on my own but Molly saw that I was looking at setting sprays and was kind enough to let me know they were half-off! She explained the difference between all of them and helped me find the one that was perfect for my skin. I wasn't wearing any makeup and explained to her that I have very problematic/acne-prone skin. I am on prescription medication for my acne and I was having a hard time finding something that would cover my flaws without making my acne worse. Molly took the time to help me find the perfect foundation, match it to my skin color, and was very empathetic about my situation. Shopping for new makeup can be an overwhelming experience especially when you have problematic skin, but Molly made me feel comfortable and I can't say enough good things about her. Thank you Molly!
Store doesn't carry everything as other Ulta's do. I feel like store is never busy and I am interrupting the associates conversations by going in.
I love this store! I bought Aveeno face scrub and moisturizer and bubble bath that can be used as shampoo and body wash. They make being a woman extremely easy..the staff is very nice and helpful.

Shout out to the lady who recommended the Sebastian curl cream to me, they were fairly busy but she took the time to explain the difference between products. I was about to purchase a product that was more expensive and less effective. My friend was also helped by a guy that matched her skin and helped her pick out good makeup for her!

Went to get my brows done at ulta for the first time. Walked in and got them done right then and there by Faith. She was great, super nice and did a wonderful job. The only discouraging thing was the gal at the front desk on the phone and had me wait a while when I was the only person in line, didn't even acknowledge I was there or ask me to hold on a moment. Didn't impress me much and that's why I took away a star. Anyways, if you get your brows done there ask for Faith!!

I had a decent experience here. I'm not a makeup lady, or haven't been much of one until my recent curiosity/employment calling for a more "polished look". I went in to the store, saw a couple other shoppers, and was promptly greeted. Then again. Then again. Then AGAIN, and actually two more times before I ended up going to the register with my items and checking out. The women were all very friendly, and somewhat helpful, it just became very apparent that it was more loss prevention than helpfulness at a point. Which is a shame because I did not go there to steal, but probably didn't leave with everything I would have if I didn't have four different salespersons, some of them multiple times, asking how I was doing (I was planning to fill a makeup bag, ended up only spending about $70).The shade of foundation I ended up buying I feel was not perfect for my skin, but I felt pressured to buy it because the saleswoman came up and so promptly said it looked great to her... making me feel somewhat shy or weird about trying other shades, or really looking in the mirror to see what I thought. In all, there was another half of the store I didn't even browse through, and what I did was only skimmed, because I felt so odd with every person in there being so obviously concerned with theft. 
I liked the selection but the squad made me a bit uncomfortable and I probably will not go back, just buy direct from the brands online, next time. Maybe the other Ulta stores in Reno are different?I get that theft is a serious problem, I too work in retail, but making customers feel like they're doing something shady while exploring makeup options is not fun to experience.

The girls here are so sweet and helpful, and seem to always manage to find just what I need. On this last particular trip, I was looking for the Anastasia Beverly Hills Ultimate Glow Kit that had been sold out the last couple of times I'd been there. I don't typically ask associates for help, (I don't know, I'm weird), but this time I stopped Faith, and asked her if they had any of the glow kits in left in stock, to which she asked another associate who said no. Faith went above and beyond to look in the back for a kit, and found one a few minutes later. Needless to say, I was incredibly happy, and went to pay for my stuff. Now, while I was checking out, I saw SEVERAL of the glow kits stationed behind the sales counter. I don't know if those are holds for other customers, or what. But there were several there. So, I'm just incredibly thankful Ulta had someone there to go out of their way to help me when clearly there are also people there who won't. They would have lost a rather expensive sale (I bought several other items) had Faith not done what she did. Thank you so much for making me feel special and beautiful!

If you're lookin to get your eyebrows done, go to Mikayla! She did a phenomenal job in taming my insanely thick Italian eyebrows. I don't trust people with my eyebrows because most of the time, they'll do them too thin and then I'll end up looking BALD, B U T Mikayla was so attentive to what I needed and shaped and waxed them perfectly. PLUS she's a sweetheart and so good at what she does. (This is my first ever review on anything if that tells ya something)

This location recently opened up within the last year. Conveniently, it's much closer to my house than the other location. 

The staff is on top of it and always willing to help! I was looking for a new moisturizer for my face but didn't know of any good brands. A lady named Michaela pointed me in the direction of a brand called Dermalogica. She spent adequate time with me going over their trial size package. I learned a lot about my skin type and what I should be doing to take care of my skin! Michaela was very patient with me and answered every question in detail. The moisturizer she recommended for me to try has improved my skin within a week! Even my blemishes have shown great improvement with this product I wouldn't have known about if it weren't for Ulta's staff.

There is only one MINOR complaint I could possibly think of (which isn't even a real complaint). I was supposed to get a spot treatment on my face with Michaela and she mentioned I would get a reminder text. I didn't get a reminder text but I did get a phone call 15 minutes after my appointment was supposed to be asking if I wanted to reschedule since I had missed the appointment. I think that was a mistake on both of our ends -- mine for not writing down the appointment in my agenda and their mistake for not sending me a reminder text like I was told...

Nonetheless, I still enjoy coming to this location.

I don't usually write review but this time I had to. I had overall good experience here until I went in today to exchange my philosophy skincare product. This old lady working there made me feel very uncomfortable as I explained to her how this product I bought has very bad/weird smell. I've already finished 2 jars of Philosophy's renewed hope in a jar before and I loved that mild fresh scent and it worked perfectly fine! But it was not the same scent I smelt before,so I asked for the exchange. That time I told her how this jar is my 3rd one. As I said that, she cut me off and sarcastically said "oh if this is your 3rd time returning it, it may be not for you." I never said I returned this product three times. Excuse me? Then she walked away to the back of the store to get the new one. It was okay. I was fine until she came and put the new one in front of me and acted like just take this and get out. Seriously? She definitely had that rude look on her face. I couldn't take that attitude and I asked for a refund. I will NEVER go back to this store again! I just ordered mine from online store. Also, I'd rather go to another location just to get better customer service!
Mila did a balayage on my hair and I couldn't be happier with the result. Creating the exact color that I wanted on my black hair was not easy but Mila did a fantastic job.

I love this place! I've always used a random stylist (no specification) and they've been consistently professional and enjoyable. 
The hair washing (the best part) is always long and feels amazing, it's like a massage... I've never had a bad experience here and I highly recommend it!

Ok Ulta is like Toys R Us for grown ups chicks with make up!  Awesome selection of make up from cheap to super spendy.  Wait for the sales on hair products and join their rewards club for extra discounts.  Talk to the ladies in the beauty bar and they can help with whatever ails you.

My only complaint is the pilferage.  I hate finding empty boxes stuffed in corners and behind stuff obviously with the product being stolen.  This seems rampant in all of their stores.

I recently had one of the makeup artist help me find a new foundation. I usually use Mac Makeup but was too lazy to drive to the Summit Mall. She matched me with an Urban Decay foundation. I only wear heavy makeup when I actually go out, so needless to say I have used this product only twice. Each time I used it, it looked gray on my face. With enough blending, contouring and blush, I made the color work but for $40.00 I felt that this wasn't worth the effort. Sadly, I will not be buying another foundation from Urban Decay. 

I came back to Ulta, package and original receipt in hand. I gave the cashier my Ulta Rewards number and was promptly given a refund to my card. 

I always appreciate shopping at a place that truly guarantees customer satisfaction on their products. While I won't be purchasing foundation here, I will continue to shop for my other beauty items.

Always fully stocked on things I need. Fast and friendly customer service. Went into buy some stocking stuffers. There's a variety of products from hair, nails to skin care. If you're unsure of what you need or where to get started ask one of the ladies at the counter and they will point you to the right direction. Ulta Beauty is moderately priced. The lowest cost for and item I have seen is 5$  and highest is 150$. Remember to sign up for the rewards program as you get birthday gifts and annual discounts.

If anyone need to do a full hair service (color, highlights) absolutely not a good place to go. I had to go over three time to fix my hair which were not done correctly at first visit. However, they were still not done as I wanted. I wasted almost $200 and also my time. Definitely not a good place if you have darker hair as mine.

Corrine was fantastic! Very helpful and got me everything I needed for my wife's birthday. I had gone in before to try and find what I needed, but the other girls didn't really seem to care or want to help me find what I needed, but I tried one more time and Corrine was able to get everything I needed with the very little details I could give her.

Michelle did my eyebrows recently and did an absolutely fantastic job. They got me in right away as a walk in appointment. Michelle made sure that she took her time making sure that they were done correctly. If you need your eyebrows waxed, these are the people to trust.

I went to get my eyebrows done at this location at the brow bar. The girl who was doing my eyebrows didn't listen to what I wanted. She told me that my eyebrows were thick and beautiful but I wanted to go thinner and she did not agree. I was so upset. After she finished my eyebrows were not twins they weren't even distant cousins ): I was so sad. I will never go back here for my eyebrows. The only ulta that's good for eyebrows is the one off Los Altos

This review is based on a return I made a week ago. I previously bought a concealer online and it was the wrong shade. So I came to this store to trade it in for a lighter color. After looking around and seeing that they didn't carry any of the concealer on the floor (maybe I didn't see it), I waited in line to speak with the cashier for the exchange. The cashier was nice, but she called for the (I believe) manager for assistance. When the manager asked me what shade I needed, I told her and said I couldn't find it. Right away she said, "Then we don't have it." It was pretty rude and she could have at least went over to the section to double check or check the back for me. A couple minutes later, one of the cashiers that overheard our conversation came up to us and handed her the shade that I was looking for and said she found it. I didn't catch her name, but thank you to the girl for going out of her way to find my shade even though I never asked her. As for the manager, it takes a minute to look and see if you have something in stock. I don't know if you were having a bad day, but you don't need to be rude.

I went to the salon for kind of a big hairstyle change and I'm SO happy with the cut! Jordyn was very receptive to what I was looking for and did a wonderful job. I LOVE my new style! Will definitely be going back!

I've been a platinum member to Ulta for years. One of the fun perks is getting coupons for free samples. They "couldn't find" the sample for the coupon I had. No problem, EVERY single time that had happened they always give me another sample to make up for it. This specific location said no. It's not a big deal but it's the kind gesture and great customer service. I'll avoid this unfriendly location.

Well today was a hard day at my local ulta. My mom is gonna be visiting me for Christmas and I came in to try stuff on to get my wishlist together. Back home we only shop at sephora and are both VIB rouge because we love makeup.  My mom loves it, but I'm the real fanatic. I'm an only child. Very spoiled. My mom always indulges this passion of mine.
Which is why I'm so sad by my recent experience because my other experiences have been overwhelmingly good.  It's not good though going into the busiest time of year in terms of sales for a retailer to get it SO wrong.
I had found some brushes. I asked to see the testers of them so I could feel them. I was the most interested in an "it cosmetic" brush for cream and powder.  I have a Chanel silicon based cream bronzer that I want to use it with.  Right now it's my Laura mercier brush from when I freelanced, it's more than 10 years old but in great shape. I really just wanted something to throw in my crazy purse that would stay nice and was small.  Anyways, I was refused the option of feeling the limited edition holiday brush by it cosmetics . Instead she tried to talk down to me and tell me about the product in order to sell it after I repeated to her, I was not going to buy a brush I can't feel first. Is that really that crazy? As a veteran makeup artist, I'm not gonna know I love the brush until I feel it and fluff it. I don't need to use it I just wanted to fan it to feel the density of the bristles. I know exactly what I'm looking for, but I need to feel it.  The whole premise and success of a store like ulta and/sephora is this experience. Try before you buy. I'm so easy, I have a list in mind of what I want before I even get in the store. I clean up after myself. And I use testers hygienically. All I asked for was to feel a tester.
Because I was unhappy with her she then made a point to interrupt me multiple times while I was trying on makeup. I wasn't using the brushes and she took them away. Then when I needed a brush there was no associate around, so I cleaned a brush and used it. Then another associate came over to take the brush away rather than offer assistance to apply the becca compact. She came simply stated the brush was for employees and walked away.... okay if that's store policy I understand. But how was I supposed to try on the powder compact she interrupted me using-face half done? I'm baffled by the lack of customer service because I contradicted this power hungry manager.
She was in a dear santa sweater and I'm pretty sure she called herself the creative director. Honestly, if she is in a leadership position I fear you are losing business.  
In terms of how to train your employees better it seems pretty simple.  If they legitimately do not have the ability to make a tester of the brush or it didn't send one, explain that... don't just say no. It's too much because I KNOW "it cosmetics" would be appalled by her behavior.  
And the other associate, I assume acting under her direction to make me feel bad about using a brush they didn't feel was appropriate is a reflection on your stores lack of leadership and customer service training.
If I'm gonna spend a few hundred dollars and my mom easily double that in any given visit to a beauty store, we expect a lot more.  There are three ulta stores in town, the Mae Anne location is next to the dog park and was my favorite. Sephora is in south Reno, so I almost always go to ulta first.  Now, I'm considering making the drive to sephora or trying a different ulta.
I hope this is helpful from a training perspective.

Let me say that the customer service I experienced yesterday was above and beyond my expectations. I've shopped at Ulta (in CA) on multiple occasions to buy gifts for family/friends but never for myself. So this visit was a little unusual. I'm in desperate need of a new skincare regimen . Since relocating here to Reno my flawless, soft and evenly complexion skin has transformed into a blemished (black spot), uneven and roughly textured skin.
